text: Looking to have a great tasting meal, fresh squeezed juice, or protein shake? G&P is the place for you.  They have gluten-free choices, a lot of organic choices and it's very affordable.  They even sell DNA Life Bars! Check them out after your next workout or just to have a fun lunch or breakfast with friends or even the kids!

One of my favorite healthy places to eat in Las Vegas. I always get a Wellness Drink and a Broccoli and Cheddar soup. The food always comes out fast and consistently very good. I just wish there'e was more than 2 locations in town.

Love this place! I go here after my workouts to "treat" myself. Their pizzas are all amazing, each 10"s and each low in cals (250-300ish). Also try their tofu fries! Very tasty and also super low in calories. If you're trying to watch your waist but still crave some comfort type foods (and more), this place is the place to go!

(Also gluten free, vegetarian/vegan/raw friendly - major plus!)

I wanted to thank the manager (or maybe it was the owner - anyway I'll just call him War Beard) who treated me really well. Ordered their chicken sausage pizza and took a seat. 

After a few minutes, War Beard approached my table and said "the pizza is taking a little longer than expected. Would you like a complimentary drink while you wait?" 

To be honest it wasn't that long a wait (it's never a dull moment when you have a Smartphone!) but I said "sure, what would you recommend?" He said "How about a Wellness drink?" And I said, "go for it!" 

Their Wellness drink is more of a juice than a smoothie and it's pretty darn good. Later I looked at the menu to see how much this complimentary drink normally costs - $7.50. That's not the cheapest drink around and yeah, lucky me, I got it comped, just because War Beard cares about his customers. 

I guess the point I want to make is that War Beard - whether he's the manager or owner - really knows the meaning of Customer Satisfaction. I don't normally write reviews on Yelp, but the service at this Eastern/215 Greens and Proteins convinced me to spend a little time writing this review.

Place to go for low calorie meals. I ordered from make your own menu which incorporates protein, greens and grains..They have nice variety of foods, stuff I haven't even tried before. 
Important thing is; food is very delicious and still very healthy for you.
Juices are very popular and absolutely delicious, 100% natural and packed with nutrients.

It is SO hard to find healthy food in Vegas! Normally I would probably give this place 4 stars but because it is so hard to find a healthy place to eat out they get 5 stars! Order the protein pancakes, turkey burger, or fruit juices! All delicious!

EVERY single employee is so polite and informative. No matter who you talk to. I just experienced a customer being so rude to Chris and Memo and I just cannot believe how people can be so unfairly demanding even when the staff is bending over backwards for you!!! We eat here everyday and see all the cashiers, eat all the different chef's creations, and it is nothing but consistent and delicious and healthy and fresh every single time. We are forever loyal to this place thank you so much guys!!!

Great menu choices, healthy ones at that! The Wellness Drink is the best greens drink I ever had but all of the drinks are great. The build-your-own with bison patty and spicy peanut sauce is my favorite but the seared ahi is also excellent.

I've mostly had the juices here, wellness juice is my usual. Most juices and smoothies have a fair amount of sweetness although most of the staff is open to slight adjustments to the recipe. The most vegetable based juice is V9, it's great though. Juices are made with a Vitamix. Restaurant has a laid back atmosphere.  You order your food at the counter and wait for your food at the table. Free wifi. Bright green decor makes me happy. Can order ahead, but don't call too far in advance, a juice sitting around too long thickens.

The food is great. The employees are great. I just call or walk in and they already know and remember my order. Food brought to you and tabled cleared for you. Yes it is pricier than most, but it is healthy, tasty food. Owner is involved and there in the mix bring food to tables. Liz is great. Right next to gym so after a great workout a great meal. Clean and pleasing atmosphere. Try it. Greg and his staff do it right every time. Like another lady said, it is my second kitchen.

Finding a healthy alternative to normal restaurants without sacrificing the actual taste of the food seems to be getting increasingly more difficult. Greens and proteins has finally mastered this problem and given people conscious of how they eat a place they can really enjoy. Lettuce cups are the best!

First time for lunch at this location and I'm impressed with the friendliness, professionalism and service excellence of the staff. It's difficult to find a great vegan place to eat that doesn't contain salt, oil and sweeteners. They knocked it out of the park here!
I love the fresh and crunchy sweet potato fries along with the green shake. Staff is very friendly... I highly recommend this place.
Not sure what all of the fuss is about. Overpriced foods that I can make at home. The only thing I would actually pay for again is the green smoothie. Oh and the jicama fries are terrible.

Green Shake and Tofu fries are the only items worth getting. Both are exceptional!! However, the rest of the menu is 2/5 (and we've tried about 50% of it). Healthy food with very little flavor. Go here for a huge yummy superfood shake and eat real food at Lyfe Kithen instead.

Dinner here left me wishing that we had gone somewhere else. Their friendly service was about the only redeeming factor, and I'm still wondering if it could be the smoothies that bring people back here and keep it packed. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt on this, because I didn't try one. 

I had the build your own plate with basmati rice, "marinated" tofu, broccoli, and to my dismay, lemon vinegrette.
I began to order it with teriyaki sauce in mind, but when I inquired about the peanut sauce just to see, I was informed that the only two vegan sauces were lemon vinegrette or a balsamic reduction. Caught off guard I went for lemon, which turned out to be straight up lemon juice and olive oil. The tofu was far from marinated, and I smothered my food in hot sauce to make it a little more edible. The broccoli was just fine, but even a decent steamed vegetable doesn't have the power to save bland tofu and dry rice.

The tofu "French fries" were the only thing I tasted that I would even consider paying money for... But that won't happen since I won't be giving this place a second chance.
Perhaps it's a just a hit or miss kind of place, but if that's the case, then I would like to know what that hit is. I sure didn't get lucky.

Ordered food and a carrot juice drink some how didn't get the juice on the bill when the food was brought manager was awesome and didn't mind giving us the drink even though we were willing  to pay it he didn't charge us for it efrim is a good dude and has an awesome personality and food is always perfect. Rec everyone check them out!
It was my first time & I did not like the acai bowl. The random pineapple and berries didn't taste good with the acai mixture. The acai itself was like icy not smooth and tasted odd.

I really love the food and juices here but there is always a problem. Today I called in an order 10 minutes before I arrived and came in and paid. I waited about 30 minutes inside before I asked someone about my order. They brought it out and said they forgot to bring it out and it was cold. THEN I looked inside and everything I ordered was wrong. It gets better. They then brought out my new order which was also wrong. So I've been waiting 45 minutes for 1 turkey burger and I'm quite disappointed
Wow great food, very healthy & perfect after a good as work out. Very friendly customer service.  YOU GUYS DESERVE 5 start :)
Unique blend of healthy and tasty all in one location.  Try it... You'll like it!

Order the bison cheesesteak and the acai smoothie!
Chris and Justin gave excellent service with yummy suggestions :)
Very clean, kinda pricey but you pay for quality food. Will be going back great experience.

I have been going the G&P for several years and it has been my go to restaurant for a clean and healthy meal.  I would not recommend the Decatur location because of the lower quality service and meals.  My last three visits have included a wrong take out order, over cooked meat in both wraps, and undercooked tofu fries.

I love this place!  The food is scrumptious!  The vegan pizza is delicious.  I love the cucumber water and the amazing juices.  I like to go here for lunch, and that is one of the only drawbacks.  It is insanely busy sometimes and hard to find a table, especially when people sit and chat at length after they have finished eating.  A lot of day working people use this as a lunch destination, so it's a bit annoying at times. The service is great, though.  Even at the busiest times, they are timely with the food.  The other detail I'm not crazy about is the kale salad.  Since it's mature kale, it's a bit tough, and it would be nice if they used baby kale or chopped it up a bit more.  Also, sometimes the dressing is a bit lip-pursing and sour.
First time trying out this place ordered a breakfast burrito but I never had a burrito come in all wet and how are you suppose to hold and eat when it's all wet? Little disappointed.

Foods good. Downside is the wait, but at least the food is always fresh and hot when served! Pretty packed at this location (the times I've gone). Good service as well! In for some healthy food, try this place out or better yet create your own protein style with sides meal

I love this place. The breakfast is so yummy I questioned if it was really good for you but it is. Love the Bison Burger as well as all of their soups. The staff is beyond amazing and helpful! Highly recommend.

If your a 110 lbs women or not very hungry this might be the place for you , if you don't mind paying $12 for a sub mediocre salad leaving hungry ,this might be the place for you as well .  I'm not either .  I went there after working out and I was starving, i figured I'd have a nice healthy salad. I ordered the large Albacore Salad , the guy at the front said it was good ,  when I opened it I almost peed my pants , it was 5 pieces of bibb lettuce , 2 cherry tomato's , a scoop of canned tuna and Dijon mustard (not mustard dressing) this was the large too , 
Generally I like to go to a place more then once to give an open minded review, but I'm not sure if I could bring myself back to give it another chance. The Daily Wellness is a much better place !

I was skeptical before coming here today but I was extremely presently surprised!!  My party ordered a few items and shared -- the hummus appetizer, greek pizza, bison burger with jicama fries, a veggie wrap and apple pie smoothie.  We were very happy and satisfied! The service was fast, attentive, the quality was great and the food was cooked just as specified. I'll be coming back soon!
Glad to c another restaurant with some raw food options.  Would be nice if they had some fresh pressed green juices and some raw salad options.

Greens and Proteins is a great option if you are looking for something quick, yet healthy.  The skinny chef salad is a favorite of mine!  You can also get 1/2 salad, which is nice if you are not too hungry.  I would go there just for the free cucumber/lemon water!!  It is so delicious and refreshing.
Great healthy  food. I usually go after my morning  workout.  Friendly staff , clean tables, TV
The wellness drink is fab, and the wraps are wonderful. A little on the pricey side but the staff is very friendly

Love Greens & Proteins. I eat at this location quite often and the staff is really nice. Great location right off the 215 and tucked in with Starbucks. They are in the same plaza as a breakfast place so they cannot serve some of the breakfast dishes here. Example: they don't have the Greens and Proteins breakfast burrito. 
Tip: You can call in an order or Yelp an order and pick it up here; very convenient.

Truly one of the best restaurants we've ever been to, the vegan raw cashew chicken lettuce wraps were incredible, so fully satisfying and the service was impeccable. We will definitely be coming back!

This place is aswome, great casual spot with really healthy and tasty food!  Great vibe--one of the proprietors, Jeff, even visited our table to see how we were doing and regaled us with interesting stories of his youth.

So fresh!  I love this place.  I only give it a 4 star because it's a bit pricey.  I love the fact that they have ostrich!  Hard to find.  There's so much on the menu that I have to try.
Tasty, healthy food, what more cold you ask for?  Don't forget to try their cucumber water.  So refreshing on a hot summer day.

They have some of my favorites- the greek scramble is my absolute favorite breakfast item on Earth. I also get the low-carb caesar salad on the regular! However I recently had the 7 cheese vegetable broccoli soup and I was pretty disappointed. It was extremely bland. So food-wise, I would say they are kind of hit and miss.

The staff are always very kind and polite. They get busy in the afternoon, so I usually place an order on the phone and then pick it up to avoid the wait.

I love this place!!!! The bison cheese steak is A+++ I wanted to try other menu item,but I'm hooked. It's a good portion size for the price. I usually bring one half home for later. I highly recommend the antioxidant chiller as well it's delicious!!
Enjoyed breakfast here with a Groupon. I had a smoothie and the breakfast burrito - both were delish, and the tofu fries were too!  It is pricey though!

Awful experience here today.  I work in the Las Vegas service industry so I am fully aware of service standards. When I walked in at 4:30pm there was no one in line.  I knew what I wanted to order so I went straight to the register to place my order (1 Apple Pie Smoothie).  The two female employees prepping ingredients continued to chit chat with themselves, not acknowledging my presence for a full minute of standing at the register.  Finally one came over and took my order, my name, and payment.  The other employee started working on my smoothie.  I watched her pour in almond milk and then dump at least a CUP of nutmeg in my smoothie and gasp 'Oh my God' to the other employee.  (A little sprinkle of nutmeg goes a long way).  The two of them decided it best her her to  scoop the nutmeg out with her gloved hands.  Unsuccessfully, she decided to start my smoothie over (thankfully, as I watched her like a hawk, regretting having just paid $8 for a smoothie).  Meanwhile the other employee helped the two customers behind me as I watched employee 1 take her sweet a$$ time re-making my smoothie.  The other employee managed to make FOUR other smoothies (for customers behind me) in the time it took employee 1 to make one smoothie.  This all took about approx 10 minutes.  Then, employee 1 tried to give my smoothie away to another customer behind me.  I finally walked up and said, "that's for (my name), right?" "Oh oops, here you go!" was her response to me.  No 'sorry about the 10 minute wait'.  Sorry Greens & Proteins, no matter how hungry I am and how hard it is to get a healthy snack when I'm all the way across town, I will faithfully use my own Blendtec at home and make better, cheaper smoothies.  And I"ll make sure to tell my friends.

Incredible!! My fianc√© & I are doing a show on the strip & it's a must that we have our Greens & Proteins. So much so that we have the shows runner make the daily run for aftershow food. We love Tyler. -It's known for it's incredible seasoning. I love the bison cheesesteak wrap.

Really great place with tons of options. The service is always very prompt and I love that you can get some clean items so you don't feel guilty when eating out. I had the salmon with a walnut pesto sauce that came on the side but I added it on my salmon and it was delicious! It came with two side choices and I did quinoa and grilled asparagus. Minimal to no seasoning which I like as it's better that way. 
Their juices are all so delicious too! Really good sizes and they are nice and thick that you almost feel like you are drinking a smoothie.
Whenever I come to visit the area to see family I come here at least once and I'm always happy!

Had the teriyaki chicken wrap but made it vegan with tofu and lettuce wrap.  What a waste of $10.99!  

Lettuce (romaine I think) was very tough and hard, simply wrapped around a bunch of tofu (looked like the tofu fries before being breaded and cooked).  Not wrapped at all so all the filling fell out as soon as I picked it up.  The tofu was supposed to be marianated, but it certainly wasn't.   When I marinate tofu in teriyaki sauce, it absorbs the marinade and turns brown.  G&P's tofu was still white and flavorless.  Supposed to include cukes and something else.  Nothing but a lettuce leaf, flavorless tofu and sauce (which dripped all over the plate).   When I went back to the counter to talk to the manager, I was told they weren't in!

This place blew it.  Won't be back.

Went into the Decatur location and there was not one guest. There were two girls folding pizza boxes who instead of greeting me or helping me clearly wanted to make me feel uncomfortable and giggle. Another employee thankfully helped me while they continued to make me feel uncomfortable. The next guest was greeted by them and helped. Not sure what's so important for them to make someone who helps pay their check by bringing business uncomfortable or why folding pizza boxes has priority over helping a guest. I wish I could give the guy working a separate review because he was kind and helpful.
This place has really good smoothies. The food wasn't bad but I'm just not into healthy eating. My health conscious bf loved it though.
First time coming here and we fell in love with this place,their Bison wrap is the best,this is our new favorite for healthy food!!!

I love the wellness drink! The owner has been studying nutrition for years and really plans everything in the menu with the best possible nutrients.  Everything is amazingly fresh down to the cucumber lemon water.  I can not wait until they start catering!

So far, I have only come in here for breakfast, but I have loved everything I'ved tried! This place is right by the gym so the location is very convenient. I've gotten the oatmeal with bananas, cinnamon, raisins. The mulitgrain protein pancakes and granola french toast have to be my favorites. I loved the turkey sausage and egg whites. The portions are pretty big, which I like because I can share with someone or take the rest home. I love the Berry Blast smoothie which is nice when I'm on the go and can't sit down to eat. I can stop in and just grab a smoothie. I have been here quite a few times and I notice that sometimes the food can take about 15-20 minutes to come out, even when I only have one entree for myself. Other than that, the staff is very nice, the place is clean, and the food is tasty!

Have been here a few times right when it opened, so maybe my opinion isn't the best one to go off of.  Regardless, I had a couple different veggie smoothies, and I liked them both.  The Wellness Smoothie is just what the doctor ordered, and then I had a one time creation from Shane, with watermelon rind in it, which I also loved.  I haven't tried the food yet, but am actually excited to see what they have to offer.  This is a great place if you are looking to add some fiber to your juice routine, which sometimes, I am!

One of my favorite health food places in Vegas real food real tasty!! The ostrich patty is excellent and the smoothies are delicious especially the "wellness" drink. Pricey but most healthy places seems to be.

What an interesting place!  The feel of the restaurant is young and hip and the vibrant green of the decor makes the place feel fun and eclectic.  This is my first time here even though I often go next door and hit up Starbucks.  The menu is rather large and it will take you minute to read everything over.  They are gluten-free, vegan, vegetarian, and low-carb friendly place that offers a nice selection of soups, salads, burgers, 9" pizzas, smoothies, sandwiches/wraps and a choice to even create your own meal.  After pondering what to eat I decided on a burger.  What is more classic than a burger and if they could make it right then I would be encouraged to try more off the menu. 

I ordered the buffalo burger done to a medium (they also have ostrich which I have never had) and tofu fries.  There is also an option for the jicama fries.  I was told the jicama fries are fry-shaped pieces of jicama tossed in a dressing.  I shied away from the jicama because I have not had it before personally but I did hear they are good.  The tofu fries are firm tofu tossed in rice flow and fried.  They are delicious!  The burger can come on a wheat or gluten-free bun or as a wrap. I chose the wheat bun and got Swiss cheese on my burger.  The burger itself is massive stacked with a thick patty, lettuce, tomato and onion!  I can barely fit it in my mouth!  The bread to meat ratio for the burger is perfect.  I took a bite and the burger is done exactly right (medium), juicy and tender.  

For my buffalo burger, tofu fries, pickle and a soda cost me a little over $14 including tax.  A good price for a nice buffalo burger.  Also their soda machine dispenses small ice pellets.  This is an important point to make for my fellow ice munchers! 

The place is WiFi ready but you will have to ask for the passkey to access the network. When I asked the staff about power access they did not know but I was able to speak to Jeff, one of the owners, and he was able to show me where to plug in.  For those needing a place to work there are a TON of plugs (long power strips) under the bench along the back wall of the restaurant. Just a little looking and you will see them.       

If you are looking for a nice place to grab a healthy bite to eat (even with your GF, Vegan or Uber-health conscious friends)  then look no further than the Greens and Proteins!

The Bison burger is delicious. The chicken quinoa salad was cool, fresh and tasty. Add avocado to everything because it's yummy. Add banana to the watermelon strawberry smoothie to make it a little creamier. The place is well decorated for a good atmosphere and well maintained. Bathrooms are clean too. Would love to have one of these in California.

Not a juice bar. They do not serve juices. What they do serve is smoothies. All drinks are blended and contain fiber. That is not a juice. If you want fresh cold pressed juice I suggest you try one of the many other legitimate juice bars in the area.

First time here, and can't wait to come back! 
The wellness dink is absolutely amazing! And my mom and I shared the raw macho nachos, and half an order of that was so filling! I highly recommend them.

The cashier was very helpful even though she had not tasted alot of the Vegan food but that is exceptional. The smoothie was very fresh tasting.Im not a big fan of vegan cheese but this pizza was actually taste.

I've been wanting to go check out Greens & Proteins after I hit the gym for months now. I finally did this weekend and was pleasantly surprised with their GREEN SHAKE. I'm glad I chose to use almond milk rather than soy milk in the shake because I think the sweetness helped, but it was still tastier than what I expected for a shake that is mixed with spinach, collard greens and kale! After this first run I know I'll be back to try a few more smoothie options.

Delicious....... Don't hesitate. Just go!

Very cute inside. Nice, clean, classy. Makes me happy.

It's been a while since I've eatin at G&P so I thought i'de check check out their location just outside of my new hood- mountains edge. I needed a meal to take to work so I called my order in.  I was in the mood for something healthy and satisfying and the dude on the phone recommended the bison cheesesteak wrap.  Got there about 10 minutes after ordering and my food was ready to go. The wrap held up nice during my commute to work. When I finally got to eat the thing I was pleasantly surprised. Lots of meat with the perfect proportion of veggies and low fat cheese, and the spinach wrap added a nice touch. I had it with the sweet potato fries, because hey, we all need to cheat on our diets once in a while. They were bomb too! Will definitely keep this place in mind for quick healthy food options. Very convinient and delicious. Looking forward to trying out their other menu items. I already have the Cajun steak sandwich in mind!!!

This is one of my favorites. I usually get the bbq chicken pizza on lavash. It tastes great and is low calorie. Service is always good despite having to wait in line sometimes (that means that it is good). My only complaint is that their wraps and burgers come with a choice of tofu fries or jicama fries as a side. I am not a fan of either and think sweet potato fries would be a great alternative.

Always love coming to this location. Terrible experinences at Flamingo location. Came in late night after a 12 hour day and Julie was polite, kind, and brought my food out with a good conversation. Shes two thumbs up!

If you are looking for a place with fresh eats and yummy shakes, this is it.  I really liked it, it seems unique and has really great "healthy" food.  Located near LVAC, it attracts that healthier, fit crowd; but I went for the shakes.  I do try to watch what I eat, and this place does not offer greasy and heavy food.  It's fresh and well proportioned.  Friendly, inshape (lol) staff and patrons as well.

You have to ask for the veggie burger to be prepared "vegan" style.  They delivered it to me with non vegan spread. So be careful if you are vegan as they do not cater to vegans. Also your burger will be cooked on the same grill that a ostrich or bison burger was cooked just previously with the grill merely wiped off before your vegan burger is cooked. The food is good, but not certified vegan. The wellness drink is good, but not organic. I would skip this place if those things are important to you.

We have been here twice now, and still not impressed.

The customer service and staff are excellent, which is why I gave them two stars.
However, I have not had anything there that I liked yet. I am a huge smoothie fan, but there's aren't up to par. Have had much better in this area of town.

Im hooked! I keep coming back to this place for my healthy meals. The food is great my favorite is the breakfast, I enjoy eating the multi grain pancakes. I really appreciate the staff and chef ceasar for the excellent customer service.
I had a green shake and left pleasantly surprised. Slightly on the high side for prices, but fresh and good. I will return

Some of their drinks are an acquired taste, but it's fun to be adventurous in the name of "good for you." Food items haven't failed me yet. Only downer is the prices are slightly higher than seems fair.

Healthy and tasty, free wifi, and great customer service, too.

Manager Greg and staff took good care of me... my smoothie is delicious and I will definitely be back for more, if U're looking for healthy food that taste good and good for you, this is the place!! Oh did I mention the Chocolate Peanut Smoothie is my new drink, it's soo delicious!!!!

This is definitely one of my favorite health food places in Vegas! I'm really big in to health and fitness, and this place definitely meets the needs of health freaks, while also giving some more indulgent options as well. No matter what I always order the Wellness Drink every time I go. SO AMAZING and packed with fresh delicious ingredients. If you're a green juice person, this is the drink for you! I also usually always order their barbecue chicken pizza. The crust is amazing, the thin crust and the gluten free, I've had both, and the sauce and flavor is just incredible and the pizza only has 320 cals! How awesome. I have also had one of their wraps, forget the name but it's packed with a ton of vegetables and comes with tofu fries. So delicious, except I would say that the asparagus in the wrap was just a little too crunchy for me and kind of threw off the texture of the rest of it. I also have been to the Henderson location many times, and I must say this location just does it was better! The shape of their pizza is better and the taste of their smoothie was amazing.. but overall.. LOVEEE greens and proteins! definitely go if you have the chance! you won't regret it!!

Daniel, the general manager, is such a delightful person. He was extremely patient and helpful with explaining and recommending options on the menu. It was my first time at Greens & Proteins, and the food is fantastic. I ordered the green shake and a BBQ chicken pizza (square) - super thin crust and vegan cheese. I highly recommend this place. I wish there was a location in Irvine or Los Angeles, CA. I highly recommend this place

After about a dozen orders, mostly carryouts, the service and quality have declined steadily. My first several visits easily merited five stars. However, the always cheerful welcome has been gone for a while, and tonight's carryout meal was a disappointment. The salmon was good, but the avocado portion was small and so full of brown spots that I wouldn't eat it. The watery mashed sweet potatoes were not tasty. Furthermore, the cashier closed the cash drawer with a hasty thanks and goodbye but without the change I was due. Until I see a string of favorable reviews I'm taking my smoothie business to the nearby smoothie restaurant, and my healthy meal business to the nearby protein restaurant. I'll be back at some point, with the hope of providing a more positive review.

I must say I am not the healthiest person buuuut I finally got the chance to go in and check out this place that many of my co-workers would speak of. I had the bison burger and it's by far my all time favorite burger!! Everything is fresh and the meat is just perfect. I also enjoy the wellness green juice. Every now and then I call and schedule it to pick up. The guy that's usually there is a young man named Raul that always takes good care of us and makes sure that our food and juices are top notch. Excellent customer service by him and the rest of the greens and proteins team. By the way get the sweet potatoes fries!!!! You go g&p!

Absolutely love the food and smoothies here. Usually get great customer service but today not so much. Cashier kept looking into the kitchen talking to a co worker after each question she asked me. Had to repeat myself multiple times due to her not listing to me. Then she went on to drink her drink infront of me as i tried to order. The cashier needs some basic customer service training.
Healthy AND delicious! The jicama fries were awesome. Really nice environment and surprisingly easy parking for Downtown Las Vegas. I will be back to try other items on the menu!

It actually makes me very sad that I'm writing this because I was so looking forward to finding a good healthy place to eat. Everyone was really friendly, from the cashier to the manager, and their customer service was excellent. I can't say the same about the food. First off, I ordered the "wellness juice" which isn't a juice at all, I watched the girl prepare it throw vegetables into a blender and it was this disgusting, warm slush of liquid-y vegetables. I'm a green juice hound, and I don't know why they market their drinks as "juices" if they're more like slushed-up smoothies? The smoothie-thing had a horrible aftertaste like the vegetables had gone bad, and I only took one sip before throwing it in the trash. Secondly, I ordered an albacore salad which was literally a lump of canned tuna thrown on top of a bed of lettuce. I don't know who decided to call this thing a salad but it's definitely not what most people would consider to be a salad. The lump of canned tuna and lettuce bed was horribly tasteless and the lettuce was wilted and soggy. It makes me so sad that I didn't find what I was so hopeful to find in greens and protein. I was really excited to find my new favorite healthy cafe. The only reason why I'm giving it two stars is because the employees were really friendly & helpful. But unfortunately, the horrible food was a dealbreaker for me, and I won't be a returning customer.

I have been to this place numerous times in the past and I never got the chance to review this place. Greens and Proteins never dissatisfied my visit, all of their food and smoothies are great. My favourite is the Chocolate Veggiechino, the best stuff to get through your morning in a good mood! Also the Tofu Fries are a must-have too!
This time I decided to order the Granola French Toast, which is fantastic and don't be fooled by the small portions. After 4 small toasts it really filled you up.
My favorite place to eat!! I eat here often, and once I forgot to replace the regular cheese in a salad with Goat cheese and the girl taking my order remembered and reminded me!  Now that's Service!

Good Smoothies and Juices but ehh on the salads and over priced.

I guess if you stick a healthy label on a restaurant you would always expect to pay high prices. 

What I do like are the juices and smoothies as their made from real fresh ingredients. The last time we were here we ordered the "Green Shake"; "Green Ginger Limeade" and the "Albacore Tuna Salad"

The "Green Shake" comes with Banana, almonds, mango, orange, apple, avocado, spinach, collard greens, kale, vanilla, agave nectar. Sounds like they put the kitchen sink in this shake but you can taste hints of every ingredient. You get a dose of fruits and vegetables and an added extra protein burst with the almonds. You can substitute this for a meal as it's very filling. 

The "Green Ginger Limeade" comes with Green grapes, spinach, ginger, lime, agave nectar. Its a very refreshing drink and its not filled with a bunch of sugars. One of the things I love about this drink is the ginger. It does not overpower the drink as it adds a unique sweetness. 

The "Albacore Tuna Salad" comes with Tomatoes, celery, cucumbers and bibb lettuce, Dijon dressing. Now this was such a big disappointment. My thoughts ordering this was I was going to get seared tuna on top of greens but to my surprise it was canned tuna and the large size was priced at 9.99. I felt like I just got ripped off. The dressing was also a little too strong with the Dijon but at least it killed the taste of the canned tuna. 

I would definitely come back for the Juices and Smoothies but would hesitate to order another salad. There are other selections available on the menu like pizzas and burgers that I might try next time.

The best I can say is that the food was edible. That's the good part. 

The place caters to paleo and vegan type people, so it's going to be more expensive, but it substantially so. They are a food and smoothie shop with an open kitchen, but do not have enclosed blenders, so there is a huge amount of noise. Also, they do not appear to have run cycles on the blenders, so someone will turn one on, and walk away to do something else, and leave it running. One was left going for 5 minutes non stop. 

The food: to say that it was worth it would be an overstatement. One entree was the shrimp, cous cous and asparagus. For 13 dollars, there were literally 5 shrimp. My cheese steak was greasy to a level that was borderline inedible (It's a cheese steak, so that's par for the course.) The jicama fries tasted like nothing and overall everything was bland and boring.  The food had all of the outward appearances of a place that isn't trying all that hard.  

You can get some veggies and protein there that's about as interesting as a subway salad.

Healthy and delicious food, washed down with tasty juices and smoothies is what I was looking for when I first stepped into Greens and Proteins. And they did not disappoint!

I ordered the turkey and bacon wrap with tofu fries, and I could not believe something this good was really healthy! I was a little hesitant about the tofu fries, but upon first bite this place has me hooked! The wellness drink is great, and I order it every visit. It has the perfect blend of fruits and veggies, getting your daily dose of vitamin needs. 

My only complaint is in the wellness drink. Kale is very good for you and wished they put more than just the few pieces they use. It feels like they use just enough to say that kale is in the drink.

Still love this place and will be here many many times!
First time here! Menu looks yum but the cashier was hella rude! We will see if the taste of the food can override the rudeness!

Love this place.  I am currently on a strict dieting regiment that requires counting all my nutrient intake and they're always willing to go out of their way for me.  I was helped by Cassie and she was very accommodating in making my order perfect.  Can't complain about anything here.
Love eating here write after working out at LVAC. A quick fix for my protein needs. Gotta step my greens game up though.

This place has a variety of healthy good foods including pizza!! Everything here is good so don't be afraid to order but if you an unhealthy person and don't like health food this is not your place I did say pizza but it ain't no Pizza Hut

My husband is obsessed with this place, and I do love it too. Every Sunday after church we have to come and I always talk about how I need to give this place a rating! I think we tried just about everything on the menu! We love everything, except for those jicama fries. If they were cooked, I think I'd enjoy them! However, everything else is DELICIOUS. we LOVE it all. Our favorite is the Veggie burger and the Margherita pizza on vegan lavash.

I saw this place by chance when I went to breakfast yesterday nearby, and the name -- and Yelp reviews -- convinced me I had to check it out.  My post-workout lunch today was amazing: I started with the Green Ginger Limeade, and then put together a build-your-own plate of turkey breast, kale, caramelized onions and a side of sweet potato mash.  The meal was lightly but perfectly seasoned; it didn't even need the balsamic reduction sauce (but that was pretty tasty, too).  I will definitely be back!
Love this place!! Frequent visitor. Friendly staff!! Always bring out-of-town guest here to try the delicious and healthy food! BBQ pizza is the absolute BEST!!!!

Get their green ginger limeade!!! Amazing!
I can even get my kids to drink it.
Their wellness drink is also very filling
I love this place!!!! I got out of m routine of stopping by but will be making it a priority to get healthy in 2014.

While this place is fine and technically proficient, I was not wowed or amazed by my meal, and for the price, I would not come back here again.  I did the make your own meal where you pick a protein, a "green", a "grain" and a sauce.  The chicken was done well and was juicy, the quinoa was a bit on the al dente side for me, but again was fine, and avocado is avocado.  What I did not care for was how they served it.  It was on a large plate, with everything separate and not touching.  I felt like someone who had OCD fixed the plate.  I would've preferred a bowl where I could mix the things together with the sauce, since quinoa isn't exactly easy to get on a fork with chicken and avocado already on it.  Quinoa is also rather bland by itself.

I also got the Thai Ginger soup, which was more like a thick yellow curry with nothing in it.  I love ginger, and couldn't really taste it in this soup, which was disappointing to me, as it's the reason I ordered it.

I would honestly give this place 2.5 stars, more on the lines of "meh" than A-ok, and that's mainly because the service here was decent and the people working behind the counter were nice and helpful.  I would honestly rather go to the Sweet Tomatoes down the street as it's about the same cost depending on what you order.

Fun little place.  As someone that has recently been introduced to juicing, I found this place really cool.  The combination of both a "juice bar" which is why I went there and having a lot of traditional food choices fun to salivate to.
Glad they are on South rainbow.  Same menu and half of the time to wait after you order.  Highly recommended

I made the mistake of coming in during the lunch rush. It was my intent to treat a colleague with very specific tastes to lunch. When we arrived, the line was twelve people deep, so our assumption was the food was worth the wait.

As we waited we noticed the manager or owner take a person out of line and personally take and expedite her order. At first, I thought he was trying to speed service. The woman in front of us commented, "if I were in tight spandex maybe I'd skip to the front of the line too." Sure enough, the helpful employee did not take anyone else out of line to take their order and stayed chatting with the young woman until her smoothie came.

Meanwhile, my associate noted prices were higher than she really wanted to pay for a smoothie or lunch. Since we were already waiting and the lunch hour was winding away, I reminded her I was treating.

Adventurous, I ordered the ostrich burger with tofu fries. My companion ordered a smoothie and a make your own meal with salmon and rice. By the time we paid, the helpful manager had long since seen his prey leave with her smoothie and was sitting alone at her table on his phone texting or maybe yelping. 

We waited to take our food to go. As we waited, we both cringed hearing the cook at the grill sneezing. This is incidental as I'm sure he was sanitary about the sneeze, but it's still not something you want to hear as your food's being prepared, and it bolstered a so far unsatisfactory experience.

We eventually received our order and rushed back to our office to eat.

My coworker's first comment in the car? "This smoothie is terrible. I can get a better one a Whole Foods for half the price." 

We waited till the office to start in on the rest. My ostrich burger wasn't bad. This was my second ostrich burger ever and it ranked top two. The tofu fries were actually pretty tasty. 

Unfortunately, my coworker's meal wasn't as tasty. Already unhappy with the smoothie she asked me to taste her rice. The rice was still uncooked. The fish on the other hand was overcooked. For the rest of the day all I heard her say was, "that smoothie was not worth nine dollars" and "how hard is it to cook rice?"
This is my favorite place to eat, the most healthy and delicious food.  It's open late and the customer service is the best! Always take care of my and know what I want.

I am currently a vegan and thought this place would be a great place to grab a healthy 'juice'. So I come here with my dad and he orders a parfait and I order a green 'juice' and the total comes to about $16 dollars with tip. I thought that was a tad on the expensive side but I know the prices of juice are very expensive because of the amount of vegetables and fruits that go into a juice (I worked at a juice bar for about two years so I understand juice pricing). So my 'juice' comes out and it's a smoothie? I do not know how they can call these smoothies juices?! It was frozen and it was really sweet for something that was considered a green juice. I was very disappointed and felt very mislead. My dad did not like his parfait either (too sugary). As a health nut and a biochemist I would not consider this place to be healthy at all. Albeit I have not tried any other items but i will assure you that I will not be coming back to try anything else. The only time that any one should go sugar load there is after a very High intensity work out. The only reason I have this place two stars is because the service was lovely. 

A note for the greens and proteins owners: 
I would recommend rewording the menu so it is not so misleading. I know you mean well and have a great idea but for people educated on health and wellness it is very misleading.

I stopped at the one on Flamingo for the first time yesterday and took forever to decide what I wanted.  I asked the gal at the counter for suggestions and one of hers was the summer salad.  I ordered a small one with chicken and it was absolutely delicious and very large portion.  I will definitely come back.

Great selection of healthy food for the health nuts and macro-conscious!

I'm in Henderson for a business conference but I didn't want to break my healthy eating habits. I love the variety in protein options, the green options without the extra added oils and spices, just simple and delicious! Bonus: complimentary cucumber/lemon water. So good!
I wish I could do my meal prep like this! Clean quality and taste great. It's worth the price for the quality.

I love going to Greens & Protiens post work out and it's real convienant due to it's location near the N. Decatur LVAC. I love the frittatas, they have vegan options galore and will accommodate you. The staff is always very friendly and the cook will often bring out the food himself. I usually get mine to go, so I haven't had that pleasure yet. The place is clean and good for a meal anytime of day.

The food was ok. The portion sizes were just a little small for the price. I left feeling unsatisfied. 
If your on a diet and don't want to over eat, this is your spot. You will never need a to go box. 
Fellas, if your over 200lbs and aren't trying to lose weight, eat a snack before you come.
It was good my sandwich was tasty and healthy. My wife's gluten free pizza with Low fat cheese was also tasty.
I love the food here.  Very healthy.  The staff is top notch, can't think of a friendlier staff.  I wish Las Vegas had more restaurants like this one.
Little pricey, but love their options. If you are going for breakfast, you really should get those Walnut pancakes! They are so good! Smoothies are awesome and organic ingredients! Yep, I'm hooked!
Great service! Great food and even better staff! If your lucky enough to meet Ceasar he will surely put a smile on your face!

I try to eat very healthy 90% of the times. I lead an active life style and am always looking for good healthy/organic nutritional places to eat. I came across this place and became stoked because it was so close to my house. Yesterday I decided to stop by with my boyfriend; first of all, HOLY EXPENSIVE! I don't mind spending money on food specially if it's good quality but it wasn't. I ordered a Greek pizza w out cheese on a vegan crust and it was so dry! The hummus looked old and I was burping it up two hours later. My boyfriend ordered a chicken wrap (which was not bad according to him) however he felt extremely bloated afterwards. Lastly I had an acai bowl and I was so extremely disappointed, the granola was chewy and old tasting, the fruits were alright but the acai was off in color. It wasn't a rich purple it was more of a raspberry pink. Seriously do not recommend. A myriad of people love it but I just want to share my experience.

Had to dock them one star for my recent order.  I ordered two orders of pancakes and was told they would be ready in 15 minutes.  I waited about 30  minutes. The server even apologized. Also,  when I got home I realized they didn't give us the agave syrup it was supposed to come with.  The house was empty from moving so I didn't have any syrup in the fridge. It's kind of like eating a huge chocolate moist brownie without any milk.  That's just wrong. Next time I'll look at my order before leaving which I should've done instead of grabbing the bag and driving away.

On my way to workout at LVAC I happened to see this restaurant and I happened to be craving a smoothie. After my workout I went in and ordered the Wellness Smoothie. If you enjoy green smoothies, it was delicious! I loved it! Then I saw that there was also bison and ostrich on the menu which are unique menu items. I can't wait to return and try it out!

Not bad.  Been here twice on a Groupon.  The first time the sausage was grotesquely cold, but they took care of it.  Didn't care for the greek scramble or the scrambled egg whites with housemade [cold] turkey sausage.  The berry parfait and Greens & Proteins Breakfast Burrito are good.  The Green Leaf Berry Blast was yummy and not too sweet, just super spendy after the tip. Won't go out of my way to return.

YUM!!!

When you walk in..it doesn't look that special. The decor is nice but the menu was deceiving. What I got was MUCH better than I had expected. I had the veggie wrap..and oh my! So delicious and healthy. I had the tofu fries with it.. and i LOVE tofu. They were very light and also did not taste fattening. The staff was very friendly! 

I wish we had a place like this in the North Bay!

The best place to hit after a workout! So convenient and most importantly AMAZING! I love their wellness drink and the build your own menu. While on contest prep I was able to grab a quick, healthy bite here and they are always willing to customize your order (no added salt, oil, etc.) Everyone is really nice and helpful, but Mariah makes the best drinks in town! She always has a genuine smile, friendly attitude, and seems stress-free---even with a line out the door! Keep it up guys!

Just tried this place due to it's glowing reviews from several friends. I saw a Groupon for their breakfast and figured it would be the perfect opportunity. 

We ordered the G&P breakfast burrito, egg whites with sausage, and the whole grain pancakes. The burrito lacked any kind of flavor and was very wet. It was literally laying in a pool of liquid. I didn't try the sausage for the eggs but my stepson didn't care for them at all...once again no flavor.
The pancakes were the best out of the three, but were kind of on the dry side. I didn't mind but my significant other doused them on extra syrup.

I will try this place again, just not for breakfast. Maybe come back around lunch time bc that menu looked great.

Found them through Groupon. 

It's about 5 miles from the Strip but boy is it worth it!

My husband and I both ordered the southwest tofu and soyrizo burrito. Mind you my husband is a full on beefaterian, while I'm a vegetarian. It came with house salsa (amazing), and tofu house fries (bombtastic). The burrito had the right amount of heat but not too overwhelming. I also ordered a strawberry watermelon shake, it was so refreshing. They also offer complimentary cucumber lemon water, we couldn't get enough!

They offer a breakfast and lunch menu. They also have different types of proteins, such as bison and ostrich meat. Another reason to come here is their juices and shakes! 

A must try!
Yum! Love this place, if you are a vegetarian/vegan or just like clean healthy food you have to check this place out!

Been here for a while and I liked it when I first started going but then the customer service just went down. They definitely don't really care to listen for anything else but what you ordered. I think they're understaffed because I always have a wait time when there was only one person in front of me and everyone else in the place got their order. Recently had a take out order and three people behind me got their take out order before me and they ordered more than me. Not sure where their Priorities with orders are. The food is good but it was over priced for what the wait time and average customer service here.

I want to support this place because there are few easy healthy options in the area, but when it takes 15-20 minutes for $5 oatmeal in the morning and are late for work because of it, I can't justify coming back. I don't fully blame the guy working because he might have been understaffed,  but everyone else seemed to get their food on time. Oh well.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! I love the healthy atmosphere this place has and how they create such delicious entrees that are good for you! The bison Philly cheese wrap is delicious and the bison burger as well! 

The chocolate peanut butter banana shake is so decadent and it's a little pricey (7.50) but the portion size is huge! So it's definitely worth it. 

The people there are really nice too! They cooked my moms steak well done and she wanted medium rare and so they made her another one and there was no attitude or anything. 

Definitely recommend !

I would like to thank the wonderful staff at G&P! I have been coming to this location for the last couple of months and today they were even more amazing than ever!

I ordered my normal breakfast to be picked up on my way into the office this morning. Well...that pickup turned into a cancel because I drove right by the exit, yup I didn't even think about exiting (I guess my autopilot kicked in ha!) 

I went ahead and called over to give them the courtesy call that I would not be able to make it and they can do what they please with the food. Becca (I believe her name was) answered the phone and had her supervisor jump on the line. 

Priscilla assured me that it was alright and that they would re-make it when I could come by later in the day, all I needed was to give them a 10-15 minute window. Sure enough, when I called Priscilla answered and she knew right away and said it was no problem and that they would have it ready. I was elated!

I know this a bit lengthy, but I would like to express my gratitude to G&P staff! Thank you, thank you, thank you! Superb customer service and always delicious food!

I hope the owners are reading this. Please listen to other customers' reviews that discuss poor customer service (ie Latoya & Natalie G). This is one of the reasons we will wean ourselves off of this G&P location. 

I try to eat pretty strict, and every single time I've inquired about ingredients in particular sauces, nobody (except Julie) knows. An employee tried to ask a chef, to which he replied "we can't share that with customers." After approaching him in person, he said he was only following protocol.

So why does the G&P website state "We also provide an experience for our guests where they can feel free to ask any question about our menu items, recipes or obtain basic nutritional facts to help them on their way to health, happiness and success"  ?

The employees don't want to learn how to accomplish this. No management, poor work ethic, horrible service...during slower afternoon hours all they do is stand around. They don't take initiative to wipe down tables, ask the few customers inside how their meals are, or clean the drink station.

Julie is the saving grace of this location and should be promoted. God Bless her. She has shown more customer service, more kindness, more motivation and work ethic than anyone else.

Food in general is excellent, even though yes, it is a bit pricy. For this particular location, the employees have always been nice. My only qualm was sometimes they forgot things or for example whenever I'd order "saut√©ed kale," for the most part, it was never done and came out plain. Other than that, their bison burger and salmon are on point!

Ok I don't know what I am gonna do when I leave Vegas for the Basketball season! I am going to miss this place! I pre order my drink via phone and I order it do much they know my voice what customer service! RC and my main man Kevin are amazing! My favorite drink is the wellness little grapes, no agave &extra greens! A must try!
Well thought out restaurant. Amazing, healthy food at a great price for the quality you are getting.  Ostrich burger is fantastic.
Weak to say the least! Nobody knows what's going on! Ask about the H G C diet, they have no clue! Vegan!!! Haha! Cooked on same grill as chicken plus! Wish I could give a negative 5

The white turkey chili is a party on your pallet. Packed with flavor and delicious pita chips on the side. I highly recommend it! 

As for service, everyone was super nice and helpful. The cashier offered suggestions which I really appreciate being that it was my first visit. 

I will definitely be back.

1.5 star for today. Patrick so unfriendly during my encounter with him while his processing my transaction. It's a first time I got treated like this here. He's tall and I think he's of the manager. He better change that attitude or else customer like me will be so disappointed and stop coming back to this location.

I'm health conscious, so I'm always looking for a good place to eat out that is still healthy.  Love the juices and I always get a vegan pizza when I'm there.  I guess the only reason I wouldn't give it a full five stars is because it gets too crowded sometimes.  This is probably because it's next to the LVAC.

Clean, bright, and nice. I will return to enjoy the healthy variety. You can chose from many of the menu protein drinks or create your own. This restaurant is a great place to eat that won't give you indigestion or undermine good health.

I asked for angus wrap with out blue cheese and he gave me a phillysteak wrap. I ordered avocado to be added to my meal and he put it on the side.

Only thing that was right about my order was the sweet potato fries. 

Mind you i did not specify it was the cajun angus wrap but when he told my philly angus wrap i told he thats not the one. He stated it was the only angus wrap. I even asked is it the one with blue cheese and he said no. I then stated thats not the one. He was adamant it was the only angus wrap. I said on trusting he would be knowledgeable.

I have now written my wrap down to prevent this.

The smoothies and juices here are fresh, healthy, and tasty! Great for the hot Vegas weather! I go out of my way to come here for their juices...mostly because it seems one of a kind, but also because they're that good! I wouldn't say their tofu fries are healthy, but they're definitely delicious too.

First time here, and I'm impressed by the menu size. They have anything a health-conscious citizen could ever want. Coming from a late night gym session, I stopped by here to please my appetite. I ordered a Bison Cheese Steak. It was fat and juicy enough to make my taste buds dance. It wasn't by no means a tango but more like a waltz, softly making you go hmmm.. that's interesting. Nevertheless it was delicious in its own respect. Tofu fries was great as well. I had a smoothie I can't remember but it was decent. I will return for a second opinion on the other items. I recommend this location to anyone enthusiastic to care enough about this review.

I don't understand the "portion size" issue.....First time in , I had the bison cheesesteak wrap with tofu fries....the wrap is huge, actually perfect for having a half of one and saving the other half for later (or sharing)...the salads looked substantial also. Second time in, I had the Greek Pizza on gluten-free thin crust...247 calories...and I seriously do not understand how they do it. It may look smallish; but eat the whole pie...I dare you to tell me that you are still hungry. Great flavor concentration also. I am not into the healthy shake stuff and do not work out at the gym; but "eating clean" is a great way to feel better about yourself and the carbs and proteins here are a perfect part of that plan.

Love the unique and clever healthy options-including jicama fries! I wish all the juices weren't blended though, some actually juiced veggies was what I was looking for, not a smoothie. Still we are eager to return and try new stuff!

What incredible service! All the staff was very friendly and head chef Cesar was most accommodating. 
I came with my entire family and we all left happy and satisfied. The food is well made and great for a healthy alternative when eating out.

The lunch choices are really good and the jicama fries are delish. I dont like the small amount of breakfast items they carry but everything can't be great, right? For the people who are calorie counting, the calories they put on the menu are not very accurate so beware.
Tons of options The food actually tasted like food, which is a lot more than I can say for Rachel's Kitchen. Also the green drink is good, looks weird though
Love their healthy beast options great value for your money especially after a workout!!!

Greens and Proteins provided a meal for our crew and cast of 70 on a short film last week.  Our shoot was hard to say the least, it was so hot at least for those of us not from Vegas and we were shooting nights.  Green and Proteins came in and made everything a whole lot better.  So often on set we have the same old meals, over salted and too heavy.  Greens and Proteins gave us plenty of fresh and wholesome food that tasted fabulous and got us through the rest of the night.  I can not recommend them highly enough for you catering needs.  I am a big fan :)
Food was great, need to have a lesson in customer service. Asking people to leave because it was after closing time was very rude.

Had an issue and yelped about it previously. The owners fixed the problem immediately and were super friendly.  I LOVED the gluten free vegan pizza, hard to find and it was delish. Place was spotless and relaxing. YUM.

If you go get the chicken, asparagus and sweet potato mash it was my first time and I feel great! And Marc was great and very helpful. He gave suggestions and checked back to see how we were doing it was like a sit down restaurant with a less formal feel!

Love this place love the clean meals right after my gym workouts great service.
Love the smoothies the oatmeal's amazing amazing.
If you're looking for a clean meal for a reasonable price definitely check this place out

Vegan is hard to do. They did it!

Got the veggie burger with seasoned tofu fries. GF got the Cali Chicken wrap. Pumpkin spice tea and Chocolate veggieccino.

I've been here many times, but I usually get the wellness drink which is delicious, but a bit pricey. 

I finally tried food. Turkey Burger with Jimica(?) fries.. I was not a fan of those fries they are served cold and the texture reminded me of an apple. 

I went again today and hap the BBQ Chicken pizza and wow! So good. SOOOO GOOD! I want another one! Lol 

I also really like the atmosphere since I am usually finishing a run or workout when I visit I don't always look my best. The staff is always friendly. And there's always others in workout clothes too. I don't feel out of place here. Also an okay place to visit solo

Hearing so many great things about this place, I decided to check it out for myself. I've never left a bad review in my life until now.  Although the food was great I could only give one star because their staff was terrible.  Being in the service industry, I am really big on customer service.  It took forever for the cashier to acknowledge me because she and another staff member were texting and talking on their cell phones.  Very unprofessional, poor customer service, unfriendly.  I will probably eat there again only because I was pleased with the food, but some of the staff members could use a course or two on customer service.

The service was lovely and the restaurant is clean. Big points there. I've been wanting to try them out for ages because I love tofu and they have tofu fries. What more in life do you need, right? Well...I guess I was just a bit disappointed. I ordered the veggie burger and unfortunately, I was not impressed. If you're a homemade veggie burger fanatic like I am, here are the things that I found lacking. 

1. WAY too thick. It was an inch thick. That with fixings, plus bun = too large!

2. Super dry. I mean, like bad falafel dry (I would say the texture was similar to falafel as well...kind of unusual for a veggie burger).

3. Bland. I could have gotten past #1, and maybe sauced it up to help #2 a little bit, but the lack of flavor made the burger taste like what non-vegetarians think of when they think of vegetarian food. 

It reminded me of vegetarian food from the 80s. We've come a long way since then. Maybe Greens and Proteins didn't get the memo. 

The tofu fries were good. Nothing to write home about, but I would probably buy them again when I'm craving tofu. Oddly enough, the veggie burger at Cheesecake Factory blows this one out of the water. I love supporting local, rather than chains...so I am super bummed. 

BUT...if they ever rethink that veggie burger recipe, I'd be more than happy to give them another shot. The place was clean and everyone was friendly. I'm still rooting for them.

I love the vegan burger and the tofu fries (extra crispy!).  If you tired it when they first opened, it's time to go back.  Everything I have tried recently has been delicious, prices are reasonable (especially considering what you're buying) and the staff is friendly.  It gets pretty busy during lunch, so  I usually call ahead for carry out.  I may have to go back there tomorrow!

This place is changing, and not for the better. The prices are the same, but they're cutting back in other ways; $8 for an acai bowl that has less than 8 oz of acai sorbet; which barely tastes like acai anymore. We asked for a kid's burger with sweet potato fries, but they forgot the fries and said it only comes with a fruit cup, yet they forgot that too. Avocado is extra charge...but guess what my chicken wrap was missing. So 2 out of 5 stars for getting 2 of my 5 items correct. This place was great, and I'd hate to watch it go downhill.

The manager did refund me for the acai bowl, and they eventually brought out the fries, twice. But I was already home before I realized the chicken wrap was lacking avocado.

The young man who took my order obviously did NOT know the menu. Told me the small salad was "huge" its was actually about the size of a small side salad. It shouldnt take more than 5 minutes to get a smoothie and a small salad with just lettuce and tomatoes and 3 tiny cucumbers. Took 9 minutes and I watched as my drink sat on the counter as 4 people ignored the fact that someone ordered a togo drink. I would NEVER pay 15 dollars for what i got EVER again. Horrible service, small portions for an expensive price.

Came here with a friend and ordered an all raw meal. The jicama fries are plain out bad. There is nothing special about them. The raw pizza had an unusually thin crust like a chip and the flavor was not good either. My friend got the nachos and was also not impressed. Hate to give such a thumbs down but gotta be honest.
Great healthy food, has so many GF options and different chains. However it is pretty pricey and a long wait time
Wow! What a great surprise. Excellent, very creative quick meals. Fresh Ahi Tacos were great.
Love the margharita pizza here!! Will try more dishes next time I go! Maybe after the gym, lol.

Excellent!  Ive tried about half the menu and everything has been superb. The service is fast and friendly as well.  The grilled buffalo chicken strips are the BEST!   The other things I'd recommend are the pizzas (Margerita and Chicken are my fav), the bison burger and the breakfast wrap.

I write this review with tears of gratitude in my eyes. I'm visiting friends in LV for a week, and I'm wicked broken. You think gluten free would be hard, try being gf, dairy, soy, canola, rice, and potato free (amongst others) due to sensitivities. It's rough. 
After carefully reading their menu for about 8 minutes, the wonderful cashier helped me out with a few specifics. I ordered the bison patty with kale and sweet potato mash, and the lump crab and avocado lettuce cups. I watched as they made sure EVERYONE in the kitchen was alerted to the specifics of the ticket, consulted the recipe book just in case, and made sure they had my back as they prepared my food. 
It was all great, clean food. I couldn't ask for more. Thank you so so much. Recommended to every person around.

VERY accommodating. Great customer service! I had a VERY unusual request during today's lunch visit. I had just had my teeth professionally whitened and was told I could not eat any foods or beverages with color, what so ever. Only white or clear foods would be allowed for the next 48 hours. I expressed this "odd situation" when it was my turn to order. Next thing I knew Mark (the cashier at the time) and I had concocted an egg white with feta cheese omelet and a side of straight up, plain Jane jicama fries. Though it may not have been the most delicious culinary outtake you have ever heard of, it was a creative and accommodating dish that served up well in my time of need. And it tasted pretty good in the big scheme of things. Thank you again for the great attitude and customer service experience it required to solve my colorless food dilemma.

This place is convenient when you need to choose a restaurant for healthy meal options. I've ordered from Greens and Proteins a few times and was pretty satisfied.. I like that they show what the macros nutrients and calories on their menu. My only suggestion is that they should offer sweet potato fries or something similar to go with their burgers. I tried the jicama "fries" and really was disappointed with the texture and taste of them. I would describe them as cold turnips or tasteless apples formed as fries.

Very good food.  I normally get the Bison Cheese steak with a spinach wrap when  I go.  I have also had the Ostrich Burger and a few other things as well.  I have had most of their Juices and Shakes as well.  All of the food has been very good.  

It's always been good service as well.
Bison Burger, side of Sweet Potato fries with a Watermelon /Strawberry Smoothie . We'll be back! Kudos , quite clean in here!
My favorite healthy place to eat! i love the greek pizza and the green shake is the best smoothie! :)

really love this place. they have great juices and really awesome options for everyone from the raw diet to the meat diet. Had 1 bad experience here when I ordered a gluten free pizza and they brought me one that was not gluten free and only caught it after I had eaten a slice. The waiter just blew it off as an "oops" but for me it is an intolerance not a diet choice so it was not a little "oops" to me. I was a bit taken aback by his flippancy. I didn't make a huge thing about it, maybe i should have but i was just disappointed. If you are celiac definitely double and triple check everything...Other than that, i have never had a bad meal there. It is a favorite post yoga and post airport treat
First time here.  The suggestion for breakfast was spot on.  Love having a healthy option for eating out that also taste great.

For once I was not feeling guilty about eating out. They have a good selection and really live up to their name. 

I had the california chicken wrap and chose a lettuce wrap instead of wheat. The dipping sauce it came with was very good. I do think that the wrap could have been seasoned better. For the side, the choice was between tofu fries and jicama sticks. I chose the tofu fries and quite liked them. Also tasted the jicama a friend had chosen and it was good too.
And their water is infused with cucumber and lemon and is YUM!

Everyone liked their food. I believe the 'wellness' drink was great and tasted amazing.
Everything from salmon to greek pizza looked so healthy and tasted great.
It's a good place to eat.  Plenty of hot chicks that work there, and a lot of tail coming in and out all day.  Way overpriced though.  $8.00 for a smoothie ?

While attending a  training in the area I fell in love with this place..  I ate there every day ... and later was bring others from the class.  I love organic and healthy choices, juices, smoothies, vegetarian and vegan options.... and this was a perfect place for me. Thank you .

Love this place. I was in LV on a business trip. Heard about Greens and Proteins, it didn't disappoint. You have to try the bison burger with tofu fries, great combo. Washed it all down with a chocolate peanut butter banana shake. yum!

Look we all have to eat and in the fasted pace world we live in it is too easy to eat things that are yummy but NOT healthy.  We believe in moderation in all things. A little self control is required!  I promise, you will eat again so keep the splurging to a meal or two a week. Luckily in Vegas there are lots of healthy places to stop and eat and not feel guilty. I mean I can think of 4 or 5 just on Eastern!  Greens and Proteins can fill your stomach with some high quality fuel and make your taste buds jump for joy all while making sure you look good for the pool party season. 

The salads are awesome and you can add really good salmon for a protein boost. The lettuce wraps are always a light healthy meal. Their juices are good but for me I ask them to leave some of the fruit out as I don't want as much sugar.  The staff is helpful and efficient.  You can get in and out quickly for breakfast, lunch or dinner or you can also choose to sit and enjoy a great meal and conversation. I love sitting outside and feeling the wonderful Vegas warmth in the evenings. Enjoy a glass of the complimentary cucumber water that is ice cold and plentiful. 

We all love to eat but we all also want to be healthy and look great. We all like convenience and most of us don't have time or desires to cook three meals a day.  This place can help you live the life you want while eating healthy and enjoying your food. 

Eat to live, but live to experience life. 
Aaron

I will never eat here again! The cheese and broccoli soup was very running and hand little flavor. The hummus was worst very bland and no flavor. It tasted like an old rag. The cost was pricy. I get that you are paying for health but it would be far cheaper to buy some chicken , brown rice, and kale, put nothing on it and cook it! This is a fad but an expensive one!

My brother ordered several pizzas (BBQ chicken and Margerhita) for me and my parents.  After trying these pizzas, I exclaimed, "Oh my god!! They are sooo good and healthy!!"  These pizzas have just 300 calories.  For Vegan lovers, this is the place to go!!

I've been looking for a good Acai bowl outside of Acai to the T. I saw that G & P had one on the menu and decided to try it out. 

When the bowl came it was very small and I was surprised to see that instead of an acai berry smoothie mix, it was an acai flavored sorbet with some generic granola and cut up fruit on top. Most places to above and beyond to included honey or agave syrup and some sweet fruit. 

Overall I was just disappointed with this type of take on the bowl.

Excellent service and food. Fresh, healthy, tasty, and fast. Really enjoyed their selection of craft fountain soda and vegetables. I wish there were more restaurants like this. I ordered the grilled chicken with sauteed broccoli and sweet potatoes.

The food there is unique and pretty true to fact on it's healthy portions and calorie intake I like the location because it's near the gym so if I want a protein drink afterwards that's not from LVAC I can always go there. I do wish they would do something about their AC though the last time the heat was like a little higher then the outside.

My new favorite place to eat in Vegas! So healthy and everything is so full of flavor. Their salads are great and I love the pizza. Loved the acai bowls are to die for. Employees are so friendly and fun. I'm a huge fan of the complimentary fruit infused water.

Vegan review. I ordered the buffalo chicken strips and a smoothie. The strips were tasty, it came with a few strips of carrots and celery; I wasn't a fan of the vegan ranch. The smoothie was good enough. I'd recommend giving it a shot. The girl working register, Kayla, was helpful in informing me about all the vegan options.
Great food.  Pricey, but organic and healthy food is always pricey. Hot girls in this place all the time too
The food is good for a health food place but customer service is awful. Do not order delivey because they will mess up order.

Super healthy food and very clean restaurant! The bison burger was so good and I did not feel weighted down after eating it. Many veggie and vegan options as well as regular diet to choose from. I am not a fan of jicama but the seasoning on the jicama fries complements it well. I would go back to try to beverages they offer.

I will not be returning due to the terrible customer service I just received. Just spoke with the woman who said she is the to go manager about me being dissatisfied with my order and she proceeded to argue with me rather than just listen and see how she could help me. There was turkey in my salad, I am vegetarian and even called and verified my alterations over the phone - my smoothies were melted by the time I got there and horrible. I will NOT be returning. Terrible terrible customer service.

I selected Greens and Proteins (G&P) because I wanted a tasty, wholesome breakfast with no animal protein.  In short, I was not impressed with this establishment and its offerings. It seems to me that they are offering a watered down version of "healthy" food.

EXPERIENCE: I struggled with their juice menu first. I juice and drink fresh juices from other establishments on a regular basis so I felt comfortable picking out a quick juice to start my meal. Unfortunately, agave nectar and honey were featured in all but one drink.   I can get added sugar anywhere in town, I was surprised that a place that calls itself a "healthy kitchen and juice bar" offered no pure juices. And that what they were presenting as juice was laden with a sweetener more processed than high fructose syrup (agave). 

Needless to say, I chose the V9 juice since it offered some vegetable and contained no added sugar.  I asked for more greens (spinach and kale) in the juice with regular tomatoes rather than the sun dried tomatoes usually in the drink. The addition of vegetable stock to the juice was confusing for me. I saw them add a processed vegetable broth, not a stock, but that didn't bother me too much. I have never seen a juice offering with vegetable "stock", but I was willing to try it.  The "juice" was more of a blended concoction.  It was cold and thickish.  Especially as I got the end. What is was not, was tasty.  There was no bite from the lime or garlic and the "stock" watered down the taste of the vegetables. The texture and flavor were off putting, but I'd spent the $6.99 for 24 oz. (8oz of that are the vegetable broth) so I drank it. Most of it.

My mother ordered the Greek scramble with a side of the homemade turkey bacon. I ordered the "Real Deal Oatmeal" with some of the additions (raisins, bananas, and "sucant", which is sugar) on the side. The menu lists "sucant" as an ingredient in the oatmeal, but I believe G & P has misspelled the word Sucanat on their menu. Sucanat is a whole, unrefined cane sugar made by "crushing sugar cane, extracting the juice, heating it, and dehydrating it into granules." It's still sugar, but many people consider it a healthier option because it contains less sucrose and "retains the natural molasses and trace nutrients like iron, calcium, potassium, and B vitamins."

I've ordered oatmeal at dozens of establishments in this town--most not presenting the image of a health conscious establishment---and I've never heard what I heard from G&P.  After ordering, the cashier had to come over and find me to tell me that they could not put the sugar (Sucanat) on the side.  "Why" I asked. She explained that the sugar is mixed in with the oatmeal. What??? I clarified in case I had misheard her.  I asked incredulously, "The sugar is already mixed in with the oatmeal? So I can't get oatmeal without sugar?" Correct.
