She informed me that they pre-mix the sugar in the oatmeal.  To put this issue in context, a person can order rolled oats oatmeal at McDonald's without sugar.  How do they know how much sugar (Sucanat) I want in my oatmeal?   I imagine they err on the side of "a lot." 

All of the other breakfast options included animal protein or sugar except for the Berry Parfait. I ordered it without the strawberry yogurt since I assumed that it had more sugar than I would like. I asked for plain yogurt in the parfait. The chef happened to be out on the floor and the cashier (misunderstanding my request?) asked the chef what was in the strawberry yogurt. He stated that it was plain yogurt with strawberries and sweeteners added.  I don't eat pre-sweetened yogurt and figured the strawberries and sweetened granola would add enough sugar to the meal. He said they had plain yogurt in the back and that they could accommodate me. 

The parfait was fine--lots of large strawberries and sweet crunchy granola.  I tasted one of Mom's tofu fries and it was crunchy and well seasoned. She enjoyed her egg white scramble and turkey sausage side.

I understand everyone visiting G & P will not share my expectations. If people are looking for a place with some vegetables and some healthier options, this place is solid.  I love that they have a raw section on their menu. I also appreciate the lean meats on their menu that are not easy to find elsewhere: bison and ostrich. 

SERVICE: Great service. They did a fantastic job of accommodating me.

SUMMARY: Greens and Proteins seems a decent option for those on a plant-based diet looking for restaurant options, those seeking non-certified gluten free options,  or those looking for more generally healthy food options. 

It was not a good place for me. When I patronize a "healthy" establishment, I am seeking whole foods, less refined sugars and grains, great taste, few if any processed foods, and greater raw (and cooked) vegetable options. I do not think I will return to Greens and Proteins.

I was really excited to try this place!  Just moved to LV and was looking for some healthy dining experiences.  Me and a friend both ordered the bison burger in a lettuce wrap with tofu fries and I also ordered a Green Ginger limeaid.  The green drink showed up quick and was sooooo good!  A+ and about 10ish minutes later our food arrived....The burgers had the bun on them instead of the lettuce wrap but the waiter was really great and brought the lettuce out promptly!  The burger was delicious!  There was some sort of yummy sauce that came with it too.  The tofu fries were ok...they weren't hot :(  probably would have been great if they were hot, but I ate them anyways bc they were still good.  Next time I will order the jicama fries.  Cant wait to come back to G & P and try everything else out!

We tried Greens & Proteins again and was really impressed with the service and food quality... I can see why it's a favorite of so many people... The food was fresh & healthy and the juice was fresh pressed. So happy they have menus you can look at rather than having them taped to the counter like they used to be... Will definitely be enjoying this again soon!
I had the wellness juice and the turkey wrap and was surprised at how delicious it was! Very flavorful appetizing and delicious, but healthy as well. A win win!
If you want cheap , go somewhere else . If you want to eat clean and bomb food at that , this is the spot . So far everything I had here is awesome

Delicious!!! Perfect spot to get a healthy meal after working out at LVAC. Their juices and smoothies are great and I love their breakfast. A bit overpriced thus the minus one star but other than that my new favorite breakfast spot!
Awesome concept. Very friendly and efficient staff. Very fresh, healthy and proportioned menu with lots of choices for all diets.

First visit to Greens & Proteins, so glad Julie was there! She introduced me to the menu and recommended the tri tip tacos! OMG, the best. Also let me taste one of the juices, so refreshing! Thanks Julie for a great experience! I will be back...soon!
Lots of vegan and gluten free options.  The veggie burger didn't have vegan mayo as advertised, but was tasty anyway.  Decent service.

Healthy doesn't have to be Bland.....


Greens and Proteins is just waiting to explode into locations all over the place.  It is as marketable as a snow day when you're ten, and healthier than a visit to the gym (with less no-neck tools grunting too)

The interior is serene and beautiful, with waterfalls on the walls, grass-green accents around the room, and a few big screens; Greens and Proteins is a smoothie made of Whitman's Leaves of Grass poetry, modern chic, and conscious eating.  

Trying to stay on your diet plan for that summer body?  The items on the menu have their calorie count posted, so you can tell just how many miles it would take to burn off lunch.  If you don't care about that sort of thing, the food is still quite delicious.

I enjoyed the teriyaki chicken wrap w/ jicama "fries,"  and a smoothie that had pretty much everything in the garden in it.  I can't recall the name, but it was green and wonderful.  


I live pretty far from here, but luckily the nice woman at the register told me that a new location could be opening in Summerlin sometime soon.  In the meantime, I'll make the trek for something nourishing, tasty, and satisfying, it's certainly worth the drive.
Great place to have healthy food the best egg whites turkey sausage with goat cheese on the eggs and half avocado and green ice tea services also great

First experience and last. Most painful order experience. I asked what the restaurant was about. The girl couldn't and answer me just stared blankly. I asked her what the * meant next to lean angus burger and she had no idea what I was taking about. I should have turned and walked out and gone to the other protein place across the parking lot. I then asked about the Salads and then portion size. I made sizes with my hands. Again a blank stare. It was pulling teeth to get anything out of her. I will never go back again because of that experience. She was clueless, lazy, and did not want to work. I'm in sales and I work for my money. I expect others to as well.

Really enjoy this place. Food is awesome and they alter items easily to fit dietary restrictions. 
Cute and clean inside. Friendly and helpful staff.

I come here twice a week and every time I walk in the employees are very rude in taking my order.  They seem to be talking in the back before coming to take my order or texting on there phones. Also all the tables are very nasty and disgusting and one time it was so nasty I got up and left . Food on the floor and tables and dirty water cups. This place want see me again in the future. Rude customer service and it's nasty from the eating area to the bathrooms. Who would want to come eat and the tables and floors are disgusting . This place needs to learn to treat people with some respect and learn to clean there establishment!!! Disgusting

My partner & I are from out of town & we both watch what we eat. This place is AHMAZING due to the fact that they have the amount of protein, fats & carbs per menu item written alongside the descriptions! It's a dream come true for people who log their food in diet apps such as MyFitnessPal. I wish we could get a place like this in Australia :(

We didn't have ANY issues with the speed of the service or the quality of the food. Very very bloody delicious

5 Stars - Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

5 Stars - Veggie Quinoa burger was great. Do not like buns, so they put it in a spinach wrap for me. Had Jicama fries on the side (raw with seasoning sprinkled on) and those were great.

5 Stars - Thai Ginger Soup was very good.

1 Star - Chicken Satay was horrible. The chicken was so tough that I could not eat it and actually had to return it the next day (as I had already taken my food home and was not close by)

I would def return to this place as they have lots of wonderful choices but I think I would eat the food there, in case there were any issues. 

Parking is not all that easy around this place, you may have to find a place and walk a bit to get here but it is nice to have this type of healthy food available to us.
Great Healthy food very trendy atmosphere lots of beautiful women in gym clothes and great service. The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is it's pretty expensive

Since Greens and Proteins opened, the gf and i eat here at least once every other week.  It's one of several dining options within walking distance of LVAC and it's definitely our fav especially when we are faking it trying to eat nutritiously.  About the only thing we haven't tried are the various smoothies, shakes, veggie blends, etc.

Our fav item on the menu is the make your own meal - a protein, a veggie and a starch with a sauce.  The cost ranges from $9 to about $18.  I generally go for the pork loin or turkey ( the cheaper selections ) with the veggie choice of either mushroom, asparagus or spinach and the brown rice with the pesto sauce.  they have about 8 choices in each category.


Also like the tofu fries, the chicken fingers and the caesar salad.  The pizzas are also decent but suggest you ask them to make the crust crisp since at times i felt the crust was " limp"

Good service and they have a several flat screen TV's for sports watching.
Food is great!!!  Service was fast. I have been to G&P over five times now. I highly recommend this place!

I've been here a couple of times, and the service is always friendly! I have a ridiculous amount of food allergies to watch for, and they're always willing to check labels for me or answer any questions. I like the build your own meal option, but it can be a little pricey depending on what you order. Usually, I order the Angus burger wrapped in lettuce with vegan cheese. Comes out to about $12 with tax, which is reasonable considering the quality of the beef. Also, I love being able to use those substitutes!! The only bummer is the sides they have to choose from ..no soy allowed, so I can't  have tofu fries, and the jicama fries taste like raw potato to me.  Only other option is a vegetable, but honestly? Broccoli with a burger isn't the best. Still giving them a good rating because of the staff, though. Keep it up guys!!

I am forever on the hunt for a fast casual restaurant with healthy food that can rival those on the East Coast. Greens and Proteins was the next stop on my list.

I ordered the Caesar Salad. I know it wasn't a particularly exciting choice, but I can't say I want any tofu fries...

The salad was just okay. The dressing was super light and lacked a lot of flavor. I wish there had been more. I liked the addition of the Parmesan.

Overall, this was not a salad worth the price. I'll go elsewhere. Maybe, some of the other food is better. I'd be willing to try something else.

The service is quick and friendly enough. Overall, it's a decent place if you need something fast and healthy.

Yesterday was my first visit and I Was very happy with my meal.  I got the G&P breakfast burrito.  I'm still new to the healtier eating lifestyle.  Initially the taste was not as rich as a normal burrito, but I liked that I wasnt eating 2000 val in the burrito. I put a little salt and burrito tasted great. I am definitely going back.
This place is amazing. Staff are very friend. Food are excellent quality and prices are very reasonable! Try this place if you're looking for a satisfying healthy meal.
Love this place!! This is exactly what we need. Healthy fast food!!
Best healthy fast food in Vegas! I only wish there was one by my work so I could have if for every meal!!

Perfect post-workout nutrition to fuel your body right after a hard training session. They have a wide variety of healthy options including anything from a hearty protein shake, grilled chicken salad or even a gluten-free vegan pizza which lately has been my absolute favorite. 


+ Conveniently located within walking distance to the gym
+ Large variety of options, so there's something for everyone
+ They have gluten-free vegan options 
+ Outdoor seating patio options 

- I typically go when it's busy so there's usually a wait
- A little pricey. My friend and I ordered a gluten-free vegan pizza with a large rough-cut roma salad (no meat) to split and it was about $30 - yikes!  

Overall, yes I would definitely recommend this place as I go here at least once a week. Their wellness green drink is super refreshing and as I mentioned before I'm a fan of their gluten-free vegan pizza; however, you can't really go wrong with anything.

Love this Place!!! I have been going here for about two years but just recently started posting here again. Their food and drinks are GREAT.A huge variety, nice service, good location, but can be a little crowded at times. The prices are a little high too as it will cost about 50.00 for two. They offer delicious protein shakes and you can have them ADD things such as blue berries, celery etc...
I like the Turkey burger and tofu fries. Check it out and I am sure you will go back over and over.

After a morning of errands I was starving...but also sick of eating heavy processed food! A quick yelp research lead me to this place. 

We really liked this place overall. Love the fact that the company has lots of meatless options and healthy earth conscious meats.

We got three smoothies and drinks 
1. Tofu and banana split (no agave can't stand it) 5/5
2. Wellness drink so good, green with a hint of nirmeg 5/5
3. Green-leaf berry blast. Not that good weird off flavors all 3 of us tried and didn't like it 2/5
4. G&p breakfast burrito-delicious with turkey and home fries made of tofu 5/5

I'm absolutely obsessed with this place. Great way to eat out and eat healthy. The staff is attentive and personable. The food always comes out amazing. Very fresh, flavorful and completely healthy. I eat here almost every meal. Lol  I can't stay away. Like I said I'm obsessed!

Love this place, eat here at least once a week. Bison Cheese Steak and Chicken Sausage Pizza are amazing. Just got the Bison Burger. Sooo good. Healthy food that tastes good is hard to find and they are definitely the best I've had in Vegas.

Healthy food. Slightly on the pricier end. Food is bland. I built my own mean. Bison patty, quinoa, and avacado with walnut pesto sauce on the side. I liked the under salted patty, but I eat a low salt diet. Most folks will taste the difference. Quinoa was over saturated, as in totally soggy and tasted like tap water. I got one of the protein cookies on a whim. I'd skip the prepackaged baked goods.
I love this place. Especially the angus burger with tofu fries and the bbq chicken pizza. Delicious everytime.
Good spot to grab breakfast. The wellness juice is delicious. The customer service was awesome and I will definitely return again.
I Love Greens and Proteins. The wellness drink is the best! Everything is so good and super healthy for you. Great place to hit after the gym!

I really wanted to like this place so even after a bad first experience, I came back for a second try.  The concept is good- we need places that serve good food.  But what i had was not very good.  First time i had the tuna salad and it was exceptionally small and dry - just did not taste good.  The second time i came i had a Coffee-Chocolate-Veggie Shake (720 calories) and mediocre with a LARGE chicken Cesar salad: small quantity limp romaine lettuce, some stale tortilla chip broken up, a little bit parmesan cheese thrown on the bottom --- the dressing was like a flavored mayonnaise on the side.  Really weird taste on the tortilla chips almost like cheetos and the rest was dry.  The chicken itself, while not grilled, as at least passable.  Not the sterling experience I had hoped for.

Everything thing I've tried here has been delicious... The greek scramble, french toast, bison wrap, & now the turkey club with avocado added to it. It's all delicious this place should be on every corner around the city.
I'm always happy when I can find gluten free food. They have healthy food and a nice atmosphere.

This is just on the basis of the madness of how they made an $8 smoothie: they added a heap of ice, which, you know is basically just filler. Then they ended up making too much, filled my cup and dumped the extra --- all of those wonderful fruits and vegetables --- down the sink. So frustrating to pay nearly ten bucks for some diluted smoothie, the rest of which is wasted, flowing down the drain.

If you're a vegetarian or vegan, this probably isn't a post you'll want to read... because this place has made me fall in love with bison! Referred to as America's "original red meat," bison (or buffalo) is not only richer in flavor compared to cow beef, but it has lower saturated fat & is a great source of nutrients (zinc, niacin, iron, B6, selenium, etc). What is this -- a sales pitch to eat bison or a review for Greens & Proteins? Lol, seriously though. I'm hyped on this!

FOR HER: 
- I ordered the BISON BURGER ($10.99). Grilled bison meat with low-fat cheese, lettuce, tomatoes & onions. Very tender, I ordered medium well & on a whole wheat bun. For $1.00 more, you can add two strips of turkey bacon (which complimented well!) and for $0.75, you can add avocado. Also comes with your choice of fries, I tried the TOFU FRIES -- which are 6 thick strips of fried tofu (not a fan of tofu at all, but these were surprisingly good!) that comes with a dipping sauce & a pickle. 
FOR HIM:
- He ordered the BISON CHEESE STEAK ($10.99). On a wheat hoagie bun topped with red onions, peppers, low-fat mozzarella, lettuce & tomato. He also opted for the tofu fries (he actually is the one who recommended them to me to begin with). A generous amount of meat, lots of flavor & very filling! Instead of bread, you can also choose to have on savoy cabbage, wheat wrap, spinach wrap or a whole wheat bun -- but I think the hoagie gives it that necessary cheese steak vibe you need!

Prices are reasonable for what you get. If you're expecting dollar menu prices, you belong at a fast food joint then. Always been a fan of Greens & Proteins, but it was a long literal 20 mile drive from home -- so to have this location open up only 2 miles away is extremely exciting for us! Located near the new LVAC on 215 & north decatur, I imagine this place doing well since that is such a big up & coming area right now... and we definitely WILL be back often! :)

PRO TIP: As of 5/7/16, there is a Groupon for 12$ worth of food for only $6! GET ON IT NOW!

I liked this place! Just don't get the cold "fries" that start with a J...

I live really close and thought it was part of the supplement store that is next door, but as I was driving to Del Taco I noticed it was a cafe.

The food tastes great for the most part, the service was superb and the place was very clean. I didn't see too many people there, probably because it is so new and people don't know about it. I got a smoothie as well that was really good! The downside is that it is more expensive than going to most other fast food places, and the wait is a little long. I suggest the sweet potato fries and the ostrich burger.
Obviously a healthy place to eat but jeeeeeeez -us, like waiting for dial up internet connection waiting on the food

I am in Vegas weekly for work, and I struggle to not visit Greens and Proteins multiple times during each trip. It's amazing, the food is great, fresh and after eating I always feel satisfied, not grossly full. If you are looking for a quick, easy and amazing meal when in the desert, get here.

This spot was just OK for me. I am hoping it was just what I ordered, which seemed a little bland. Maybe I really had a hankering for something savory at the time - just trying to give them the benefit of the doubt!

The restaurant was definitely clean and service was friendly. Although it was lunchtime during a weekday and it was busy, I thought they were serving customers in an efficient way. 

I will be happy to give them another chance and update my rating as necessary but for now... meh!

This place is legit! Finding a healthy spot w/ good food at a reasonable price is tough to find at times. Def check this place out if you're having the same problem I've had in search of healthy tasty food. I got my breakfast & lunch fix today here, that's how good it is.

Breakfast - real deal oatmeal (Irish steel cut oats, flax, cinnamon, sucant, & almond milk w/ bananas & raisins (335 cal)) - a good healthy portion of it. They don't skimp here. Even included half of a sliced banana

Lunch - Wellness drink (Green grapes, green apple, pineapple, orange, lime, wheat grass, kale, spinach, collard greens, ginger, flax seed, agave (286 cal)) - Very tasty & refreshing
California Grilled Chicken (Turkey bacon, L,T,O, and extra virgin mayo (494 cal)) - the meat was tender & every bite was just as good as the last.

For their wraps they do offer a spinach wrap as an alternative. In additional you can just between a few options of fries.

They have quite the selection & the best part is you can order breakfast or lunch at anytime.

My husband came here and picked up some food for us to go. He ordered me the California Grilled Chicken Wrap with tofu fries. He got the Bison burger with the raw jicama fries (I think that's what they were?). Mine was so yummy and that was the first time I ever tried tofu fries. They were seasoned so well. The wrap was delicious as well. It was a little bit dry but overall it had great flavor. 

My husband's bison burger was probably the best thing out of both of ours. It was so yummy and juicy. I wish I got his burger instead, lol. I wasn't a fan of the raw jicama fries. They had a good seasoning on them but I did not care for them. 

I cannot comment on how the service was or what the decor looked like because he took it to go. We will definitely be back to try some other items on the menu.
Great place to eat healthy for breakfast lunch or dinner. Smoothies are a little pricey but otherwise everything else is amazing.
Just ate breakfast. Burrito was pretty good but asked for a side of fruit and they gave me literally the smallest side of fruit. Not even enough for a kid. Guess times are tough.

Quick and healthy! My kind of place.
So far I liked everything I've ordered.
Favorite thing on the menu- Bison on spinach wrap.
Super healthy, super yummy!

Easy order, easy pick up on the way to work or football practice.
The staff couldn't be sweeter and in a better mood. From the busser/food runner to the register people they're all good at what they do. The outside seating is always nice too. Great place!

Im updating to 5 stars because they have added to the menu and in all the times I have been there (alot) they have not disappointed. Kudos here. And they just opened a new location at Rainbow & 215, which is great for me. 

I love this place, the food is great for healthy living. Quality is great and ppl are nice, the owner does his best for his customers. I am absolutely addicted to the wellness drink. The reason i didnt give it 5 stars is because its a lil pricey for what you get and i wish they had more variety on the menu and daily specials. Perhaps they could use an executive chef that puts a bit more flavor in the mix.

Cool easy vibe. 
Fast, fresh food.
AC forever on blast. 

Favorites (in no particular order)...
Acai Bowl
Chichen Quinoa Salad
Vegetable Fritatta (comes with watermelon/feta salad. sounds weird, tastes great!)
Ahi Tostadas

Bring my laptop? No problem.
Fill my giant hydroflask? No problem.
No pressure.
No drama.
Employees: Pleasant, thorough and concise.
Eat and go. Eat and chill. 
Consistent.
Very vegan friendly! Whole foods! Clean eating! Healthy! Raw options. Great service. Great food.

Had big exceptions on this place because I've heard a lot of good of it. When my wrap came it was watery, no taste at all. I couldn't be more disappointed, my teriyaki chicken didn't even have a flavor.. so unfortunate.

AMAZING. And I'm far from a health nut (I like to pretend I am sometimes.)

Sometimes you just want something that's gonna make you FEEL good during and after you eat/drink it without sacrificing taste entirely. 

I had the green shake and it's incredibly tasty!

I think I've found my first spot to stake residency in. 

YUM!

So I've been here about 5 times now and every single time it is GREAT! THE STAFF IS ALWAYS SO HELPFUL! The chef Caesar makes excellent food and even comes out sometimes to make sure everything is tasting good. The options are so healthy and there is something for every eating plan. I always stop here after my workouts and even bring home food for my bf who isn't dieting and he loves it too. Highly recommend

great vegan breakfast burrito.  great juices.  I used a groupon here.  Lady at register was very friendly.  I enjoy these style restaurants more than traditional sit down.  Pay up front and they still bring it to you.  little bit pricey but worth it.

The title on the front: "Healthy Kitchen", that alone should be the warning. If a business has to advertise that, they are trying too hard.

Maybe we have high standards because we are from California where we know what good, clean Vegan food actually is. When we walked in the manager/server (?) jumped up and said "Hello, Welcome", then went back to leaning over the front counter with his phone in his face. Everything seemed okay while ordering at the counter. The realization that I was in a gross place started when I went to pour water. Tap water from the Coke machine. What "health" oriented  business has anything to do with the Coca-Cola company (FYI: corrupt evil corporation). Any truly healthful food restaurant knows what clean/pure water is. Not this place.

When my Veggie Burger arrived the GF bun was SO DRY and starchy it was like eating stale duck feed. And it's not just my bun, my husband had a standard wheat bun with his veggie burger. I went to the sidebar to check out the condiments like ketchup and mustard: SYSCO. If the basic condiments are SYSCO with high fructose corn syrup, just imagine the rest of the ingredients in the kitchen, and their source. Some of the reviews here say "I'm glad they use high-quality ingredients", that is not possible if their main supplier is SYSCO. We asked for another ketchup or condiment option that did not have High Fructose Corn Syrup from the server/mangaer. He said that was all they had. Lame.
The Veggie patty was bland beans. The Tofu "fries" were so fried there was no tofu left in the middle, shriveled and soaking in oil. Gross.
The Thai ginger soup I got was like a think gloppy pudding. I tried putting it on my burger like a condiment to make it more edible. Didn't help. 
My son got the GF Veggie pizza, the only thing flavorful on the table, because it was drenched in oil. 
If you have HEALTH standards, are Vegan or Gluten-Free, I would NOT recommend this place. It is a cheap chain, with rip-off prices. 
Unfortunately, we left half of our food on the plate uneaten, walked out highly disappointed and feeling sick and gross from the quality of food.
I'm trying to eat & they are painting the restaurant during dining hours! Nothing like the fumes & scent of paint in a health food restaurant.
Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served here. Each of these meals are healthy, clean, and tasty. The prices are not cheap but definitely worth it.
Very healthy,  get your Greens and your pic of protein.   Lots of choices, beef,  chicken,  ahi tuna, tofu. Sandwiches ,  salads,  smoothies, and your fill of complementary Cucumber water.
I enjoy this restaurant. The veggie burger and sweet potato fries are great. You'll get full from earring at this restaurant. The customer service is also excellent.

This place has really great veggie options but also have different meat options as well. I enjoy their green smoothies. The only downfall is that you have to pay for parking unless there's a place to park that I don't know about. For my green cravings, this is where I go.
This place is amazing!!! My favorite place in vegas. The wellness drink is a must have! If you want to eat healthy but not sacrifice flavor!

Love that you can build your own meal! I had grilled turkey breast, spaghetti squash, and avocado, with lemon vinaigrette. It was great! 
I shared the summer berry salad (per the guy behind the counters recommendation) with my boyfriend (without the cheese), and it was delicious!
We also shared a green smoothie, and it was fantastic!
My boyfriend ordered the bison burger with jicama "fries." He said it was wonderful!
I tried the jicama fries (jicama and cayenne powder) and they were good!
Overall great stop on our road trip! We got our food quickly and the staff were friendly! I would definitely return!

This place offers something for everyone, but it is especially vegetarian heaven in a city where meaty buffets run supreme! Or it's a perfect if you are feeling guilty after a few days of indulging. I was in Vegas on business and found this place a few miles from where I was staying. Now, I would say not to come here if you are ravenous because the portions are just right to be filling, but definitely aren't huge. The menu is a mixture of smoothies, juices, burgers, salads, sandwiches, pizzas, and custom plates. I got a custom plate with tofu, asparagus, spaghetti squash, and peanut sauce. It was pretty good and the price was reasonable. They don't flavor the vegetables at all and put the sauce on the side, so you are free to do what you want. On the plate, it looks kind of small but I left with a full, happy belly! And the employees were super friendly,  which is always a plus!

A coworker recommended this place to me so I decided to give it a try today, definitely worth the trip! Had a small rough cut with chicken, yummy! Perfect size, too! Will be a normal lunch spot from now on. Try it, you won't be disappointed!!

CAME IN FOR THE ~V9 (carrot,celery,sun dried tomato,scallions,cabbage,garlic,yellow squash,zucchini,orange,lime and vegetable stock=279 cal) The place was clean friendly folks working here and helpful! My juice was tasty and very earthy in flavor and not bad! Hey If you want a break from juicing at home come here hangout you can pick the strong wifi from the Starbucks next door... also they have 3 big screen TV's! The place is very chill....

WOW......this place has an incredible menu !   Unique items not found anywhere else!    A little on the pricey side, but not when you realize how healthy the eats are !  I decided it was well worth the money !  I am now totally addicted to their ginger lime-aid -- like nothing I have ever had !!!   Totally addicted for good !

I ordered the chicken quinoa salad. I can't believe the calorie count they cite because this salad was AMAZING and too big to finish! So many things on this menu looked fantastic. I was craving a salad after work and wanted something quick and easy but also high quality. This place exceeded all expectations. The salad was one of best ever, parking and access was easy even during rush hour, and the wait was less than ten minutes.
Turkey burger with sweet potato fries at least once a week! We've tried a few other items, and all were good too. Service is always quick and employees are always smiling :)
Get the Protein Pancakes! I split them. They're delicious but make you full, so I get one order to share and my own smoothie or juice. Order ahead!! They're packed.
Tasty food and great customer service from all the crew! This will be my go to spot for lunch now
Great food! Okay prices.Food is fresh and delicious! Great for when I need a break from cooking! No cheating on my diet there!  They have everything you need!

Good food. Mediocre service. I go here pretty frequently because I work about three minutes away.. 
Last night I ordered a bison Burger cooked medium rare and an acai sorbet bowl.  The Burger was cooked perfectly medium rare and my acai bowl was fully packed - Everything proportionate to each other. I prefer to get my acai bowl here because unlike everywhere else, I can eat my bowl with everything and I'm not left with a whole bunch of the acai mix on the bottom without any toppings. However, I got my acai bowl again this morning around 7:30am, once I got to work, only half of my Togo cup filled, half of the granola I got from the night before, and only couple of pieces of each fruit was on top. Their consistency with the portions are not always the same.

I ordered a broccoli and cheddar soup today and it was horrible. My stomach instantly got upset by the soup and it wasn't tasty at all. And to top it off they only gave me three chips with a big cup I'm so disappointed in what I purchased today. I feel like it was absolute waste of my money.

The best! I love eating there and the staff is super helpful if I need to change something in my order a bit! They are also very educated on the Menu and are able to give you explanation for all things!

Honestly I'm over the crappy service here. Been on the G&P wagon for years. This is very high priced "healthy food". I get the concept and I'm ok paying the extra money for quality and service. But they just simply do not staff enough people. We know you are a profitable business (New locations opening). Spend the money and staff your restaurant. 40 min wait for simple wraps is stupid. This happens to me on a weekly basis. I owe a business right down the street and will no longer allow any of my staff to eat here because the wait time is too much. Ive given too many chances to fix the issues including internal complaints to management. You might as well go sit down for a nice leSurely meal at Archis next door at the price and wait time it cost to eat here. No more G&P. I'm sorry but I've had enough....

This place has done such a good job with my groups! They are always on top of it! The food selection is so vast-from Raw Vegan food to a Grass Fed choice Felit for less than $20!! The wellness juice drink is a great way for me start the day love it!

Greens & Proteins has my Favorite #Vegan #Burger made from #Scratch #Organic #NON-GMO ingredients! Very clean restaurant great staff very friendly, they've added new menu items, #ProteinBowls, #Streettacos. Great concept!
Love G&P-they offer so many choices, they have great juices! The food is full service quality at fast casual prices!! They even have spaghetti squash!! Love the #vegan options!

This place is definitely not my favorite & the prices are a bit on the high side for the amount of food you get. Taste wasn't exceptional either but the smoothie was delish, although at almost $8, I'll just make my own food & make my own smoothie. Thanks but no thanks.

Horrible customer service. I was completely ignored, as the staff talked to themselves, so I gave them a couple minutes while I stood there. Eventually, I left and went to another business. Normally I would give a new business the benefit of the doubt, but I was the only customer there and didn't even get a friendly hello. Probably won't be going back.

Took my kid here . First the good news . I ordered steak tacos . Delicious!!! Now the bad news . I was asked if I wanted to ' add ' avocado, I said yes . I never saw avocado so ........?  My kid had one of the wraps and did not enjoy it . 
When you enter a restaurant I believe you should not complain about pricing. So just be forewarned that two people could enter for a casual lunch and walk out having spent close to $ 40 .00 . 
But I will finish by saying the staff were polite and helpful. My food was delicious and everyone has their own taste so someone could enjoy the wrap my son ate . And I DO recommend to try this restaurant. I will be bringing my kid back to try different items .

Ordered acai bowl and this really a joke!!
See my photos you will realize that you are paying for nothing! It cost 8$ for less the 3 slices of strawberry 1 blue berry and 4-5 slices of bananas!!
It's not even organic ! Why $8???!? The acai is sorbet and not real 100% acai- you can tell because the sorbet is sweet so they added sweetener into it,
If you ever tested real acai fruit you probably know that's it's not sweet.
Literally there is nothing here that worth more then a $1.50!!!
Beside that I don't understand what is all about how all the items in the menu can be healthy if they NOT ORGANIC?!!?!?
Love this place, staff is amazing and they always give great suggestions for new drinks.

This location needs to go get customer service training from the Rainbow location. The service at this location from the self proclaimed supervisor is so sub-par, although the server who delivered our food was very nice. The lettuce in the Caesar salad had hints of green but was mostly white. Charging $2 to substitute cucumber slices for pita bread is very irresponsible & counterproductive for a "healthy" restaurant. I will only be going to the Rainbow location from now on.

I admit I've probably driven past this place a billion times but finally paid attention to it when I was on Groupon and saw they had a $12 for $6 deal and had to try it. Came in during lunch time and it wasn't too busy. I was told I had to make sure I spent at least $12 for the Groupon deal so I went ahead and ordered an Acai Smoothie which wasn't amazing compared to other Acai smoothies I've ordered but still drink worthy. For a meal I ordered the Turkey Burger with Jicama Fries as I've never had Jicama before and well, the turkey burger was excellent but Jicama, I am NOT a fan of you and should have gone with the Tofu instead. There was a little bit of a wait especially in between my smoothie and meal, like I literally was almost done with my smoothie by the time my food was ready but all staff members had a smile on their face, very friendly and even with some slow service I still got in and out of there in a decent amount of time during the lunch hour. I'll definitely be back to try more especially as they serve healthy menu items for a fair price compared to others!

My favorite place for healthy eating options, and post workout refueling! Pizzas are delisH on lavash crust. I've also had the breakfast burrito and burgers which are also yummo! Love the atmosphere,  staff is always friendly!
Hard to find a good spot for healthy food in this part of Vegas. Everything was very fresh. Great smoothie / juice bar. Excellent staff! Went 3x in a 2 day span after finding it.
Eating while on the go in just a nightmare that I try to avoid. Eating at Greens and Proteins however is a breeze! I don't struggle to find food that won't hurt me and tastes delicious.

Came here one day for lunch with a friend (actually come to think of it, it was before the Brooklyn Bowl event) XD 

Margherita Pizza (Low-fat mozzarella, tomatoes, roasted garlic, and basil) - To my surprise, i didn't know there was roasted garlic in this. If anything, all i noticed was the huge amount of mozzarella cheese on the pizza. They have different crusts you can pick. thin pizza crust (normal), lavash (a persian? flat bread?), and something else. Not sure what lavash was or the other one (and this was my friends pizza anyway but i was ordering/paying) so i decided to get the normal thin pizza crust. Flavor overall, like a normal margherita pizza. Only thing was i hope they can amp up the roasted garlic flavor (or maybe i can request for more/additional roasted garlic... XD garlic lover om nom nom) and the crust, maybe they can bake it longer. It was a little soft for my taste. The edge crust, it was nice and crispy, but anything under the toppings, was a little, floppy =X

Bison Cheese Steak Wrap (Red onions, peppers, low-fat mozzarella, lettuce, and tomato) - this order was for me. I thought it was quite interesting and ive never had bison before. something new to try for me. Comes with either a side of tofu fries or jicama fries and a pickle. The pickle was a normal pickle spear (yum). I opted for the tofu fries (curious but definitely not a stranger to tofu). Nicely fried. A little underseasoned but still tasted yummy (i like tofu anyway). As for the wrap, you get a choice of either a savoy cabbage wrap, wheat wrap, spinach wrap, or whole wheat bun. I opted for the spinach wrap. Overall, it looked decent and yummy. While i ate it, it was dripping a lot of juices/oil. Almost made it seem like this wrap was heavier/fattier than it really was. First experience in trying bison? uhm if i wasnt told it was bison, id almost call it beef. Overall, flavored well but a bit messy to eat (drippy drippy ....) Im not sure how healthy this wrap was but after eating it, i didnt feel so healthy. LOL  

Overall, nice place. A bit on the pricey side. These two items added up to i believe around $24? I guess a price to pay for fresh/organic? ingredients. May try other things next time since i think i picked the fattiest item on the menu.

If you want awful disgusting food, then this is the place to go.  We ordered the raw nachos, lettuce wraps, hummus, soup, and raw pizza. Not a single thing was appetizing. It all tasted like last weeks left overs.  

The food was over priced and our order was botched.  We asked for no avocado...food had avocado, asked for no olives....food had olives. Ordered the tortilla soup....but instead got this goo which i think was the thai ginger soup.  

Final word for my experience:  gross

First time customer. As soon as I walked in it was busy. I was greeted by a friendly cashier and she help me order. Especially asking if I wanted avocado like she read my mind. I ended up ordering up the buffalo wrap which I devoured once I arrived home. Everything fresh. Good customer service and such an upbeat atmosphere. I will go here again.
Great food,  unbelievable salads.  A little pricey for what you get,  but any health food fanatic will be found eating their.  Not only does the food look and taste great the patrons are lookers too.

Been here only 3 times and I love it. I love eating here and not feeling guilty! Everything here is fresh and (organic I'm assuming) but def healthy! They put the calories and macros right on the menu to help u choose. My personal favorite so far is the California Grilled Chicken wrap! I order it with tofu fries (which I had for the first time here at this restaurant) and the combination is delicious!!
If you are looking for a healthy restaurant that is also delicious? Greens and proteins is where you want to be. They have delicious pizza and their bison cheese steak is the best thing to me.

I am somewhat of a fitness enthusiast so I was looking for a place that sold healthy food and drinks. I came across Greens and Proteins while driving along eastern avenue. Now I'm used to cooking and making my own healthy greens and protein foods, so I have a bit higher standard for places like this. First of all, they are relatively expensive but this is understandable considering the healthy ingredients which tend to be natural or organic. 

My friend ordered one of the actual meals while I ordered one of the green drinks, I believe it was the one with chocolate flavor. Anyways, my drink tasted horrible. Maybe it was too healthy but I couldn't swallow it. If you are into this type of thing, maybe its for you. My friend ordered something I believe with the eggs and it was ok.

The environment is very nice. When we went the place was booming so I have no complaints there. The staff is friendly and it gives off a healthy, clean, fitness vibe. I think you just have to be into this type of food. It's a different taste which I don't like but many health buffs will like. Maybe I will try a different food so I shouldn't jump to conclusions. I will update this review once I try something different and will take pictures of what I ordered.

Another Green's and Proteins!

I usually get a grilled veggie wrap and tofu fries. Actually I try to try something different each time I visit a location. 

Got a berry smoothie today and can say that this location put out the same quality as the other two locations I have been to.

G&P's favors opening locations by LVAC's and this is no exception. Right at N. Decatur and Rice.

Anyway I'm usually not in this area but ran an errand this morning and popped in for a custom smoothie and am happy the quality is staying consistent.

These places are not Go Raw but they always put out a fast and healthy choice when needed :)

Happy to see another location and good luck!

I respect the hell out of any proprietor that wants to improve their business. After having the owners contact me I decided to give it another try and met the GF for lunch.

This time around it was by far a much more pleasant experience.  Upon making entry we were greeted and offered to have the menu explained to us.  I went with buffalo burger wrapped in lettuce. I ordered up a side of jicama fries, which I discovered I really did not care for. I really enjoyed the GF's tofu fries. For a beverage I chose carrot juice with a bunch of other ingredients  added to it.  Surprisingly, I was full all day and very much on a nutrient buzz.

Sure it's a tad on the pricey side but so is just about everything else out there and this is healthy for you.

I did wait a while for my food however the employees were very sincere for the wait, they kept coming and apologizing. The food was definitely worth the wait though I enjoyed their protein pancakes very much (:

"Healthy Food" is such a trend so I feel most places just make anything healthy and it'll be popular. The food is very bland, the hummus is horrible. So dry and flavorless please avoid. The chicken satay is yummy "the peanut sauce" on it is healthy and good. As for everything else I don't think healthy has to mean lacking flavor, and spice. This place is alright wouldn't recommend anyone to come here.
This place never disappoints.  Been here to many times to count and never leave un happy.  Wellness drink and veg burger are my go to's.  Light and refreshing! Enough said!

Ok so this is my new favorite place!! I can't get over how fresh and amazing the food is at an extremely reasonable price for being MADE TO ORDER!! Yes, it takes some time, but it's more than worth the wait. I've had the chicken wrap and the build your own plate with chicken, edamame, and sweet mash!! Wow so good!!! After consuming both of these meals, I enjoyed the berry parfait....  It was pure heaven!! I have a hard time believing it was only 185 calories because it was so god darn delicious.  The next day all I was craving was the place. That is a great sign of a great establishment. Kiddos to you and the staff! Speaking of staff, Savannah is so friendly and patient when taking my order. What a great person to have greeting the customers and interacting with them! Can't wait to come back!!!

This is my "go-to" place when I'm looking for a quick, healthy meal. I've been here for breakfast (totally hooked on their frittatas), lunch (love the bison burger on butter lettuce) and dinner tonight for the salmon.  I love that I can build my own plate that allows me to eat Paleo. Tonight's meal did not disappoint.... And now I'm hooked on their sweet potato mash!!

What I love: The Veggie wrap on spinach with tofu fries and a banana tofu smoothie. I have been squeezing in a trip to this location after yoga and it is perfect every time. This is a meal that is enjoyable without fail time and time again. If money grew on trees I would probably eat here every day.
Food is good cashier is really nice great service nice hospitality menu very healthy worth every dime you spend
AMAZING FOOD, DRINKS, and the FRIENDLIEST STAFF. My new place to go right after a hard workout and to stay healthy and fit

Protein pancakes are what I get every visit. So delicious! Management must be really good because out of all locations I've visited, never had anything other than fun, happy, and professional dealings with employees!

Quick smoothie instead of a meal.  Gets the job done.  $7.50 for 255 calories.  Kinda pricey but convenient.  Service is quick and staff is knowledgable.  Grilled Buffalo chicken strips. Excellent and just the right amount of spice.   

Breakfast is the best thing they do here in my opinion.  Give it a try.

Where can I start?  We used to live in Vegas and our BIGGEST complaint over that 3 year period was always the same thing... There are 0 healthy/organic/clean food options in Vegas off the strip!  So, as it goes, within 1 month of moving back to Miami, G&P opens their first location, lol.  
1.  BOTH locations are super clean, great seatin in&outside
2.  Breakfast options at all good, healthy but not boring
3. Lunch options are just as awesome, the quality of their products shines through in all their dishes. Very unique! 
4.  Lastly is the star of the show... The JUICES!! OMG! Seriously, I'm not even a juice guy, but they make them so different and enjoyable, you don't even know it's healthy.  The wellness that everyone raves about is all that.... 7 or 8 diff green fruits & leafy's with a touch of agave and your Good to go!

Way to go G&P!  You hit the nail on the head.  Keep it up!

This by far my FAVORITE place to eat! I had lost around 189lbs a year or so ago before moving to Vegas and finding a HEALTHY restaurant that does not cost fortunes prices difficult. This place is the exception!!! The food is a REALLY good quality and the atmosphere is fresh/inviting! The best of all is the prices are not astronomical which for clean eating is extremely hard to find. I will certainly be coming back here soon and look forward to trying everything on the menu!
great food, great smoothies, I would also recommend breakfast there...tofu served like country potatoes is quite taste.  Only does side would be the prices. $$$

Giving them 3 stars simply because finding a healthy option in Vegas is nearly impossible. However, maybe it's me but does get by mean bland? If so then I guess this place is good??? Atmosphere in restaurant was nice and their drink selection was decent, but the food itself was wholly miserable. It took FOREVER for the food to come out, not sure if they cool everything to order or what. Also the processes astronomical. For 3 ppl two wraps a meal and 3 drinks it was $54. Say WHAT??????  Would honestly never go back but my husband's a health nut and after a week of binging in Vegas I reckon he'll drag me back to this place.

So seriously, why is everyone so obsessed with this place? I get it's healthy and nutritious, blah blah but it's overpriced and the food itself is just meh. But maybe I'm the one with weird taste bc I do enjoy me some Protein House and I get sad that Protein House is only in Henderson. 

I've tried different things at Greens from their juices, to the burgers, to the fake pizza, spaghetti squash, and everything was simply not memorable. The only good thing, that I actually enjoy eating, is probably the tofu fries. Those deserve 4 stars.
Friendly service and great options. Food wasn't fantastic, I built my own and husband got the bison wrap. The sweet potato fries were the star, we are hoping to try other items next time.

Awkward service. Weird vibe. Made me feel very uncomfortable to linger.  Decent food, certainly, but massively overpriced...and bland (tofu fries; veggie frittata). Unfortunate that this place just can't meet expectations after having been there several times, given that I live in the building.

Service awful. Young muscle head cashier never said hello, never smiled, never thanked me after tipping him cash. He served me my ostrich burger it is was dried out completely and the sweet potato fries were stone cold. Took forever to get it in the first place. Not even busy. Just think they were lazy and not really paying attention. Will never eat here again. It used to be much better when it first opened up several years ago. Now it just sucks! They could do without the attitude for sure!

First time at this location. The dining area seems a lot more spacious and clean than the location on 215/eastern. There was only one couple that ordered ahead of us (and maybe only one other group of people who already had food) in the restaurant. The food took ~20 minutes to come out! I NEVER waited that long at the other location and it was much busier. The food was really good but wait time ruined it, might as well go to a full service restaurant. The build your own meal is the way to go, the sauce options are awesome - especially the pesto! It is pricey but "healthier" than most.
Food is fantastic. Loved that I could go and pick my own food. It was so good and so healthy! Absolutely will come back!!!

I'm new in town and found this place next to the gym. Asked the pretty lady working there what she recommended. I ordered the bison cheesesteak after a work out. Wow. Couldn't finish it although I gave it my all. The tofu fries were something else. Take out service was speedy. We need more places like Greens and Proteins.

A great spot to grab lunch/dinner with your friends who are looking for healthy options. I've been here twice and really enjoyed it. First time I ordered the bison cheese steak and the second time I ordered the bison burger. Both dishes were absolutely delicious. Their tofu fries reminded me of a tofu dish you can get at any Chinese restaurants, which I really liked. They serve cucumber water and often walk around with smoothie samples for customers to try. Their customer service is excellent and I will be back to try their other options such as salads and create-your-own-meal dishes!

First time trying this place.  Kept it simple and ordered a turkey burger with avocado and opted for the tofu fries. My coworker ordered the veggie burger with gluten free bun and jicama fries.
       The food was decent, nothing spectacular, nothing terrible. 

The staff was very kind and courteous. 

Bottom line....  Nice healthy eats with a premium price attached.

This place is hugely popular with people leaving the gym next door. It has a huge healthy menu and I tried the salmon with avocado and quinoa. $12. Pretty good but pricy I thought. Hard as a first timer to read and figure out their menu. Not enough pictures. Looks like lots of other things to try.

I go in here specifically for MANBAKE bars which are so so good! I love the double chocolate and cookie dough! They have a bunch of flavors right at the register when you walk in. Make sure you check the expiration date because they are all different ;)

Have eaten here many times since it opened. Today is the last tho. It's happens to me three times now so I don't know why I'm surprised but I ordered egg whites and sausage and also protein pancakes. Turkey sausage was raw and like jello when I chewed it so I immediately spit it out and go to eat the pancakes and they are still batter inside. Smh. Like I said last time I ever eat here.

My husband and I stopped in at 9:40 after a long flight. We expected to be rushed since they closed at ten, but the customer service was on point. The food was amazing, and they were incredibly welcoming. There was no rushing at all. We were still out by ten, but the fact that they didn't shoot attitude or rush us was a pleasant surprise. We will definitely be back. 

**i highly recommend the bison cheesesteak - it's awesome!

***If the owner or manager is reading this, I'd like to know how you can prevent this unpleasant experience from happening again in the future.***

This is one of the worst customer service experiences I have EVER encountered before. 

I called Greens and Proteins about a month ago, to see if they could take a reservation for a large party of about 15-20 people. My team was planning an outing in the area, so I thought it would be a great idea for a healthy lunch. The girl I spoke with checked with her manager, who said it wouldn't be a problem, and to call back closer to the date.

A fellow team mate of mine called and spoke with the manager a few days in advance, who confirmed the date, time, and number of people. 

I called the morning of the event, and spoke with Elizabeth. She was totally unprofessional in both her tone and handling of the situation. She put me on hold to check with a manager, and came back to tell me there would be no guarantee that they could accommodate us. The time we would be visiting was a busy time, and she stated that they could not promise to reserve tables for us. So I asked if we could be seated at separate tables, to which she repeated her original statement: she could not promise us that we could be accommodated. This was extremely frustrating, as we were told in advance that we could make reservations, and it would NOT be an issue, and now I had a team of 18 people with out a place to eat.

My fellow team mate that originally made the reservations called, and spoke with a different girl this time - and she had no record of the reservation made under her name, days before. The girl assured us that she would have the manager call us back, but we never received a phone call. This resulted in us having to find a different place to go to, an hour before our event was supposed to occur. 

Why would management originally say YES, you can take a reservation for a large party, only to go back on your word, and put myself and my team in a difficult situation. We were told that our reservations were set, and when the day came, no one had any idea of what we were talking about. WHY would you make promises that you cannot keep? That is a huge customer service no-no.

As for Elizabeth, she was had NO empathy, did not offer ANY solutions for me, and was so unprofessional. Customer service is the most important aspect of a business. For this reason alone, I will not be back again.

great green smoothie(forgot the name)
ok chicken quinoa salad (special) needed some flavor kinda bland but looked healthy
will come again
well deserved 5 star, healthy menu, easy to read, great prices, food is served to order, so it is fresh, friendly staff and super clean restaurant.

This place is ridiculously good.  I had the albacore tuna salad and the white turkey chili, both of which added together are less than 600 calories and both are insanely good.  I will definitely be back the food and service rocks!

You might think that a $15 meal would be given to you hot. That was not the case for my last visit just a few minutes ago. I ordered my food on line and the app said it would be ready at 12:36. I arrived at 12:34 and picked up my meal. When I opened it and began eating it the Angus wrap and sweet potato  fries were stone cold as if th ed y had been sitting a while. Not happy and It will hinder any decision to return.

I love to see what people can do in the health food/vegan food industry and I've been blessed to try a lot of establishments that take the idea that healthy food can be delicious to the next level! That being said, I really wanted to love Greens and Proteins, but after ordering from them twice I'm feeling pretty lukewarm about them. Heres why.

The roasted vegetable wrap: Ok, good assortment of veggies in here but VERY VERY greasy. So greasy that it was inedible the next day. Even though it has some pesto in there it REALLY lacks flavor. I think they need to pair it with some kind of creamy dipping sauce, put some seasoning on those veggies, and for the love of god: tone down the oil! Then it would be perfect.

Hummus platter: Very unimpressive and tastes unusual? The hummus was very gritty and dry and has a flavor unlike any hummus I've had before (and I've had a lot of hummus!). A decent hummus is extremely easy to make so I'm really not sure what happened here *shrug*

Fries: Their options are tofu fries, jicama fries, and sweet potato fries for extra $. I'm sorry, but the only sensible option here seems to be the sweet potato fries. I could be wrong but the other two options just sounded bizarre. So I ordered the sweet potato fries twice. The first time I just tossed them out because they were so bland and under cooked. However, the second time somebody in the kitchen wisened up and crisped those guys up and added a bit of salt. Ate the whole thing! Yum.

Ahi Tuna Salad: I got without the hard boiled egg. Probably the best thing I ordered. Pretty straightforward. Kudos.

Wellness Juice: Excellent. I love the large size, flavor, and it was definitely fresh!

So yeah, being that I have a lot of dietary restrictions I was pretty much limited to only a few items + plus the juices/smoothies. Which is fine, as long as they are delicious and prepared correctly. Clearly there need to be some improvements! I hope Greens and Proteins reads this!
This place was very cute and the food was delicious, I ordered the tortilla soup which was a bit too rich for me but it was filling. I'm glad we stopped in on our long drive back home.

The atmosphere is like a cafe sit down area with open windows. Choose between a large selection of healthy breakast items , lunch or dinner. I went at breakfast loved the greek scramble, a bit bummed on just black coffee no creamer or substitute for creamer but they have a nice selection of special caffeine and non caffeine drinks. My husband got the burrito and enjoyed it with a peanut butter bananna smoothie shocker he couldent taste the kale or spinach in it thats a bonus for him. My daughter enjoyed a turkey burger. Overall great food will definitely be back.
I love their smoothies but I swear every time I come here it takes 20 minutes for them to make me ONE

I used to go to this place often and then received amazing customer service, however my most recent experience was one of the worst customer service I have ever received. I ordered a burger for pick up on April 8th around 4pm. As I picked it up I asked to get it cut it in half because I was on the go and wasn't sure if I would have a knife. I then heard the cook in the back say in a rude tone "she can't do that herself? She can just open her mouth wide..." I found this very offensive especially at the fact I can clearly hear her. Very sad that one of my favorite places quickly became one of the worst.
Amazing place to come for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. I love their menu and fast service.
Very fresh, great menu selection and variety. A little pricey but worth it. Good customer service.
We had two shakes from there and they were pretty good. I'm happy with my purchase and I will definitely come again

Concept is good, quality is good, but not good enough to give more stars. Particularly for the price I would expect something better.

To be fair, I only tried their smoothies, so I might have a different opinion when I have other items.
I was looking for a healthy breakfast since I have been feeling under the weather. Turns out this is the perfect place with the perfect drinks. I highly recommend the Wellness Drink
It was a good experience. The tofu fries are surprisingly good and the food is wholesome, but it didn't really blow us away. Customer service was friendly.

This location will never get my money again. First off the customer service I received today from the young lady at the cashier was so unprofessional. From the time you walk into a place of business/ restaurant. The individual at that front counter will be the person who sets the tone. 

The protein pancakes I received were nothing like the pancakes I received before. I didn't even bother eating them on top of the fact that I was already displeased when I walked in. So I ask for a refund & this same young lady that I first encountered at the cashier. Decides to practically throw my money in my hand. As if it wasn't enough that she was rude from the moment I walked in. 

Great food chain, but when you have someone like this young lady working at the front counter. Who knows nothing about good customer service. That type of attitude will definitely drive customers away.

This was a good salad that I enjoyed. The lettuce was fresh and nice size helping since its hard to fill up on lettuce I got some chicken as well. The chicken was decent and I think I'd go back against for another salad but I don't think I'd get the same thing. Gotta switch it up and see what else they have to offer.

This place is located near my house so it is a  plus having a place you can grab "fast food" when you're not feeling like cooking, and not having to worry about plaque building up in your arteries as you are consuming your oh so delicious lard. 

The place is located in a very high traffic plaza and it can get pretty packed during lunch. Inside of the restaurant is very well done. The interior has a very sleek, modern and clean look. The menu is fairly simple, and the calories are added next to each item on the menu (major bonus). The staff was fairly friendly albeit a bit rushed even though it was not very busy on that particular day. 

I opted for the Teriyaki Grilled Chicken wrap with a side of Jicama fries. Everything was very delicious.  The less calories conscious boyfriend opted for Turkey BLT wrap with tofu fries. The wrap was just ok. It needed some sort of a light sauce or marinade  to infuse the exceedingly dry turkey. This would be a forgivable,  if this wrap was not $10.99. He ended up finishing my wrap of which he was a huge fan. I absolutely LOVED the tofu fries. SO good! The lunch was not cheap, but that is expected at a place that serves healthier options, and by nature of the business incur higher direct and indirect costs. Also, by choosing this particular location to open shop, the business has found its niche. Let's hope for the best. I will be back for sure, just not sure when or how frequently.

Review 6/4/17: This used to be my go-to establishment for smoothies. I'll chalk today up to short-staffed. They're now adding ice to the smoothies ... I don't remember them doing this before. The drink was watery with chunks of ice left in. The person taking our orders totally blew it with one ... leaving out the peanuts and honey. I'll go back, but be more careful about ordering.

Review 11/4/17: We've tried a few more times since my last review (which somehow never got posted). They've changed menus several times (with price increases accordingly). Today we ordered 2 more smoothies specifying "no ice" and "no honey". They were both so sicky-sweet we had to trash them after a few sips. Apparently (and confirmed by the server), the sugar comes from the "chocolate chips). Really? They used to include Stevia, honey, and the banana as the sugar sources. My conclusion is they switched to a cheaper sweetened chocolate. Sigh! Another establishment starts up with ideals and slips into mediocrity as economic reality sets in (I'm giving the benefit of the doubt that profit margins are not the drivers here).

This is SOO good. It's their vegan Impossible Burger Cheesesteak...I've had it 3 times this week! I want to try some other things off their 'make it Vegan' menu but this is so good I keep ordering it lol anyways I love the variety for vegetarians and vegans they offer and my omnivore husband can come here too. Love this place! I ate the other half before I had a chance to take a pic
If you want to eat healty - quickly and at a resonable price, this place is great. It's self service and the decor is nothing special, but it provides exactly what the names says.
Great place to go for healthy drinks and food. I tried the wellness drink and the vegan pizza and both were great. The place is a little pricey, but way worth it.

I greatly love this place wonderful food and I love the drinks all that stuff but for the price is super hard here I love them but I I can eat all I can eat Shabu or sushi for the price for just a smoothie and food there I think they should come out with combo meals one day so I can enjoy them more.

Extremely happy they are finally on this side of town! I was able to go the other day and got the G & P breakfast burrito with tofu fries and it was amazing! I also love the banana split smoothie! So much flavor and extremely heathy!!
love this place! great healthy food. breakfast burrito is amazing here. :)
Not impressed with this place. Don't waste your time it's too expensive and they don't deliver on the food descriptions.They should  stick to smoothies.

Today is Monday, March 21, 2016 and I have NEVER left a yelp review positive or NEGATIVE however, the chain events that I went through at this one Greens and Proteins I felt compelled to. I called from the parking lot, using my bluetooth, to place a to-go order, I was at the Lifetime fitness on Charleston and just finished my workout (11:45 am). Immediately I was asked if it was okay to put me on a brief hold. I was on hold for over 10 minutes, and by the time they picked up again I was standing right in front of the cashier. She seem annoyed at ME, which is ridiculous because it should be the other way around, and she said, "our phones are not working properly." I placed my tuna salad and chicken quinoa salad and the cashier said in a condescending tone, "well at least you do not have to wait long for your order because you are ordering salads." $19.00 + dollars and on top of it I tipped them 2.00 (which I should have not had I known what other crap I had to endure). Had it not been for the Seven magazine I was reading to occupy my time, I realized 15 minutes had passed and those who ordered after me were already eating or have left. I looked into the kitchen and the two cashiers were talking and "looking busy." I see my salad order just sitting on the counter in the kitchen. I loudly say, "Is that my salad order I have been waiting for?" They looked at me as if I am the one being rude and look at the order like it appeared there magically. Since my husband had already had lunch he said he would eat the quinoa salad for dinner. I just got a call from him at 7:30 pm and he said there was GLASS in his salad. I called to inform this location what we had been through. Of course it is not the evening shifts fault and Priscilla, the supervisor I spoke to apologized and offered to buy us new meals but that is not what I want because I am NEVER going to this place again. The Greens and Proteins on Rainbow is closer to me and I usually go there. This was my second and LAST time going to the Flamingo location. If you decide to patronize this venue, be aware and cautious.

Yes, it is a bit pricey. However, the food is fresh and tastes wonderful. I only review places I have been to at least a few times...and I have had a good experience at G&P every time I went. The Wellness drink with protein always makse my body feel wonderful. I drink it after I workout on days I feel a bit under the weather, and it always makes me feel much better. The Ostrich burger they have is so good and low calorie as well.
If you're looking for a clean meal that's actually delicious, this is the spot for you! I would definitely recommend Greens and Proteins to my Real Estate clients!

This my jam.

This is one of my favorite spots in my area. 

The juices are awesome and creative. They taste great. They aren't cheap (7 bucks or so), but at least you get fresh ingredients. That's what counts right?

Food is quite good too. The Bison cheesesteak is delicious. So are all of the flatbreads.

Most Vegas locals know about this spot, but if you are unfamiliar, give it a shot!
My favorite place in North Las Vegas! I love everything here so much that I order atleast once a week!

I've been here a few times. The first time I found something on my burger and when I told the manager he took care of me. I appreciated the good customer service. Their pizza is good and so is the angus burger. Smoothies are healthy and a nice size, but overall the food is expensive. I'm ok with paying for good quality if the ingredients are healthy, just can't come here too often. I appreciate them showing the calorie count!!

I love Greens and Proteins. There are so many delicious healthy options. I have eaten at this location twice, and neither times was it is good as the food at their n Eastern location (tofu fries were way over seasoned and they forgot my sauce that goes with it). I also do not like the layout/vibes of this one as much. The staff was very friendly though. With so few healthy options compared to fast food chains it is great to see places like greens and proteins spreading. Overall, this is a nice place to grab a healthy bite.

Ordered the Bison Burger to go. Definitely an interesting healthy menu I'd like to come try again, especially the Ostrich Burger, even though it's pretty heavy on your wallet, $14.99. But I heard ostrich is pricey.

Jicama fries that comes with the burgers are very interesting. Not french fries, far from it. It's more like seasoned radish slices. That's definitely a healthy substitute... definitely not as yummy as french fries. A+ for effort, though. Many items for people who are on that HCG diet, too.

Free Wi-Fi inside and the decor is very modern and hip. The place looked very clean and orderly. There were lots of take-out orders going out, so lots of people seem to like this place. Always a good sign...

I'll definitely come back here. I think you get a check-in discount on their smoothies, so I'll come back for those and more healthy eats!

Stopped by the other day and did a "create your own" meal.. I got the bison patty, whole wheat pasta, and saut√©ed spinach. My girlfriend got the ahi tuna, edamame, and quinoa. Both meals were very good, and we left feeling full and good about ourselves. Definitely can't wait to explore the rest of the menu.

This place is great when you want to eat out, but still want to eat right! Just went with some clients and I'm sure happy we decided to go here. The tofu fries are a great choice, but anyting in thus menu is great. Make sure to try one of their green drinks!!

Always clean restaurant and their food is amazing! A lot of different options and everything I have tried is good! Their staff is friendly as well and there is tons of seating! The bison cheesesteak wrap with sweet potato fries is my fave!
This place was great,good healthy food,fast drrvice,everything was very clean,l will keep going back

I always love Greens and Proteins except for the times, like today, when I am missing half of my order (ordered through Postmates so I couldn't check myself). I wouldn't mind if it was cheaper food, but for the fact that this is more expensive than other options and to still not receive what I ordered is annoying and I paid for something I didn't receive. Just some advice for Greens and Proteins, double check orders before checkout so someone isn't leaving a bad yelp review.

Greens and Protein is the place.  Looking for healthy food? You gotta check this place out. I've lost almost 25 lbs since they opened the downtown facility.  The staff is always cheerful and positive and eager to please you. The restaurant has a uniqie vibe to it; if I ever walk in in a bad mood I always walk out in a good mood.    If everybody ate here they would put shrinks out of business.   Keep it up guys!
This place is the best place in Vegas for living a healthy lifestyle. Food is great and customer service awesome
The best place to eat clean in Las Vegas. I wish there was a location in Los Angeles... My favorite part is that they cater to HCG dieters. "Awesome sauce!"

When we arrived we were second in line. We ordered a wrap, 2 wellness drinks and a child's pasta. Our drinks came out fast but it was over a half hour for our food. The food was ok but they messed up our order, we were charged 1.50 for avocado that they forgot to put in the wrap. Overall the food was good but overpriced. Their smoothies are $8-$10 and service is slow. 

The girl who took our order was rude and very short with us. Sad to say it this will be my last trip here.
Wellness drink is the BEST!!!!!! I haven't had much food here, except for the hummus, salad and wellness drink. Everything was absolutely amazing!!!

I've been going to this place for awhile.  They rock!  If your unhappy about something tell management and they will bend over backwards to make you happy.  Highly recommend this to anyone who wants a good meal that is healthy.

Visited on Aug.20 at 7:45pm. I've been a customer for 3 yrs & never before had a negative experience however last night was a disappointment! I have laryngitis otherwise I would have requested a do over in the store. The lady that took my order for a green ginger limeade was wearing plastic gloves that she handled my money with. I then witnessed her sweeping the floor with the same gloves on & then delivering a meal with the same gloves. That customer sent his meal back for more rice. She made my drink with the same gloves on & I think she was having a rough night as my drink was devoid of any ginger or lime & was watered down. Just as I got my drink another customer came back in to complain & have their green ginger limeade remade as it was waterey. Please have your employees change their gloves as the above is very unhygienic. I should have also asked for a redo on my drink.

Food here is good the buffalo chicken pizza and the bison philly are my two favorites. I really don't need to explain why this place is soooo good just go and try for your self you won't be disappointed. But seriously the bison Philly was almost if not just as good as a Philadelphia Philly
Gluten free friendly Great place to eat healthy.  The staff is friendly! It's a clean place bonus for me. You can sit outside as well.
Great place to get an after workout juice or smoothie!  You all are fabulous!

Love this place! Been looking for a new spot to eat healthy at and I found it. Ir had the create your own with chicken, brown rice, broccoli ad get the lemon vinaigrette dressing and put it all over everything. Love that dressing, seriously wish they would bottle it and let me take it home! I've also had the veggie pizza and chef salad here too which are both really good and light. All in all this place is phenomenal and all the staff are really nice!

Inside the place is nice and colorful, makes you feel fresh. The menu is a little steep but reasonable for being healthy. I ordered the bison wrap and tortilla soup. The wrap was amazing. Not sure if the soup was even what I ordered. Just seemed like a cream of something, no chunks of anything in it. The taste was fine, but I don't think it was what I ordered. The complimentary "cucumber lemon" water was way too cucumber-y and there was absolutely zero lemon in it. False advertising. If the soup was right and the water was more to what I expected this would have made five stars. I will go back again to try other wraps and their burgers. A great healthy alternative.

Greens and proteins is a decent restaurant with healthy offerings but at the end of the day, there's not enough offerings and variety for us to be regulars.  

I ordered the angus burger with lettuce pocket (instead of bun) with tofu fries.  Angus burger was fine, not salty which is good.  The tofu fries were salty because of the seasoning.  So healthwise, its kind of a wash with the tofu fries lol.

My wife ordered the build your own with angus patty, kale, and sweet potato mash.  She seemed to enjoy it because the kale was steamed and not sodium bombed.  She also ordered a ginger limeade which was too sweet for her taste.

The price was surprisingly high as all the above came out to 35 bucks (with tip).  So although we feel the food is relatively healthy, the price and distance from our home is a small obstacle for consistent repeat business..

The cool thing about this location is that is open till 10pm for all those healthy late snack meals.

They have bison burgers, and other cool healthy foods.
