Just because 0 is not an option!! What a stupid staff! i told them no pecans in my pancakes! They made it with pecans. And when I called them the manager told me they will make another one without pecans. And when I went to pick up my pancakes they told me that there is a pecan already in a butter they use for making the pancakes. And he told me that he didn't tell me to come back for another one! And they didn't offer to refund me my order. I was speechless...I am defenetly not going back!
I wish I had discovered this place sooner! I love that it is truly healthy food AND it's delicious.
Im giving them an extra star because they followed up with me to show they actually care. That is def a way to keep me as a customer

I got the chicken, brown rice and asparagus! It was so delicious. I love it  the smoothies are so yummy too I had the green shake and it was really good! It's a healthy place for sure. Something you eat after a good work out!

I like the novelty of Greens and Proteins, but find the execution a bit "off".   It's nice to offer a version of fast food gone healthy, but I found many of the options very bland.  The jicama "fries" are a nice choice, but I'll go for the seasoned tofu fingers over the cool jicama any day.  The addition of the crunchy/healthy side is nice, though.  I had bites of the bison burger ordered by others at the table, which was fine - a typical bison burger, but my veggie patty was not what I expected.  I thought since the place focuses on healthy that the veggie patty would be - veggie.  But nope, it's 100% soy and pretty bland.  I was pretty dissappointed.  Some of the drinks/smoothies are fun, but it's not enough to draw me in without a meal I'm excited about.  I'll try more things, maybe some wraps will rock my world, but the bland and soy-ness of the veggie patty was enough to discourage me for a while.

This is the first time I have eaten here, I got the Ahi protein salad for 14 dollars. It is absolutely horrible, not only did the entire salad stink when I opened my dish but the tuna was stringy and slimy, and my avocado was hard and underripe. My fruit bowl had rotten brown slimy pineapple. I don't mind paying 14 dollars for quality food but this was not. Extremely disappointed. I wish I could give 0 stars.

Simply delicious food. I had the salmon, asparagus and quinoa paired with the lemon vinaigrette... Perfection. Salmon was really well cooked, the vinaigrette was light and refreshing.  

Staff was super friendly. I was so stoked to hear they also have a location right near my apartment. This will become a regular spot!

Earthy & modern atmosphere in several locations with fresh ingredients & healthy menu options. Also, friendly to food allergies & dietary restrictions, including: dairy-free, gluten-free, vegan & raw.
I love this place.  Great healthy food!  The quinoa salad was delicious and the turkey burger was super good.  For a great healthy meal this is the place
Of all the places in Las Vegas we chose this place because of its healthy flavorful food!  I love it!
Barbecue pizza was okay, the the jicama fries were not. Not sure if I would eat here again.
Great spot to grab a quick, healthy lunch or dinner! Love that all the nutrition information is readily available and that there are so many healthy choices!  Great spot!
Definitely a fan and will be making this a daily occurrence while in town.  Tried the Green Smoothie & Straight to the Heart both are great!

I was super excited to drive by here last week and saw that they opened a location near me. We have eaten at the Henderson location and fell in love with the food and smoothies there. My husband usually gets the Green Shake and this time I got the Antioxidant Chiller and it has become my favorite. Our favorite food to get is the Bison Burger. The meat is juicy and every bite is delicious. It comes with either jicama fries or tofu fries. We are not jicama fans so we get the tofu fries and they are yummy.
The people and the food are great!!! The staff is friendly and the shakes are so refreshing. Good little spot for a nice lunch with family and friends. Thank you Tyler for you exceptional service (:

Tasty, healthy, servin' it up with love little cafe that specializes in hi protein homemade food.

Filled with gym-bunnies eating after the work-out, definitely keeping their trainers and diets happy!

The menu looks simple from fist appearances, but they really try to get creative with the flavors, and foods. For example, instead of potatoes, yummy little tofu bites. Over all I was impressed.

This is becoming the favorite place for "Lunch Days" with my staff!
If you are in the mood for an awesome salad, or even a healthy burger, this place will hook you up!  Have been for both lunches and brunches. Never disappointed! 

Tons of yummy healthy options on the menu. The Jicama "fries" are amazing!! And I love the bison burgers, I go back and forth on the jicama fries or the tofu fries, they are both so good, in completely different ways. The egg dishes are light, and tasty. I have never had a smoothie from here, but I see them making them like crazy, so I assume they are a local favorite.

There is a reason why this company has different locations popping up around the city.
Once people discover it, they love it! Don't miss out!!

Came here to try a new healthy joint in Vegas after a day of splurging.  The place reminds me of veggie grill but they serve meat too. Appears to be very basic flavors and simple stand alone dishes. They have combinations of flavors for you to mix and match if you desire.

We ordered the tofu fries- not too bad
Thai chicken peanut bowl- not good at all. They mixed up my order. I asked for no rice. My bowl had specs of rice; as if the cook forgot and took the chicken out of the rice and placed in the greens. My bowl also had some beef? Not sure how they store the meats..

Meaty potato soup was not bad, literally ground turkey, potato, and kale with cream

They got my husbands order all wrong and late. They forgot the buffalo sauce for the chicken the meat was bland, and they forgot the egg white add on.

Our friend ordered a banana split smoothly that tastes like water and ice.


The place was not busy at all and they keep missing up our order.

I still prefer veggie nation near the area :)

Wrote a really great review awhile back, but unfortunately my thoughts have changed. Recently I have been ordering to go and each time my order has been wrong. I write in all caps on my orders for no cheese because I am lactose intolerant and cheese does not sit well with my body. Unfortunately, the last 7 times there has always been cheese, orders are mixed up with my husband's order. I.e they put cheese on my angus burger and no cheese on his bison burger, cheese on my salads, etc. I've always tried to give the benefit of the doubt because I love their food. But it seems like there is always miscommunication or no one truly reads my entire order. Again, a meal I can't eat because of the cheese. :/
I had a peanut butter banana chocolate protein smoothie and the barbecue chicken pizza. Both were amazing!

10 check-ins and I'm the Duke! 

This is my review it is almost sickeningly green in here these lime green plastic chairs are hard on the eyes. It's like you want to eat and get out. Tne walls and a good chunk of the ceiling are also bright ass green. Most of the tables wobble, it's usually packed and loud. But damned if the food doesn't keep bringing me back even though it is 10 miles from my house so 2 stars on interior 4 stars on food.

A definite must go when I'm in Vegas! Staff is always friendly! Love their tofu fries and their French toast is AWESOME! Their green shake and wellness drink are my favorite beverages! BBQ chicken pizza on lavash is DELICIOUS! I wish they opened one in San Diego!!!!

Lots of healthy options. I love getting the "create your own" because I can keep my dinner low calorie and clean by doubling up on the greens. Also, the gluten free pizza is really yummy. I suggest getting it extra crispy though. Only downfall for me is that their "juices" are smoothies and not green enough for me. Overall, a great place to check out if you ate trying to eat healthier

Love love love this place!!! Its the perfect place to start eating healthier and transitioning yourself into a healthier lifestyle. My "go to" is a create your own, where u pick a protein, a green, a grain, & a sauce. If I'm splurging I go with the gluten free BBQ chicken pizza. I myself have Celiac disease (gluten intolerance) and have to be very picky about where & what I eat; its nice that the staff is well educated on which items, including sauces & dressing, fit my food requirements. Also, staff is very friendly! Can't wait to see this place grow more and more popular!
Great place to eat healthy. Food is delicious and there are a lot of options. Only issue is it is a little pricy
I love going here! The chocolate veggiechinno is the best ever, with almond milk of course. I've been vegan since January and this place is great stop for a fast meal or pick me up smoothie.

**Smoothie Review**

Great smoothies and a solid option for that mid-afternoon snack attack. 

I've only ever had the smoothies and let me tell ya... they're tasty. I usually get one after the gym or when I'm fighting back that burrito craving. Greens and Proteins offers multiple smoothies options: Green Shake, Chocolate Peanut Butter and Banana shake and something called the Apple Pie... the list goes on, but you get it, right? 

I'VE TRIED BOTH:  The Green Shake & its Chocolate mutant counterpart. 

The Green Shake is delicious. Filled with banana, almonds, mango, orange, apple, avocado, spinach, collard greens, kale, vanilla, agave nectar. This beast will definitely curb hunger cravings, but won't leave you feeling overstuffed and gross. Great smoothie for the Green and Protein curious but isn't sure about all this weird healthy food business. Not only is this drink tasty, but the super silky texture is a great way to smooth out a rough day. Ha! 

The Chocolate Peanut Butter Banana Shake is for the person who needs to be tricked into eating "healthy". This drink, with over 700 calories, comes fully equipped with cacao powder, dark chocolate chips, banana, roasted peanut, avocado, kale, spinach, zucchini, flax seed, chia seeds, honey, vanilla, agave nectar. This is definitely a meal substitute and should be treated as such. This one is actually my favorite (duh) because I drink this instead of eating a heavy lunch, but it also does what it's supposed to do, fill you up. 

I'm a big dude, so if these smoothies can tide me over until my next feeding, than I'm sure the twiggy masses will be set for days. Keep it smoothie!

I don't usually eat out because I have to stick to a gluten free diet so im very limited. 
It was my first time in and Kristen I believe her name was really took amazing care of me. She showed me the most amazing meal ever. I most definitely will be back.

Pricey healthy food. But good! I love their smoothies/juices, lots of different options. My favorites are the Wellness drink, Green Leaf Berry Blast and Apple Pie Smoothie. They list all of the ingredients and calories on the menu so that's great.
As for food, they offer a great variety as well. Soups, salads, BURGERS, PIZZA lol, raw and smaller items. I must say, for being super healthy, the tofu fries are actually pretty good. I also like their Bison Burger and BBQ Chicken Pizza. Where else can you eat a whole pizza for around 350 calories?? Score!
If you're an avid greens & proteins person, they have an app where you can place orders. It's pretty busy most of the time so that's helpful. Workers are friendly and there's a bit more wait time so give them an extra 5 minutes.
I was thinking to give them 3 stars because it's a little pricey and because nothing is like omg melt in your mouth i'm craving for it good but then I had to smack myself and remind myself what type of business they are. Let's get real, it's not meant to taste like cheesecake factory with 1500 calories per dish lol for the type of food they offer, they do amazing. And again, for the type of food they offer, it's naturally pricey anyways so 4 stars! Don't forget to check in for $1 off juices and smoothies!  :)

Greens and protein is my go to spot if I'm looking for a quick, healthy meal.  Their menu has enough variety to satisfy your pallet regardless of what you are in the mood for (assuming you want to eat healthy).  It is conveniently located .1 mile off the Eastern exit on the 215. 

The vibe is very fresh when you walk in.  The staff is very prompt and friendly.  They have a full juice/smoothie bar (peanut butter/banana/chocolate smooth is phenomenal), grill, and healthy treat options.  

My favorite meal to order here is the bison cheesesteak.  The Bison is wrapped in a spinach wrap with melted cheese, peppers, and some type of chipotle sauce mixed in. 

The bison burger is also delicious.  It is much leaner than beef burgers so it's not as juicy, but they do well at making it very flavorful.

I dined here when they first opened and thought it was simply mediocre, food wise. But organization and the overall restaurant decor wasn't too great. 
I'm happy to say that things have certainly changed now. The food is good, drinks are great, and restaurant has grown into something special. Most people complain about price, and yes, it's not cheap. But I'd rather pay $2-3 more for a meal and get something that tastes fresh and made with organic/quality ingrediants.

Grateful to have a healthy option in the area! The food is well-prepared by a kind staff. I eat here at least once a week & am a big fan of the HGC options. The bison burger is a great cheat day meal! Can't get enough of the sweet potato fries!
Great place with lots of non-animal product choices. I've brought omni friends here and they LOVE the tofu. A little pricey but great food.

Wow. Just had the turkey and it was awesome!
It's nice to eat quick - have it be good and healthy and only a few dollars more than what daft food (my phone autocorrected fast food to daft food and I think that's a better name for it so I'm leaving it) would cost. 
2 sides came with it - I had saut√©ed kale (it was ok) and asparagus (really good).
Love this place! The food is clean and refreshing. Does not have any gross "healthy god tastes" yummmmm

I've been to this location a few times over the years. Now that I'm more health conscious and watch what animal products I put into my body- Greens & Proteins is a good option. They offer vegan, vegetarian, and gluten free choices, plus animal for those who are so inclined. 
The bright green color scheme is still overwhelming for my eyes. They had 2 tvs to keep you occupied. Lots of seating inside and a few tables outside. When I came in on a Saturday around 11- it was pretty quiet but the dining area was pretty messy. A lot of tables with crumbs and food items and the floor was dirty as well. 
My veggie burger was way over cooked. It was dark brown and really crunchy. Hard to finish it because it was pretty dry. 
Went today and had the mock chicken wraps. They were so salty. I couldn't even finish them. 
Staff was friendly and professional.

I am on a new road to healthier eating and this is a great place to go to for a smoothie or a light meal. I tried the Green Shake and I am hooked! I also ordered some broccoli soup, hummus/pita, and a Margherita pizza with the Vegan option. The shake was refreshing,filling, and delicious. The food however was just not my style. I saw other people enjoying their meals. I would say nothing was wrong with the food at all. It was made fresh and with good looking ingredients. I just think as of now, I'm more on a juicing/smoothie kick. The open plan of the kitchen was nice to be able to see your food being made in front of you. I liked the modern and clean look of the decor. There was a large patio to enjoy the spring/fall seasons here in Vegas. 
My only gripe.. the noise level!
Bring earplugs. When they get those blenders going... It's LOUD!!

I am so happy that this side of town has lots of healthy options popping up lately. G and P is another light and healthy choice if your wallet can handle it. I know fresh options are usually more expensive, but for some reason, G and P always seems to feel like I am paying a few dollars too much for the items that I order. I have ordered their juices, salads, wraps, and pizzas. All were very tasty, flavorful, and yes-- fresh. 
I usually get my orders to go because it is a small place and get crowded. I have seen the owner/manager come out and talk to the costumers and bring the meals to the tables which is a nice touch. 
I do however HATE how dang tall the counter is when you are standing in line to order. I feel trapped and claustrophobic while I am waiting. I get a neck cramp trying to look over the wall and strain to read the menu. 
Oh well. The sacrifices we make to eat some healthy food. :)

Jump on the train!  Eat healthy!  This new place is located within walking distance of my office, and when I'm there (which is almost never) I head over for lunch.  Great salads, and even better juices, with a friendly staff and a casual atmosphere.  I always feel weird about leaving dirty dishes on a table in a fast casual restaurant like this, but I'm warming to the idea.  Summer Berry Spinach Salad, Harvest Kale Stocked Salad, and Bison Cheese Steak are current faves.  Try a Wellness Drink or a Green Ginger Limeade, and you too will be a happy, healthy human!
I die for their vegan burger wrapped in cabbage with tofu fries. Seasoned to perfection and portioned great for a curvy girl on the go!
The BEST Veggie burger I have ever eaten- and the cabbage wrap & tofu fries are fantastic! I ordered two days in a row.

First Time Eating Here,It Was A Little Pricey. I Ordered The Bison Burger Which Was Really Delicious,And Got Hiccama(Spelling?) Fries Which Were Not Really My Thing.I Ordered A Watermelon Raspberry Juice And It Was Okay.All In All I Think That Its Too Expensive But The Bison Burger Was Really Good.Great Location Near LVAC On Decatur And The Staff Was Really Nice And Helpful In Explaining Things.

Absolutely love this place. The bison cheesesteak, turkey burger, and lean angus beef burger are my favorites. The green shake is the bomb.com! That cucumber water is really refreshing with this heat. 

I recently got there app on my phone and it made buying lunch so much easier. Order it and in about 10 minutes it's ready!

I love this place because of their awesome crew! Shout out to Blake and Steven for always being so friendly and accommodating! 

I have never been to the other locations before but I have grown to love this one since it is closer to where I live now. It is also not too far from Planet Fitness on Rainbow and 215 so this is definitely my favorite go to place for my post-workout meals. I've been to this location four times already and the food is fresh and delicious every time. 

They offer a wide selection of meals, protein shakes and smoothies. If you are watching your calorie intake, this place is great. They have low calorie pizzas and burgers!  I will definitely recommend this place if you are looking for delicious and healthy food.

Literally the BEST juice I have ever had. I'm honestly, extremely picky about juices...haven't found one that I liked...till now! The Wellness Drink is one that is a must try. It had green grapes, green apple, pineapple, orange, lime, wheat grass, kale, spinach, collard greens, ginger, flax seed, and agave. The proportions were perfect that you don't taste too much of one ingredient. 

I only gave it 4 since this is the only item I've tried. I wish they brought it to LA, it would do so well! Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm DEFINITELY coming back.

Still one of my favorite places to go when I'm visiting Vegas. I always get the Wellness Drink without Stevia. It's sweet enough with the fruit that you can't taste the greens. If you check in on yelp you get $1 a juice or smoothie. The person who helped us out...Steve? was great. Very personable and gave great recommendations.

Still waiting for this place to come out to LA!

Been here twice now and I really dig this place. The food was excellent. (I split two meals between my girlfriend and me: the tofu chorizo breakfrast burrito and the veggie wrap.) I really dig a place that purports to be fresh and healthy *and actually is*. There were little things that made the experience better, as well. The staff was obviously very happy and interested in their food, our satisfaction, etc. It didn't feel forced, they actually seemed happy to be there and like they cared what we thought. And this might sound lame, but we didn't order drinks, and they proactively offered water cups to us, and then we saw that the water was nor just a fountain-style plain water but rather a cucumber/lemon water concoction that tasted great.

The only reason this is a 4 instead of a 5 is that it IS a bit pricey. Our two meals, without drinks, came to $20. And the second time I went I got a medium-ish sized smoothie for more than $8. But I feel like that's worth it for what we got: indisputably fresh, healthy meals.

I'll be going back regularly.
I waited 30 minutes for a Wellness drink here. Turns out, they forgot about it. After finally receiving my drink, I didn't get an apology or anything. I'm disappointed.

Dining out is so hard when you're trying to stay healthy, but this place takes the temptation out of the dining out experience because everything on their menu is good for you! I've tried the turkey burger, the bison burger, and a wrap (can't recall which one) and was pleased with each. The tofu fries are really yummy!!! This place is pretty expensive though, but I guess when you're putting good stuff into your body it's worth it

This place was ok...

Yes, its healthy and good for you but what the hell? My brother treated me, himself and his wife to dinner and it came out to $50.00!!!  For dinner at that price I would have expected a better quality and portioned meal. Do not get the tuna salad....sooo little tuna and also I would stick to the wraps and sandwiches. My brother got the build your own meal, and the tuna was not cooked properly, no flavor and very small portions. I got the chicken wrap and it was really good but hot damn they are pricey. I got the leafy berry smoothie...was not that good and really?? Almost $8.00?! If you are going to spend that god awful amount on a smoothie or juice get the green wellness or whatever its called, it tastes better. Overall, I will not be coming back here unless its on someone else's dime. I would rather spend the money on groceries and cook something healthy at home.

I thought this place was awesome! I had the buffalo cheesesteak sandwihch with a side of jicama fries (not cooked...raw) which was a very welcome and wholesome change for the norm. 

The atmosphere is modern. Seating is pretty ample and comfortable for all sizes. Most of the patrons have on workout clothing as the LV Athletic Club is in the same shopping center. Parking seems a little cramped but there's always a good amount of parking spaces available. 

They also have cafe seating with very nice furniture. I was impressed and will definitely be returning.

Good Lookin' and Healthy is what you feel when you head in here for a snack! 
I enjoy this cause it's faster than me shopping for the ingredients and doing it myself when I'm in a crunch for time! 
Grab and go is how I feel when I stop for a smoothie and/or juice! 
Doc would be proud of me! 
Just wish they had more juices!           (((o(*??*)o))) over all satisfied!!! I like the fact that it's yum stuff

I absolutely love this place! They have great food selections. I've tried their Greek pizza, breakfast burritos, jicama fries, watermelon juice, and their green machine shake. It's all amazing. If you get the green machine shake get it with almond milk preferably.

Love that's it's good food when I don't feel like making good food.  But then again, if I'm eating out, I want something a little more exciting than what I make for myself at home.  I've tried enough to have my safe menu items and I go there for them. 
Love the Grilled Vegetable Frittata and the delicious Watermelon and Feta Salad that comes with it (Idk why this keep this secret, it's not mentioned on the menu at all but comes w the frittata and can be ordered as a meal)! Also the sweet potato fries are the best I've ever had anywhere, I crave them often. I also really enjoy their acai bowl, no added sugar but soooooo sweet and delish!! 

If at first you don't like something, keep trying.  It's a good alternative to cooking or eating crap out.

This is my first time at this location. I love their food and juices.

Had the Harvest Kale salad and pumpkin loaf. The salad was delicious and very "citrusy." I'm not sure if the pumpkin bread is seasonal but it was also very good.

My sister had the turkey club and sweet potato french fries and said it was good.

Solid food all-around!

Whenever I am back on my healthy kick, Greens & Proteins is my go to! Normally, I would say it is a little overpriced, but for great quality food, sometimes you have to pay a little extra.

Bison Cheesesteak Wrap is my go to! When I'm being really good, I'll turn it into a salad, with no tortilla. This place is awesome to modifying anything that I get here.

The staff is awesome and very attentive and friendly. Always great when it comes to recommendations and taking care of their guests! 

Great place for a quick bite or a casual luncheon!

Excellent Service,  Friendly staff.  I like their spinach salad and salads in general.  Chicken was moist and tender and greens fresh. Once I placed my order the staff followed up and made sure that my order was delivered in a reasonable amount of time.  I have no affiliation with this restaurant, but fell I should note excellent service when provided! Check it out, you won't be disappointed!
Love at first sip ... Green Machine shake ... a must have!  and Tofu fries :) nom nom
Fave fuel station for post or pre workouts...or to grab a healthy bite. Tofu fries, wellness drink, green shake and raw macho nacho are my faves. Vegan and vegetarian friendly. Free wifi too.

I have a love hate relationship with this healthy spot. I travel to Vegas and absolutely love this place for its healthy options. However the team must work on those customer service factors like speediness. I ordered an Americano and it took about 10minutes and there were no customers waiting. Either it's a training issue with new staff or they are totally oblivious to this piece of running a business.

This will be my third time here. The service here is phenomenal! Also the service is very fast the manu is amazing with all the healthy choices and very tasty, and fresh! satisfied customers definitely always a choice to return.

I have recently found myself on a low-carb, high protein kick.  For that reason, I thought Greens and Proteins would be right up my alley.  I visited their Green Valley location and found the food to be a healthy alternative, but a little on the pricey side compared to other restaurants that offer similar fare (Rachel's Kitchen, Daily Wellness, etc).

About a week later I decided to give the Greens and Proteins location at Flamingo and the 215 a try and I was greatly disappointed.  The service was very slow and when I brought the issue to the manager's attention his reaction was trite and condescending.  He did nothing to rectify the situation and told me I had no reason to complain.  When I went to eat my to-go order, an ostrich burger lettuce wrap, I found it was topped with a rotten avocado and it was missing the turkey bacon I ordered.  

For the price point (my meal was $18) I found the service and quality to be lacking.  On the upside, after reading another negative Yelp! review of this establishment, I found a great nearby "healthy alternative" restaurant that I will be returning to for sure.

I ordered delivery to my new home to see what's around. I got the Green Leaf Berry Blast Smoothie and the California Grilled Chicken Wrap. I loved their smoothie options, however the one I ordered lacks a little flavor. Still good, just not what I thought it would taste like. That being said, the wrap is HELLA delicious. This is definitely a place I'll be frequenting for an healthy meal on my lazy cook days.

Really good for people with diet restrictions or food allergies.  They have healthy shakes and they also juice there.  The Jicama fries are different but very good.  I like that you can build your own meal by choosing your meat and vegetable.  The decor is pretty cool as well.  You order at the counter and they bring it out to you, very laid back environment.  It is in the same lot as Las Vegas Athletic Club, so there are a lot of people in there juicing or getting shakes after working out.  Cool environment.

Absolutely Floored!!!! I just received a call from the owner of Proteins and Greens. letting me know that I overpaid for my Chocolate Peanut Butter shake, apparently I gave the cashier a $20.00 dollar bill and walked away with my smoothie, I thought I gave her a ten dollar bill therefore leaving the remainder as a tip. I love the Honesty and Integrity of  this establishment!! The quality of the food is spectacular, the service is second to none and the attention to detail ranks with any 5 Star establishment that I have ever been to!!! I am speechless....Kudos to the entire team of Greens and Proteins!! They officially earned my business for a lifetime....

I always love grabbing a quick and clean power lunch at Greens & Proteins! 

I usually get the Bison Cheese Steak Wrap in a spinach tortilla. Side of Sriracha sauce. 
Amazing! 

Also try the tofu fries, they are delicious. 

Top it all off w a Green wellness juice and you've got the perfect balanced lunch!!

I am definitely planning on trying to become a regular here!  Every week I find myself talking about how I need to change my eating habits and start eating right!  (More like every morning, but I'm trying to make myself feel better here!) Well, Greens and Proteins is definitely a step in the right direction!! I met a girlfriend here one afternoon for a quick lunch and I was definitely in love!  We both got smoothies and split one of their breakfast options.  I was definitely satisfied by the end of our meal!  

I got their acai smoothie and I loved it!  It wasn't as thick as some smoothie places make their smoothies and I was definitely happy about that!  It was the perfect flavor and consistency.  AND, it filled me up!  Now, I'm a hungry, hungry hippo, so I usually need a lot more than a smoothie to satisfy my hunger.  But not here!  My appetite was completely satisfied and I had to force myself to split the frittata with my friend.  Which was also delicious!!! 

This is definitely an amazing healthy alternative in the area and I can't wait to go back and try even more!

Wow, I'm so impressed. Ceaser just gave us samples from the new vegan menu. AMAZING! I pray that they keep all of them. So good. Had the vegan burger and the vegan Philly cheese steak, tasted so much like meat if it hadn't come from the cook I'd have been suspicious. This place is awesome

THIS  place is all the rave.  So, I had to come check it out.  I had the veggie burger w daiya cheese and a lettuce wrap to avoid any soy. My burger came w jicama fries....which are not FRIED at all.  I didn't expect that one!! They were cut to look like actual fries, served raw and seasoned with real lemon juice and paprika.  The burger was good..decent. The fries were a nice healthy alternative and not too bad themselves. I started w an Apple pie smoothie....expecting the flavor God's to swoop me up to food heaven....but yeah NO! It was flavorless....a huge disappointment after the big intro given by the cashier. Not sure what it needs, but it was missing "something".  Service was good, staff very helpful w questions. Overall it was a satisfying meal....all vegan, no soy and no added sugar....AWESOME!! Will come back for the burger and a different smoothie next time. Oh and they have crushed ice.....my absolute favorite kind of ice lol. The crushed ice added to my experience of course!! Great healthy alternative to Mickey D's....TRY IT!

Okay. 
The food presentation is 5/5.
Taste 4/5. It tends to be a little bland so I added salt, which fixed the problem. Good flavor. 
Price 3/5. Purchased two bison steak wraps and 1 chicken tenders meal. It cost $50. That price is enough for a dinner at Olive Garden. 
 
Would come back to try some more food, definitely.

Very good first time dining at this place! The menu is kind of expensive but then again what can you expect from a place that aims for healthy eating! They have this $1 off coupon that you can use on the $7.50 smoothie drink :-/ it was ok.. I ordered the "Wellness" drink which I could've made at home myself nothing special..I feel like they should give more than a dollar off that's not even covering the tax on the drink itself but that's neither here nor there.. On to the food.. So my friend talked me into ordering the Bison Cheese Steak which honestly was good but for sure not worth $10.99 I got a pinch on cheese steak with ALL that bread and some light mozzarella.. I enjoyed the tofu fries more than anything else to be honest! I guess I'll just have to try something different on the menu because I won't let one mediocre experience take away from the whole dining experience..

Delicious and healthy are a rare combination, but Greens and Proteins nails it! The service here is also top notch. I enjoyed a lean angus burger perfectly cooked medium served with savory tofu fries and a pickle. Steve-O served me and was incredibly attentive and generous! Now, I'm sure this doesn't happen often, but he offered me a trio of smoothie samples to try and two free smoothies! He also brought some bbq sauce to accompany my burger and my utensils to my table. Great value, so yummy, and guilt-free. Greens and Proteins is healthy eating must!

This time I ordered the granola french toast with a juice containing watermelon; apples; kale; blueberries. The french toast was poorly executed. In certain areas it was undercooked and it contained too much granola that was not sticking to the bread properly. When I finished I was left with a plate of granola. The juice was also disappointing and had a watered down taste from the ice they used. 

I like the menu here however some of the recipes need tweaking.

Before I placed my order, I asked the girl at the register what Greens and Proteins specialties are and she said make your own plate, and the BBQ chicken pizza. I decided on the pizza. 

My order came about 20 min later maybe even a bit longer which I think is too long for a fast casual restaurant. When I took the first bite of the pizza all I could taste was the BBQ sauce. While the BBQ sauce did grow on me after a few bites, I almost thought it tasted a little too unique. Additionally, if a "traditional" BBQ sauce is not used, the menu should specify the type of BBQ sauce being used (citrus BBQ sauce). Now on to the chicken, I did not like the spice on the chicken and it was a little dry. The positives were that the pizza is low calorie so you can finish the whole thing; the fat free ranch is delicious; the lavash bread gave the pizza a nice crunch.

Towards the end of my meal, I called over the manager to give him some feedback. While I appreciated him sitting down with me and having an open conversation, I did not like the fact that he said normally I would offer a refund but in this case I don't think we did anything wrong. I wasn't asking for a refund just offering my honest feedback. 

Overall, I like the concept of the restaurant and I am willing to come back to try more items on the menu.

Love this place. Great green drinks and smoothies. Food is great and very fresh. Only reason for 4 stars is because it is slightly pricey. But it is definitely worth it. 

Decor is so fun and modern. Wonderful friendly staff too! If you are looking for a HEALTHY place this is where you should go

The Bison Cheese Steak Spinach Wrap is amaze-balls! Mmm good... I will be thinking about it for days. The Bison was cooked well, soft and great comparison with the cheese and spinach wrap. A great filling and healthy option. The Tofu fries were a bit lacking in flavor and had an oily/greasy taste. The decor is well green and very natural and outdoorsy. Very relaxing and Zen ambience! Will definitely be back to try more of the menu.
My go to spot for healthy and tasty food. Love the bulgogi bowl. Friendly workers and my only slight complaint is that it's a tad pricey here.
Love this place! I love the juices and burgers. Very healthy. I highly recommend this place

Indeed a healthy and delicious choice!!! e

Even though some foods many be bland they're still pretty good and best thing, you can even taste how HEALTHY they are ;)

As someone allergic to milk, I must evade pizza (seemingly at every turn).  Fortunately, the pizza here can be ordered with vegan cheese!  Further, it tastes amazing.  Crispy crust, fresh toppings, well seasoned.

I also ordered the green ginger limeade to wash it down.

Juice was ok- but the pizza made the trip.

This is the best place to go after a workout. Not a good place to go if you are super hungry. You won't feel guilty after your workout since they serve sort of healthy entrees. The serving here is smaller than usual and is pricey. 

My bf and I ordered a bison burger (very dry even though my bf mentioned that he wanted it cooked medium), crab wrap and a BBQ chicken pizza. For 3 items, it was almost $40. The crab wrap was not bad. You can see some crab pieces in it. The pizza was okay. Nothing special. 

One thing I liked here is their free cucumber lemon water. Very refreshing! 

Not sure if we will be back.

I so wanted to love this place but it's just not that great. It's possible I ordered entirely the wrong thing, but it also took forever to come out (20 minutes), and then one of the containers exploded (opened) in the car and spilled salad all over the floor. 

The bison burger, which I ordered medium, was way way way overdone. Well done in fact. It was flavorless, and the toppings were soggy even though they were separate from the burger. It came with jicama or tofu fries. I got the jicama fries. They were covered in chili powder. I'm not a fan of chili powder. I love jicama. I also got a caesar salad, which was itself actually good minus the exploding container. The little tub of dressing would not have been enough had I not lost half of the salad to the car floorboards, so that was a blessing in disguise. Burger and salad cost $11+5, fountain drink was $2 or $3. They also offer fancy healthy shakes/smoothies for $6-7. 

Menu not offered in a format other than 10 feet above the registers or glued to the counter at the register. Made it hard to figure out what to order since I couldn't read the options. :/

Wanted to try this place for a while as I live around the corner... Impressed with the skinny chef salad! Was afraid it wouldn't have enough going on, but was wrong. Not the best salad I've ever had but pretty good and definitely filling. Service was good and quick as I got it to go and can't wait to stop by again to try a build your own dish. On

Great food!

Green Veggichino is the best Frappuccino replacement.  Everyone here is friendly, and very knowledgeable of the menu.  Lots to choose from!  It may be quicker to call in your order, depending on the food you get..It may take a little while.
I like this food.  Seems healthy. Good value.  Two locations.  Jicama fries are awesome.

I order To-Go orders from Greens and Proteins often. However, I just called to ask if they could accept a To-Go order, considering the fact that they were going to close in 20 minutes. My first attempt to call the restaurant, it rang for a good minute. Then all of the sudden, I was on hold (which I found out through the pre-recorded prompt) and no one answered. So, I tried calling once more to see if it was a mistake and the kid who answered was absolutely rude. Dramatically sighing out of irritation, that I was calling so close to closing time. It's obvious that someone placed my call on hold my first attempt, in hopes that it would deter me, or any business for that matter, from ordering this late.

I don't think that healthy should necessarily = expensive. I've had better for cheaper. I can make better for cheaper. 

I went here after a workout. I got the Ahi Tuna salad which was okay. The lettuce was crunchy and the avocado was creamy, but I think the mushrooms overpowered the whole dish. I thought it would be a "hot" salad instead of the cold salad thinking they would have seared the tuna last and give it to me. My bad on assuming that though. 

The Green smoothie I got was good, but didn't think it was worth about $8. 

The size of this place is decent. It's very clean and I liked that they bring the food to you. The staff was friendly, until I looked at the menu to make my decision, then the he stopped paying attention to me to talk to another staff.
I was so disappointed with this place. Service was trash, food was sub par and super overpriced. I sadly will not ever be returning due to the quality of everything.

Love this place, great options for fitness and healthy conscious people like my self, there is always something that will help you fulfill your macros.  The restaurant is cute and the staff is always helpful and friendly

My new spot for delicious low carb meals and smoothies! I'm so glad they are finally open and conveniently located next to my gym. This is what they are giving us:

Vegan/Vegetarians- Tofu fries, hummus, veggie burgers, smoothies, pizza, salads, soups etc. 

Gluten-free Groupies- For all the Crossfitters and others on the Gluten-free wagon they offer pizza crust, burger buns, etc. all Gluten-free! 

HCG Dieters- Yeah, all you crazy girls shooting yourself up with Lord knows what Greens and Proteins offers a meal replacement shake for you!

Low-carb Heads- Yes, I'm one. For us, they can make any sandwich into a wrap. 

For everyone and their moms- They have a design your own meal option. Choose the protein (grilled, steamed or sauted) which includes low fat Ostrich, Bison, turkey, etc. Next you choose your veggie which range from asparagus, spinach, broccoli, etc. Next you choose grains- mashed sweet potatoes, cous cous, brown rice, low carb pasta, etc. Lastly you choose the sauce which is everything from peanut sauce, salad dressing to a pesto or bbq sauce. The combination choices are endless! 

The drink selection really turns me on. They offer several different unique smoothies and also some that combine healthy herbs and veggies with coffee I can't wait to try. The soda fountain has figure friendly Coke Zero, Light Lemonade and Sprite Zero. This is unheard of to have all of them! 

Next time you want to get your healthy on EAT HERE. Your body will thank me.

I've eaten here a few times and it has been good and healthy every time. I like that I can have a hearty, good meal and stay within a decent calorie range. This morning I had the egg white with turkey sausage and tofu fries. I love the tofu fries- they are fab! They play good music in here too:)

Love that we have a place like this on MY side of town! Very delicious good food! My new spot! I like the vibe, though it was strange to hear country music on (and a little too loud outside) and at a good volume (inside). 

It's a really fascinating concept. Just wish they had bike racks (but, that might be more of a Vegas problem...) I'll definitely be back again!

I like this place. Fun healthy meals with good service. The BBQ pizza on the lavash crust is my favorite. I follow flexible dieting so I love how they list the macros so I can track my food. This is a new location and they play awesome reggae music at night. The vibe is good and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Close to my house and the gym this place is my go to for that post work dinner. Steve was great and very helpful and polite

So far I love the place. Every good customer service. A place near my house that has good food choices. Definitely going to come back! A bit pricey but it's well worth it for a healthy life style on the go and when you're in a hurry. Love the ostrich burger and the acai berry smoothie.

Giving THIS LOCATION 3 stars based on the fact that both times I've been here the customer service has been sub-par. Ive had Greens & Proteins many many times and i was very excited to see that they opened one up where i live. The food is still amazing here, and i will continue to visit this location, only because its so close. Both times that ive been here, ive never been greeted when walking in, or when walking up to the counter. I work in Hospitality, i know how easy and simple it is to greet people that walk through your doors. So for me its unacceptable to watch the people who work here ignore me while im standing at the counter, and then pretend like they didnt see me or act like im the odd one when i didnt walk up to the counter immediately.
My favorite everyday restaurant! Healthy, delicious and friendly staff. Changed the way I eat

The staff is very helpful! I had my toddler with me when I had to make several orders for friends and the guy assisting me (I'm upset I didn't get his name) offered to assist me bringing it to the car since I had my hands full with my little one. Great staff !

Best healthy place to eat in las vegas. Usually get the wellness drink which is far better tasting then the green drink at whole foods. The tofu fries are as close to healthy fries as you get. Havent tried everything but everything I have tried is very tasty. Best tasting healthy food around.

I must say I was not impressed. My husband is EXTREMELY gluten sensitive  (it's not a fad, but a really big deal, like an allergy) and when trying to explain this to the guy at the counter he became impatient and huffy. I am not sure if he was the manager or what, but regardless of how busy you are, you need to maintain a certain level of professionalism and care about people, especially food allergies. He was dismissive and after we ordered, I was sure they didn't prepare his food correctly. I ordered an albacore salad and it was just "okay". My husband had requested just a bed of rice with bison and veggies, I believe it may have been a custom order. He really liked his, and didn't have a reaction to any of the food, which is a thumbs up. I hate to leave negative reviews but I just wasn't feeling after the guy was a little abrasive. I WILL go back again because I know people have good and bad days and life happens. The smoothie I had was great however. It was a pretty busy place so I look forward to trying it again. Will update review then.

Ya know, sometimes when a restaurant is slow you'd expect them to be on their game. However, this was not the case. As my family and I waited for 30 minutes for our food the staff had no sense of urgency to check on our order. Once we got our food and realized we were still missing some food I informed the staff and once again there was no urgency to get us the rest. 

When I asked the staff why our food was taking so long they gave me a sorry excuse. I use to work in the food industry so I'm not stupid. I feel pretty confident in saying that they probably forgot my order or messed it up but instead told me it was the pizza dough.  

Btw- I order the same pizza every single visit and at other locations. I've never had this problem before. 
Luckily, this location isn't my normal go to.

Healthy spot! Quick, easy and decently priced! 

My office ordered take-out from here earlier this week. I have never been inside the restaurant even though I live around the corner from it. Sometimes when you go to a restaurant that is known as being healthy can be a little disheartening because you think it will ONLY be salads! Greens and Proteins has burgers, pizza, salads, sandwiches, smoothies, juices, etc! There are so many options! 

I ordered the Veggie Burger and Crispy Tofu. It was by far one of the best veggie burgers I have ever had. It could have been the cashews added to the burger, but it was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It made you feel good about eating it. The avocado, lettuce and tomatoes were fresh and hit the spot. The crispy tofu was delicious too. I want to try the jicama fries next time! 

Definitely a spot to go to again!
So much grease in this burrito ,the grease is dripping from it , this is the second time I come here smh never again ,

I saw this on my way into Zabbas last week and mentally bookmarked this place.  I am always down to try a new place that is supposedly healthy.   Wow, was I surprised.  In the first 48 hours I had eaten here for lunch, dinner and lunch again!

Walking into the place was a little daunting.  This place was so busy that there was literally a line out the door.  All the tables were filled and we were worried we'd have nowhere to sit.  This place is very hectic loud like a high school cafeteria!   The floors are nicely tiled, the tables are high end wood, as are the chairs.  There are booths along a window that, if one can grab, are pretty comfortable to sit at.

The menu consists of Breakfast items (until 11am), Soups, Salads, Pizzas, BURGERS and Wraps/Sandwiches.  Calorie Counts are next to their popular items!  To drink, there is your standard coke fountain with a dedicated dispenser for WATER.  :)

The place is very busy, but still manages to be clean.  There are no trashcans in sight, you just leave your table and the staff quickly cleans up after you.

The first time out I ordered the Ostrich Burger with Swiss Cheese and Tofu Fries.  Despite the cost of being over $15 for my order, it was delicious and I felt it was well worth it.  The burger was a tiny bit dry, but delicious nonetheless.  Burgers come with the standard lettuce, tomato and onion.  The tofu fries were unique.  I wasn't impressed at first but I later realized it was because the fries weren't cooked all the way and it was still squishy in the middle.  This meal I would rate a 8 out of 10.

Later that night I came back again and the place seemed to be less busy.  This time I ordered the Turkey Wrap with bacon and a spinach tortilla and Jicama fries (it's like eating a raw apple sliced up like fries).  Absolutely DELICIOUS!  I loved it - I was very impressed.

On to my next meal here at lunch:  This time I ordered the Bison Burger Swiss cheese, medium rare with Jicama Fries.  The burger was just the right amount of juicy absolutely incredible.   Where else can you eat a burger like this guilt free?  I also ordered a Green Leaf Berry Blast shake with almond milk.  It was very good and satisfied my cravings for fresh fruit.

Be warned, however.  Buying a shake with one of their meals is like eating two meals in one.  I was completely stuffed by the end of my visit.

Today for lunch I ordered the Turkey Burger with Swiss and half Jicama fries, half tofu fries.  To drink I got the Apple Pie Smoothie with Almond milk.  I was impressed with the burger.  Very juicy and tasty.  The Jicama fries are spot on.  Just like eating an apple again and served raw with paprika.  The Tofu fries this time however was even better than I remembered.  This is because they were actually cooked all the way through.  If I can get tofu fries prepared like this again, I think Jicama is in trouble!  On the other hand, the Apple Pie Smoothie left more to be desired. I am not a fan of this.

I am sure to visit again to try the Bison Wrap with Spinach tortilla.  My friends have all been getting it, but before I settle into my "norm" i wanted to try as much as possible here.  If my norm is the bison wrap, so be it. :) 

This place has definitely earned a solid top entry for my work lunch rotation.

I am only giving four stars for a simple reason: the guy that took my order at the register the past two times doesn't seem very friendly at all. Not a smile; not even a forced smile - it's like I'm bothering him when ordered.  On top of that, I don't EVER get a receipt from him or even offered a water cup.  The other guy, who appears to be either a manager or owner is very friendly and helpful.

Other suggestions to the owners if you are reading: You need more tables and seating - It appears the suite next to you is empty, consider expanding. :)
The Wellness Juice is by far the best and biggest size green juice I have had. The menu has something for everyone, carnevors to vegans.

This location is extremely inconsistent (wrong side, no dressing or sauce on multiple ocassions and sometimes the salmon is raw and sometimes it's jerky) and the girls at the register are snotty. The last 3 times I have ordered to go, my food isn't ready when I get here  (20mins as stated on phone), I pay and sit and wait on my food. I see the cook bring my food out, tell them the name on the order and they let it sit on the counter. They are too busy conversing amongst themselves to do their job. Then when I go to the counter and tell them it's been sitting, they try and make lame excuses. I watched the whole thing play out. I can not stand poor customer service. I'm done with the Rainbow location.
The options are so good. I loved my green shake and my burger. Eating with out feeling guilty and doing my body good. What more can anyone say ?
Quick, healthy and delicious option in Vegas!! Love this place for paleo eating.  They even have bison burgers!  I'm hooked.

I really just love this place. The best part is my 9 year old daughter loves the place as well. Their egg whites out beat my made at home egg whites and the juices are AMAZING - the agave:) greens and proteins is always a fun stop after a work out with the girls:) I also love that their loyalty card is one my phone apps so I don't have to worry about losing and searching for a card in my clutter wherever it may be!

Meh.

The food was just ok. Salmon was fishy and dry. Quinoa was bland. Not worth the price and not nearly as good as some of the new fancy fast salad places popping up. 

The staff was friendly, though.
I eat here at aminimum once per week. The food is good and healthy.  I will continue to eat here
Terrible service. My husband waited for +20 minutes for 2 smoothies while another lady after my husband ordered received hers.

The service at the N. Decatur store was unbelievably slow!  There were four in our group.  Two meals were delivered after 10 minutes, one meal after 20 minutes, and the final meal almost 30 minutes from when we placed our order.  None of the orders were special orders and many people who ordered after us got their food quickly and before us.  We will NOT support this business inthe future and will share our experience with our friends and family.  Neither of the girls behind the counter seemed to be bothered that the service was slow.

There are so many great things about Thai place where do I begin. The the Thai ginger soup is the best things about coming here. Have it with whatever you get as a first course. The salads are always made to order so they are never droopy. I eat the kale salad and add shrimp. My husband gets Chicken pizza or bison burger always satisfies him. Your fresh choices are endless this is a gem of a place!

We have been to another store. But could not drive there because we did not rent a car. We showed up well before closing and they had sent everyone home except two people and turned off the grills. Uber ride waste. Disappointed to say the least. Door says open till 5 it was only 215.

This place has roaches and I have the pictures to prove it
I've come to this location for a very long time and I like the food but lately I've seen roaches and I am no longer coming back to this location, the service is horrible also, never coming back
One of the best and most creative "healthy" places to grab a casual bite in town. The servers are always friendly and the menu has TONS of options.
Awesome selection but the ketchup has high fructose corn  syrup...for the price, I expect more.  Still would highly recommend trying this place out!
Chicken breast, sweet potato, avocado after a workout.. Boom. Food is terrific as well. Get a good fresh meal for 10-15 bucks. Definitely going to be eating here too often...

Every time I come here I get great service & pay great prices. They always give me suggestions due to my cravings & they always hit it spot on! The place is always packed with people... they are definitely doing something right. I will continue to come back and be a loyal Greens & Proteins customer.

This place is perfect for anyone on a low carb (or healthy carb) diet. Not only did I enjoy my meal, everything everybody else was eating seemed appealing. 
Can't wait for this model to grow so we can have something like Greens and Proteins in Reno.

Appropriately named, Greens and Proteins cooks up some of the best tasting healthy dining options I've had in a while. 

Decided to stop by after hitting the gym and was not disappointed at the quality of the wood. G&P puts a healthy spin on a lot of popular dishes: burgers (available in beef, ostrich, turkey or veggie), pizzas, sandwiches, salads and a huge assortment of smoothies and health drinks. The food is delicious, the BBQ chicken or Greek pizzas are a sizable portion yet unbelievably low in calories. G&P is one of the few places nearby to get fresh squeezed juices, and their parfaits are awesome.

The downside is that Greens is a bit overpriced. During my last trip I opted to get a chicken Teriyaki wrap and at $11 I thought it was very overpriced. I guess this what you can charge for healthy food when you are right across the street for a LVAC. Staff and service is fine for an eatery of this size. Greens and Proteins is definitely worth checking out as one of the few clean eating spots in town.

Coming here on a Friday night, it was quite; however, for some reason, the service was really slow. I ordered a veggie burger with tofu fries and we had to wait about 20 minutes . The food was delicious so I guess it was worth the wait.

A "healthy" spot, conveniently located nearby an LVAC on the 215 and Flamingo, it provides a great place to go get some post work out food. They provide a great variety of what would be considered health foods and healthy shakes. Something I would recommend is their bison cheesesteak. It would be a favorite among anyone that tries it, and a favorite among customers. You can make your own meal, so you can try many different combinations of food and try things here that you wouldn't have otherwise. The only downside to m is the pricetag, it can be a little pricy, but this hits a specific niche of people that will spend the money to eat at a place like this. You may not enjoy the price, but you definitely will enjoy the food!

Herbivore Score = 2 stars
Carnivore Score = 4 stars
Overall Score = 3 stars

Herbivore Review
Herby ordered a build-your-own plate with marinated tofu, quinoa and edamame. As a vegan, Herby asked about vegan sauces, the employee at the register didn't seem super confident but perfectly friendly. Tofu was a bit mushy and had no marinated flavor. Quinoa was really watery like it hadn't been properly strained. Edamame was good. The portion size looked small on the plate, but was actually filling. Cost was $10, wouldn't order again.

Carnivore Review
Carno ordered the bison cheesesteak in a cabbage wrap with tofu fries with water cup. The meat was really tasty and well flavored. Everything was really fresh and clean-tasting. At a lot of restaurants like this, there are issues with portion size, but this place has great portion size (3 handfuls worth of food) and macro cost. Definitely recommend a fork since it will fall apart as you eat (like all leaf wraps do). Cost was $11-12, would order again.

Overall
Food was ready in less than 10 minutes and total cost was about $25 with tax. The number of vegan options is above 5, so high enough for Herby to return. Carno enjoyed the food, it's definitely a good place to go if you want to feel full without killing your ratios for the day.

Have eaten here many times and at 2 other locations couple of times. Have never been disappointed with any dish, but I do have my favorites. Harvest Kale salad is my "go to" lunch choice, even though Kale is usually described as "hard to stomach" by most - this is not the case, this salad is absolutely delicious. My hubby usually gets the bison burger with tofu fries - and it's finger-licking good!! 
Place always looks spotless, which is very important. the staff is always very courteous and helpful - seems they enjoy working there, that says a lot to me too :)
Yum and yum. A haven in strip mall hell. I had mixed plate and it was so flavorful and healthy.

Just stopped in here because I like the named Greens and Protiens HEALTHY KITCHEN AND JUICD BAR even on BEAT THE IRISH week.  The menu is extensive selection of healthy choices.  My favorite is all the calorie intake information for transparency on what it is you are actually eating.  I would come back again this place is tasty indeed.

I didn't eat at this establishment but I did stop in.....check out the menu....and talk to the staff about their VEGAN options. It goes without saying they have all the usual healthy items and the prices didn't seem to bad. This particular location is right down the street from my timeshare property so I just wanted to let all my VEGAN followers they do have a healthy option in Spring Valley if they are looking for one. The establishment is very clean.....staff is friendly.....location is easy to find....and I think there is plenty on the menu for both Vegetarians and VEGANS alike.

Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

When I'm in this neck of the Summerlin woods, this is definitely my go-to in a pinch. 

The service is speedy, and the food is delish. 

Nothing fancy, but there are lots of healthy, cheap options. I had the bacon and eggs (so paleo), and the portions were pretty big. My friend had the protein pancakes. She couldn't finish them. I had a bite, and so yummy!

I really wanted to like this place.  I love to eat healthy food.  The Green Ginger Limeade was very good - no complaints about the taste, just the price.  $5.99 for a drink is too much for me.  Then I ordered the Turkey Burger wrapped in lettuce.  The presentation was nice, but it tasted terrible.  The meat was either under cooked or just had a nasty gamey taste. I tried to cover up the flavor of the meat with ketsup and mustard.  My total bill was $17.27.  Too expensive to eat food that tastes bad.

I always go to Greens and Proteins but this is my first time at this location. First there were no clean silverware. I ordered the Egg White scramble with turkey sausage. The presentation was wack and the sausage was not fully cooked it was ice cold on the inside. I let the manager or cook know and he gave me a free lunch on him on my next visit due to the inconvenience. I was cool with that.
Great place to grab lunch, dinner or a smoothie and the owner Greg is a great guy aswell. Love to come in and have some bison or a chicken teriyaki bowl.

I love the green shake from here and I also love that bison burger! Prices are a little high but it's worth it. Food is money here! Nothing special about the atmosphere. It could be something more if they added a little bit more of a home feel instead of fast food. Could be a very successful restaurant instead of a pit stop in between going home and the gym.

Listen up! If you want healthy, tasty and affordable - then here's a run down of a few routine healthy favorites from the menu which I rely on: chicken tacos (3 hearty tacos for only 410cals), wellness drink (more like a green smoothie packed with nutrients and fills you up), the build-your-own (bison burger patty or the grilled salmon)!

I have been craving a turkey burger for like the passed two weeks. So used my yelp search to find me a turkey burger. So I decided to try greens & proteins! I will say it's very cute and clean, it wasn't too busy and they make your food to order and they are very friendly. My burger was delicious my only thing is that I wish they had more flavor...seasoning salt. I also liked the soda...stubborn soda...the best! Will go again love that it's so close to my house too.

I  love this place! The staff is very friendly with helping you decide what u want to eat. It was my first time here and this place will be a routine stop for me. I ordered the salmon with fresh broccoli and sweet potato mash. I was very happy with what came out of the kitchen. Then salmon was prepared perfectly. Again this place is fast, healthy, and reasonably priced!

First time to Greens and Proteins after wanting to go for like forever and it exceeded my expectations!! I got the wellness juice, which was refreshing and great, and then blueberry cream cheese crepes that were just so amazing and delicious!! Can't wait to go back and try something else!! Staff was super friendly and helped me pick my meal, which I really appreciated!

Love the extensive healthy menu.  The frittata, egg wrap and multigrain pancakes were outstanding.  Couple of disappointments: stevia is put in EVERY juice and smoothie.  The whole point of juices is to NOT have added sweeteners.  And the other thing was agave served with pancakes instead of real maple syrup.  Had to pay $4 for a little plastic condiment size container of maple syrup.  Service was indifferent and unfriendly on first visit.  Cheerful and accommodating the next.  Will be back for the healthy food choices.

Healthy as you want it. You can go a healthy ahi tuna taco or a big fat burger even vegetarian if that's your thing. Sometimes I like to eat a vegetarian meal I am a carnivore and a herbivore. Lol  It's a fresh and yummy change to get fast food that's not going to make you sluggish for the rest of the day. Also the smoothies are some of the best in Las Vegas. It's downtown so parking is tricky for most. I ride my bike there so not for me there is a bike rack right outside. Definitely one of my favorite lunchtime spots.

As my first venture out after being diagnosed celiac I was not disappointed with their gluten free items! Walking into Greens & Protiens has a very homelike clean feel. It almost seems like it should be in Southern California. They have a large assortment of healthy items on their menu such as shakes, salads, pizzas and sandwiches. I decided to try the green leaf berry blast shake (carrots, kale, berries, spinach, soy milk, agave nectar, and vanilla extract) I've been every day for the past 5 days since for this shake its so delicious! I also tried the Greek pizza on gluten free crust.. YUM! Hummus, cucumbers, tomatoes, feta and kalamata olives. The crust is actually amazing too it's almost like a flatbread. I will be suggesting this place to everyone and I can't wait for their 2nd location on Flamingo and the 215 to open! See you all there :)

This is one of my favorite local hangouts. It has an informal, upbeat atmosphere, and healthy, delicious food. All the salads are great, but the wraps and burgers are excellent, too. My kids love the buffalo burgers. I am a fan of the smoothies, which have lots of greens that do not overwhelm the taste. If you go for lunch, it is best to get there early during the week as it gets pretty busy. At the weekend, it's a great choice for brunch or evening meal and not too crowded. There is outside seating available, too.

Love the food here. Also the smoothies. Nice workers. It's easy to get to and they are fast. I really love the decor, it's bright and happy. We got the green shake and the choc peanut butter banana, both amazing.
Love this place.  I come here after a work out at Vegas hot.  My favorite is the chicken salad yummy

I had their buffalo chicken wrap on a spinach wrap for $10.99. They were generous with their buffalo sauce but it wasn't overwhelming. The blue cheese was so good. They put chunks--not small chunks but a good size chunk--of blue cheese. The wrap was really good.

I got the meal with tofu fries. The fries were pretty chunky and had flavor but not really a fan of tofu anyway. 

The service was good. A quick in and out. Would come back again to try other things on the menu.

Love this place! I'm glad they opened up a spot closer to where I live. Usually I'd have to drive to the one on eastern and it's always busy. At least here it's not too crazy yet. I usually just get the turkey burger with jicama fries . Soooo tasty and my husband loves the bbq chicken pizza. The staff is always on point with their customer service. Definitely recommend this place!

Extremely impressed. I haven't been here in about 8 months, but the quality of food has grown exponentially. I got the seasonal chopped salad, it was absolutely perfect. The portion was perfect and it was clean. Absolutely worth it
So stoked it's finally opened! Had an amazing first experience. Everyone was really nice, place was clean and food was bomb

For the enthusiast that is big on nutrition but short on flavor. 

It was a nice atmosphere initially in coming into the restaurant. The menu was very self explanatory but was not very unique.  

I got the Turkey Club and my husband got the Bison Wrap. There wasn't a lot of flavoring either of the dishes unfortunately. On a positive note the sweet potato fries were good. 

We wanted to give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt and try their smoothies. We got the chocolate peanut butter and banana with additional disappointment. We were so let down with all the good comments about this place. Not expecting to ever go again but it was a nice experience.

I've been here numerous times.  For a occasional bite to eat I have no problems.  I was eating some of the build your owns. I decided to see how many calories it actually was......   You give a cup of brown rice.  Your menu states that it is 159 calories. It should be about 200.  Read a box of brown rice.  Chicken breast I weighed it at 5-6 oz cooked. Which is 6-8 raw.  That should be about 340 calories. 40-50 calories uncooked per ounce not 272.

This very inconspicuous restaurant is tucked away in the corner by Del Taco. I have lived in North Vegas for going on three years and have been curious about it but not enough to try it. Boy, have I been missing out. 

Finally ordered take out and I must say I was impressed with the quality of the food and taste. The satay Thai chicken had humongous cuts of tender chicken in not-too-sweet peanut sauce. There were tons of cucumbers that were strung like an accordian. Wasn't sure if I was supposed to pull the cucumbers apart or they should have been cut up. The deliciousness of this dish is a fast favorite. Super-huge portions of chicken deliciousness.

The margerita pizza was a bit bland-I would have preferred more basil but it was still good. The acai smoothie was very good and not too sweet. I definitely would like to dine in and see what that was like.

 One star taken off due to the fact that I wasn't thanked when picking up my food. And people wonder why fast food joints are going to computerized kiosks. Sorry to be harsh but at least a thank-you would have been written on the screen. If you don't like to be hospitable, get out of that line of work because a business owner depends on that congeniality.
Great protein pancakes and french toast! Nice small breakfast place with tons of healthy options

One of our favorite places! Their pizzas are great and their wraps are very good too. My favorite is the California Chicken wrap, it comes with a side of tofu fries and you'd never guess it was tofu. They're crispy and well seasoned. My favorite drink is the green smoothie, it's refreshing and you can barely taste the greens. Check this place out, their menu is healthy and the prices aren't too bad.

I finally tried the ostrich burger, and it is excellent!  I had an apple pie smoothie with it and that was very good. I've had a few of the other shakes here as well, and they are all good, but  none of them 'wow' me.  Then again, I'm really not much of a shake person.  Oh, and the tofu fries are very tasty. Same cannot be said for the jicama fries. 

It is a pricey dining experience.  My ostrich and apple pie smoothie cost me $24.31.  That meal was definitely worth the experience, but I wouldn't pay that much to experience it again.  This place is a rare visit for me.

I like that most of the menu items have the calories listed. Calories for tofu fries vs. jicama "fries" were not listed, but the helpful person at the counter was able to tell me. Nice, helpful employees. I got an extra lean angus beef burger, and it was delicious. I always enjoy having a healthier option. Certainly not cheap though.

This place may be a bit pricier than your average, run of the mill corporate fast food joint but be aware that this is no ordinary establishment and that the extra dollars are well worth it. The quality of the ingredients really speaks for itself and the healthiness, which may be a major selling point for some, was really just a bonus for me. 

I opted to try the bison cheese steak on a wheat bun, which seems to be a popular option. It came with a side of "fries" and I chose the Jica, having never heard of them before. The girl at the register was friendly and willing to explain the various menu items. Much of the menu is vegan or vegetarian but not all of it-- it offers plenty of options for the carnivores so don't let that deter you from visiting.

The food was pretty impressive. The bun was hearty and filling, and the the actual bison meat was just as tasty as any beef I've ever had in a philly cheese steak. The sandwich itself is filling enough but does come with the fries. I probably will try the tofu fries next time because the jica "fries" were really just raw sliced vegetables that provided the optical illusion of fries but tasted nothing like them. The chef who started this place has a great philosophy about making food that is both healthy and delicious and I daresay he has executed it perfectly.

I will definitely be coming back here and hope to try some of the smoothies as well as the wide assortment of salads and sauces.
this place is a little pricey, but everything is healthy and fresh. cant go wrong with the Wellness Drink as a post workout!

Awesome place to have in the north!!  We ordered the steak salad and ostrich Burger .  There steak salad Jade candied walnuts and blue cheese along with an onion vinaigrette.  The Burger came with a side of choice.  We will detonator come back!! Marc was very helpful and have is a sampler of the wellness drink.  Delicious!

Came here after a reflexology session and I feel like my relaxation was extended! Had a smoothie and the grilled buffalo chicken strips. They were amazing. The smoothie was delicious! All of their food is healthy and from what I can tell, tasty! Will definitely be trying this place again! Thank you for bringing a clean "fast" food establishment to Vegas!

Love this restaurant for all those health choices!! I mean everything is good too. The staff is super courteous and helpful. This is the place I go for great tasting healthy foods of all types. And has awesome smoothies too!! Everything is made right on the spot and that doesn't take too long either!! I could eat here everyday  :)

There are so many reasons to love Greens and Proteins! 1st, I am gluten intolerant and it limits my choices when I dine out. The menu offers so many choices and combinations that it is refreshing not to beg for menu accommodations. 2nd, I am calorie conscious so I like that there were so many excellent healthy options that were appealing. 3rd The menu covers selections from raw to meat therefore everyone is happy, and no one compromises. 4th The prices are great, you can keep it low and not have to eat a side salad. 5th I saw the cucumber lemon water and found out that was free! 6th, I loved my choice! I decided to have the frittata with turkey and fontina cheese and it was delicious. It was served with a salad with watermelon. The portion was generous and  I cant wait to return again. 7th I was so happy to have a reuseable plastic plate and silverware which is nice not to eat off of paper etc...

As far  as ambiance, it is all open air, it is very casual. There are  flat scrrenTV's with a variety of shows.  We enjoyed sitting outside, there is a parking lot  so keep in mind it is casual

My friend and I dropped into Greens and Proteins for a post-work out second breakfast of a "healthier" fare. 

The Southwest Tofu & Chorizo Burrito caught my eye; the idea sounded interesting, and so did its description: scrambled tofu and soy chorizo, tomatoes, cilantro, and Anaheim chilies, wrapped in a spinach tortilla. A side of tofu home fries originally comes with this, but you can replace that with another side listed on their menu. Also, you can choose to sub the tortilla with lettuce. With that being said, the burrito only looks good on paper. In this case, I would've preferred actual meat than the tofu because of the spices and ingredients. 

One cool thing to mention about this place is that the calories for each of the menu items -- excluding breakfast -- are listed. Prices for foods seem reasonable, much more reasonable than other "healthy" eateries by my gym. They do make smoothies and juices here, but I think $7.50 for a smoothie is too much, even with a Yelp check-in for $1.00 off.
Perfect post gym meals. Ostrich burger and a Wellness with extra ginger FTW.
Really liked the Vegas Pizza. I guess for Vegas its a pretty good Vegan/Healthy rest.

The concept excited me. Healthier, lower calorie vegan//vegetarian options served alongside healthier, lower calorie meaty options - a place I could go with my meat-eater friends and not feel jipped. 

The above concept is really all that was exciting for me at Greens and Protein. Unfortunately, the food was rather bland. 

I ordered the plate with tofu (protein), asparagus (green) and quinoa. The quinoa tasted literally like quinoa. No seasoning, nothing. Likewise, the asparagus failed to incite even a slight quiver in my taste buds. The tofu was passable - but I'll eat tofu made any way. 

My husband ordered the raw mock chicken lettuce cups. I actually found this dish offensive and puny in serving size. But my husband liked it. 

One of my friends ordered the bison burger which he relished and the other one, a similar plate like mine but with a grilled portobello mushroom instead of quinoa. The mushroom was actually very good. 

We shared the tofu fries - quite good but I really wish they weren't fried. What's the point of a healthy meal? 

The drinks were ridiculously priced so I refused to have any. 

All in all...nice concept, progressive for Vegas and a place you could hang if you were on a strict caloric diet. But being satisfied with your meal...that's another story.

Wasn't a super big fan of the Acai sorbet in my Acai bowl. I don't understand why places don't blend the Acai fresh and mix it with some fruit and juice or hemp milk or whatever. Just seems super lazy to me and it's not as good. There are better spots in Las Vegas I would rather spend time driving too.
