I  love the place-so yes, I  gave them 4 chances! ! 

It's still one my favorite places, just not the bison.

So I LOVE the food here but the tall black guy with a goatee who works there is so damn RUDE! We just left there and probably won't be back again because this is the THIRD time we've come in and he has the worst attitude. We spend 140.00 and he got pissy when I asked where the rest of my order was. His EXACT words "It is obviously on the way if you don't see it in front of you " Terrible customer service!!!

This place is amazing! 

The food is super tasty, lean and healthy. I love that it shows how many calories are in each food. 

Price is reasonable.

It's great they offer healthy options and they are right next to my gym. They definitely need to work on their customer service skills. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but being located directly next to my gym i frequently visit. 

My recommendation: BBQ chicken pizza. And amazing 320 calories!

I heard about this place on Groupon and decided to check their menu out online.  I noticed they have bison burger and since I've been dying to try it, I thought this would be a perfect opportunity.   I was not disappointed!  Their bison burger is so juicy, like literally dripping out.  It could use a tad more salt, but other than that I love it.  I've been here several times and this is all I ever get.  The service is fast and always made to order.  It smells great there too. Very clean and fresh.

The location I go to is near my job and they share a parking lot in a business plaza with several other restaurants and a Starbucks.  It can be pretty congested during lunch time, but when you have bison on your mind none of that even matters.  Love this place!

Seriously delicious! I stop by here every time I visit town (aka every other week). Simple and healthy and the staff is SO nice. Gloria is super sweet and helpful always! If you're looking for really healthy options - this is your place!!!

I'm always looking for healthy food options that provide a great variety of options. Greens and Proteins have a lot of different nutritious options to choose from. I had the chicken tacos and the watermelon strawberry juice. The food itself wasnt that exciting due to it lacking flavor however the juice was refreshing even though I thought it would be a bit sweeter. Their service was great, and they were patient considering it was my first time eating there. I would try it again, but I'll choose something different next time.

TOFU FRIES!! I like it here. Ok, it is pricey here but it definitely is quality. I normally get one of the many pizza options. I do like the Greek pizza mostly. You have the option to have your pizza crust as low cal lavash, gluten free crust or pita. Also you can have vegan cheese (nope, I will never order vegan cheese). Definitely the favorite menu item is the tofu fries. Crisp and well seasoned. I had the turkey burger with tofu fries last time I was here and it was sheer perfection. The smoothies are yummy and jam packed with nutrients. Also they have wifi which was helpful when I used to have to study. Definitely a good place to go and not feel guilty afterwards and still feel as if you had a filling meal!

During my bike ride Sunday, I stopped at Greens and Proteins for breakfast.  Who would have thought that healthy food would taste as good as this did?  I was surprised.

The place was almost empty and after ordering my Greek Scramble and coffee, I took a seat at a table under the section near the entrance that has a roof overhead.  The young lady who took my order, gave me a post with a number so she'd know where the food was to be delivered.  She soon brought my coffee which was very hot and enjoyable.

The Greek scramble consisted of scrambled egg whites with feta cheese, kalamata olives, basil, green peppers, onions, and was accompanied by tofu home fries.  Their information lists this at 309 calories.  I wasn't concerned so much about that as I was taste.

The taste was quite good.  The olives brought out the flavor of the feta and the tofu home fries were a treat.  There were some pieces of toasted pita to accompany the scramble.

I will stop in again and try something else.  The price was very reasonable and the patio dining was perfect before the hot days set in.

One note for those who ride a bicycle--few I know--there is a garbage can on the east side of the building and you can lock your bike to that with your cable.

YUMMMY! I got the bison cheese steak wrap and my friend had the California chicken wrap , we split them both ! Quick and fast after the gym. Food was fresh as well. The bison was a little salty but it could of been the chef hehhe !
I love this place! The portions are great and the food is cooked well! I love the green limeade drink!!!

Visited this place for the first time today. The girl at the cash register was not helpful at helping us decide what to order and I actually felt very rushed and u welcomed by her. I purchased a groupon to use toward two breakfast items. I accidentally ordered the banana protein pancakes along with a Greek pizza. The girl got really annoyed when I presented her the groupon and told me it was only valid for two breakfast items, which the Greek pizza was not. She recommended the acai fruit bowl which I had no choice but to accept since I did not want to inconvenience her any further. I'll give this place a 4 star review because  the food was really delicious being that it's a lot healthier than I'm used to and the young waiter who brought out our food made up for the cashiers lack of customer service. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking to change your diet but are afraid of trying foods a little out of your comfort zone. They have a variety of items to satisfy your cravings for breakfast lunch or dinner. However, the prices are definitely high enough to scare you away but I think it's worth the visit every now and then.

Perfect menu and setting for my favorite healthy dining spot in Las Vegas! Delicious low calorie options. The pizzas with lavash crust and burgers are my favorites.

Always friendly staff!

Highly recommend.
This was our first visit and it was fantastic. I have food allergies and eating out is not very easy and can be a pain. They made it simple and we will be back
Best healthy food on this side of Las Vegas!! The bison wrap & sweet potato fries are awesome! Definitely will be back for more!!!
I love the Bison wrap.  The jicama fries are okay; I like mine with a little honey or barbeque sauce.

It took over 30 minutes for my food to be ready and my sweet potato fries were cold.  They also added a tomato that I didn't ask for because I'm allergic.  Quality of service has been dropping off at this location recently.  I can't wait for the nearby Sprouts to open.

This healthy place is located in one of my favorite intersections in Las Vegas, 215 & Eastern!  I came here again after a workout session at the LVAC less than 100 yards away and it was busy as usual.  I'm glad the drink making station is immediately to the left when you walk in because they can make your drink while you wait in line.  I ordered the Wellness again, it's my personal favorite but you can't really go wrong with any of the drinks they have here.  

Protip!:  A Yelp check in on your smart phone gives you $1 off towards a smoothie!  Every bit helps since the prices are high, but if you're a health nut then you'll know eating healthy is costly regardless.

For my protien I wanted the Ostrich but they were out of it this time so I settled for the Bison Burger without cheese.  They're both really good burgers and trying to find real Ostrich or Bison meat is difficult in Las Vegas, much less already prepared and ready to eat.  The tofu fries is really unique and good too!

This place is really cute.  Bright fresh colors, and bright fresh food.  There are nice gurgling waterfalls cascading down the back walls; however, they are unfortunately masked by the football blaring on the t.v.s?!

Regardless, I had a smoothie.  My smoothie was a whopping $8.00!  I understand the price because it had everything and the kitchen sink blended into it: squash, kale, avocado, berries, almond milk and so on.  You would definitely want to consider these smoothies a meal replacement.  That said, it was extremely tasty.  Just be ready to pay!

Everyone I dined with was pleased with their food.  They said it was flavorful and fresh.  

A good place for a light lunch or a post workout refresher.

I'm pushing it with the 3 Stars, but my husband liked his food so I'll be kind. This is the 2nd time we come here and both times I've been underwhelmed and disappointed with my food. The first time I ordered a grilled chicken teriyaki wrap and the chicken was practically burnt and there was no teriyaki sauce. I had to ask for extra to put it on myself. This time I ordered the summer berry salad with chicken and it was drowning in dressing and had like 5 berries with undercooked chewy chicken. My fountain drink was good though. This place is overrated BIG TIME.!!
Food was good I love ahi taco yummy and the drink ! Near to the house ! If you are looking for healthy food ! I definitely coming back:)

Yay for having healthier food options on this side of town!! I loved my steak salad I had today. When the lady told me $15 for my salad I was like ehh.. But my portion was huge! I got to take leftovers home. I think the portions of your meal will equal out to what you pay because the price is a little more expensive.. But you're paying for quality, and the quality is great! Super yummy, I'll be back
The Frittata is wonderful. Very hearty. Not much I can say about them other then they are very good, tasty and not necessarily for breakfast!

This place is within walking distance so I've been here a few times. Today was the last time. Ah where to start..

Called ahead to pick up. Was on hold for 15 min. Called back and someone answered. Yes, they forgot about me...okay. No biggie. I go pick up (place is empty) and food is not ready yet. Okay. No biggie, I'll wait. I pay, wait 10-15 min. The same person who rings me up finishes ringing up the two other people who arrive then asks me how she can help me. I tell her I already paid and I'm still waiting for my pick up order? She grabs it and gives it to me. Oh...it's been ready the whole time? Awesome. It's cold. 

But what really got me wasn't the horrible service... as I waited for food I noticed the cashier (who says she is new) use gloves to ring people up AND touch food. Why are you wearing gloves? Pretty sure the gloves aren't there to keep her hands clean....pretty sure it's so that the food isn't contaminated! No thanks. I'll spend $12 on chicken somewhere else.

The name of this place alone makes me think wheat grass and vegetarian menus, which for me is a turn off because I am a meat and potatoes type guy.  My wife and eye kept seeing excellent reviews for this place, and the place being advertised all over the place.  Two weeks ago my wife and I were looking for a new place to try, and  she brought up this place.  I thought I would give it a shot, event though I expected it to be a tofu and salad type place.  When we walked into the restaurant I was met with surprise...

This place is not that just a vegetarian place.  They have a rather large menu with a mix of meat, fruits and vegetables.  They have everything from your staple foods such as chicken and beef, to exotic foods like bison and ostrich.  My wife had the bison lettuce burger which was very flavorful. My favorite aspect of this restaurant is the custom meal which allows you to pick from a number of meats ranging from poultry to fish to beef.  The meal also allows you to pick a vegetable, which there are several to choose from, a grain (also several choices), and a sauce of your choice.  I got the chicken with mixed greens, quinoa, and balsamic dressing.  Everything about the meal was excellent.  It was so good that my wife and I have eaten there 4 more times in the past two weeks.  It has become one of our favorite places to eat now.  We have also tried their smoothies with are very good as well.

The decor in this place is very cool, and their are a lot of outlets for electronic devices, which makes this place a great place to study or just go to get work done.  I have also found this a good place for many who go to LVAC to go an hang out and get a good, healthy meal.  I do agree with some of the reviews that this place should have more "eco friendly" materials, and the price is somewhat steep for meals.  This will not deter me from going here again.

I've been trying to figure out a factor that I consider when reviewing places and finally remembered: approachable. 

I'm a foodie so in turn I'm also a fatty. Not to say all foodies are, but I am.

I've wanted to try one of these health driven food places and decided on Greens & Proteins and the staff definitely made my visit. They were taking dine in orders when they were closing in 10 minutes. That's awesome. Disclaimer: I wasn't the jerk coming in 10 minutes before closing: I was leaving.

I tried their famous tofu fries with special dipping sauce and a bowl of turkey chili that night.

The first thing that popped in my head was how big the portions were. $5 for 12 tofu fries and $5-$7 for a giant bowl of chili. I took my leftover soup home and it legit filled the take out cup. The chili was the perfect balance of being unique, healthy, and tasty. After I was done I felt fine full but in a pleasant way as the soup wasn't loaded with sodium as most soups tend to be. 

With all that said this fatty felt like this place was approachable. They have a lot of similar items on their menus as other healthy casual dining places in the Vegas valley like wraps, juices, smoothies, and grilled chicken. They also have some stuff that someone who wasn't eating a healthy diet would find appealing.

The prices are affordable, really clean, friendly staff, plenty of seating- I dig it.

I'm tired of these snooty places charging a crap load of $ and can't even splash a smile when ordering or picking up. The smoothie was good but I won't return because I would rather give my money to a place that is welcoming and appreciates it's customers.
Good food ! Great location ! But what's on the menu is starting to look and taste a tad bit boring......

I want to like this place because they offer vegetarian and vegan options, and I want restaurants to offer more meatless meals.

That said, I recommend Greens and Proteins for the occasional smoothie or pizza.  The smoothies are rich, fresh and made right in front of you.  The pizzas are flavorful and the crust is crispy.

The salads are okay, but I always think "I could have made this at home."  Nothing special there.

The veggie burger is just blah.  Little flavor, strange texture (as others have mentioned), and unpleasantly sticky.  Even with cheese, I didn't find it to have a good taste -- I ended up slathering the veggie burger with mustard.

If you're going for a quick smoothie or a pizza, then Greens and Proteins is a good option.  However, I can't recommend anything else on the menu.

Finally!  A place that serves phenomenal meals without the guilt trip.  

Auditions are coming in close, so Ive been training and eating at home to further reach my goal.  But once a week I'll have a cheat meal and that's where Greens and Proteins comes in to play. 

I've only been here twice, and i have yet steered away from the Ginger Limeade Juice: Green Grapes, Spinach, Ginger, Lime, Agave Nectar, and blended with ice.  Sounds iffy, but trust me it is amazing.  

I tried the Teriyaki Grilled Chicken Wrap and the Bison Cheese Steak Wrap on two separate visit and they're both freakin' amazing. I love how the Teriyaki Sauce on their Wrap was not overly too sweet nor thick.  Perfect to my liking without the feeling of going over the edge since I'm sensitive to sugary taste.

The Bison Cheese Steak is probably my favorite Cheese Steak, ever!  The meat was juicy and loaded with big flavor.  Tossed with onions, red peppers, and low fat mozzarella cheese.  This one truly hit the spot and reset all my cravings for the week.

You choose Wheat or Spinach for the wrap, and also Tofu Fries or Spicy Jicama Slices for the sides.  The spice level of the Jicama is just enough to tickle your taste buds.  Great fillers.  Tofu Fries are lightly bread, baked, and served with their Russian Sauce (Low Fat Mayo, Ketchup, and Relish).

Only small gripe is that i wish the portion was just a tad bit smaller.  I have no self control when food is placed in front of me and usually end up finishing it all.   #firstworldproblems.

Service is impeccable and restaurant is super clean and spacious.  I can't wait to come back to try the rest of their menu.

Extra! Extra! Read All About It!

You're a wise man or woman, if you read some of the reviews of Greens and Proteins before trying them out.  You'll find a mix of "I've experienced better", "A-Ok", and "As good as it gets".  The most common issue...the sticker shock.  Yup, Greens and Proteins is on the Richie Rich side for what you get in quantity.  Smoothies over $10 (not lying), sandwiches over $12 (no five-dollar foot long here), and even their burgers are pricey starting around $10 (Where's the beef?).  I read the reviews and was armed with knowledge before I step foot in here. So, why the 5 Stars from me?   It comes to down to what I think Greens and Proteins was trying to accomplish, eating on the healthier side.  One thing about eating healthier, it sure cost more and I knew that coming in.  5 Stars because I expected less and got more.  

I came here for their Proteins, not the Greens, and decided on the "Build Your Own Custom Meal".  This is a 4 Step process, but I only chose Step 1, which was protein only.   You have a choice of Filet Mignon ($17), Bison ($13), Chicken ($10), Turkey ($9), Salmon ($13), and even my favorite lean meat Ostrich ($17).  I got the salmon and they knocked a few bucks off the price because I didn't get anything else with it.  The salmon is about 6 oz and to be honest, it was a little bland.  I solved this by adding a little Teriyaki sauce to it.  Voila! Problem solved. 

As for the restaurant and ambiance, it's just okay.  You get a mix of your Average Joes, Fitness Freaks, and New Year Resolutioners.  My favorite is the guy wearing a tank top, beanie, and sunglasses.  Guess this guy is just confused whether it's hot ,cold, or sunny inside.  Or, he's just too cool for the rest of us.  The wait is little longer than expected and since the restaurant is also small, it gets a little loud and crowded.

Overall, I am a fan and think Greens and Protein is as good as it gets.  If you're looking for something quick, cheap, and tasty, then Greens and Proteins may not be for you.  If you're looking for something clean, healthier, and don't mind spending a little more, then Greens and Proteins is perfect.

You'll get fresh healthy food, but expect to pay a price for it.

Stopped in for a quick healthy lunch, was greeted with friendly service and paid $35 for two to eat.  The green leaf berry smoothie was good, but the apple pie smoothie tasted watered down.  Next the Margherita Pizza (about 10" across / enough for 2 people to eat) was just like any other you can get and the Thai Chicken Peanut Satays sounded appealing.  They were supposed to be spicy, but were not at all; they were chicken skewers with some kind of creamy peanut sauce over them.  

Nice atmosphere - guilt free eating - just wish it was more affordable.

Wow...A new location and all reviews are 5 Stars.  Albeit only 3 reviews, this is a new location on the Westside (i.e. the best side, throwing up the W!!).  If you read my review of the Eastern location, I too gave them 5 stars.  However, it's easy to dismiss these posts as biased ones since there is so little reviews.  I had to investigate because that's what I do.   

I am a fan of Greens & Proteins and one complaint about them is price.  Most of the items on the menu are pricey and to be honest, don't have much taste either.  Keep in mind, G&P is healthy and that includes you to have an healthy wallet. I'm not a baller by any means, but will splurge when quality proteins is what my body needs.  I also use to have food delivered to my home via "Eat to Grow".  This was pricey too and taste is only for the desirable.  I made my biggest gains on these meals and G&P is no different. 

I've tried their Salmon and Ostrich Burgers in the past.  At this location, I opted to try their Turkey.  You get 8 oz of clean protein and less fat with their Turkey Burger.  This meal is also served with their Jicama fries.  The turkey was pretty good, but the fries is something that made it into the basura with the quickness. After Lent, I will definitely come back for their Filet Mignon.  

I gave the other location 5 stars, but had to drop this location to 4 stars.  This G&P is more spacious, but missing that ambiance that the Eastern location has. Great people watching at the Eastern location.  Because this location is new, the staff is also new.  Knowledge is power and a newbie staff can mean weakness.  When I order at places like this, I like to know how much the servings are like protein count, total ounces, etc.  The staff actually had to go to the back and ask.  They also didn't know if they served fat-free ranch.  I know, I'm just getting picky but these are the things most health driven restaurants would know.  I'm sure by the next visit, they'll be more prepared. Thus, I will probably up their rating back to 5 stars. 

Still a fan of Greens and Protein.  Don't be surprised if you see multiple check in's from me at this joint.  This is a new and more spacious location.  I'm sure within the next couple of months, the word will be out and the ambiance will mimic what the Eastern location provides.

Here's my not so long review on Greens & Protein

I gave up on Greens & Protein about year ago.  I had a back experience at one of the other locations and when this one opened up, I had another bad experience. I'm not going to go in detail to what happened because it's really a moo point (Yes, from Friends).  I gave G&P another try and sure glad I did.  There's a lot of options at G&P and the price is not too shabby.  A huge plus is the macro breakdown and most of their items are on myfitnesspal. 

My favorite is their BBQ Chicken Pizza, which is less than 500 calories and packed with over 30 grams of protein.  Other favorites include their bison and ostrich.  Bottom line, Greens & Protein has become a staple for my post workout needs.

Decided to stop in here after finishing my leg workout at LVAC. I usually hit Tropical Smoothie but had been meaning to stop by this place. I needed something to go so I figured I would try one of the smoothies; they all seemed tempting. I settled on the Green Smoothie. I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first taste. I have to say I'll be back and next time try some of the food.
Great healthy meal options and super friendly helpful employees. Everything I ordered (chicken, mushrooms & rice) were super tasty! I'll be back!

My friend and I ordered smoothies here after our spin class. We ended up getting the extra protein added into our drink, which racked up the original $7.50 smoothie to $10! Don't get me wrong, the smoothies were pretty good but call me cheap for not wanting to spend that much on a drink I can make at home. I'll probably come back and try their food because it seems to be getting a lot of love lol.

I ate the French toast which contained pecans which isn't mentioned in the online, on-screen (in store), or the paper menu. I had an allergic reaction to the pecans which I would have avoided had I known the allergen information. I didn't bother mentioning anything to employees since we needed to leave to deal with my reaction before it got worse. What kind of food provider doesn't list allergen information? 

Otherwise, the food tasted reasonably ok. We would have perhaps returned as we're trying to create healthier eating habits and also enjoy trying new things. The service was mediocre and the beverage selection was oddly limited. We obviously won't return due to the allergy issue.

This Greens&Proteins at Eastern is really great. Sweet potato fries come out just right - golden and not overdone. Pizza comes out perfect - not burnt.

I had a couple bad experiences at Flamingo/215 with burnt pizza and less than fresh avocado so that is why I am highlighting the fact that the kitchen at Eastern does a better job of food prep!

This is a great location for Greens&Proteins. Staff is super friendly and the kitchen does a good job of preparing the food just right. I am particularly happy about their efforts to offer vegan menu items. They are also very happy to accomodate substitutions.

I raised my rating to 3 stars because the owner wrote me a thoughtful apology.

That said, I will still avoid this Flamingo/215 Greens&Proteins location because the food quality and the consistency of food preparation is very disappointing. Rainbow/215 and Eastern/215 don't have the same issue. It's too bad because the outdoor patio at Flamingo is the nicest!

Love love love this place! I had ordered a Grilled Vegetable Wrap that came with amazing fresh daikon fries along with a Leafy Green Berry Blast Smoothie and my husband ordered a Vegan Burger along with Delicious Tofu Fries with a Wellness Drink Smoothie.  Everything we had ordered was so tastey.  So we went again the very next day and I had ordered the same thing and my husband ordered the Vegan Pizza and Carrot Juice.  The smoothies are seriously really healthy and so refreshing!  We are not Vegans but wanted to try something different and healthier.  The cafe is set up very nicely with TVs.  The place is next to the gym LVAC where you will see a lot of fit people coming to eat after the gym, also we saw people on their laptops as well.  I give it 4 stars because the prices are pretty expensive.

I'm on the HCG diet & dare not eat out & risk ruining my strict protocol, but I'd heard about this place & the HCG menu, so I had to try it.  It's in a cool area with lots of fitness/health type shops, and it was positively buzzing with the weekday lunch crowd; obviously a fave for the health conscious professionals.  The HCG menu is simple; choose a protein & a veggie, they do the rest.  No measuring or worrying about how to prepare while sticking to the diet plan, they have it all figured out for me.  I ordered mine to go, shrimp & asparagus; it took about 15 minutes, and a guy brought it to my table. I had to take a peek once I made it to the car; wow!  Jumbo shrimp & skinny asparagus, both tender & perfectly cooked, served in a reusable plastic container with a side of dijon mustard.  Delicious!  What a treat to get to have a meal out & know it's structured around my diet; LOVED IT!!

I've been coming here for years and multiple times a month. As a local I stop by Frequently to grab a healthy meal.  The last 3 times I've been underwhelmed with poor service but more importantly very slim potions and improper portions and presentations for their price points.  I'm not sure if management changed but it's not acceptable.  My bill is 12-50 dollars always and now I'll take my elsewhere.

I have been here twice and both times it was pretty good. I have had a banana peanut butter smoothie and a bison burger. Wasn't a fan of the tofu fries but hey I tried them :) good place to grab healthy food!

Love the chocolate peanut butter banana smoothie! I tried the buffalo chicken tenders today and was disappointed with how "zesty" it was. I would recommend less citrus as that was the only thing keeping me from enjoying the meal. I loved that it was under 450 calories as well as a nice presentation.

I made my own meal: grilled chicken, spaghetti squash and quinoa. I really liked that you could look at each item on the menu and see how many calories and grams of protein there were. I liked everything, though I could tell I was eating healthy food( bland). But when you are trying to eat clean and feel full. They did a very good job. (11.99$ for my meal)

This place is very close to where I live but I've never had a good meal here. Meals consisted of a very dry tortilla for my wrap, what was supposed to be a healthy tuna option, the mini ahi tostadas, but they were drenched in a sugary sticky dressing, and a couple other dishes that just weren't good. I mentioned my disappointment to another resident and they said they agreed, but another friend of mine says some stuff on the menu is great you just have to know what to order. I just had several bad meals so I switched to The Goodwich down the street for my nearby lunch fix, which is delicious! The juices and smoothies are good though.

I'm super disappointed with my experience with this business. I placed an online order using this app a few days ago when I visited Vegas. First of all, they called me and told me that the soup I ordered was not available due to a broken blender and politely offered a turkey chili, which seemed fine, until he said it would cost me an additional $2. No thank you, I kindly responded. He offered to deliver the parfaits I ordered and claimed he would give me a credit for the soup, which seemed great. Until I checked my bank account. At first, I figured maybe the double charge was accidentally, until it fully posted to my bank account. I contacted the bank and they claim they are both legitimate charges. So let me break it down for everyone- my first charge (soup included) was 23.58, the second was for 17.62. I literally was charged $41 for two little parfaits.

This is an edit/update since my review last week. It was a head over heals different experience. The food was excellent. The service was wonderful. Thank you for restoring my faith back In this establishment.  I will be back. I will tell friends to go. The roasted red pepper hummas is a new fave! I will be coming back for that. Next time I'm going to try the raw nachos. They sound delightful!!




So. Not. Impressed. For $20 bucks I don't  expect my food to be tossed in a bag and my drink to be forgotten about.

I don't know why this place got an average of four stars. I got the egg white omelet with turkey sausage and for the portion size and bland taste, it was definitely not worth ~$8. The only thing I liked was the little orange slice they put on the place. I could make better breakfast at home!

Ok my sister's oatmeal was tasty but it wasn't anything I couldn't recreate myself. 

The girls at the front were super nice but the food was a waste of moolah. If my dinky omelet was $3.99 maybe I wouldn't be so harsh.
Great juices and salads

Greens & Proteins is a great place to eat.  The food is delicious. Plenty of healthy choices and low calorie meals. You can get anything from a pizza to a smoothie. All the choices are pretty much low cal. The staff is pleasant young and professional. I came during rush hour and they got us in and out. The food was fresh and out fast.  

They are open from 7am to 10pm Monday- Sunday.  There is 4 locations near the 215 beltway. They have great deals on Groupon!

I remember my first visit at Greens & Protein on Eastern & Pebble and I gotta say it was the worst experience ever. Fortunately for me things have improved and I do realize that each location varies. 

I've been to this particular location twice now on a Saturday and Monday and I'm very pleased so far. I've been ordering their egg white scramble turkey breakfast and a green chia seed smoothie with added protein and I must say that it's pretty darn amazing.

I love eating at a place where I am aware of the ingredients are in my food and where they give a precise calories count of each dish. It definitely makes life easier for me.

I also love that this healthy place doesn't cost an arm and a leg for super delicious and fresh food. This has become my favorite place to eat breakfast and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves to eat healthy.

Way to go G&P!!!

First time here... no one could explain what was in the food?  Asked about veggie burger... no idea what was in it?  Next the guy at register game me no info how to get the food!  Finally figured as there is a number you get when ordering.  Never was told?? 

Ok the Veggie....by far the worst!  Omg...tasteless is the best description!  The owner should taste the food!!!! 

Avoid!!!!!!

First time here, customer service was outstanding. The bathrooms were super cleans as well. 
Now to the main stuff, we ordered buffalo wrap and tri tip tacos and wellness juice too. 
Buffalo wrap was very delicious and well prepared. The tacos were tasty but a little on the dry side. The sweet potato fires and wellness juice was very good. Once I'm in town I'll definitely stop by.

I was not impressed with my juice at all. When I order juice I expected it to be juice. I received my drink and as I was drinking it I noticed something was weird. I asked the guy at the counter what type of juicer they used because I've never had such a Texture before... He informed me that they do not use juicers at all but they blend their juices... Then that is not considered a juice! That is a blended vegetable drink. If I wasn't with my coworkers I would have asked for a full refund because I was not even able to drink it. I am on a strict juice diet and cannot have much fiber and that was definitely not in the description. Plus you would think being a healthy alternative restaurant they would know that blending vegetables ruins the nutrient value. 

You would think when somebody advertises juices that it would be juice not blended and chunky ( gross) 

Waste of my time and money! Ended up skipping lunch that day because I couldn't finish the "juice" without gagging and didn't have time to go anywhere else. 

I am giving it a two star because inside was clean, nice, and customer service was great! Everybody who got food there said it was a bit overpriced, which I agree.  

That was definitely the worst juice I have ever had in my life. That was my first time there and definitely will not come back.

I can't believe that I have yet to review this place. 
We come in on the weekend, and split a breakfast burrito. There are quite a few options for a side dish, which is included with your burrito. 

We have tried the sliced avocado as well as the potato medley. I love both. Fresh salsa is also included with the burrito. The food comes out HOT. Steam coming out. That is what I am talking about! 

I don't know how people can eat this entire thing by themselves. We split it, and we are stuffed. The food is so good, and the staff are really friendly. We also really enjoy their drinks. I love anything that has grapes in it. The drinks are so fresh and full of flavor. 

It is always clean here as well. Love it here.

I very rarely eat out, but when I do I come here. Staff is wonderful... very friendly and accommodating. Chris goes out of his way to remember my name and take care of me and my friend Ashley.
Food is always hot and prepared in a timely manner. 

Thank you to the Greens & Proteins staff for all you do!

This place is so good and the staff working r so nice and very happy. Its nice to go into a restaurant where everyone is smiling and say hi and when u leave they say bye and have a good day as u r leaving. I like customer service like that, plus as u r sitting there eating the guy that waited on us came over and asked us if we were good and if we needed anything. That amazing service. The best part the food is soooo good and the drinks r tooooooo.

While it can be a little bit pricey it's is one of favorite places for gluten free healthy meals. The BBQ chicken pizza, parfait and ginger limeade are three of my favorites. I do wish they had maybe a few more breakfast options.

This place was packed when I went in. I tired their Bison Cheese Steak with Tofu Fries on the side and wow that was good! Their smoothies are actually pretty good despite what is in it. The menu seems relatively healthy and the interior decoration is very modernized. It really set the mood. I definitely recommend giving this place a try.

Knocked off one star for absurd prices. 

However, the quality of their food is absolutely amazing. I can live off the Antioxidant Chiller -- stuff is made of gold. Definitely refreshing after a good work out if you're not into the Wellness Drink, which tastes like grass but I'm sure it's ridiculously good for you. 

And after that hard work out and you want to find some good food under the guise of low calories, get the BBQ Chicken Pizza. I can also eat that stuff for days and maybe they're lying to me and it's not as healthy as it should be, but I can die in happy ignorance. 

Prices: 
Antioxidant Chiller = ~$6
Wellness Drink = ~8 (use the Yelp check-in for $1 off) 
BBQ Chicken Pizza = ~$10

Ostrich burger and green leaf berry blast Yum!!

Nice to see something healthy and different In the valley.


Out door and indoor seating.

Kinda crowded all the time but that tells you something, GOOD FOOD!! 

Clean and everyone is super friendly.

We ate here twice while in Las Vegas. It's worth the trip off the Strip if you're looking for food not full of butter and salt. (Don't get me wrong, there is some great food on the Strip.) We did lunch here while waiting for the rest of our party to arrive at the airport - Harvest Kale and Chicken Quinoa salads. Both were excellent - and huge - along with two very good smoothies. We did breakfast on day two with the protein pancakes and the roasted vegetable fritatta. Again, excellent on all counts. The only hit is they didn't have coffee (broken machine), but we just jumped on a latte at the Starbucks next door.

I was really impressed. The menu features  delicious healthy options with calorie information. I enjoyed a bison cheesesteak that was only 600 calories. My partner has pizza with hummus as the sauce and feta as the cheese. Cucumbers represented the pepperoni. Very good affordable meal.

My daughter (age 12) and I had dinner at the Eastern/215 Greens and Proteins last night. I had the steak salad and she had oatmeal with fruit. Both dishes were prepared perfectly and tasted great. We also had smoothies, which were also delicious. The staff is very friendly and we got our food very quickly. This is a great place to go if you're wanting a healthy, delicious meal. Two thumbs up!

I came in today and ordered the green smoothie and the mini ahi tostadas. Both items were delicious.  I always pass this place up to go to the other fast food joints. Never again will I substitute health over wealth. This dishes are simplistic yet complex. Great food and the service was good also. The young lady brought all the smoothies to the customers with a friendly attitude. Don't let others pre judge this place for you. Try it for yourself, look over the menu before you go. They have a couple of dishes that are similar but aren't. Just a large variety of good ole wholesome food. I saw mothers with young children inside    which made me think  what a great start they're giving to their kids. I will be back.

Greens and Proteins: The name says it all! 

I make a smoothie daily and regularly visit smoothie and juice bars, but I've never had a smoothie as good as the ones that my husband and I tried here. The consistency was so smooth yet thick like any good smoothie should be. 

There are SO many good options here for anyone. Make sure to get the potato melody as your side! : )
Best juices in town! I I am addicted to the wellness and antioxidant juice. Nice clean location as well.... Oh yeah can't forget about the turkey burgers!

The fact that I can eat an ENTIRE Gluten Free pizza and KNOW the Macros is amazing in itself. The fact that the macros are SO GOOD that I can EASILY fit it in my day even on contest prep is even better!!!! Everything I have had has been AMAZING .. but the fact that they list ALL Macros is what keeps me going back! Thank you for providing this service .. especially for those of us that practice Flexible Dieting! You make dining out easy! Makes me not want to go anywhere else when I want to "eat out" :)

Not bad, food is pretty good, the drinks are different and definitely awesome to tryout. 

When I came I had a turkey burger with tofu fries, taste pretty good.

Not just for health freaks people I'm telling you! I'm not a hardcore vegan or health nut but I do pay attention to what's going in my body so I had to give this place a try. I had the steak tacos. Delicious! I don't know what kind of sauce they put on top but it made the tacos!! You got 3 tacos with the choice of corn tortillas or lettuce wrapped. Large portion only really needed to eat 2. I'll definitely be in again and again. Craving one of their delicious fresh smoothies! Also, the establishment itself looks SO clean. That is not something I ever overlook. They do have a pretty large selection in food and drinks as well. Go try it!

WOW! All I can say is the customer service, and the two young pretty ladies that greeted me, got me sold to come back again! I live on the southwest, and I happened to be around the 215 and Eastern area craving a protein shake. The big sign caught my attention and I was in a thrill. I got the Acai Berry protein mixed with greens, and it was delicious! (recommended by the cashier)

I myself, am a business owner here in town and was impressed with this place. They also have big star DJ resident Steve Aoki a big fan! I heard they have three more locations coming up! Best of luck to this brand and the best of success! 

Yelpers check em' out!!

I spotted this place while going on a coffee run. I was on a diet at the time as per usual and my foods were pretty limited. I went in just curious to see what they had. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I asked for a wrap but I didn't want the spread that came with  and also no added salt. (Yeah I was that person) the cashier was very nice and made it happen for me. The food was great considering the lack of everything that would normally be yummy. The restaurant was clean and tidy. A definite must for any healthy eater.
I love this place. Love the choices for delicious healthy food.. Especially since it seems like nothing but fast food joints are popping up in this area.

The service is great. The people there have great customer service and are so welcoming. Only problem is every time I eat here I can never keep the food down. This may be a super TMI but I get really bad sh!ts when I eat there and I even had food poisoning. I legit was on the toilet or laying on my stomach for a full 24 hours. I'm pretty sure it's just me but I can't eat here anymore.  **UPDATE** I received a reply back from the owner of this specific greens and protein and I just want to let you know that I've lived a healthy lifestyle for over 10 years now and am currently on prep for a bikini competition so my body is well aware of the types of food that is entering my system.  I'm only eating to fuel my body right now so shouldn't assume that I'm an unhealthy person who is just trying out your certain restaurant.
Ordered chicken cheesesteak and jicama fries, got home and I had tofu fries . Not a fan of the fries, but the cheesesteak was great, the season was delicious, and it was very fulfilling.

When this place first opened I was extremely excited about something new and "healthy" not too far from my home. Turns out its not as "Healthy" as it promotes to be and is a bit over priced for the quality of the food. To me, Health= organic. If its not organic its not healthy. I don't want to eat pesticides and chemicals, it defeats the purpose of the nutritious food. I went in a total of three different times ( in case someone didn't know what they were talking about) and I asked each time if any of their items were organic, the response "NO." How is this a healthy place when the food, including veggies and fruits,  are not organic? And why is it so pricey when you're feeding me pesticides, chemicals, and no "added" but already there hormones? No thank You.

Strictly service. I love the food and drinks here! Very tastey and healthy! What I'm not happy with today is service. The counter girl, short tanned brunette has a really bad attitude about her. I felt like I was annoying her by ordering and that I was an inconvenience to her when I was asking her questions trying to figure out which shake I used to love to order. Wednesday morning 10:15 girl, work on your attitude.

So so. The menu lacked lots of green-vegi choices. Name should be various meat and tofu proteins and green drinks. Veggie Garden Burger was just a pale bocaburger (no veggie or garden in it), my wife a life long vegetarian could not eat it.

A quick stop over at Greens and Proteins left my stomach smiling, without feeling the need to rock the elastic sweatpants around the gut afterward.

One highlight of the menu here is the option to build your meal to your specs, starting with your greens, protein, grains, and choice of sauce - All of the components for a full and balanced meal, with you knowing everything that went into it.

For my order, I went with a vegan burger, topped with avocado (costs extra), and a side of tofu fries. The burger was delicious and flavored to perfection. The baked tofu fries were insanely good too. I left the restaurant wishing that more places offered this as a side. Don't fret, carnivores. There are plenty of great meat options for you too.

If you're looking for a casual stop for a bite to eat, without the worry of having to loosen your belt a few notches after. Greens and Proteins is the right place to be. I just wish there were more places like this around the valley for the more health conscious eater.
Waited for ever for my food they got my simple salad wrong the ahi tuna salad was terrible customer service sucks won't be back

I love this kind of place. Everything is kept clean and the drinks are always prepared fresh. It's easy to eat healthy here. They have great selection for any craving you have. I love the complimentary cucumber citrus water. They lose a star because of their pricing.
Definitely unforgettable !!! I've never had a worse meal, I ordered the "turkey" burger and I'm still searching for flavor!

Meh. I came here entry because I had to be somewhere super early and didn't have anything at home to make breakfast. I had briefly looked over their menu and was interested in trying a juice and the Acai bowl. Once I got there I realized that I was more hungry than I thought so I decided to order their breakfast burrito, the Acai bowl and the watermelon and strawberry juice smoothie. The total was like 18 bucks, damn! Anyway, the juice was fine. The burrito had no flavor whatsoever. They give you a little salsa on the side to spice it up, but even that was not sufficient. Eggs just need butter and salt, and this contained none of that. The acai bowl was good, and I have been back about three times to order it again. Others the that, it really is expensive and not as flavorful as I would have liked.

Stopped by today for the first time . I had the Chocolate Veggiechino.  It was delicious. I love that they use all natural ingredients. I would suggest this Cafe to anyone looking for a healthy alternative.

My daughter & I came here after workout and ordered 2 Wellness drinks (green grapes, green apple, pineapple, orange, lime, wheat grass, kale, spinach, collard greens, ginger, flax seed & agave) --- so good & refreshing. 

Loaded antioxidant chiller (green grapes, blueberries, blackberries, agave nectar) ordered by my daughter's friends - tastes like grape, delicious, not very sweet which is good. 
Location is convenient. Will come back definitely. Just found out have loyalty cards -- buy 10 smoothies get the 11th free. A dollar off if you check in with yelp. Not a bad deal :)

Love the veggie burger and tofu fries. Food is amazing and they even give free green water which is all that I drink. The manager Patrick has been super helpful and they recently catered an open house for me. I love this place. 5 Stars!

I always have a great experience at Greens and Protiens. Food is clean, healthy, flavorful and delicious. The yummy sauces and large portions are what sets it apart. It's definitely my go to spot and I'd choose it over the other healthy resturant's. 

I like the build your own meals, and would sometimes even cut the meals in half if I want smaller meals throughout the day. I've had the Apple Pie and Wellness Smoothie and they're both great! One of my favorites is the tofu fries. They're crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and seasoning and sauce are very tasty. I love the complimentary cucumber water, it's very refreshing and light. They're open early, so I would even pick up my lunch before work. I've ordered in, to go and delivery and the quality is very consistent. Employees are friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming. If there is an issues they take care of it right away. I come here at least once a week, if not more. I highly recommend this healthy balanced resturant.

Yummy yummy in my tummy!! If you are feeling like eating healthy and want someone to make you something scrumptious then Greens & Proteins is the place to visit. I ordered a summer berry salad and it was the bomb!! The crisp spinach topped with their citrus dressing and fresh berries (strawberries, blueberries, and mandarin slices) married perfectly with chunks of creamy goat cheese. In fact, I want this same salad right now! 

I've also tried one of their green smoothies, although I didn't realize it was a smoothie when I ordered it. I was expecting and looking forward to a juice, but regardless it was tasty!! The menu boasted a bunch a delicious sounding items. I can't wait to venture here again to sample some more yummy goodness!!

Was amazed to find such a place on my visit to Vegas. And it was something that everyone I was traveling with liked too. My only complain was that there was only one trash can ( at the back of restaurant. Which for someone to clear their table made it a pain) it was a bit on the pricy side. But heathy is hard to find.
So delicious! I drove past this place a few times after the gym, and finally stopped in today. I had the G&P veggie burger with jicama fries and wow! I scarffed it down quick. Yum :))
Restaurant was completely empty, and one meal took almost half an hour. Very unfriendly staff with bad customer service. NOT COMING BACK

Not impressed with the service. Waited too long and it wasn't busy? Stood around and watched them talk to their friends.  I wanted to try it because I heard it was good but the flavor was just ok. I guess I expected better by reading all these great reviews. I think people believe that its more healthy by eating here but are you willing to pay for it? Not healthier because they put extra granola on things!!!There are other places that have better service and quality. I will try other places and don't see myself returning. I will get my juice at Wholefoods.

Located in the Southeast corner of Las Vegas, but easily accessible via a short drive on highway 215 from Las Vegas Boulevard, Greens and Proteins offers fresh vegan and vegetarian meal options to the hungry health food masses of Las Vegas.  

Hipsters, the health conscious, aging hippies, Thunder From Down Under and Centerfold types, along with your average Joe lined up for smoothies, vegan pizzas and wraps on our visit.

Situated between, ironically enough, between a candy/bakery store and Starbucks, the counter staff was friendly and personable and all of the items ordered, including a vegan garden burger, hummus with pita, Thai ginger soup and tofu fries were well prepared.

For those ordering smoothie drinks, Greens and Proteins has a frequent visitor punch card.
Slow service. I was in front of the line and made me wait about 7 mins. Love their juices but its a bit overpriced.

I looooove the loaded antioxidant chiller juice! It's my absolute faaav one! I also love the get the tofu fries and the summer berry salad with shrimp! Overall, I recommend! & the cashier is such a cutie with big blue eyes (:

Crazy good. If you got some cravings and your on a diet, this is the place to go. Great for a cheat day/ or some "greens With proteins". Smoothies are great. BBQ pizza with pita  and the sweet potato fries.

Great place in the middle of the food desert! Will go again. Being organic is the only thing that would make it better and more plain juice options. This is an interesting use of commercial food and better than 80% of other mainstream eateries.
best smoothie I have ever had, chocolate peanut butterr.... I died.

I finally got a chance to try this place. The atmosphere is nice and staff is polite. I ordered the G&P burrito with tofu fries with a watermelon strawberry juice. 1. Wasn't really excited there was stevia added to the drink. I would have thought they'd use agave. I steer clear of stevia being some say it's no better than equal. 2. The burrito sounded amazing but it took a long time to get there and just really didn't have any flavor. It's like the ingredients are there but tasteless. I loaded it up on hot sauce but doubt I'll visit there again. Maybe I ordered wrong I'm not sure but just didn't do it for me.

The people behind the counter greeted us immediately when we entered. The food was delicious and made in a timely manner. Gluten friendly food available. You can get your food to go or have a dine in experience.

I ordered the g&p veggie burger on whole wheat with jicama fries. The "burger" was a mushy patty of processed aggregate items with no flavor to speak of.  The bun tasted alright, and was a nice consistency. G&P's vegan mayo had a buttery flavor and texture reminiscent of garlic butter which would have been a nice touch had the burger been more flavorful.

The staff was not knowledgeable about the menu, and gave my table the wrong food then gave it to the correct table after we had touched it. A table mixup is absolutely understandable but not taking the food back is problematic. The server only took it from the other table after we flagged her down to alert her. 

This was my first time at this establishment so maybe it was an off order but it's not the kind of experience that will bring me back.
I enjoy coming here.  I usually get the chicken Ceasar wrap it's delicious!  I also enjoy the green drink and the acai berry smoothie.  The chicken teriyaki wrap was also good!

I am waiting for my shake. I ordered it at 7:28 and now its 7:47. I use to like this place but when i had to wait more than 20 mins for a shake and no one in front of me is kind of ridiculous. With no one in front of me, i don't think it take more than 7 mins tops to make my shake. Leaves a bad taste in my mouth, so it will be my last time here.

Great Grub get ready for a great loyal customer.

I just got my shake at 7:52 and its so bland and tasteless. I can only taste grapes and i dont think the banana split has grapes in it.
Btw they never called my name, but instead decided to store it in the fridge. I had to go up there and ask for it

I've tried going here a few times, because I thought maybe I just didn't like the dish I got, but this is the last time I'll go here (for the food, the juice is good). I got the ahi tuna tostada and my fianc√©e got the chicken sausage pizza. The tuna was really tough to chew and it was literally on crackers. His pizza was very bland and was also basically on a large cracker.

Well it's healthy...  While healthy food isn't fast, holy crap!  This ain't no quick bite!

GMonkey do:

THAI CHICKEN BOWL- aka chicken breast in peanut sauce over rice.  It'll build a turd. 

GREEN LEAF BERRY SMOOTHIE w/Pea protein- pretty good

"$21 for that or AYCE Sushi next door - WTF?!" Monkey grumbled.

If you want to eat healthy and are on the go this place is amazing. And affordable! ! Not to mention everything taste great.

I usually make my own plate, chicken breast, mixed greens,  and the sweet mashed potatoes.  I always feel great afterwards. 

They also have a great breakfast selection as well.
This place rocks.  Food is great service is outstanding. The food and portion size is perfect.  Can't go wrong at this place.  Everyone always smiles and seems to care.

Been going to Greens and Proteins for several years now and the food is mostly consistent except in their Western location. I ordered it to go turkey burger and it was undercooked but that was a one-off. They had just opened so I'm sure they've got the Kinks worked out.

My favorites are the bison burger ostrich Burger turkey burger and some of the smoothies with the quinoa and especially the tofu fries with the death.

Also the Cucumber drink which is free is always very refreshing on hot days here in Las Vegas.

The staff is very friendly and the owner a sweetheart if you ever get to meet him

Today my sister and I tried this plate, it was absolutely amazing. Customer service was great, and so was the food. When stevo, the cashier noticed that we didn't eat all the tofu, he brought us out different options of foods to try without us even asking! And then when we were ready to leave, he rushed over to the door and opened it for us. A1 customer service and food!

LOVE, LOVE Greens and Proteins!  I am so glad that I was introduced to this wonderful option in Las Vegas.  My go-to is the G & P Chopped Salad - spinach, tomatoes, turkey, artichokes, and so much more!  I know why it is so popular - it is amazing!

good fresh food.  they lost a star cause i ordered the grilled veggie pizza but they gave me a greek pizza which they told me was the grilled veggie.  (sorry but the feta and olives weren't supposed to be on it then)  but either way it was super tasty so I didn't mind.  Everything seemed really fresh and was quite tasty.

We're so happy to have a delicious and nutritious food choice up north! We've enjoyed the W. Flamingo locations many times...no need for the long drive any longer!!! Same friendly staff and clean restaurant.

We had the bison burger and bbq chicken pizza (pita bread option). Great juicy burger! Ostrich is on the menu, but I'm not sure I can handle that. The pizza sauce had a great kick to it. It had the right balance of toppings. I love that they offer free infused water too.
From past experience, you can't go wrong with the granola French toast! Tofu fries are also a win.

We'll be back soon for smoothies!

If you're looking for healthy eats, Greens and Proteins is for you.  They have a variety of food to choose from and they are able to accommodate those who have specific diet needs(vegan, vegetarian, etc).  

Today we ordered the Bison cheese steak wrap and ahi protein salad.  Both were great selections.  No complaints here.  However, my "go to" dish is the BBQ chicken pizza.  Yummm!  Food is consistently good here.  I love the fact that they serve complimentary cucumber water.  The staff is always pleasant and friendly.  Parking is fairly easy, right front of the establishment.  They share a parking area with Starbucks and The Original Sunrise Cafe.

Ordered the custom meal. The ahi tuna was cooked perfect as well as the quinoa and wakame salad. The smoothie was ok. I was not blown away. I tasted one of my friends tofu fries. They were okay not great. I think they should be cut smaller so they're not mushy inside or use a harder tofu.

Overall a good place for vegans, gluten free, etc.

Love going here especially after a good workout or at lunch. The food is very filling. I would highly recommend he justin wrap and the burger and the green shake is one a fave. The tofu fries comes with the burger and wrap and it is perfect!
Awesome. Came here with my parents who are not vegan or healthy by any means and they really enjoyed it. Yummy smoothies, tofu fries and other delicious eats. The service was fab too! I will be back!

I never write reviews, but this is the third time I've been to this place and so far I love it! The staff is always so nice and welcoming, they make you feel so comfortable. Their enthusiasm is genuine and they're always so helpful and the food is so good. Great Job guys keep up the good work!
If you are looking for a healthy meal + tasty + affordable, Greens and Proteins, is your place to go! Everything is made fresh. I love this place~!
Excellent food and great service.  Have had it to go a few times.  First time eating at restaurant,  and impressed by the accommodating attitude. Real can do people.

Imagine a world were everyone has good skin and are very healthy!  That is what would happen if you ate this everyday.  They have great healthy drinks and quality food.  I saw 3 girls who were nice and firm get food and I realize thats why they still have curves, not lumps.  Can't wait to try something else !
Love this place! The staff is ALWAYS really nice and helpful in picking something out. The quality of food is always spectacular, and I simply can't get enough of this place. Way to go guys & thanks!
This place is a great location, but their food is moderate at best, and a lot of the items are not all that healthy.

Awesome place to grab a bite to eat after a workout or anytime.  Everything I've had has been yummy.  They are reasonably priced too.  Outdoor seating is nice but they have plenty of indoor seating when it's too hot outside.

Had the breakfast burrito and a piece of the BBQ chicken pizza.  I definitely recommend the BBQ chicken pizza.  Great customer service.  It was busy, but the food was brought out quickly and with a smile.

When I lived in Vegas, I found this place while searching for a good healthy place to dine. Let me just say! I loved this place. I have been to other locations as well, but this one I went quite often since it was near my home. My husband and I left Vegas and now we are in Texas, I miss this place so much. I wish we had some where I live now.
If you need honest healthy and watch what you eat, only place to go. Staff is always great and happy to answer questions.

My favorite post work out meal conveniently located by my least favorite place, LVAC. I always get the build your own with either ahi or steak, mushrooms, spinach and pesto. If I feel like doing a carb I'll get the quinoa or sweet potato mash. I love that they have calories and macros listed by all the food items and complimentary cucumber water.

I love Greens and Proteins and if it were not so far away I would live here and never cook again.  They make juices the hide the herbaceous nature of veggies. They have Wifi so you can camp out here and it is a great meeting spot if you are on the Henderson side of town.  I also love their indoor garden.

My favorite place for healthy food after I go to the gym. Everything here is the highest quality. Check out the Greek scramble if you want a great meal for under $7. Would highly recommend trying this place out.

Wow !! Fantastic !!  Phone service is outstanding. They are so friendly and helpful and the food is sooooooo yummy  my favorite is the bison cheese wrap with sweet potato fries. They have an amazing selection of really good food that is good for you also. This place is my new Favorite place.

CRAZY ROID RAGE customer was RUDE to me. Owners need to give him the heeve ho!!! I'll explain more later and how the amazing girl Savannah professionally put him in his place. 

First the food: I've never really eaten in this restaurant but my HCG diet told me about their amazing prepared meals they have Which are 10$ and weigh out the 4 ounces of meat with 2 cups of acceptable veggies. So good!!! 

ROID RAGE guy... So there was a crazy roid rage maniac who interrupted me as I was paying for my 4 meals to go... He said, "ummm.. Scuse me miss.. I'm in a hurry and trying to pay and get out of here. So if you don't mind.." Then he proceeds to try and cut me...by stepping in front of me... You can tell he worked out but was super Aggro. Angry and very rude. Then he was rude to Savannah... The sweet lady checking us out. He did this AS I was paying... The amazing cashier Savannah stepped in and quickly put him in his place. Then....

HE TRIED to start a FIGHT!:: Then he started to try and start a fight with me and my BF as he was leaving. Saying, "fuck you" and motioning for us to go outside to 'fight' him... Let me repeat this interaction above was ALL that happened. It was so bizarre. I said why is he so angry?? Then I asked the cashier and all of the employees said he's rude every day... 

It got me to thinking. Although my BF and I ended up paying close to 70$ before we left.. Maybe more.. (because we ordered food for lunch and dinner tomorrow)... And I will probably eat the majority of my next months meals here... Even if this guy is a customer EVERY day.. He should NOT be allowed to be in here and wreck our experience. His rudeness was all my BF and I spoke about all dinner. I hope the owners read this and although my food and experience with the workers here has been great.. They should rectify this situation by banning this guy because I really am dreading have to run into him again... It's giving me anxiety about coming in.. And if every employee knows him I'm sure if they read this they will know exactly who I am talking about. 

Other than that guy... My experience here is amazing. I've lived in LA forever and they really GET this whole healthy living lifestyle thing. I commend them, LOVE this restaurant and will recommend this to anyone. I now have my BF hooked. I also wish there was a reward program as I've now gotten about 7 HCG meals and will keep coming. Such a great restaurant. Great job GREENS & PROTEINS!!!
Love their Wellness Drink! I haven't gotten the chance to try their food yet, but it's all about healthy eats and drinks here.

I love this Greens and Proteins! Always quick with the service and great clean food for bodybuilders and non-bodybuilders! I particularly enjoy their employee Kristen's energy! She's fast, will tell you her favorite items on the menu, and is always a pleasure to run in to!

Because of the nearby LVAC, this place has kinda become the a mecca of yoga pants and "arms day" guys. So, if you can put up with the constant influx of that crowd, you're good to eat here. I'm actually shocked what some people are wearing to the gym these days...anyway...

I come here for the smoothies, not the food. I have always found the food here to be really bland and overpriced. The gluten-free bread is terrible. Don't bother freaking out over it. Their tofu fries are AMAZING. I love love love these. They are pretty much the only thing I will order as far as solid food goes. Buffalo sauce is very tasty as well and they have a nice vegan alternative that comes with these if you ask.

I really do love the smoothies. I've been coming here for a few years now, and their smoothies never get old. They are super refreshing, healthy, and I really do think it's a reasonable price compared to Whole Foods (not to mention they taste way better). 

This location does have a nice outside seating area (complete with umbrellas), which I do enjoy in the summer.

I came here with my brother just to have a little snack a while ago. I ordered the chicken strips to have something in my stomach. The chicken was really dry and I did not enjoy it very well. But my brother got this juicy burger (idk the name of it). He also got a side of tofu fries. The tofu fries are DELICIOUS. I crave it so much. It's a must!!! The prices are a reasonable price. It is supposed to be a healthy place so it's going to cost a bit.

Wow! I was in town and wanted a healthy meal. I came here based on the reviews. I was not disappointed. The salmon was super fresh and delicious and the salad was amazing. I ordered the lemon vinaigrette on the side and it was tasty.

Sometimes after a healthy meal I am hungry quick. This meal had enough spice and seasoning to make me feel full longer.

Green and Proteins has great, ridiculously healthy food. For real - I didn't know it was possible to make some of the things they offer in such low calorie ways. I've tried a few different juices and a few different food items, and it's all been great. I'd eat here all the time if it wasn't so expensive (for me, personally). To get a fancy drink and a meal will cost you about $12-15, which is middle-ground pricing around the city, but I consider coming here more of a splurge. The two locations are each far from the heart of Vegas, but it's worth stopping in if you're in the neighborhood!

I come here at least 2 times a week because it's inexpensive and near the gym. It's unfortunate that every time I come here the staff is unprofessional and the tables and cleanliness of the store is questionable. I have to walk around to find a clean table that's not sticky and the forks look dirty. Staff has loud discussions about customer complaints against them. I believe management needs to come in and watch this business before you lose 4 regular weekly customers. I enjoy the food not the service or cleanliness

BUGS!!! Went here the other night... after waiting for a really long time (it wasn't very busy) and we didn't get our whole order, they have some kind of mite infestation going on. I posted a picture of the mite crawling on our table. I noticed it after I ate I just hope there wasn't any in our food, they're really tiny!!! Ahhh ew I won't be back here!!!

Great healthy food & awesome  Variety! The coffee served was Angry Joe Coffee which will now replace all my coffee, best ever.
Greens & Proteins, clean & great staff... love this place!

The points are for the effort. Otherwise, bland, overpriced and misleading. They blend their 'juices' and put sweetener in everything. Pretty gross. The 'veggie parm' is just spaghetti squash (instead of noodles), marinara and cheese (vegan available), no veggies at all, for $9. The 'make your own meal' thing is bland and comes with a tiny container of sauce. We gave them a couple tries because they were the only vegetarian place around where we stayed, but next time we'll just drive further or order veggie options from a thai place or something.

Whenever I have to be in Henderson (typically for work reasons), I try to make a stop by Greens and Proteins. Why? Mostly because it is healthy food, and I need to eat better most of the time.

That being said, Greens and Proteins, while expensive, is worth it. I'm not saying I'd be dropping money here every week, but it is a splurge for a quick bite (or just a smoothie). Thus far I have had two of their smoothies, my favorite of the two being the Chocolate Peanut Butter Banana Shake: Cacao powder, dark chocolate chips, banana, roasted peanut, avocado, kale, spinach, zucchini, flax seed, chia seeds, honey, vanilla, agave nectar. This produces a smooth, yet thick smoothie I really enjoy.

I've also had the Green Leaf Berry Blast: Strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, pineapple, lemon, carrots, cabbage, spinach, kale, vanilla, agave nectar. Not as good as the Peanut Butter Banana taste-wise, and the texture is much more watery. However, all those berries, and vegetables - you know you are getting a powerful boost of nutrition.

Lastly, food-wise I have had their BBQ chicken pizza. It comes out on a thin crust with low-fat mozzarella, chicken, and red onions. It was recommended to me by the staff and I have to agree with them - it was delicious, crisp, not at all greasy, and delightful to be eating a pizza that isn't AS BAD for me as other pizzas.

Overall, I have no complaints about service or quality of food. The only thing is the big bite it takes out of your pocket book. Be prepared to spend upwards of $15-$20 if you want a meal and drink. For smoothies, the pricing is $7.50. It's not the cheapest, but when you are thinking of you health, isn't it priceless? Ha!

When I wrote my initial review all I had had here were the smoothies and they were a little sweet for my taste. However, after trying the food this is like hella my new favorite place to eat. 

The service is awesome, the place is always clean, the food is IN. SANE. and really reasonably priced. Honestly this place rocks. Breakfast served all day and the caloric value of each item is stated on the menu. 

For realz, if you are looking for a delicious, healthy, and quick meal at any time of day I definitely recommend this joint.

This place was nice enough, and the staff was really friendly. The food was just ok. I ordered the create your own entr√©e with veggies and brown rice. I asked if I could have extra veggies instead of tofu for the protein, while they obliged, It didn't seem like enough veggies to really be comparable to having meat or tofu so I had thought maybe they would have put a bit more than they did. I could have easily cooked that at home for around 3 bucks on the high end. So paying 10 dollars for that was not worth it. Giving the third star for customer service as both employees I interacted with were really nice.
Want a healthy lunch but not a boring one? This place is it! And their sweet potato fries are great!

I used to really like this place for their smoothies and healthier food options and would visit them often. The staff was always friendly and their service has always been great but that recently changed. 

Last week I noticed my bank statement had a charge from Greens and protein but I hadn't been there in a month so I checked my statements and also noticed that I had two charges to my card the last time I was there (one was not approved) I called the store to see why I had a total of $27 charged to my card with out my approval and when I told the person who answered the reason why I was calling they asked if I was Diana, apparently I wasn't the only one with this problem. 

The manager "couldn't get to the phone" so I went to the store and spoke to him in person. He claims they had a "glitch" with their system and promised it wasn't fraud on their behalf and that there was 5 other people with the same problem. He also said he would call me on Monday (i went in on a Friday) once he figured out what went wrong,  a week has gone by and I haven't heard anything from them. I had my bank investigate the charge and they returned my money. 

I no longer trust this restaurant and I would warn anyone who eats here to check their bank accounts.
I can't get enough of this place.  They have the best selection of healthy food and I've never been disappointed with my choices; always fresh and prepared daily.

I love this chain. The customer service is amazing. The food is usually great; if I ever have a problem it's fixed immediately with no questions asked. 
Save your macros up and try the burgers with sweet potato fries.

I love this place. They have places to sit outside the restaurant.   Very casual place.  I ordered the grilled chicken quinoa salad. I love it.  Very filling.  The salad was served in a bed of lettuce leaves.  Bite sized grilled chicken is mixed with quinoa, dried cranberries and green apples to give it a tangy, sweet taste.  The different texture is very appealing to the palate.  The Malibu breeze smoothie is a great complement with this salad.  A blend of green grapes, pineapple, carrots, and oranges.

I came here for a lunch meeting with one of the offices that we work a lot with and at first I was very hesitant as I have never heard of this place. What a great choice to go to for the health conscious eater.  I ordered the peanut chicken skewers and the G&P salad. The portions are big, enough for two people.   The staff were really friendly.  Prices very reasonable.  Although it's a bit far from work, I will definitely visit this place again.

We love Greens and Proteins in Las Vegas!  I always start with a Wellness Drink!  It's as good as it gets..  refreshing and delicious!  We love the food and the restaurants are always clean and the service is terrific.

I've eaten here a couple of times and I'm happy to see healthier options popping up around the Las Vegas Valley. I like coming here when I'm craving for burgers because they have Bison meat which tastes great! I've also had their Philly Cheesesteak as well which is equally delicious. The last time I was here I had their flatbread pizza it was pretty tasty. 

I do love this concept but I wish they would give you a choice of a side salad instead of Jicama strips. I only like Jicama with hot sauce and vinegar. I also wish they would blend their drinks a little better. I ordered a green drink and a peeling or something got stuck in my throat.  It wasn't pleasant but before that the drink was good! I'm sure this was just a freak accident.

I could have a FOFU banana split smoothie everyday. It is soooo good. And you can order online for pickup which is a big plus. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars because I belive the smoothies are expensive.

Wow, this place will make you like food you never thought you could.

I ordered the raw "Nachos"  and a Lime and Ginger smoothie.  Both were excellent.

The place is very clean and serene, and for what they are serving, it's perfectly priced.

Highly Recommended!  We'll be back!

I love G & P, EVERYTHING on the menu is good you can't go wrong. BBQ chicken pizza on lavash is the way to go. It's priced reasonably too. My coworkers and I love it here because we can call in an order to go, it only takes about 10-15 minutes and there's still time to do other things in the lunch hour without rushing and it's a healthy but not over priced meal.
One of the best best healthy restaurants I have eaten at. I ordered the Ahi salad and the ginger soup that both tasted delicious. I will definitely be coming back here again.

A few weeks ago I went here on a Sunday evening because the Starbucks next door was packed. My friend and I were just looking for a nice quite place to chat and this place seemed like a good fit... The atmosphere was really casual; it was really calm and inviting, definitely had a trendy coffee shop feel to it. That night it was filled with a lot of young girls in yoga pants and gym shorts... I figured it must be the post-workout spot for the ladies from the LVAC across the lot.

Anyhow... as we came in my friend had ordered a wheat grass drink and we took to a table along the back wall. The seating area was nice, all of the tables were cleared and they had a grape green hue to match the healthy theme of the entire place. What was also nice was the waterfall that ran across the entirety of the back wall. Definitely gave it a calming feel with a modern nature theme... if you can try to picture that.

As we were seated I couldn't help but notice the quality of service the server/cashier was providing. While taking every order he would try to acknowledge the guest by their first name. It definitely gave it a personalized feel. It was nice to see, and I could notice a lot of the guests were regulars... if only they did a better job at greeting us as we entered the place. 

While we were seated I also ended up ordered the Teriyaki Grilled Chicken Wrap. The price was a little unreasonable for what I got, I understand it's a healthy choice but for $10.99 I expect to get a little more for the buck. I guess all that extra money went into the plating and presentation, which brings me to the next point. For as good as it looked the flavor was very disappointing. The wrap had no taste at all; the only thing that helped me distinguish the ingredients was their texture.
