Overall for what we came for I would say it definitely met our expectations and didn't disappoint, however the food wasn't so great. The ambiance was 5/5, Service was 4/5, and the Food Quality was 3/5; presentation was great, ingredients seemed fresh and health, but the taste was not there at all. Maybe it was just what I had ordered.

I will most likely not eat here again but if I needed a nice casual meeting spot I would definitely keep this place in mind. Although my experience with the food was not pleasant the intent of the visit was for a casual meeting spot and it definitely delivered on that.

My friend and I came here yesterday after our workout. It was kind of pricey and honestly I didn't like anything that much. I really was just eating because I was hungry as fuck and also I spent a stupid amount of money on a juice so I felt obligated to finish it. I did have a $1 off juice/smoothie coupon for checking in when I got there but $7.50 for a juice is a little insane.
My friend got a veggie tofu wrap thing with tofu fries and we shared that and the smoothie. My other friend got a broccoli cheddar soup. 
The wrap was kind of weird. A lot of veggies (duh) but super bland for me. I had to put some ketchup on it. The fries were alright, super strange but the dipping sauce was delicious. My friend claimed to really enjoy the wrap and faux fries. I was pretty meh about them. 
My Most Expensive Juice Ever was ok. It tasted kind of weird and looked downright nasty. My friend thought it was ok too. But for that much money I was expecting a strawfull of heaven or top shelf scotch at least, not just an "ok" drink.
My other friend got one whole piece of broccoli in his soup, that lucky man. He ate really slow and when we left he still had like half a bowl sitting there. He and I were both still hungry as fuck when we left. So that was a bummer.
Also- some guy in line next to me described the menu perfectly: "can you not decide what you want because everything looks so good, or because nothing stands out to you? I'm the latter." That sums it up.

Visiting our LV office from LA and this place is across the street.  So had breakfast and lunch here.  Amazing. Breakfast I had the Green Shake, amazing.  Lunch I had the Bison Cheese Steak Wrap with sweet potato fries and a Watermelon/Strawberry Cocktail.  Every single thing was amazing.  The cheese steak was overstuffed with bison meat, no skimping here.  Delicious.  I would be in trouble if this place was across the street from my home office.  I would eat here every day.  Well done.

Meh....came back again to try an acai bowl. It was $8, which is normal, but I'd say less than 1/3 of it was the acai.....everything else was the filler.....ill just drive the extra 5 minutes and go to protein house next time
I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this place. The menu, the speed, the quality are all so very good I would come here daily when im in town if it were solely up to me.
This place is outstanding. Price, service, quality, taste are all 100% top notch. I'd eat here three times a day if I were a LV resident.

This place has the potential to be good, however, they keep coming up short.  I agree with some other comments about the staff.  This place does not have a staff on the A game.  C to D at best.

To have trust and faith in a place, it really needs to start with the person taking the order to hit the right keys and input your order correctly.  It's not rocket science and no one is being rushed, so to get your order wrong is just a sign of incompetence.  

We have been here 3 times now and have had bad experiences.  The first bad experience was the wrong smoothies being made.  The second time, the smoothies were not made properly.  We got close to what we ordered, but the people just seem to be too inexperienced.  

Now the third time, they advertise to be HCG and Vegan friendly, however, the chef and owner are not Vegans, and have not read a Vegan cook book.  Hint, hint, maybe will help becoming more familiar with what you are advertising.  This place is still kind of new, but you should have a clue before you make a claim and advertise that you are friendly to people's needs.

Again, the order was put in wrong at the register which cause the entire experience to go nowhere but down, which is sad.  This place has a LOT OF POTENTIAL, as I said in the beginning and I would love to see this place succeed if the owners and chef have the ability to tighten up their ship and get things right.  With all the holes in their staff, which leads to bad experiences by customers, ships full of holes only go in be direction, down.....as of now, I cannot give this place any more then 2 stars.  We will probably give hem one last chance before we write them off completely, I just hope they stay in business long enough for this to happen.
The restaurant is located at Juhl Promenade.  My absolute favorite is Chicken BBQ pizza.  The team at this location are amazing!! Always smiling :)

Recently went here for lunch before an afternoon yoga class and was pleasantly surprised. I had heard the food was pricey, which it is a bit more compared to the norm, but the portions are large & the food is delicious. I had the turkey club wrap with tofu fries. The fries were crisp and unique and the wrap was great too. They also offer complimentary cucumber lemon water. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking to stay fit, but still eat deliciously.
Had the bison wrap and tofu fries. Pretty cool place and fast service. Wish it had more flavor but it is diet food. lol... I'll definitely stop back again and try another item.

I tried the lettuce crab wraps and the bison cheese steak wrap.  I have to say they were both pretty darn delicious. 

I couldn't imagine a cheese steak wrap, let alone a bison, but once I took a bite...mmmmm was all that I hummed.  I have to say, as a wrap I couldn't even eat everything.  As a matter if fact I saved the other half for dinner.  I could not decide between the tofu fries or the jicama fries so I was able to go half half.  They both were good, but I did favor the tofu fries.  I think I might order that as a side by itself too.

This seems to be a pretty bust place, the whole time we were there, there was always a line. But it moves quick.  The servers, if you dine in, are quick and pleasant when serving and taking away your plates.  

I'm pretty excited that I tried this place out because I'm coming back to try even more things.  I'm going to also try some of those yummy smoothies I kept seeing everyone order.  

Yippie for greens and proteins!

To those having problems or seeing issues: did you say anything? Did you bring it up? Ask to speak to anyone? Remind the young kid his gloves were on? Don't just come on yelp and rip people apart, it's petty and ridiculous. Just talk to them. Any problem I have had, especially with a Postmates order, they fix right away. They bend over for customers that interact with them. 

That being said, very glad I finally have one close to me. Although I still always go to the original location. I'm glad if I don't have the time to do so, I can still get my fix close by. The ability to ingredient swap as needed for allergies and my auto immune disease is amazing. They're incredibly accommodating. They always make my juice exactly how I need it for chemo. Shout out to you good sirs.

Very impressed!! If you are looking for a satisfying healthy meal or smoothies & juices with great customer service, this is your place!! Even though we arrived about 30 minutes before closing, we were still treated like "priority". We were never "rushed" and the food was made and served fresh!!! The entire staff was warm and friendly!!!

I love the healthy options available to vegetarians & non-vegetarians. I eat meat so the fact that they offer great tasting burgers in bison and Angus is great!! 
I had the Choco-Banana Smoothie...sinfully delicious without the "guilt"!! They add kale, spinach & avocado which "works" with the rest of the traditional ingredients (chocolate, banana and peanut butter)

I ordered the Angus burger with avocado and cheddar cheese, which was perfectly cooked & juicy!! The sweet potato fries were good n crispy!!

Steve-o not only treated us to great customer service, but gave my friend and I tasting samples of the acai smoothie, walnut pesto sauce with crackers to dip with and refreshing cucumber water!! 

Greens n Proteins...you won a returning customer & a fan!!! Delicious and nutritious!!

I love love this place.  One of the best really healthy restaurants I have found.  Their smoothies are amazing and have only ingredients that you can actually pronounce, no funny powders, just real food.  I love the lettuce they use to wrap the wraps and burgers if you opt for no bun.  The bison is super tasty.  This place is the best.

I love this place. Salmon with Steamed asparagus and brown rice with Balsamic reduction, or the veggie burger with a gluten free bun are my go to meals. Molly and Jeremy and the rest of the staff are always very friendly and remember me when I come in. I appreciate that the food is made sincerely and with a mind for the health of their customers. Thank you guys. :)

Although I've never tried their food, I love their juices and the girls in the morning are always super nice and efficient. They even know me by name now! I would defiantly recommend and would like to try their other options as well!

I've been to a couple greens & protein locations but this is my favorite! Very friendly staff and the food is well prepared here! Tatiana is very helpful and always has a smile on her face, she is definitely one of the reasons I eat at this locations, Always positive and welcoming! If you come to this location I recommend the bison cheese steak! It is by far my favorite thing on the menu!

Delicious real food.  I have gotten take out here a couple times and the food quality and freshness is high.  The tofu fries and tofu croutons in the salads are amazing.  The Ahi protein salad is very filling and the citrus dressing is so good.  Definitely recommend.

When in Vegas its a MUST to eat here! Have never been disappointed. Clean, fresh and great food. What more can you ask for. 

OF course I highly recommend the Protein pancakes! Best!!!

I have to say I am definitely a food junkie.  I came here with a preconceived notion that I would have a meal either lacking in flavor or in portion, due to the name of course.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised.  I had the Cajun wrap with Sweet Potato fries and both were outstanding.   I also love the cucumber infused water, very refreshing on a hot summer day.  Nice to see a restaurant can do healthy and happy at the same time!  BTW, I actually visited the location on Eastern and 215 but it is not listed on Yelp.

The fact that this place has vegan options that are clearly marked (most restaurants have vegan options but they may not be obvious on the menu) makes this restaurant above average, but the high prices and odd menu (bison burger? gross!) bring it down a couple notches. 

Try the smoothies, they're great. The vegan pizza is good and the soup is delish! Garden burger is fine. What's really nice though is how the vegan-ness and calorie count are clearly displayed.

PS - Outdoor seating is available. They don't have any high chairs or small kid's portions so it's not particularly kid-friendly.

I would give this place 5 stars for their food, it's delicious.  But I would only give them 1 or 2 stars for service.  I've ordered twice on line and both times the order has not come out right, got a wrap instead of a bun, wrong type of wrap, or missing the avacado which costs extra.  When my husband went to pick up the food I ordered today, the person at the counter said I never made an order when the order was right behind them with my name clearly on it.  They then told him he needed to pay for it again, which he would've done had I not told him I already paid for it before he left.  Get your sh*t together green and proteins!

I am changing my life style and this place is helping. I use to spend 12-15 dollars a DAY on fast food. Now I'm like why did I ever waste my life on crap, everything at this place is so freaking delicious.  I'm having the ostrich burger and all I can say is WOW! If eating healthy and clean is your way here's the place for you.  It is for me! :)
Everything tasted fresh and healthy, however, it lacked flavor.   It was very bland.   I don't believe spices or simple salt and pepper would make it unhealthy right?   I had the tacos.

It's a good clean healthy option when you have been bad all weekend in Vegas. I had the egg whites scrambled with turkey sausage. It was very good Shannon had the Greek scramble so loved it. And she dosent even like olives. Caleb had oatmeal big surprise there lol. Kyra had the multigrain protein pancakes. I had a couple of bites and though they were pretty tasty. Overall it was a good experience.

Multigrain pancakes are delicious (although I don't use the agave syrup I use organic maple at home lol) and the breakfast burrito is also delicious. Pretty much everything I've tried is great... Except jicama fries  I highly recommend and love this place!!

To keep things simple shall we...

Pros:
-not crowded
-nice staff
-healthy menu choices that surprisingly taste amazing
-electric outlets everywhere!!
-clean

Cons:
-slow wifi
-kinda have to pay for wifi (no biggie but next door offered fast and free wifi) 
-wifi password wasn't working but I was too lazy to find out the right one. 
-pricey but not a shock since eating healthy serves a price. ** I find this trend odd but oh well**
Updated review. I was very displeased with my last few orders from GP. But the resolve was so pleasant and the managers were so professional. Thank you.

I love this place!  I stopped in today after a 90 minute bootcamp and grabbed a green smoothie - it was delicious and I love going somewhere where everything on the menu is yummy and good for you!  I will be back over and over again !!!!

I truly was not a fan of this place, the meals here were simple and unseasoned. I understand that their meals are healthier, but healthy does not mean flavorless.. They look and taste like something that cook at home, and let me tell you I'm not a great cook. I guess if you need gluten free items or if you are vegan this place offers an extended menu. However, you are also going to need to pay a bit more for it! 
I ordered the teriyaki chicken wrap with tofu fries and they were just so chewy! And let me just add that I love tofu, but they really dropped the ball on that one
Excellent attempt at doing a restaurant that is healthy and yet accessible to everyone.

Bison Cheese Wrap - splurging wihtout feeling guilt and I'm all for it.  Tofu fries are a bit bleh but at least I won't feel guilty chomping down fries.  The place is pretty cool and defintely has a lot of options.  A bit pricey but well worth it.

Quick tip - don't get a Caesar salad, not that special and you can get that at quiznos and it would taste the same.

Great place for people with or without eating restrictions. My mother in law has to go Gluten-free, so we try to find locations that accommodate all palates.  This is one of those places! Although I try to eat healthful, I don't really deny myself good food. This places allows you to eat well and flavorful. You don't feel like you are giving anything up. I had the bison burger with Swiss cheese and jicama fries.

I'm also not a fan of green drinks. But I had a taste of the wellness drink and it was really good. 

So give this place a chance, you won't be sorry!

Definitely one of my favorite places. Both the smoothies and juices are great and while at first glance prices look crazy expensive, you get your money's worth not only in deliciousness and quality but also in portion size. They give you a lot of food. 

So far my favorite dish was a make-your-own bowl with turkey, steamed spinach, and sweet potato mash. Absolutely awesome. I can't wait to go back.

I will say that they do what they do well. However, I'm not a health nut, so this review is from the perspective of a guy that has never stepped inside of a Whole Foods.

The atmosphere is bright and inviting. It just looks healthy. Almost like a Jamba Juice, but in restaurant form. The menus are clear and displayed nicely above the registers on a few flat screens.

I ordered the bison cheese steak on a wheat wrap. It comes with a side of tofu fries or jicama fries. I went with the tofu. The wrap wasn't bad. It tasted like a ground beef wrap. The tofu fries were surprisingly good. However, I'm a tofu fan, so take that with a grain of salt. My coworker on the other hand hates the tofu fries.  I wish there was an option to order something unhealthy here. Just because I want a healthy entree doesn't necessarily mean I want a healthy side too. I should be able to get artery clogging potato french fries with my healthy ostrich burger. I shouldn't be limited to an all or nothing healthy meal.

My coworkers love this place, so inevitably I'll be here again. I would never come here on my own though. I don't like paying a premium for anything, even if it is organic and healthy. On the bright side, the female eye candy was solid.
Love the wellness drink, so good for you and so delicious!!! Nice friendly staff too.

BS +++

Hold the presses! If you are bench pressing HOLD IT UP! If you are ironing clothes PRESS IT DOWN! Then grab your car keys and come to this spot.  Vegans Vegetarians Vegettas and meatheads this is the spot for any healthy person or wanna be healthy like myself.  The place is clean and has a nice layout.  The chef (I think he's Samoan) is BEAST!! This kid is like 6 ft something and kills it on the skillet.  The girl who took my order is super chill and super smiley.  The food was WHAT! Seriously it's healthy and clean eating.  I won't write about it because it's like a spoiler alert in The Walking Dead (Carl does die BTW!) hahahaha kidding!  Come down to this spot.  They have breakfast - lunch - and burgers! And shakes and smoothies.  What more can you ask for? They use fresh produce and clean meat.

Food I got:
Protein wrap (breakfast)
Egg White omelet 
Coffee (black)


Food is BOMB
Selection was ON POINT and NOT TOO OVERWHELMING
Restrooms are CLEAN and got COOL RUSTIC LIGHTS
Tables FANCY and RUSTIC
Table wait time PLACE WAS EMPTY
Take out wait time is QUICK
Customer service is GREAT
Ambiance FANCY
Kitchen SUPER CLEAN
Chef is super chill and big (so don't piss him off)

* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

I love love love their menu and food quality! Also very clean.  If I were to make ANY change I'd tone down the music & maybe make the music a bit mellower. 

So nice to have so many options of great food!   Today I split 2 entrees w/ a friend & we tried chix sausage pizza on lavish, a bison burger w/ jicama fries (fries served cold - yummy!). EVERYTHING was excellent!

The workers are always energetic and welcoming! It's really a different environment when people actually like being there. 

I always order the bbq chicken pizza since I feel less... Guilty. LOL it says it's healthy so it must be, right? But honestly, their bbq chicken pizza is amazing!! I've also tried their chicken quinoa salad or something like that & that was also really good! 

The cucumber water is also a nice touch! Very refreshing!

After just 4 visits here I've walked away thinking it's way overpriced for what you get. I also share Cayenne E's thought that the food itself was bland. I am not a fan of their jicama fries, I ended up tossing them in the trash. A simple California Grilled Chicken sandwich was one of the most boring things I think I've ever had since I moved to Las Vegas. It was flat out flavorless. The only thing that is saving Greens and Proteins from a 1 star review is their Acai Berry Smoothie and the Green Shake which I would actually go back for. But even their drinks seem to be way overpriced for what you get...and yes I'm aware that it's not cheap to source the stuff that goes into the drinks. 

Add in service that was painfully slow along with a not very friendly attitude and I don't see myself gracing their doors again for a long time. Also parking is a pain as the Starbucks next door draws a lot of traffic so the idea of fighting for a space just to get bland food and an overpriced smoothie is not appealing. 2 Stars...but that's only because I'm being nice and want to save 1 Star reviews for places that truly deserve it.

To be perfectly fair... All I eat are greens and proteins! So for me this place is like coming home to a perfectly prepared meal. I was blown away by the low calorie options, by the huge selection and by how great everything tastes. If you can tolerate the pretentious yoga pant wearers and the obviously into fitness body builders then this place is amazing!
Sooo good I could just go here everyday if it were one in Hollywood...please open one or more in LA. This is so good and healthy.

Looking for a healthy place to hit after the gym? This is it!

Although it's in the Henderson area, I try to swing by every so often. 
Their wellness drink is amazing. It reminds me of the Naked juice- Green Machine (It looks disgusting but it tastes so good!).

Food wise, their thai peanut chicken satay is good for a small snack. 
Their BBQ chicken pizza is delicious as well. 

Honestly, I would've never thought eating pizza and burgers would be so healthy!

This is going to sound strange but this place was TOO - GOOD.  I had the salad with seared ahi and wOW.. It was great. I was looking for something healthy and nothing too heavy- this did the job.  I also had a watermelon drink and that was also seriously tasty.  The portions for both are hefty and I left feeling so stuffed.  And overwhelmed with how high the quality of food was.  they have so many nutritious options to choose from and all their drinks seem super appealing. This is the kind of place that you can go to for breakfast, lunch, dinner & dessert.  It's an all around great little joint if you're feeling like you can go for some greens and a more wholesome range of foods.  

Service was quick.  Received my food pretty fast and I was able to devour it that much quicker.  Everyone working there seemed pretty nice too.  

The price of the food here is reasonable because you're paying for some good quality food.. So of course, it's going to be priced a bit higher than other fast food places.  But really- it's worth it.
Greens and Proteins is healthy, fast, and a great place for lunch. The entire shopping center is quickly becoming the go to spot for food on Eastern.

My wife and I eat at Greens and Proteins a lot, at this location and the one on West Flamingo.  The food is good and the people seem to always be nice.  My complaint is that when you submit an order on their app and you go to pick it up, it's never ready and sometimes not even started.  Then they tell you it will be ready soon.  So you sit in the dining area and wait...and wait...and wait and then you go to the counter to get your food that's been sitting there for who knows how long.  They don't call out your name or come and find you in the dining area.  This has happened to me or my wife several times but only at the Rainbow location.  We use the app to save time and make it easier but this location seems to not value our time.  We'll go to the other locations until this one figures it out.

It's been a while since my first visit, but the food was still just as great during my second visit. I like the healthy eating options, the large menu, and simplicity. 

Turkey Club ($9.99): Sliced turkey, turkey bacon, lettuce, and tomato, and Russian dressing on a whole wheat hoagie. Added sweet potato fries for $1.50. Decent sandwich, however, not a lot of flavor. I added some S+P and condiments (ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise) and it improved significantly. Sweet potato fries were good.

Bison Burger ($10.99): Grilled Bison burger, vegan cheese, and LTO on a whole wheat bun. Side of tofu fries. I believe they use Daiya vegan cheese, which I loooove! Plus, it's available at no extra charge! Again, very little flavor as you need to add your own condiments and seasoning, but you can do it to your liking. This was delicious! The patty was tender and cooked just the way I wanted (medium rare). Plus, the tofu fries are awesome! 

Extra Lean Certified Angus Beef Burger ($9.99): This is also grilled and accompanied by LTO. I added avocado and chose lettuce bibb for a low-carb option. Another great burger!

The best part of their menu are all the choices and options. I was delighted that they have a vegan cheese option for burgers at no additional cost. The burgers, sandwiches, and wraps can be paired with whole wheat buns/hoagies/wraps, spinach wraps, and protein-style options like Bibb lettuce or cooked cabbage. Everything is so customizable and they have so many options to fit several diet needs. There is also a build-your-own-meal section.

This is a great place. The menu is overwhelming at first as there's a ton of options but so far I've been here about four times and the food and service has been excellent each time. 

The grilled asparagus is great, the teriyaki chicken wrap is phenomenal (and healthy) and my wife has had the soup, lavosh and other options and she's loved them. 

Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.
Everything made to order.  Using the best products.  But be prepared to pay for it.  This place is not cheap.  What price do you put on your health?

Really enjoyed the food....This was my first time eating bison and I must say it was yummy...I'm now in search of a eatery in my area that serves bison. Everything was delicious and healthy which is extremely important to me as a physique competitor. I will check this place out again when I return to Vegas for a visit,

Loved this place!  I've been twice and will definitely be back.  Everything is super fresh and healthy.  The Chocolate Avocado Peanut Butter Banana Shake was killer! I admit I was a bit afraid after reading all the ingredients.  I didn't think it was taste so damn good.

This is definitely a place to try and convert the non-healthy eaters as long as they're brave.  I've also had the turkey burger.  Nothing flashy, but good taste, juicy and fresh bread.  Just the knowledge that all the ingredients are free of all the garbage of any other turkey burger I'd get elsewhere makes you feel so much better about the meal.

Super good. Feel good food.

I ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza. I was so hungry I couldn't snap a pic in time. In fact, I had to eat the pizza before my guest could even sit down to start eating his pizza. 

The place is legit, the workers are friendly, and the food is fresh. A+ five stars from me.

Fantastic!

We had accidentally came across this place I caught a quick glimpse as we were driving to the gym and immediately decided to go here after our work out for lunch after looking at the menu and seeing bison and ostrich! 

I had the ostrich burger and my boyfriend had the bison burger each with a side of jicama fries. It was so good we didn't even talk during our meal! We were totally glued and hypnotized by our meal!

The cucumber lemon water is delicious and fresh. 

My boyfriend had the straight to the heart juice (lowest calorie option) and boy was the probably one of the best unique juices I have tried in a long time!

This place is so good and healthy they aren't afraid to publish any of their calories from the meals to juices to even the sauces. This is extremely helpful for us as we count calories and are very strict with our intake. 

We will be back and are looking forward to trying different things on the menu (however it'll be hard to stray away from the straight to the heart juice)

The management and employees are excellent. The place is clean and has a very nice feel for it. It's quiet and bright. Great for a quick lunch by yourself, business lunch, date with your significant other, even a dinner! Highly recommend!!

See you soon!!

I'm a regular at this place
I am always battling my weight, and this place does it all for me, breakfast lunch dinner

It's not only for health nuts and dieters, the food is really good. 
It's insane they make tofu and kale taste good

It's an ok location, centrally
But parking is a b**** in the afternoon

I get the wellness shake every time
All your fruits and veg are in there

They do steak, bison, cod, salmon and stuff for proteins
I wish they had Sea bass
I'd be there 14 times a week

Some people think it's expensive 
Yeah kind of, but it's worth it. Because I like to see cooks preparing my food, I like the calorie count on display. 

Staff is friendly, the tables and floors and utensils are always clean, and the bathroom is never gross. 


I love this place
I wish there were more. 
I wish they were open 24/7 cause of the gym and Starbucks and tanning salon is, that's the only bad thing.


*****Update:
My neighbor in Lake Las Vegas is a world renowned Chef and restauranteur with two 3 Star Michelin Awards. Very well known with cookbooks and his products are sold in Williams Sonoma.

I took him here for a quick wellness shake, he enjoyed it. 
Recently, I brought him in for a quick bite, and the restaurant was about 5% full. 

He ordered a pizza or flatbread, and I asked him to try my multigrain pancakes. 
He said no. 
I urged him repeatedly. 
He finally tried it and said "my God ... Are you kidding me??? Agave nectar instead of syrup?"
 
It exceeded his expectations. And looked around the place, he said "this is a good thing going on in here"

One bite turned into half my plate.  
He asked who the owner of the restaurant was, but I didn't see him. He likes to introduce himself when we are out and he is impressed. 

Those pancakes made a great impression on a French Gourmet chef. 
I urge a side of the if you come in the morning...

I haven't had anything I didn't like. 
But also haven't tried the whole menu, being a creature of habit. 

Spa water is available for free, they even carry the quest bars, and sometimes the Man Bake peanut butter cookies. 

I have to diet or I will look like a meat ball. 
But when I eat here, it's not bland diet food. So I actually enjoy it, and I love meeting other people who like this place too. 

They have I think 3 now, I've only visited 2.

Loved my veggie wrapped in Napa cabbage! Got takeout from here once, rice and veggie bowls, though, and there were NO condiments, so everything was pretty darned bland. I come to places like this to steal ideas for my home cooking.

3 stars because the food is always good....but today my husband waited 35 minutes for an order of buffalo strips and a BBQ chicken pizza. The people who came in 15 minutes after him got their food which was an order of buffalo strips, a bbq chicken pizza AND steak tacos! So we are guessing they gave them our food by mistake and forgot about our order. We both work in the industry so we understand sometimes people mess up and things happen but the staff did not even voice this screw up to my husband, instead they let him wait and when he finally asked why it was taking so long, they quickly made our food. It's a shame because we love greens & proteins but after this we won't be returning to this location again.

I love Greens and Proteins (especially the one on Eastern) and was pretty excited when I got back into town and discovering that this location in downtown has finally opened. 

Okay, I'm just going to get down right to it... here's my review They need to be consistent on how they make their food. I ordered build your own plate - chicken, steamed broccoli, and basmati rice. They served uncooked rice?  And the broccoli was not steamed at all? Hmmm... something must be off the night I came in. Regardless, if I was the manager, or the person expediting the food, I will make sure the food is made right. Uncooked rice? Not okay. And then the server asked me, should we make you another one? No, sir, I've got somewhere to go.

I should have demanded my money back.
Simple food that is prepared well!  Very different eating out experience.  Great for a nice healthy meal after the gym.

This was my first time trying this place and I'm glad that I did. I had the Bison Burger cooked medium rare with cheddar cheese wrapped in cabbage instead of a bun. Well, the beef was cooked perfectly and had great flavor but my complaint is with the Cabbage. Bib lettuce is typically what restaurants use for that crispness and clean bite. The cabbage was well...flavorless and hard to eat. Every bite I had to pull and strands from the ribs of the Cabbage would get stuck in my teeth as well as not being able to be bitten off cleanly. The cabbage made an otherwise great breadless burger kinda ick.

The sweet potato fries were awesome and tasty.

I will definitely come back to this location but I may need to bring my own lettuce to eat with it since the Cabbage has got to go.

I am visiting from out of town.  I had heard about Greens and Proteins from friends.  I was very impressed with the decor, the staff was helpful and knowledgeable, and most importantly the food was fantastic.  I ordered a sample of items.  

I started with a green mixture called the Wellness Drink.  Considering the host of healthy ingredients, I was impressed how great the drink tasted.

The Thai Chicken Satay was cooked perfectly.  The peanut sauce an excellent compliment.  These skewers rivaled the best Thai restaurants!

My wife had the Teriyaki Chicken wrap.  The tofu fries are a must have.

I plan to go by for another sample tomorrow!!!

Let me start off by saying this place is amazing my wellness is always on point and food is always great, sadly last night I had a terrible experience.
So I come to greens and proteins every morning mon-fri before work I always get the wellness drink and George has got me hooked on the berry parfait and the Turkey sausage with egg whites I usually get both and have the parfait for lunch.
My bad experience came Tuesday evening my siblings came to town from Arizona so I wanted to treat them to a good healthy dinner so i took them to greens and proteins, there was two girls there the taller of the two who I have never seen before was extremely extremely rude towards us my brother asked a question and she just rolled her eyes at him and walked away, then 5 min later I ask her if I can help myself to a few cups for water her response was " I GUESS YOU CAN" MY jaw dropped I could not believe it never ever have they treated me like that at greens and proteins I wanted to say something to the other girl who by the way looked like she was working by herself since she was doing everything that's the only reason why I didn't bother her. I don't know what was worse the rude girl or the guy  cursing up a storm. 
Anyway I still went in today and I got my usual, great thing is the rude girl from last night wasn't there!! George and the other girl were there, I guess I should just come in during the day and stay away during dinner time..

Came here for the first time, ordering was confusing but then again I think it became confusing because the person at the counter could have cared less that a was waiting to order and a gentleman went directly to order and she helped him before me. Granted I guess I was in the wrong spot but directing customers to avoid unnecessary  delays would be helpful. Other than that, the club wrap I had was very delicious and the sweet potatoes are very yummy! Once I ordered, pick up time was fast.

Might just be me but this location seems to consistently be better than the Flamingo one. The simple difference in just the tofu fries and the way things are cooked seems better. The WIFI is better too lol. The staff especially the managers are always above and beyond.

Food is fresh and clean, however is way overpriced for the portion size of protein you get. You are basically paying $15 for a bowl of lettuce - very small portion of both ahi tuna and steak. Soups are good, but again overpriced for what they are. Their juices are a bit more reasonable considering money for value, and all the ones I've had are pretty tasty.
"I really want a rooty tooty fresh and fruity... But I'll settle for this delicious healthy Greek scramble!

SO FAR for what we had this place was good, we had the pancakes and ceaser salad witl grilled chicken. The smoothies were not what we were used to because we lile them a bit thicker butbthey were flavorful still, it is pricey. The staff was very friendly and fast and the place was very clean. We will come bavk and try other stuff but this place gets some very low reviews so we will see next time for ourselves how it will be for stuff lile the Bison burger and wraps and stuff.

The owners reached out to me within hours of my previous post.
Mr. Haggerty took the time to meet me at a location convenient to me & explained how he is using my incident as a training tool.
I'm very impressed with the response and appreciate the passion he puts into this business.
It's good food and I'm glad I get to continue to enjoy healthy food away from home.
Try the bison... lean, mean and delicious.

My first time visiting and it was a hit for me. I enjoy a healthy meal and decided this will be nice since I live on the same block. I ordered the Ahi Tuna Tacos. It was fresh and tasty. I was somewhat apprehensive about trying the shakes and juices, but was offered a sample of the wellness drink. Yummy!!! I'm now a fan. If I had more room in my tummy I'd order more but, theres always time for tomorrow. I would definitely recommend.

Greens and Proteins was the 1st health food quick service restaurant I noticed in the area. The food and smoothies are delicious and the employees are patient and helpful. It takes a minute to receive your order but that's because they are making it fresh for you. Now that I can order ahead, the experience is seamless and I'm happy every time. Thanks G&P!
Such a healthy place to eat. Your food is fresh they make it right after you order it. Great an environment.

Healthy food that's close by and conveniently made with love! I really like this place, and the owner is a total sweetheart. I remember my first visit, he was so welcoming and offered me samples of some of the delicious juices. Mind you, this isn't a weekly type of place for me to frequent, but when I do, I'm always well taken care of by the staff. The wait might be long, but you have to remember this is NOT FAST FOOD! This is food with your health in mind as they're grilling away in the back! Every time I take a bite into the food, I just take the love and quality in the food. I could have easily spent about an hour getting this same meal prepared, but I rather have the big guys in the back do their thing! I love the turkey burger with the vegan cheese. I'm no vegan but man do I love me some vegan cheese. Go ahead and charge me that $.90 extra baby, I don't mind! I've totally made it a habit now to get either vegan cheese slices or shredded vegan cheese during my grocery trips. 

The sweet potato fries are also very much made with love. The last time I think they were a bit too soggy, but it's probably my fault for ordering to go and getting stuck in 45 min worth of traffic.

I ordered a friend the bison wrap and there were definitely no complaints there. This place knows good food, and always takes care of you. Last time I went with both my kids, my youngest had a really bad ear infection and was so irritable she couldn't even sit still. The cashier was kind enough to let me sit in my car and bring the food out.

I think small things like that, going out of her way to help make mine easier, are the reasons I come back to places. I know I can get the same ingredients and make it at home, but when there are people that genuinely care about what you eat and your visit, it makes you want to keep coming back!

This is my new favorite spot in Las Vegas for a healthy quick bite! I heard about this place from a friend and I have been addicted ever since. 

What I order:
- Turckey Burger plain wrapped in a Lettuce shell. It is amazing, low cal and low carb.
- Tofu fries. They taste like cheese sticks! SOO good. I dont care for the Jicama fries, skip those unless you are on an ultra healthy kick. 
- Cup for water. This is a MUST. They have free cucmber infused water, it tastes wonderful. 
- Juice. The ginger limeade is my favorite! It is under 200 calories and packed with healthy fruits and veggies! i neer imagined I would crave a green juice, but it tastes sooo good! It is the perfect consistancy to drink and stays cold long enough to enjoy it. 

Best part: This place is packed with healthy people all the time! So if you are like me and need some insiping to get your soft butt to the gym, check this place out to eat! There are lots of HOT guys (and girls) to check out. They also have wifi so I can yelp. 

Make sure you check in to get a dollar off a juice/smoothie :)

Only downfall, it is slightly pricy. If you are on a Jr. Bacon Cheese diet, this isnt your place. But remember, spinach, tofu and fruits arent cheap to buy.
The food is great. I will definitely go back again. I got the chop salad, and loved it. My daughter got the buffalo chicken wrap. She liked it, but it was a little too spicy for her.

Come here after reading the Amazing reviews. Food was totally low quality and terrible. I had the quinoa chicken salad. It was pretty much quinoa with a few  pieces of chicken. The dressing was very some kind of Asian flavor, could not make up if the chicken was old or the dressing was bad. Well $11 later I went to eat lunch somewhere else. Would not recommend it for sure.

Everything I have ever eaten here is delicious and beautiful. Thank you for the complimentary fruit infused water and recyclable everything. We have been enjoying your vegan gluten free pizza for ever and finally had breakfast today. I ordered the soy and tofu wrap with tofu fries and it was to die for. I love how you spice everything. The portion of the wrap was perfect but it could have used a couple more fries.

Three stars means A-OK, and so far this is my experience with Greens & Proteins.   I do have yet to try any of the food, so when I do get around to doing that, I will update my review.  

I want to give it more stars, because I have really enjoyed both of the drinks I've purchased at this place.   

First time, I had the "Green Leaf Berry Blast".   A nice mix of berries and leafy greens.  It came out a sort of purplish-brown color but it really tasted great and filled me up.

The second time, I had the 'Wellness Drink', which is a mixture of green grapes, apples, limes, some other fruits and then a bunch of leafy greens.    The taste was fresh and fantastic, and it really hit the spot after my workout.    So yummy and it has all that good stuff in it.  

Customer service was fine both visits.   My drinks were ready in a snap.   The atmosphere of the place is inviting and comfortable and it works with their health-conscious atmosphere.   I could see myself eating here.

So why 3 stars?   I'm deducting one star because at 8 bucks a pop, well it seems a bit pricey for a cup of juice.  But that doesn't keep me away. 

The other star I am deducting for 2 reasons.   Lack of nutritional info and the use of agave nectar in every drink offering.   I track everything I take in, and I would think a place that serves up healthy food could offer more than a simple calorie count.  How much sugar is in these drinks?    Macros are important to my lifestyle.   I would like to see a more comprehensive breakdown.

And the agave is extra sweetener that is just unnecessary and really not a healthy choice IMO.

I am eager to try some of the food offerings.    I will update or offer up a better review at that time.
REALLY AMAZING food! great for after the gym workouts or anytime really. Their Drinks are tasty!
Awesome! You must have a palate for wholesome foods. This place was great. Had a decent raw food menu as I enjoyed the raw pizza

This place is great for all types of eaters, they have so many vegan, vegetarian, and meat-eater options! Their smoothies are really good, but I would not recommend taking your kids here. I love the hummus plate and the veggie burger! The tofu fries are really good too! They have cucumber water and it's really tasty! I would tell anyone to try this at least once!

I am not from the Las Vegas area, but every time I do get in to the area, I make sure to get a meal from Greens and Proteins. I found this out-of-state gem after my first day at EDC. The catch here though is the price. Good, quality, food comes at a premium. If you're not willing to spend money on the best that your body should have, then this is not the place for you.

The restaurants are well maintained, their flavored water is fresh and always hits the spot. I had their BBQ chicken pizza, an Acai bowl, and one of their wellness shakes. Delicious.

I love Greens and Proteins! I love taking my friends to try their amazing food! My personal favorites are the pita and hummus, the jicama and tofu fries, the pizzas, and most recently - Pumpkin Chai Tea Latte. This is such a filling, satisfying drink. The flavor is incredible! My husband, who is a very picky eater, loves the burgers and pizzas. Definitely worth checking out. While I am happy that this place is so popular, it's super busy! I look forward to the west side location to open! Just wish there was another one on my way to work and open at 5:30am!

I'm SO HAPPY I finally got to try Greens and Proteins after living here for 1.5 years!! This wasn't the best place to come for hangover food but I'm sad I waited so long to try this place out! Really unique menu items and good for a gal that's watching what she eats as everything has the calorie count and I think most menu items are only in the 300 calorie range. Things coming out were pretty fast but I have to come back again to try a green smoothie here! Check in on Yelp and I think you can get $1 off any smoothie.
A bit spendy and worth every penny. Super delicious nutritious food. I'd eat here every meal if I was more wealthy. Friendly, helpful service in a clean well lit venue. This is as good as it gets.

I'm always thrilled when a new vegan-friendly place opens, and G&P does not disappoint! I got to try out their vegan pizza and some of their smoothies at a yelp event, and loved them all!  The peanut butter chocolate smoothie is crazy rich and sweet and would make a great dessert -- but it's still full of fruits and veggies! How do they do it?  I totally dug the vegan pizza - lavash crust with plenty of Daiya plus roasted peppers, kalamata olives and basil. 

I returned for a wellness shake (green veggies magically blended with ginger and other delicious items) that felt healthy but  tasted like a treat.

For lunch today, I tried the vegan burger with tofu fries.  I love these tofu fries!! They are actually more like vegan chikin fingers? nice-sized slabs of 'fu coated in a light batter, deep-fried and sprinkled w/ paprika.  I added a bit of salt and hot sauce, then they were perfect!  The burger comes on a whole wheat bun, but has no condiments.  They need some Vegenaise up in there, stat.  The burger was quite tasty and I left full and happy for ~$10 including tax and tip.

The juices are a bit pricy (~$7), but not so bad if you use them as a meal replacement.  Also you can check in on the Yelp app for iPhone and get $1 off juices and smoothies!

As a bonus for dine-in guests, they have DELICIOUS water. I'm not crazy! They make a sort of agua fresca with cucumbers and lemons, and it is damn good and so refreshing! Perfect for washing down your healthy items.

Not organic enough, not gluten free enough.  A tiny bit vegan friendly as long as you eat any old vegetables, and most vegans don't. We pay attention. My regular cities where I dining are NYC and LA so by comparison it may have led to me be harsh with only two stars because for vegas this place might be a three or four star but for overall healthy food restaurants coast to coast it is a solid 2 star. My preferred combo of gluten free and vegan was too much for this place. That's normal. So, Conscious eaters need not apply. I was drawn in by the name because it sounded like something on Abbot Kinney - the hippest spot in Venice, CA. It's not truly a healthy food restaurant if you're actually into ACTUAL health food. If you're in transition from Chili's, Subway, TGIF's etc then this is a great stepping stone to Whole Foods or the vegan menu at the Wynn. The young guy behind the counter was not interested in my questions to determine what I could eat that had no eggs and no gluten. The answer "Not sure" when I ask if something has eggs or gluten is a bit of a lame response. The answer to what I could eat there was nothing so it didn't really matter anyways after all. My friend ordered a BBQ chicken pizza for takeout and devoured it, but since he regularly eats at Jack in the Box and McDonald's taking his word for quality food feedback is hardly realistic. In fact, his diet was so foul we had to cut way back on the hanging out. TMI. Still, people who go here seem to be enjoying it and the smoothie though not organic, that I took one tiny sip of, was pretty good. If you're not crazy picky about what you eat you'll love it and if you're a food snob keep driving.
My favorite is the Wellness Smoothie and the Bison cheesesteak wrap in a spinach tortilla!  The smoothie is cold liquidy and just delish!
Awesome, my first visit after hitting the gym next door. ordered the banana split smoothie with almond milk DELISH!!!
Stupidly expensive for what you get. Make sure to be picky on what bun you get because I had no idea the regular one is made of cardboard and asshole juice. The tofu fries were delicious though. :)

Place was perfect and decently priced. I'm going to go back for sure. I ordered a bison wrap and it took a while but it was made fresh after I ordered it. I liked the wrap because it didn't fall apart as I was eating it. My wife also got a wellness shake and she thought it was great, if you like stuff that tastes like melted lettuce.

My girlfriend pick this place.  I'm allergic to soy, tree nuts and peanuts.  Definitely not the place to go for me.  They're not allergy friendly.  I was told they can't guarantee if there what I order won't have a trace of soy, tree nuts and peanuts.  Yup....

Was doing the no-carb thing for a while, and was really hungry. Vegetarian co-worker suggested this place. 

Food was edible; I think I ordered the wrong thing. I got the Buffalo Spinach Wrap and was pretty disappointed. It was pretty bland and mushy and all I could really taste was the wrap itself, which is pretty damn disappointing when you were paying for Bison meat. The Jicama fries were nice, but cold; didn't realize they'd be raw. Silly me. I actually didn't finish my meal, and at $14, that was a pricey "ugh,". 

One of my other co-workers had a smoothie that looked absolutely wonderful, and another had a little pizza thing that looked lovely. Not a place I would normally choose to go for lunch, and I think my inexperience may have done me wrong here. 

I am pretty generally of the opinion that Vegans, Raw Foodists, and their Health Food Prophets care more about how well their food follows certain rules than how it tastes. 

Greens and Proteins kind of tastes like compromise. Mmmmm...compromise.

Yeah. No. I'll probably be back in the future; the Smoothies look great, and I hope I just ate the wrongest thing. I'll give this place another try in the hopes that something else I order is enjoyable. Otherwise, I just felt like I was paying triple price for grocery store deli food in order to say "I'm healthy! I eat raw vegan carrots!."
Great place to get a high quality protein and carb meal. Highly recommend. Smoothies are amazing too.

I come here regularly for a quick healthy snack, usually order one of the freshly made juices.  The tofu fries are very tasty and amazingly seasoned, however the menu states they are BAKED when they are actually FRIED, they automatically lose two stars for the false advertisement (which I've complained to management several times and STILL haven't changed on their menu).

There are about 5 or 6 different fresh juices on their menu and they do taste good, but they could use a little more variety.  Nearly all of their juices contain grapes and agave nectar.  Their Wellness Drink, which contains spinach and kale, also adds too much pineapple, orange and agave, making this fresh juice overly sweet.

They are located across the LVAC so there are a lot of people coming from the gym seeking a healthy meal.  But don't be fooled!! A lot of their menu IS healthy however things like sauces, cheeses, dough, batter etc. almost defeat the purpose here.  If you're truly seeking wholesome order the plainest rawest things on their menu.

I go to greens & proteins for the convenience and taste, but think there are better similar establishments.  Also a little pricey but have a large menu to choose from.

Imagine you just finished up a great workout and you don't have the energy to cook a good and healthy post workout meal. You panic!! You only have 30-45 min to make that post workout meal count. So you hop in your car and drive all around town in hopes to find a remotely healthy restaurant! 25 mins go by and you still can't find a thing, so you just enter the nearest drive through and order a burger and fries with a diet coke (because you're on a diet)lol . What I'm trying to say is that it can be hard and an inconvenience to eat healthy especially if you don't have the time to cook at home. Now with greens and proteins all that ends! They have a HUGE menu with lots of options! All nutritional facts are listed on everything they offer! Fast service! With a fantastic ambience!! Food is delicious!! And doesn't make you feel groggy after you eat it!! The only issue I see is that it can be a tad bit expensive at times! But other than that I HIGHLY suggest this restaurant to anyone trying to watch their girlish figure!!

The ginger limeade is my favorite drink. It's perfect in its taste with ginger and lime. I also love the vegan options. A must try is the vegan cheesesteak. It was so good and filling I could only eat 1/2. It is slightly expensive a drink and meal cost about 25 but the taste is worth it.

Food is basic for the cost of it. The pricing is disturbing. $2.00 EACH for extras such as 1/2 c of rice??? 
I ordered a tuna salad to go and it was less than a cup of made salad and probably less than 2oz of tuna within the salad. The rest of the salad consisted of extra large diced vegetables. 
I was very disappointed with the cost and portion size for mediocre food.

Great food, great atmosphere and fabulous coffee. We were here in July.  They make everything as it is ordered, so no old food sitting around. They made such a terrific Mocha (with cinnamon and chili) that my dearest ordered a second one.  When we go back to Las Vegas, we will happily go back.

Decor - amazing! It matched the healthy theme of food and was very inviting.

Selection - you won't get bored! They have so many healthy options that look and sound delicious and fresh!

Taste - I had the greens shake (something I could have made at home) but the price was okay for the convenience and it tasted perfect to its name (apples, kale, banana, and other greens).

We also had the bison burger (wow!) juicy! They have crispy and tasty sweet potato fry options and the kids pizza was huge! My kids loved it.
BBQ chicken pizza was great for less than 500 calories!! Husband ordered angus Philly cheesesteak sandwich and jicama fries. He said the sandwich was delicious but not a fan of the fries.

The best place in LV if you are looking for a healthy option! We ate here several times, their angus wrap is superb, I really enjoyed the berry granola and the build your on plate option is really nice! When I asked for some modification in my fritatta they provided it without hesitation. Loved their food and their attitude!!

I was in the mood for something different and asked around the office if there is anywhere new and where I should go.  A co-worker suggested I try this place out.  I ordered the turkey tacos that I believe were the daily special and WOW was I surprised!  The flavor was so amazing!  There were three decent sized tacos that filled me up and left me not feeling guilty about my lunch choice.  I cannot wait to come back and try many more items from the menu.  So excited to have this option close to the office!
Really good never been here. Service was great environment chill and the BBQ vegetarian pizza was bomb.com. My husband got the impossible cheesesteak delicious. Definitely coming back.

5 Stars and I didn't even eat here... HAHAHA 
Came here Saturday evening because my boyfriend wanted something healthy and yummy.. I've had this place bookmarked forever and wanted to give it a go.. The only thing is I'm doing a detox which means no food so I just went with him to watch him eat and take big whiffs of his food LOL It is located right by LVAC on Flamingo/215 which is the perfect location for it. Everyone eating at G&P looks like either they just worked out, are about to work out or like they love working out.. Very healthy, clean and fresh feel to the place. You order at the counter and someone brings your food out to you. Everything on the menu looks so good and I love how they have the calorie count for everything. 

My man ordered: 
_The build your own protein plate with chicken breast ($9.99,) broccoli, cous cous and bbq sauce- I thought it was going to be a small portion but it was more than enough and it looked delicious~
_Hummus plate ($5.99) - comes with plain hummus and roasted pepper hummus, served with soft pita and crunchy lavosh~
_Green Shake Smoothie ($7.50) - I love how they don't add sugar to their smoothies... This smoothie in particular is over 600 calories though!!! But it is loaded with all the good stuff. I had some sips of this.. It's very rich & creamy and definitely would a great meal replacement! 

My bf said everything was very tasty and he had plenty left over..The prices are actually very reasonable compared to other "healthy" places and they cater to vegan, raw, gluten free and HCG diets! The service was great here too! Especially the guy who brought the food out.. Even though the silverware is self-serve by the fountain drinks he offered to go get them for my boyfriend and checked up on us a couple times~ 

I can't wait to actually eat here!!! aghhhhhh

Acai bowl was great, refreshing, but overpriced. Hummus and pita...confused why it tasted so bland. The texture was all wrong, hummus shouldn't hold the shape of a scoop of ice cream. I didn't taste any of the spices, oil or lemon or anything that makes hummus taste like hummus. I think this is just not hummus, needs to be called something else. Actually tasting it again just now, it's kind of sweet. What is in this stuff? It couldn't be less like hummus.

Ordered food from this place, expecting it to be a good experience. I ordered chicken tacos with corn tortillas. I receive the order and my food is incorrect and the tacos are wrapped in lettuce instead instead of the corn tortilla I asked for. Being that there is an outbreak I would not have requested as the kind being used isn't specified. 


Called the restaurant to simply get my food remade. Did not even ask for a refund and the first thing she says is, " unfortunately we won't be able to refund the order." Which I never asked for! I just wanted the correct food that I paid for. 


She then tells me to contact GrubHub for a refund (though the order was placed correctly and had nothing to do with the driver or Grub Hub ordering service).


I called GrubHub only then to have the rep tell me that they are telling him a different story and that they aren't going to remake my food. The rep offers me a $10 credit which I never asked for. I JUST WANTED THE CORRECT FOOD. 


Will never return back to this place. Like come on it's a $10 item, I never wanted my money back. I just wanted my tacos to be made correctly.

Probably not for everyone but if you're looking for a healthy meal then check this place out! Some of the meals are bland but at least you know you're eating real food with healthy organic ingredients. The drinks are good, some are hit or miss - I recently got the green heart drink and it was way too gingery!
The breakfast burrito is always my go to meal after a workout. Not a big fan of the tofu fries though.

Service is great. Wait is never long. Food is always great. Staff is always quick and responsive when taking the order.

The only thing that gets me sometimes is the consistency of the drink I always order: Peanut Butter Chocolate Smoothie, no stevia, almond milk. Some days it's too thick. Some days it's looser. Some days it's more chocolate. Some days it's more peanut butter.

Other than that, a great place for when I don't feel like cooking on long,  busy work days.
Food is always fresh and tasty.  Service is good.  Place is clean.  I love this place.  Lots of healthy choices.

First visit was a take out order
I had the Angus beef burger 
Cooked just the way I wanted it cooked
Jicama fried were a disappointment was expecting hot and they are cold
Next time the sweet potato fries

The steak salad was awesome and surprisingly filling. The V9 juice was disappointingly bland-so bad, that I had to add some Tabasco to add some favor and even then it was sad. Fresh juice is supposed to be flavorful and vibrant. I had high hopes for this place

I ordered the G&P Veggie Burger with vegan cheese and a side of sweet potato fries. The burger itself I would rate a 6.5/10. I have yet to discover a really tasty veggie burger. It was decent but could've been better, especially for the price. On the bright side the sweet potato fries were DELICIOUS. A+ on that. I give this place 3 stars because I'm hopeful that they have really good food, I'll be going back again sometime in the future to try some other things.

I have been in love with Greens and Proteins for a few years and I love they are now open in the North. 

The menu is diverse and there is something for everyone as the name suggests. What is misleading but then becomes impressive is that you can have meat like bison and ahi tuna. 
I have a few favorites. Their large low carb caesar with chicken and cheese croutons is a definite meal. I barely finish it but I do! The carrot ginger soup is out of this world and is made to order using a Vitamix. My other go to is the turkey fontina broccoli frittata served with a salad. I tried the raw nachos, I am not a fan but raw food people with enjoy it. I also love that they have a delicious cucumber water that is offered as well. One thing I do know, I need to leave my comfort foods and try some new things on the menu because I will not be disappointed, that I know. I forgot I had the gluten free pizza and it was good, but not a total fan of the crust, but then again I am picky

There is no outdoor seating at this location, I will miss bringing Henry the Dog with me. The interior is bright and cheery and I love that they have stayed with metal utensils and interesting bowls and plates, it is a nice touch. My only minor complaint and it is me personal, the music always seems to be loud and if you are having a conversation it is like being in a bar and is on the noisy side. 

Can't wait to return!

OMG... I was in food heaven! :)  My friend and I decided to give this place a try because we were hearing such good things about it and about their vegan options.  So this what we ordered and shared:

1st dish:  Tofu and Soy Chorizo burrito...oh man, this was awesome.  The burrito was perfectly spiced and tasty.  I'm sure that any non-vegan would have never guessed that this was a vegan dish... it was that good.  The chorizo was da bomb!  The dish even came with tofu nuggets, which was amazing too.  They really need to add tofu nuggets as an appetizer.  I could eat that all day... just pop it in my mouth.

2nd dish: Granola toasted french toast... ok i must admit, that it wasn't  vegan because of the type of whole wheat bread that they used.. but it was all good with me cuz they didn't use egg to coat the granola to the bread.... so i just decided to try it.  It was delish!!!  The granola was mixed in with nuts, and raisins...mmm, mmm, mmm.  I felt like my breakfast turned into a dessert, but at the same time, it just tasted healthy. :) 

this place is like halfway between a fast food joint and a sit down restaurant... but to my surprise the dishes were visual appearing.  They took time to make it look pretty and presentable.   I was so hungry and the food looked so good, that I didn't take any pictures of my food.   I also think that the dishes are reasonably priced.  We paid less than $20 for both dishes....I love paying $20 or less for 2 people when I go out to eat.  Hey, when the food is good and the price is right, then that's an awesome deal. 

 I will go back for sure and order more off the vegan menu and try to take pics of it before I feed my face.  I recommend you try this place out and your taste buds will say thank you.

Very friendly staff and welcoming atmosphere. I ordered the chorizo burrito since it was a vegan option. Nothing amazing where it wild my taste buds. Same goes for the banana peanut butter smoothie. Total for the 2 was around 19 dollars. Id definitely come back and try other things. They also should expand their vegan food options.

After a few days of eating some rich and heavy food, my group wanted to be a little bit healthy. This definitely hit the spot for healthy! 

Service:
Nothing too surprising. It is a place where you order at the counter and you sit down, while the food is prepped and brought out to us. The workers were very friendly. Also, the time it took for the food to come out was extremely quick! 

Food:
This was a refreshing meal because everything was so natural and so clean. Everyone enjoyed the food and the smoothies were delicious. I will say that I was surprised from the jicama fries. I did not know it was a vegetable and when I put it in my mouth, I was extremely surprised because I was expecting deep fried goodie. But overall, it was good. 

Atmosphere:
Very casual and very chill! Nothing to special, but the aesthetics match what they are selling. 

I would come back!

Amazing place for those into the health food lifestyle, or just anyone wanting a delicious, healthy meal or yummy smoothie. I love almost everything on the menu, especially their smoothies and breakfasts. It's a great place to sit and do some work on the laptop, or to get some fuel after a hard workout at LVAC.
I didn't feel guilty eating this meal after my work out. Got a chicken cabbage wrap with a Portobello mushroom. The mushroom had an amazing taste. I could eat this all day.
Always out first stop when we go to Vegas! Great healthy eats! The bison wrap is amazing!

Greens and Proteins is by far my favorite restaurant in the  Rainbow Sunset Pavilion plaza.  I work right in the area and have been to G&P probably a dozen times.  Their food is super consistent in quality and always delicious (well, as good as healthy food can be).  The chicken quinoa salad is my favorite.

A basic lunch and juice will run close to $20, so it's definitely not a cheap bite.  However I think the quality of the food is completely worth it.  Plenty of parking around.  Highly recommend.

Five stars because this is the healthiest and delicious food restaurant I've found in Vegas with such a flexible menu! I'm definitely going to be back here A LOT and maybe even for a work + food session. Most of the food items breakdown the macros and there's many ways to have your meal prepared. The icing on top for me is the cucumber lemon water. No wonder there are five locations in Greater Vegas.

I like to imagine everyone wants to shop at whole foods on a regular basis, but of course the luxury of doing so involves shelling out the dollars for a fraction of items, as opposed to the loads of groceries you can get somewhere else. But this isn't a review about whole foods is it? I always think these health food places are just a fad, I reference that specific store because they are known for fresh deliciousness, I visit it from time to time, buying $15 juiced items when I feel like I want to support John Mackey and Rene Lawson Hardy. I love the movement of natural produce, I don't love the prices though, but let me just say Proteins and Greens surprised me, I honestly thought I would have I regret my purchase but I was fine! No buyers remorse!
First of all big shoutout to the cashier for so pleasantly manning the line, the situation was heavily trafficked and she did it effortlessly! She prescribed the right thing for me to try and now I fell in love with this lil gem of a healthy dine spot.
Bison cheesesteak and tofu fries. Let me just say I hate tofu (except one specific dish that my friends mother makes)... These fries will change your tofu-hating life. DELICIOUS.
Ok. Let's talk about the "Wellness Drink"
Green grapes, green apple, pineapple, orange, lime, wheat grass, kale, spinach, collard greens, ginger, flax seed, agave 

You know what. Done talking. 

'Twas a spectacular first for me.

4 star, it is a little pricey- If I'm already spending that I expect all organic.
Plus side: Whole Foods juiced drinks you get a tall for like what? 12 bucks
Here you're getting a Venti for 7.50
First place I go to eat when I'm in Las Vegas!  Great healthy food!
Great food the chicken wrap is great. They even have a small Vegan menu with pizza and nachos. Overall great place for a healthy living.
Consistent and delicious!  try the wellness drink! I can eat here everyday. The barbecue chicken pizza is my favorite.

Had the bison burger. It was pretty good! Added avacado for extra $$ 

Smoothies were watery. Had the chocolate veggiechino.

How difficult is it to listen to an order and get it right?!?... Apparently it's impossible for this dude,  shawn
Thanks for ruining my lunch...SKIP THIS PLACE, NOT WORTH IT...
Rude, ober expensive, Blah, at best.....

For my 50th review I wanted it to be a place I newly am in love with which is Greens & Proteins! I've visited them three times now and each time is amazing. They have an amazing menu of healthy items suited for any diet from Atkins to HCG. G&P has it covered.

On my first visit I ate their Crab and Avocado lettuce cups. It was very tasty and healthy. The lettuce cups came loaded with real crab! Definitely worth the $9.99 price tag. I also had their Wellness Drink! Let me tell you I am totally in love with their Wellness Drink (minus the pineapple cause i'm allergic). It only has 286 calories and  tastes amazing. I love the green grapes and the fact that they use agave nectar is perfect for my diabetes!!! 

On my next couple visits I ordered the Wellness Drink of course, but I brought my husband so I could try his drinks too! He tried the Apple Pie Smoothie. It totally tasted like apple pie! The one he got the other day though is almost as good as the Wellness drink ,but it's called the Tofu Banana Split! YUMMY! You can't taste the squash or any veggies that are in it. I recommend this one for your pickie eaters!

Greens and Proteins has a nice friendly staff and they are pretty knowledgeable about the food. They are a bit pricey, but the quality of the ingredients makes it worth it to me. I can't wait to go back to try some of their other food items, but I'll be back every chance I get for that Wellness drink!

After a night of drinking and dancing, we came here the next morning. I got the Green Leaf Berry Blast smoothie and it is simply, hands down, the best smoothie I've ever had in my life. I could call it a vegan milkshake instead, because it tasted JUST like ice cream. Places like this not only make it easy to be vegan, but so rewarding. My friend got the Apple Pie Smoothie and she really loved it. We both agree this is the best smoothie place as of yet. Gotta come back to try the rest of the menu.
Great food and service. Generous proportions... Thank you Greens and Proteins!

Lately I've noticed myself going here at least once a week. I eat extremely healthy and when I'm itching for a cheat meal I come here. Still healthy but just naughty enough to satisfy that burger craving. And if I choose for my cheat meal to be a burger it needs to be their bison burger.. always satisfies and cooked perfectly. The customer service is great!

I live this place and wish there were more places like it in Las Vegas. I usually get the Greek scramble. It is healthy and only $6.95. Can't beat it. Everything on the menu is really tasty. The mock lettuce chicken wraps are another one of my favorites. If you're hungover hit a few rounds of the complimentary spa water. Stay with G n P!

I love this place! I feel no guilt ordering a burger here since they design their food to suit athletic people. I love coming here after my workouts because i feel it's the perfect fuel I need! 

I've had some of their wraps and sandwiches and they're always amazing no matter what I get. Only thing I'm not really into is the jicama fries. I love jicama but they put a strange seasoning on them which I can't tell if I like or not but I usually can't eat them all. Only a couple. The tofu fries aren't bad at all! 

They also have awesome juices and smoothies that make you feel like a million bucks! I truly love the concept and wish there were more places like this all over town.
They have the best green smoothies and I've never been disappointed in the food. We called an order to go and Raul was super nice and helpful!

I came here in the later afternoon to have a smoothie with some friends.  I've been here once before and had an OK experience.  Today was the same.  

Today I decided to just get the Loaded Antioxidant Chiller for $5.99.  It had green grapes, blueberries, beets, pomegranate, agave nectar and ice.  To me, it was a little too sour for my taste buds.  There were a lot of seeds and kind of got irritating after a while.  A friend of mine had the wellness drink so I tried that too.  I found that it was more of my "speed."  Lots of greens and grass, etc.  

What I really appreciate is that this place is clean.  The colors are simple and crisp.  Combined with the food, you just feel like your body and mind is cleansed when you're done.  If you're ever in the mood for a healthy meal, go and try this place out.

Greens and proteins is amazing! Whenever I'm needing a low calorie snack I come here since I'm always watching what I eat :) I've tried the veggie burger, tofu fries, jicama fries, soyrizo tofu burrito, and all of the pizzas! The veggie burger is good and not dry and I love that they have the option to wrap it in lettuce. The jicama fries are a little weird since it's literally a cold root. Their tofu is awesome, it's firm and crispy which is definitely hard to make on your own. The Greek pizza on pita dough is to die for (it's also super low in calories.)

Everything is extremely delicious and priced fairly, which is surprising since healthy or low calorie foods cost a fortune nowadays. They also have a HCG menu which is awesome for dieting. 

 I also like this location since it is pretty spacious and everyone is super helpful and friendly. Great staff and clean tables! I highly recommend this establishment. They are also available on postmates which is awesome!

Great service: happy and patient hostesses and chefs.
Truly healthy food, and delivered fast!
Does it cost more than the average fast dining, of course, but you get way more nutritional value and the taste is fantastic.
I had a bison plate with broccoli, avocado, and walnut cilantro pesto. Delicious!
My girlfriend had the grilled turkey breast plate with broccoli, portobello mushroom, and the walnut cilantro pesto. She raved about it!
We split a Green Leaf Berry Blast smoothie which tasted just right and was loaded with fruits and veggies!
love the turkey burger :) after a great workout!

1st time here to check it out. We ordered 2 regular size Peanut Butter - Banana smoothies. I did not really pay to much attention to the list of ingredients. I was perplexed when they both came out green and gritty. The flavor was different and thats fine but I really was not expecting it to cost me $17.00 for 2 regular size smoothies. Really? Not coming back for smoothies but the food looks great. Good ingredients but it will cost you. I'll stick to Jamba Juice for my smoothie fix.

I needed something healthy and delicious. This was the place to go. Full in a not so bloated and horrible way, I ate like a queen. 

Grabbed the berry salad, 7 vegetable soup, grilled chicken wrap, Turkey bowl. Everything was so good and tasty. The Turkey bowl was probably the one entree that didn't have much wow factor. 

Great staff. Great ambience. Great tables.

Would come back here when I'm in Vegas without a doubt.

Love, love, love greens and protein. Delicious, smart clean eating with a modern,  simple approach. Modern in relevant and appealing food the young fit family will want but approachable to families and the older generation without the trendy, clich√© power foods of the moment.  Service is friendly and prompt with knowledgeable staff. There is a chef in the house so expect quality and high standards not just teenagers heating up 'healthier' cuisine at your local chain smoothie shop.  

My favorite meal items are the bison cheese steak on a Savoy cabbage wrap with tofu fries or the bbq chicken pizza gluten free crust. The smoothies are pricy at about $8 each but you do get very high quality fresh ingredients.  I recommend trying the free cucumber water that is on tap to enjoy.  Hydrating abs pallet cleansing.  G&P is always a great clean eating choice.  Simplicity in healthy offerings done with high standards.

Gave this palce a second chance.. i totallg dig it now! Love the wellness green shake totally healthy for you.. try their bbq chicken pizza and margerta pizza.. im so going here for pizzas now good bye papa john's and pizza hut hello to gourmet pizza and you dont feel guilty about it cause its healthy!
Omg!! This place is so so so good!! We got the ranch BBQ chicken pizza and it tasted better than CPK and its healthy!! We will quickly be regulars here because it's delicious!!!
I eat here too much!!! The quick and healthy options fit perfectly with my lifestyle. Plus the friendly staff makes you feel welcome. Ahi tuna tacos are my go to.

This place is my go to for an excellent post workout meal. The food is high quality and the staff is always super helpful and friendly. If you're lucky enough to deal with Kristen, you'll see exactly what I'm talking about.

This place has definitely lost a couple of stars.  If I wasn't a fan and didn't really, really wanna like this place, it would have lost even more.  I still appreciate what they do, but the quality is slippling. 

The last few visits have been a nightmare.  My fiance and I used to visit several times a week to get pizzas.  The last two times, the pizzas have been inedibly burned on the bottom.  One time, it took so long that we were given a complimentary drink.
