The last time we visited, my fiance and I ordered the exact same thing but I got my pizza literally TWENTY MINUTES before he got his.  I really think they forgot to make it, because when I asked the person who brought me my food about it, he scrambled into the kitchen and the workers suddenly hopped-to.  There was nothing resembling an apology either.  Also, the last time I got a Wellness Drink (my favorite), it was still chunky and wouldn't fit through the straw.  Eww.  I didn't notice until I left or I would have sent it back.  The Wellness Drink is SOOOO expensive, but I don't really mind... that is, if the quality matches the price.

A note to the owners of this place (because I've talked to you and I KNOW you read this):  Just because you get busy doesn't mean you can let the quality become inconsistent.  It's great to have an increased sales volume, but customer loyalty is important too.  I haven't recommended this to a friend for a while because, frankly, I'm not sure if it's going to be a good G&P day or a bad G&P day anymore.

I haven't been to G&P for a while.  I'm not really itching to return anytime soon either.

Amazing service, the food is really fresh and healthy, clean environment,clean tables,the most amazing part about this place is that they serve all natural sodas wow, first time I seen a all natural soda machine,this is great and is definitely will make us return many more times back,the greek pizza is awesome, the smoothies are not to sweet just right, the employees are friendly, good Job. THUMBS UP FOR ME
Big fan of the green lime smoothie and and the BBQ chicken pizza. Great healthy lunch option! I Highly recommend!

I first came here with a friend after some intense workout/yoga sessions. She got the protein cakes which were surprisingly really good. Usually with protein cakes, they're dry, rough, and you feel like you need a glass of water near by while you're eating them, not these protein cakes though! they were just right; fluffy, tasteful and healthy! The two times I've been here, I've gotten the the ginger green smoothie. I love all of the ginger that's in this drink and its refreshing taste. The only complaint I have about this place are its prices. Being that they're items are on the pricey side, it's probably not a place I would suggest going to every day. But of course when it comes to healthy, organic foods, the slightly high price is understandable.

While I have had nothing but good experiences with their branch on Flamingo the Rainbow location has proven to be nothing but challenged. The last four orders i have placed I have either not received an item, or they don't have an item and the only way to get my money back is to take time out of my day to either drive back to pick it up or call ChowNow to get a refund. You would think they would make doing business with them a bit easier. I think from here on out I will take my business elsewhere for lunch. Great Food, Bad Customer Service.

Not impressed at all, I've gotten better service at a drive-thru not to mention I even tipped!  From getting the wrong order to taking forever, to never ask if everything is okay with your food.  The smoothie and the sweet potato fries where the best part of the meal.

2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge  55/100

I was scanning yelp for a healthy restaurant for dinner, it was already 7:30ish pm, all the other healthy spots near by close at 8pm and this was the only one I found open till 10pm. Super happy they're open later than the others! 

I have been here a few times before, I've had their smoothies which are consistently tasty, blended well and healthy. (don't forget to use the check-in offer!) 

This time I opted for a meal since I just finished my lifting workout. I got the build your own HCG meal which comes with a choice of protein and vegetables. I got the grilled chicken breast, which was grilled perfectly. Tender and juicy on the inside. And steamed asparagus, which was cooked well. It also comes with a lemon slice and side sauce, tasted like a dijon mustard. Meal pricing is based on what meat you choose, chicken breast was $10. Packed in a reusable container. The portion size and price were just right. 

*** LOVES: 
- fast and friendly service! Cashier was nice and helpful with answering my questions and the guy cleaning up tables and serving orders was also friendly and helpful. He offered to check on my order so I didn't have to wait long. I really wasn't waiting long. ;-) 

- Loved the way it's designed. Clean, open, modern interior. Loved the green trim.
** complimentary cucumber lemon water. My choice of drink is always water, no matter where I go. Have to stay hydrated! 

Other likes: 
- tvs available to watch the game 
- not crowded or busy when we went (Thursday, 8pm) 
- a lot of healthy options, looking forward to trying them 
- new locations popping up all over the valley

Loved this place, will be back again and recommending to others! 

TIP: don't forget if you haven't used it, they still have the check-in offer,  $1 OFF smoothie!

I feel healthy and I also feel like Im making good food choices when I eat here. Its healthy when I don't feel like cooking or I want to treat myself I eat at greens and protiens, Its fast and healthy. Try the Bison burger with the tofu fries. Its amazing!

I absolutely love this place. They have multiple locations and every time I eat in their restaurant, it never disappoints. It consistent and delicious. I have tried a lot from their menu and my go to seems to be their delicious chicken wraps with the spinach wrap.. of course! I also add on their amazing sweet potato fries- which are the best sweet potato fries I have ever eaten. They also have amazing breakfasts here and comforting soups! 

Trust me when I say- this place will NOT disappoint. It's healthy and delicious and you just can't beat that.

You will always feel great after eating their healthy fresh food. I love the bison wrap with tofu fries and my favorite is the green wellness drink. The service here is outstanding! Great people great food!

This place is awesome for when you don't want to cook but still want to eat healthy. Not much to add to the review other than customer service was great, food was yummy and reasonably priced. I'll be back a lot during my journey back to being skinny.

Went here for lunch takeout. The meal we thought we'd preordered wasn't prepared, and we were told they were having systems issues. Even when we re-placed our order (two orders of Thai ginger soup and a hot tea), it took at least 15 minutes to come out to us. Their whole setup looked chaotic. The soup was... weird. I get using ground cashews to make something 'creamy' with no dairy, but the texture ended up pasty and odd. It was also under seasoned. To be fair, other food orders I saw coming out looked tasty. Final gripe: the single choice for hot tea was chamomile. No other herbal or green selections (not to mention black), and I wasn't informed until after I'd ordered and paid. Really people? The place was busy and clean and bright, so there must be some appeal, just not in my one experience

This was my first time going to a restaurant that offered really healthy dishes and foods of this scale. I came in here not knowing what to expect. It's a cute place with nice, fresh decorations! The cashiers were really nice and easy to talk to - they explained thoroughly any foods and drinks I had questions about. Though it is pricey, the quality of the food does show.

I got the summer berry salad, which consists of berries, spinach, goat cheese, and raspberry vinaigrette. The ingredients were really fresh! Some of the berries are REALLY sweet by themselves, but the taste can be easily toned down if you eat the spinach and goat cheese with it in one bite. The contents of the salad worked harmoniously with themselves!

I also got the white chocolate veggiechino, which is their healthier version of the frappucino. I don't remember what exactly they put in there, but they put a lot of greens that it made my head spin from reading the description. I was expecting it to taste like a veggie smoothie, but no! It was pleasantly sweet, even with all the greens they put in there. It didn't taste anything like Starbucks frappucinos at all, which was very nice.

Overall, I wouldn't mind coming here again. Maybe next time I'll try the Thai peanut chicken satays.

I love the staff here very nice people. I love doing the build your own with the salmon. I normally get the chicken but I got the salmon this time and it was delicious. The young lady in the register suggested i try the salmon and it was a good decision I love it

LOVE the health conscious menu, staff, and environment here! 

3/5 for the smoothie itself
5/5 for the stellar service 
5/5 for the impeccable cleanliness & tree/plant themed decor

I'm one of those people who have a lot of food allergies AND I'm lactose intolerant. 

While I try not to be too much of an inconvenience when I dine, I really really appreciate it when food establishments are happy to accommodate my dietary restrictions and food allergies. Greens & Proteins is one of those places. I got exactly what I wanted and it was not an issue whatsoever (what a relief)! I cannot even tell you the number of times I have received eye rolls or attitude from people when I have made special requests from other places. The staff at Greens & Proteins were so attentive and friendly!

I ordered the Chocolate Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie (mine with no banana & no avocado, with soy milk + extra scoop of soy protein). It was pretty dang tasty. 

I would definitely like to visit again to try their other smoothies and the food!

Another beautiful day in Las Vegas leads to another trip to the healthy oasis that is Greens and Proteins. They have recently revamped their menu making it easier to find the ingredients to their savory menu items. The staff always has a friendly smile on their face and are always willing to help you with anything, no matter if you are a first timer to a veteran. My wife and I hold the green ginger limeade as a staple here. It's a perfect blend of ginger, limeade, and the vegetables a rancher would scoff at. Their food is always seasoned to a T. The grilled vegetable wrap is an awesome choice for those time meat does not not sound appealing, but for those that want to get their meat on, the bison burger will definitely full the void. My personal favorite is the California grille chicken wrap. Don't forget to get your tofu fries! I know that sounds weird to be screaming out loud, but trust me, their sauce definitely will make you a believer.

The place screams come here and study or chill if you feel like it. I definitely will be coming back.

Not sure why this place is rated high.

Ordered their new taco addition... some kind of steak one. and I really couldn't tell what I was eating. Flavors just didn't work together for any effect.

Their green shake smoothie was also so-so... had better.
Place seemed to have traffic during lunch hour, so perhaps I just picked the wrong items? Would try again but yeah the initial discovery was less than impressive. 

Also, way too expensive for the small portion and the smoothies. I'm from NYC and their smoothie prices rival or exceed NYC prices of similar joints. 

May give them one more try as I am on project nearby...

I love this place! Healthy food, pretty darn fast. My favorite is the salmon with brown rice the lemon dressing is everything! I usually get asparagus. I truly miss the raw pizza though, but this place is a favorite of mine.
So happy this place opened.  Be ready to eat healthy, Lil pricy but your paying for food to go in your body so do the math.  Service is all positi

Staff are rude and often forget ingredients that are suppose to come with your order. I've been eating here for awhile but I'm fed up with them forgetting onions or tomatoes that are SUPPOSE to come with my order. And I hate being charged for a very small side of dressing one day and than not being charged for it at all the next. One time I was served very dry fries that were literally inedible. Spend your money on a business that actually CARES about their customers.

I would like to add that the owner did contact me to apologize and I very much respect that. It's a credit to his professionalism that he would extend an apology and ensure that he will address my complaint with his staff. Very appreciated.  
Thank you!

I've lost 11 pounds now in 25 days and this place has really helped in curving my cravings and still allowing my to eat clean and healthier!!! I've had the bbq chicken pizza and the burgers here which are very tasty! The sweet potatoes fries are to die for! I highly recommend coming here. Been here 5 times now!!
Ate here after my buddy was raving about it, but I really see nothing to rave about. I spent close to $15 on a chicken Caesar salad and a fountain drink.
Always happy with this place. Great food, smoothies, service and atmosphere. Love it here

I have heard so many good things about this place and finally tried a wrap and their hummus and pita to-go. The California grilled chicken wrap, although kind of pricey, was huge and delicious. I had to save half of it cause it was so stuffed with veggies and grilled chicken. The tofu fries that came with my sandwich were to die for! They were very flavorful with just the right amount of spice and seasoning and came with a yummy chipotle sauce! The hummus was a little bland, but still fresh and hearty. I will definitely be back to try more dishes!
I had the barbecue chicken pizza. Yum! Great lunch and the calories were minimal.  I felt that the price was reasonable. The location was clean. Service quick and efficient.

Healthy and tasty eats prepared in a jiffy washed down with equally healthy and tasty smoothies and juices is what I want, and Greens and Proteins delivers. Plus, the environment is modern and clean with TV viewing options to boot. Alas, the only sadness is that it is located on the opposite end of town, which means my visits are limited. 

At the time of this review, you still get $1 off a smoothie when you check in on Yelp, so put your app to work! They have a wonderful ginger concoction, but on our last visit we went with the Wellness Drink, and it was a mean green delicious machine. It is worth stopping in just for a quality beverage. 

As for the eats, one of my favorite treats here are the tofu fries. I realize they may sound like a disgrace to the original almighty french fry, but as a french fry lover, I am here to say if you like tofu, you will love these. They are perfectly proportioned and lightly seasoned. Do they taste like a french fry, no? But, they do taste like you want to eat another and another and another... 

My husband has ordered the bison wrap twice, and on my last visit, I went with a "Build Your Own Meal" combo. You get a choice of a protein, a vegetable, a grain and a sauce. I had turkey breast, mixed green salad, and cous cous with a balsamic reduction. I ate every last bite and didn't feel guilty. I love that you can get a complete meal that is healthy and affordable without all of the pomp and circumstance that goes along with a full service restaurant. (Greens is a counter service spot where you take a number.)

They also offer healthy pizzas and options for vegetarians and vegans. However, don't be fooled, it isn't a vegan restaurant. There is plenty o' meat!

My favorite place to eat in Downtown! This local spot has incredible food that I have absolutely no guilt about scarfing down. They have plenty of healthy options, to include vegan choices, which are priced reasonably and the service is amazing. The facility is always immaculate. The staff is always friendly and helpful. GNP fits perfectly in DTLV, and flatters the Juhl community perfectly!

NO thanks. 

Pros:
+ Nice decor, water features inside.
+ Clean.

Cons:
- Staff do not know what "vegan" means.  
- Overly priced. 
- Lacking in taste.

Note: The Vegan Burger is not vegan. The bun has egg in it. Why they call it a Vegan Burger, I don't know?  I paid $10 for a unflavored store bought vegan patty, soy cheese, 2 leaves of lettuce and tofu pieces, really?
3 stars only because the counter girl is nice. There are currently 2 customers in the place, my food is going on 20 minutes waiting for a chicken wrap! Pretty much never coming back here!

The quality of the food is way higher than some sit down establishments!  They cook everything to order and every ingredient is fresh.  The portions are huge and the selection is very ecclectic.  Any item you get here is healthy and nourishing.  Their soda fountain only contains all natural sodas... and the root beer is amazing.  The food prep time is a bit longer than most fast casuals but its only because its being made fresh from scratch!  The staff is friendly and happy to be there... the decor is inviting. 5 stars!

I had the cheesesteak wrap and it was all awful.  The meat was dry and very chunky. It was identical to eating a dry meatball for the entire sandwich. The jicama fries tasted like eating a raw russet potato. Immediately after eating this I felt tired and had a stomach ache. The following 16 hours after this meal was spent in and out of the bathroom.  This is definitely the last time I go anywhere near this place. I'm not mad at them, they tried their best.  There just happens to be 10 better restaurants within a half a mile from them.

30 minutes and still waiting for my to-go order. Multiple people came in after me, got their food, finished their food and left. I'm still here waiting. Said my wrap is still "cooking". Don't waste your time.
Service is always awesome at this location. Delicious and fresh food every time. Acai berry smoothie is a must and lawash flatbread veggie pizza w/daiya cheese. So. Delicious!!

30 Minutes waiting for my Taco order. Doesn't work to fast food timing. Come ask they don't know if I order or misplace somewhere. Haha. Early 10:30 am not many customers traffic. I may pick wrong Taco place. HAHA

Love this place. This is my go to place when I'm out and about. When I'm asked where do you want to eat for lunch, my reflex response is "Greens and Proteins."

Their menu options is diverse. It's affordable and delicious. If you get excited about tofu, vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free (or not), acai bowl, pizzas, salads, soups, turkey sausage, angus, wraps, etc...then this place is for you to check out.  Their smoothies are great. 

This place is located near Las Vegas Athletic Club and the members stop by here to grab a healthy meal.  I appreciate them offering cucumber water for free. I usually grab a cup of their coffee here...it's pretty good. 

They are open until 10pm. So if you are a late eater, you can come here. There is sitting outside. 

My most recent meal that I can remember (I've been here more than a handful of times) was their scrambled egg whites with turkey sausage and tofu. Surprisingly, the tofu was good...and this is coming from a person who doesn't eat tofu. I also had their acai bowl which I enjoyed. 

One of my favorite places. Enjoy it!

I freaking love this place ! Healthy food that TASTES good ? Yes please! 

My favorite drink is the "wellness drink". It costs a small fortune ($7.50), but is worth every penny because it's loaded with quality ingredients and tastes amazing. 

My favorite dinner is the bison philly cheese steak wrap! YUM. It's so cheesy and delicious and I love that it's made with bison instead of beef. The jicama fries are only so-so, and I don't do tofu so I would love to see them offer some more interesting sides, but I'm just being bratty..

The pizzas are yummy, low calorie, and relatively low carb. 

A place where vegans, and low carb carnivores can co-exist in happiness!

G&P thank you for being so good to me! Everything on the menu is delicious. 
My favorites according to season:

Summer Breakfast:
Acai Berry Bowl
Chocolate Veggechino

Winter Breakfast:
Real Deal Oatmeal 
Greek Scramble ***
Whey pancakes with bananas and agave syrup YUM!! ***

Favorites ANYTIME! :
Green Ginger Lime 
Wellness Drink
Tofu Fries
Tofu and Soy Chorizo spinach wrap ***
Vanilla coconut power balls

Came here thinking they were going to offer ORGANIC food and drinks, but what a huge let down. They're selling you a product stating it's healthy, but really where is the health benefit from buying foods and drinks that contain gmos and chemicals?!?! When I asked if they had any organic produce, the gentleman stated "some of it" but couldn't tell me what was, therefore leading me to believe none of it is organic. Call me a food snob all you want, but if you're going to proclaim yourself as a healthy alternative then sell non-gmo, organic foods.

Just not good food /:
We tried it 3 times all 3 times were a let down.
We are vegan and are foodies .maybe some of their non vegan choices are better . Just not happy with the food. That being said the service and staff are very good and the place is very clean.

This place was nice and clean. I like the ambience is gives. It's a little pricey and I was expecting more but maybe it was because of the large square plates make the appearance of the food look like there is not much there. Overall the food was very tasty but the smoothie didn't have much flavor to it.

When we arrived to Vegas, I decided to check out Groupon deals and sure enough this place popped up. 

When looking at the menu on Groupon it showed 2 vegan breakfast wrap options. When we arrived to place our order they only had one. Oh well...we decided to go with the Tofu Soyrizo Spinach wrap. We still had money left over and was going to get the Tortilla soup but it was considered a lunch item and not part of the groupon deal. 

We asked the cashier what else on the breakfast menu is vegan? He said the oatmeal, parfait and our wrap. We just had oatmeal that morning so we weren't in the mood. We double checked with him if the parfait is vegan because it said "yogurt" on the menu. He said yes, so we assumed it was a soy or coconut base...Oh HELL NO!! We later found out after taking several bites, me running to the restroom all night and calling them back that it had dairy. Not a happy girl. 

This point I would give them a hater review but the wrap was actually good. Maybe it was a training error on the managers part. 

I would recommend the Tofu Soyrizo wrap. It was very flavorful. Right amount of "sauce", preventing it from being dry. The added side  of tofu fries compliments the wrap. 

Vegan-avoid the parfait and Everyone else-definitely order the parfait. Although we were "snaked" the granola and the large amount of yogurt and fruit can make this a fulfilling meal.
Watermelon Juice is yummy! Veggie pizza on pita bread was good too and just enough for a quick snack for my girls and I. Two thumbs up!

So glad I got to try out this place. Can't wait to go back again. Just wished they had locations closer to home in California. :(

I ordered the bison burger with sweet potatoes fries and that was the BEST & juiciest burger I've ever had!!!! Delicious acai smoothie too.

I embarked upon this restaurant at the beginning of my weight loss/ healthy life style change. At first, I wasn't a total fan of this place because I wasn't sure what to order, or what to try.  Their menu can be very overwhelming to someone who is beginning to change their eating habits and change into a healthier life style. However, Greens and Proteins is a wonderful healthy restaurant establishment. This restaurant has an easy, laid back feel.  Greens and Proteins provide a variety of food options, even for kids.  Their menu options are also affordable and delicious. If you get excited about tofu, vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free (or not), acai bowl, pizzas, salads, soups, turkey sausage, veggie burgers, steaks, or just can't decide and want to create your own meal, well then this is a cool place to try.

I had Straight to the Heart juice. The ingredients were green grapes, honey, avocado pit, wheatgrass, ginger, and lime. The first couple of sips were a bit bitter but overall was it was ok. I did try the Green Ginger Limeade and it was good!

The menu did have a variety and I like the fact you can build your own meal. Overall this place has something for everyone. Definitely coming back.
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I wish there were another one close to me. Every time I am in the area, I stop by. Their tofu fries are amazing. Everything here is amazing. Love it!!

Prices are outrageous. $10.80 for a warm salad in a tortilla & you place your own order. I know this place is hip & happening. Maybe that's the draw.

Burgers are $9-$14, you place your own orders and atmosphere is non-existent. 

I really like the idea of a restaurant that offers healthier choices. I buy & eat tofu, organic veggies and grass fed beef. They are marginally more expensive  These prices would fly in a nicer setting with full table service, not a place that feels like a food truck experience.

This place is good, I thought it was completely vegan but they did have some items on the menu with meat. The place was crowded, and they offered a lot of juices and blended drinks! We ordered the chocolate/vegetable drink, which was amazing. We also ordered the vegan pizza, veggie burger, and hummus & pita. The food was ok, kind of what we could order at whole foods. I prefer Veggie Grill in California for the food better.  It was really pricey too, for 2 drinks, 2 entrees, and an appetizer, it came out to $50.

I really really want to like this place but the portion sizes and the prices are ridiculous. Even though the smoothies are good and if you check in you get a $1 off from Yelp but when it comes to the dishes at the end of the meal your still hungry. I honestly wish there was a native foods I would be there everyday!

PROS: Food and service
CONS: Overpriced and small portion sizes
A great place for healthy meals with a variety of options to choose from. I eat here a few times a week as I frequently order meals for pick up through chow now.

I don't know why this place is so popular. I've given it 2-3 chances since I'm always at the Starbucks next door. Bland food, long wait time and it's not cheap. Healthy food doesn't have to be this tasteless. I don't get why this place stays so busy. I think the food tastes like cardboard and I maintain a healthy diet. To each their own.

I do enjoy this place and I've been there several times, but it seems when the owner isn't around the food comes out a little sloppy, the chicken is not consistent sometimes extremely dry and overcooked and other times very moist and tender, I ordered eggs and there homemade turkey sausage and it all came out barely warm, the tofu fries came out barely warm and shrunk like that had been extremely over cooked, again this only happens when the owner or manager is not around. This food also comes from SYSCO Company which a lot of items are frozen and GMO. 

Something that bothers me more than anything and I notice these things because I used to work for the health department, almost every time this younger boy is serving/making smoothies and the hispanic chef is cooking they are wiping there noses, faces, scratching there ears, or coughing (even with there gloves on), they don't wash there hands or change there gloves, they continue to cook and serve the food. I have seen them do something dirty every time I am in there with those 2 on shift. I couldn't believe I saw the chef sticking his finger inside his ear with his glove and continue to cook, I then cancelled my order and left. 

I hope the owner corrects this because I won't be back for a while after seeing that. 
It's a shame because I really liked this place.

Just to give an UPDATE, the owner contacted me and couldn't have been NICER and I am very confident that everything will be addressed and corrected. Thank You!!!!! I will definitely come back in.

Greens and Proteins on Eastern... I give the food 5 stars, I give the customer service 3. 

I came into this restaurant on my Birthday because I recieved a gift card. After placing a very large order, the cashier (who was the supervisor on site) tells me there are no funds on my gift card. I sat and waited with my boyfriend so he could call his manager.  He spoke to his manager and informed me there was nothing they could do. They ran the card twice. He said I would need to contact the other location to resolve this matter.

The reason I give 3 stars is because of the lack of customer service. I am in customer service myself, and try to go above and beyond for each customer. He did not provide contact information for the other location, nor did he offer to contact them for me. He also failed to wish me a happy birthday. 

I ended up paying for my order out of pocket because we were hungry and on a time crunch. After grabbing a table, I realized we did not get a number for our order. I had to go up to the supervisor/cashier and ask for our table number. 

The food was wonderful! We ordered the wellness drink (my FAV juice!), hummus plate, vegan buffalo chicken strips and vegan burrito (with impossible meat). The food was flavorful and came out quickly! 

The bathrooms are usually always clean and well-stocked. The food is great, the restaurant is tidy; they just need to work on providing phenomenal customer service.

I went here for the first time this morning and I loved it. I ordered the Watermelon Strawberry Cocktail. Its delicious. The pricing is not too bad considering everything is healthy. The smoothie I'm drinking is 215 calories. Everything shows how much you're intake is. The staff is really friendly and the place is so clean. There is outdoor dining as well.

I would have appreciated if the guy behind the counter last night would have told me that the broccoli cheese soup contains raw cashews in it as its base. After being in the emergency room for 5 hours last night because of a serious nut allergic reaction, I called this morning to find out the ingredients of my meal after the fact. What a miserable experience. Thanks Greens & Protiens.

Thank goodness I don't have to drive all the way to the other side of town to get a good post-workout meal. Greens and Proteins caters to those that are calorie-conscious, macro-conscious, protein-conscious, those who didn't meal prep, and anybody who's just finding out that eating healthy doesn't have to taste like cardboard.

They have smoothies, salads, burgers, sandwiches, pizza, acai bowl, tofu fries, jicama fries, customizable meals, protein cookies and baked goodies. They have a variety of protein sources for carnivores and vegetarians: ostrich, bison, chicken, ahi tuna, steak, tofu, etc. They have grains and veggies. And I must say, I love how they cook their tofu - it's warm, lightly crisp and flavorful.

My favorites include the bison burger with tofu fries, ahi tuna salad, acai berry smoothie, and my custom combo (ahi tuna with broccoli or asparagus, brown rice and pesto).

The calorie info is displayed on their menu. Food does not have to be laden with fat, salt and sugar to taste good.

Thank goodness I don't have to drive all the way to the other side of town to get a good post-workout meal. Greens and Proteins caters to those that are calorie-conscious, macro-conscious, protein-conscious, those who didn't meal prep, and anybody who's just finding out that eating healthy doesn't have to taste like cardboard.

They have smoothies, salads, burgers, sandwiches, pizza, acai bowl, tofu fries, jicama fries, customizable meals, protein cookies and baked goodies. They have a variety of protein sources for carnivores and vegetarians: ostrich, bison, chicken, ahi tuna, steak, tofu, etc. They have grains and veggies. And I must say, I love how they cook their tofu - it's warm, lightly crisp and flavorful.

My favorites include the bison burger with tofu fries, ahi tuna salad, acai berry smoothie, and my custom combo (ahi tuna with broccoli or asparagus, brown rice and pesto).

The calorie info is displayed on their menu. Food does not have to be laden with fat, salt and sugar to taste good.

I've been to Greens and Proteins several times. I appreciate the quality of ingredients and having a place to eat at on the go and I don't have to feel guilty or worry about how it's made.

My last few visits, I realized how boring and uninspired their food is. It's dull and lackluster. It's almost everything I dislike about clean eating.

G&P offers healthy/raw/healthy versions of classic foods: burgers (beef, ostrich, turkey, veggie, etc.), pizza, salads, wraps. They're vegan, Paleo, Gluten-Free, Raw, vegetarian, HCG, and carnivore friendly. Anything good made there, I can make at home for way less, and have several servings.

I'm really mixed up about this. It very much has its pros and it's cons. Vegas doesn't have a lot of guilt-free dining options, so it's refreshing, service is great, it's always clean, and the staff is super friendly and knowledgable. 

I'm torn. Will I continue to give them my patronage? Yes. The advice I offer them is to start thinking outside of the box. Please?

Food is prepared well.  It's so simple and uninspired. How about doing something like, The Pinterest Clean Eating Recipe of the Week or some shit? Come on G&P!

Pro-tip: Get those tofu fries and whatever sauce they're served with! Amaze balls!

Service is amazing here! They have a wide variety of items to choose from. It is a little pricey. I had the Wellness smoothie and the california chicken club sandwich and it was 25.00. They were excellent!

Located off of the 215 and Eastern, near Sunrise Cafe, this place is fantastic.  Service is friendly, food is good, always packed!!!    Love the bison cheesesteak with sweet potato fries.  The bison is so lean but flavorful.  Packed with peppers and onions in a spinach wrap.  The cucumber water is light and refreshing.  The prices are similar to other comparable places.   Must try if your looking for something clean and healthy.
Yummo! Very fresh green juice and a huge portion of it.

Oh my. The Byson Burder- delicious. I have had other Byson burgers- so dry. But this one---- its like every bite is a juicy grassfed goodness. Love it. 

The juices are so good as well. I like how they don't add all the sugar to the drink. They do put Splenda in it- but that just makes the taste just right. You will not be disappointed .

I went into Greens and Proteins this morning with my 3 year old son, never trying it before. I had Kevin as my cashier and he was very helpful trying to find us something we'd enjoy on the menu . He mentioned the new steak tacos they have there so I decided to try them and they were probably the best tacos ive had in a long time . They also have the chicken ones as well but I didnt get to try them. I highly recommend trying the new tacos whether you prefer steak or chicken, theyre awesome! My son got the kids cheeseburger and he ate all of it(which is rare for my picky eater lol) so that means he liked it! Great customer service, clean store, very friendly and helpful staff, I would highly recommend trying greens and proteins, I know ill be back!

Please open a location in Santa Monica!  Tried the ostrich burger while traveling and need to have it more often.  Great, quick service and high quality nutritious food (actually healthy not "healthy-like").  Good variety - want to try everything on the menu!

Finally, a taste of heaven on the WEST-Sideeeee! ;) 

*The bison burger wrap is all that and then some. (Ask for 1/2 jicama and 1/2 tofu fries)

*The chef skinny salad is the perfect combination of greens and proteins, topped with an amazing dressing.

*Berry blast and wellness drinks are a meal in one, perfect for breakunch. (Breakfast-lunch combination) 

Keep up the consistent work, G&P's!

Who says healthy food has to be boring, bland and unsatisfying? I've tried just about everything on the menu at G&P and the food is filling, flavorful, and crave-inducing. Trust me - you don't need to be a health nut, workout warrior, or calorie-counter to appreciate the great food at this place. 

Whether you're bringing along a picky kid, a demanding spouse, a high-maintenance date, or a complainer co-worker, the menu seems to have something for everyone... And the biggest surprise of all? Even my Dad "the diva diner" loves Greens & Proteins! 

This place is also extremely well-run with the type of customer service we demand and expect here in Las Vegas. Best of all, the most beautiful bodies in the city seem to eat here everyday, giving Greens & Proteins the best "views" in the valley. 

A few people on "Yelp" have complained about the prices, but I honestly don't get where they're coming from. This place is not Taco Bell, folks. You're paying for high quality, great-tasting, healthy food here -- not processed belly fill packed with preservatives that only tastes good when you're hammered or "high on life." For what you get, the prices at Greens & Proteins are very reasonable, in my opinion.

I typically choose the "Build Your Own Custom Meal" option, where you pair a grain, vegetable, and protein of your choice with your favorite sauce on the side. I usually opt for the bison patty ($12.99) or the chicken breast ($9.99) and always have a hard time deciding which delicious sauce to order (the options are aged balsamic, spicy peanut, citrus BBQ, walnut cilantro pesto, teriyaki, lemon vinaigrette, or tangy buffalo). The Bison Cheesesteak Wrap is also one of my favorite items ($10.99) and I usually see a bunch of them getting ordered during my visits.

Just as good as the other location I've been to here in town!  This one is actually closer to me, so it wins awesomeness points just for that.  The prices are a bit on the high side, but the food is delicious and healthy, so I say it's worth it.  It's hard to find healthy "fast food" but this definitely qualifies.  And it's right off the 215, so if you have 15-20 minutes to spare and want to grab something good for you, I highly recommend this place.

A friend and I visited here after a long day out in Death Valley.  We were tired and starving! I had the black bean burger (fantastic!), with tofu fries, and the acai blueberry smoothie.  Everything I had was delicious, and I devoured it.  My friend had the sweet potato fries - good, but I was glad I got the tofu fries (I'm a lifelong vegetarian, so I love tofu!).  The food is good and the people who work there are super nice.  Will be coming back here again.  = )

I love this restaurant but unfortunately I had the worst experience on the delivery option . Their website does not make clear they will charge you a fortune to bring you the food, then the amount out of my account was even bigger... no one could give me an answer... lost money!!

Typically a place like this is not my thing but a smoothie called and I wanted something a little healthier so I checked this place out.  

The vibe here is a little strange.  Feels like an extension of LVAC and I'm the only lazy bum who didn't work up a sweat prior to coming here lol.  The decor is modern yet feels green and nature-inspired.  I really like the look of this place.  

I paid an arm and a leg for my Green Leaf Berry Blast smoothie (note: 1 dollar off for checking in) and I almost had buyer's remorse as I waited in line.  The line moved quickly enough and service was friendly but, hot damn, it took FOREVER to get my smoothie.  It's the only thing I ordered - no food, just a smoothie to go.  And I waited.  And waited.  And waited.  

Finally my name was called and I thought for sure this was going to be an out-of-this-world smoothie experience.  All the hype, all the waiting, all that cash I forked over... built up to this moment.  I try the smoothie and I'm all, "eh".  Oh the sweet sting of health-food disappointment. 

I give it 3 stars because I like the concept and the decor, the service was good, and there are quite a few things on the menu I really want to try (pizza, wraps, etc.), so I'm sure I'll be back to update this.

Others reviews are correct. Do not order for delivery. They will mess up order and not correct it when call them. They failed to deliver my soup with order.  The manager on duty said they called and left a voice message, they were out of soup. She stated she could not Credit my account. I would have to call the Company I ordered from to get a refund.  She asked me to hold. She came back on the line and said she was able to Credit my account. Upon reviewing my account I was not credited. I did not receive correct order nor was I Credited. I am not happy with their Customer service. If you say you are going to do something do it.  Do not lie.

Be cautious!!! I'm really sad because I liked this restaurant but my salad had dirt in it. My salad was really good, minus the dirt. Unfortunately I may not be coming back here again. The employees should be cleaning the lettuce. My husband's had a large clump of dirt in it. They took both of our salads and gave us a full refund but did not take the salads back from any other customers in the dinning area. Not okay. If you know about a contamination you should be overly cautious and ensure no other customers eat dirt....literally.

Greens and proteins still a major 5 stars!!!

The angus burger with tofu fries was amazing, huge high quality patie, amazing whole wheat bun, fresh crisp veggies, gourmet cheese... just a very very good burger at a very good price! The tofu fries were a very nice touch, perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside and silky on the inside with a very good seasoning.

The Greek pizza on pita bread is such an amazing combination of Mediterranean flavors, all the ingredients are sooo fresh and work exceptionally well together, a must try!!!

The watermelon and strawberry juice was outstanding, deliciously refreshing with just a touch of agave nectar to enhance the delicious natural flavors! Yum!

Greens and proteins is THE place if ou want to eat delicious and healthy, freshly made to order meals at a very friendly price.

Number 1 place in henderson for healthy dining packed with flavors!

I usually get a green smoothie and call it a day. Today, I decided to purchase chicken tacos and just my luck there was a piece of bone (about finger size) in my taco. I told the young lady and she was nice about it, offered smoothie or to search for more bones. Lol uh...no thanks. I think the manager refunded the money, she apologized but didn't really seem sincere. I will go back but only because of the green smoothies, no food.
We ate here on Sunday.  I had their salmon and my husband their veggie burger.   I got food poisonong from their fish and three days later, I'm still sick.  I'll never eat there again.

With this new year, my resolution was to not let my love of food and trying new places be the reason for weight gain. Greens and Proteins was the perfect afternoon snack/meal for my in between spa, errands, and gym session. 

It would make sense that this health conscience business would be located in front of the LVAC. The  feel of the establishment is open and chill. The waterfall fountain and plants mounted to the wall gives the place some life.

Now, on to the food. I heard about this healthy pizza notion through a past Yelp event. Curious whether a good pizza could be delicious and low calorie, I stopped in for lunch. Although nothing struck my fancy at first, I ordered the Greek Pizza ($8.99) and sat down to wait for my food. I asked for a cup for water since I saw they had infused water for guests. A faint taste of cucumbers and lemon was refreshing after sweating it out in a hotbed. When my food came out, I was doubting my decision. The crust looked cracker like. After a bite, it was not a disappointment. The thin slices of cucumbers contrasted well with the tomatoes. While the feta and kalamata olives gave bold flavors to an otherwise mellow pie. My pizza was less than 400 calories and satisfying. Instead of leaving here stuffed, it was a nice change of pace. For those lighter days, I would suggest G&P. If I was ravenous, it would probably be a different story.
Very pleasant experience. Kayla was extremely patient and helpful in finding exactly what I had the taste for. The food was amazing and I will definitely be back with friends :)

Best green drink ever! I'm on a long ass juice fast and I'm feeling too lazy to juice so I pop over to this place and order the wellness drink. This was the best fresh press ever! And this point I'm all juiced out but this saved me.

We had a great experience with food we could actually feel great about while traveling which in my book is far better than good. 
 We also had exceptional customer service by the manager, his name was Daniel and after he found out we has food sensitivities he was especially accommodating!

Best healthy joint 3 mins from home N Decatur/215. Across from LVAC gym and next door to Vegas Discount Nutrition store. They offer an array of healthy and whole food choices. LVAC members with card gets I think 10% or 15% off on your order. 

The best that I enjoy when dining here is their Lean Angus Burger on wheat bun, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onion, side of pickle and Tofu fries. I have my patty done medium well and it's perfect all the time! Another great menu item is their BBQ chicken pizza. Crust not too thick, crisp and flavorful! Great post workout meal after leg day lol! 

Another order favorite is their green shake smoothie and wellness drink juice. 
Green shake smoothie consist of Banana, almonds, mango, orange, apple, avocado, spinach, collard greens, kale, vanilla, agave nectar¬†with almond or soy milk. 

Wellness drink juice consists of, Green grapes, green apple, pineapple, orange, lime, wheat grass, kale, spinach, collard greens, ginger, flax seed, agave.

You also have the option to add protein to your drink! If you're in the area and are looking for a healthy food option, try them out and you won't be disappointed.

Was in town for a few days, and am always looking for restaurants that have vegan options (for me) and non-vegan (for my dude). So, let me say that I'm super thankful that this place exists and has veg stuff! But, the soyrizo tofu burrito was lacking. Chunks of unseasoned tofu, with soyrizo (which is seasoned smaller pieces of tofu) and maybe salsa? The potato medley was nice and crunchy, so that was good! Just needs some variety.
Excellent service, employees are always helpful. The food is great taste is wonderful, the customer service is excellent. I would highly recommend Greens and Proteins.
My favorite local spot in town! Great for lunch! Love the salads....food is fresh. You won't be disappointed!

I have no idea what kind of wizardry this is, but this place makes seriously delicious food for how low calorie it is. Im not normally one for health food places, but after deciding to get back in shape I'm glad we checked this place out. The bison cheese steak is AWESOME and my wife loved the BBQ chicken pizza. All of the items take great lengths to be low fat, so keto-ers should look elsewhere, unfortunately. 

The only thing that bugged me is that while they list calorie totals, they don't have information showing macro breakdowns of their food. Anywhere else I wouldn't be surprised or expect it, but for an expensive health food restaurant it seems strange. 

Its not cheap but the quality is outstanding. We cant wait to go back.

This was my second time at Greens and Proteins, the first time was at the Eastern location. In comparison I like the Flamingo location more. The service was 5/5. The employee who helped me was really informative. I built my own plate: bison patty with avocado and brown rice. What makes it so tasty are the sauces. I got their teriyaki sauce for my patty and the lemon sauce for my avocado. I asked for medium rare and it came out perfectly pink. The area was clean as well and they blast their AC. The reason I took off one star was because the food did take awhile, I waited 10-15 min and I feel like the food is a little overpriced for what you get. A bison burger was a few dollars less than my plate and I would have gotten more. All together I spent a little over $15 for the plate. All in all, it was great and I would definitely come again.

Used to really like this place. Came back after a year. No longer good. Noticed customers were a lot fewer should have taken that as a sign. Chicken was dry and burnt in my wife's and daughters sandwiches. My bison burger was ok. For the price we paid not coming back. Bummer.

Try the WELLNESS DRINK. It's green and might look questionable but trust me, it's delicious. They're tofu fries with aioli on the side is tasty and a great alternative when you're a French fries addict like myself. Haven't tried everything on the menu but so far I've noticed their burgers and wraps are the winners. The place itself is very trendy and clean. The only downfall of this place are the prices. Definitely not cheap. Expect to pay at least $8 for their drinks/smoothies.

I visited this place after a good workout becuase I could smell it from when I got out of the gym. Just as I was about to get irritated for the food taking too long to arrive, a nice gentleman brought me my cabbage wrapped burger. This was one of the best burgers I have ever had! The meat was seasoned perfectly and everything about it was delicious.

I realized that it takes time to prepare good quality delicious food. I will be going back, and I don't care how long my food takes, because it is well worth the wait. And what a friendly staff!!

Love this place! Just left there and had an amazing experience. Being new to Vegas from California is a bit rough being that the health food options here are scarce. I was so happy to find this place. I had the veggie wrap and my husband tried the veggie burger, we both agreed that it was the best veggie burger we've had. I took a few bites! the customer service was above and beyond! This is the kind of place I was worried I wouldn't find when we first moved here. I will definitely be a regular!

Considering it was my first time here, it was a really nice experience. Everyone that worked there was super nice, and when I didn't order a drink they offered me a water cup. The place was clean and subtle. Great for an after gym anything really. I had the grilled chicken wrap which was really good. I got sweet potatoes on the side and those were delightful. I just wish it was a little cheaper so I could go more often. Other than that I love it!

I love Greens and Proteins! Their BBQ chicken pizza is so good! 
I just wish they had sweet potato fries!

Came here for lunch with a doctor and boy was I glad I chose to come! We each ordered a burger and smoothies. 

They hooked us up with the chili cheese topping on our tofu fries and jicama fries. The jicama fries are raw and the tofu fries are deep fried. We both enjoyed the tofu fries more. Jicama is healthy for sure but I have yet to crave for this. Jicama taco shells are fabulous though! Now to chat about my veggie burger and green smoothie. 
Based on presentation, you would expect a bland burger. Especially since I had to put my ketchup on it. It would've been if they created a sauce for it. Regardless this was the best burger I've had in Vegas. Why? The veggie patty did not fall apart when I gobbled it, the thickness of the patty was spot on, it wasn't bland, there were still chunks of veggies but it was well blended and I loved the toasted wheat bun with alfalfa sprouts. The alfalfa sprouts added great flavor to the burger. Slap on some avocado and it would take bring it to home run. Besides my delicious green smoothie, I tried the watermelon strawberry cocktail juice that came out as a smoothie and it was fabulous. I loved the quantity and quality of both smoothies along with the prices. The drinks were so filling and the portions of each ingredient stood out. Perfect balance! 

Overall, I loved this joint. Great customer service, great food and drinks, great prices, spacious seats, clean environment. Oh and I loved the free cucumber with lemon infused water. I can drink gallons of these!

Love this location, it's convenient cause it's right next to where I tan. The employees there are a hit and miss with being nice. But healthy great food! Check your bags before you leave with your to go order!

I FOUND MY SPOT! 

I'm a new Las Vegan who loves all things health and wellness and still enjoys being a foodie! 

You had me at organic and clean eats to go!

We have been told amazing things about G&P and all have been held true! 

Food: I made my own plate with turkey breast and broccoli and kale and pesto sauce mmmm!! Hubby got the bison burger with jicama and tofu fries - TOFU FRIES ARE A MUST! 

Service: everyone was super friendly and welcomed us to the 'hood! 

Atmosphere: free wifi and mountain views for this Florida girl were the perfect combo! 

Can I move in there??

While I do love the great variety of choices on the menu, all of the food I've tried so far is very bland. I wish they used a little more seasoning or something to spice things up some. There is nothing flavorful I've had and I've eaten there a lot. Plus they're pretty pricey for not tasting that great.

this place used to be able to get away with the long wait, small menu, and outlandishly high prices but now it's no longer the only healthy, quick eatery in vegas. 
they have a few standouts on their menu like the satay or smoothies but i rarely stop in here anymore with newer additions to the valley like krayvings, protein house, protein source. 
also they don't use organic products the majority of the time

This place is great!  I'd recommend the Bison Cheese Steak, BBQ Chicken Pizza, any of the wraps (with tofu fries), and all of the smoothies despite the veggies inside (tried each one)!!  Call ahead if you don't want to wait, but they're pretty fast considering the long line at lunch.  You'll see lots of physically fit patrons enjoying lunch or a snack as the gym is right around the corner, so you'll feel good about eating there.  

My only issue, and it's not that big of a deal for me, is that the menu is a little pricy.  But you figure the quality and nutrition of the food you are getting, it's not that bad.

The food & smoothies are okay.  For the portions served, everything is way overpriced.  The best part is, they're NOT ORGANIC.  Plus, a regular HCG diet is not healthy for you.  For claiming "healthy" and charging organic prices, I find this place to be quite the rip off.  There are way better options out there that are healthy, whole and organic.

I called for delivery. In the instructions I asked for no red onions even put it in caps. The pizza came and had them. I called and was placed on hold for ten minutes, I hung up and then called back and was placed on hold again. I just gave up. I have an infant and I can't just throw her in the car to go get the pizza made correctly. I paid 17.00 for a pizza (tip and delivery fee) that I can't eat. Will no longer have my business. I understand human error but being placed on hold twice is ridiculous.

Generally unimpressive--the food is healthy and service is quick. But flavors and portions are kind of weak. 

The Skinny Chef Salad is OK-it has a spicy mustard dressing. 

Definitely avoid the jicama fries. They are just cold, raw slices of jicama with seasoning. 

I would rather spend my money elsewhere.

Love this place. I wish there were more of these around town. I always order the wellness drink and if I'm there for a meal I usually get the BBQ chicken pizza or the California chicken wrap. I enjoy pizza more so it's nice to order this and not feel guilty as it's around 300 calories. As you wait for your order you should sip on their cucumber water! This place has free wifi and a good amount of seating inside and outside. Both of these locations are right next to the LVAC gym which I like. To travel here for a healthy work lunch is far for me, but my coworkers and I have drove the extra 20 minutes, so I guess you can say its good enough!

I'M IN LOVE!!!!!

Its happened, finally. I went twice last week for lunch. It's ubber healthy and has things on the menu I would never eat and a couple of things I would try.

I got the buffalo cheese steak sandwich with tofu fries [yes tofu]. Super good!  Went back and ordered their combo which consists of pick your: protein, grain, veggie, sauce.  I got shrimp, brown rice, asparagus, and pesto sauce.  Has calories displayed everywhere so you know exactly what's going in. Also, got a spinach and almond milk shake [sounds gross but it was amazing!!!!!]

Priced around $10 shake was like $4 but HEY you are eating healthy.  Decor is awesome with running water on the walls and bright green chairs.  

My only suggestion: salad bar or make your own salad. Pick your lettuce, pick your protein, pick your toppings, pick from an array of low fat house based dressings?????

Something like a salad expressions??? That'd be awesome. Adding Elk to the menu would rock too!!!
Tasty healthy food in a pinch. Great for the next day in Vegas.

Perhaps I should give this place 5 stars to show my uber appreciation for having a healthy alternative in Vegas aside from Go Raw and Rainbow's end.

I dig the chocolate veggichino and the wellness juice. Love that you get a dollar off for checking in each time.

The staff is always super friendly and helpful.

Their pesto sauce is amazing and the peanut sauce was yummy yum too!

Juice bar that does not have a juicer. And no it's not cold pressed. 

This should say enough if you're looking at coming here for juice. Maybe their food is better? 

Super friendly service though!
It's ok... If I'm trying to eat proper id rather just cook for myself...not blown away with flavor or choices on the menu....the tofu fries were even a bore!

I love it when a place proves me wrong (especially when food is involved).

I figured this healthy food joint located next to LVAC on Eastern was going to leave me hungry, but their their egg white & turkey sausage breakfast plus the Wellness shake/juice left me plenty full with a little Wellness leftover for lunch. Their tofu home fries convinced me that tofu wasn't as evil as I have previously experienced!

The service is what I would compare to a Panera or other sit down/fast food place. You walk in, order at the counter, they give you a number to set at your table, then they bring you you meal. 

Service was fast & friendly and the staff was friendly and knew their stuff despite looking young (must be all that healthy food!). They don't do delivery, but you can call ahead and then pick up your order. 

The food was clean, healthy and they had plenty of Gluten Free options (bread & pizza crust) to choose from and their was no guilty aftertaste!

Don't bother. Why would you anyway when it cost almost $50 for 2 salads and 2 smoothies. The salads are literally a big bowl of lettuce, a tiny (and I mean 2 maybe 3 oz) of protein and a few other fillers. Never seen anything like it in my life. What a rip off. As a local I wanted to support the small businesses but after giving them a few tries, won't be happening again. Have tried multiple dishes  and nothing makes me what to recommend to friends. 

For a laugh, order the sweet potato fries or whatever they are called, as a side. Literally all you get are a few slices of sweet potato that have been warmed up in a grill plate (mine were mostly burnt)

Exactly what I'd expect for $50. Not.

I love how close this place is to my house and gym it's easy to drive by before I go home and eat something healthy. I wish they were a little faster with to go orders but still everything is pretty good

Super clean and bright. Very crowded at lunch time. Was there long enough to see the crowd die down. Little on the upper pricey side. But good quality food. Friendly staff. I have been in another location before. Not saying I won't go back it's good food. There's a crowd there for a reason

Lots of low calorie options for those wanting to eat healthy....not a strictly vegan restaurant as their menu clearly states.  This is probably the last place I would pick to eat, but we were convinced by another couple to give this place a try.  The food was better than I thought it was going to be, but definitely not the most flavored packed menu.  I tried the bison cheesesteak with tofu fries and I guess I was hoping for a little more flavor in the bison other than just salt...really it's a chopped up bison burger patty put in a wrap.  The tofu fries were all the rave on the reviews...but in comparison to the Chinese salt and pepper tofu squares...they were quite lack luster and dry in my opinion. The service seems like it could be refined, the couple that we ate with got a number with their order, while we did not.  The server seemed to wander from table to table asking what people ordered in order to deliver food.  The decor was bright and refreshing and the Hawaiian music in the background made it good environment for a Sunday lunch.  I probably won't be venturing back to this restaurant anytime soon, but I think the location near LVAC and perhaps for the calorie and health conscious this place is a win.

If your trying for a healthy lifestyle you can't go wrong here.  The emphasis here is clean eating, low fat, good carbs and lean proteins.  I've seen people reviewing here complaining about blandness. I disagree. The food is well prepared and seasoned without being bad for you.  If your looking for tons of salt and cream sauce you're in the wrong place.  I've had the chicken,turkey, cod and bison burger here and they were just what I needed after a workout or on a busy day instead of hitting fast food.  They are the healthy fast food alternative.

So I finally got to stop here for a smoothie right before they were closing(sorry). I bought a chocolate peanut butter banana smoothie because I'm obsessed with peanut butter. It was super refreshing and not to sweet. My girlfriend had the Apple pie smoothie with a hint of chocolate added. I stole a sip and liked it as well. She also ordered the bison burger which they cooked perfectly. It was juicy! The inside of their building is painted a bright green which pops and makes you wake up haha. I will be back to try more and next time I won't be there 20 minutes before closing.

Our go to after training Jiu Jitsu! The food is always delish and fresh! I even got my coworkers hooked on this place so I'm there often. Another reason why we love Greens & Proteins is JULIE ! She is so awesome! She always makes us feel so welcomed and always greets us with a smile. That is sooooo hard to find her in Vegas... a place with awesome food and friendly service!

Came here for the first time a few days ago & I was pleasantly surprised! First off, love the bright green colorful decor. It has a fresh feel to it. I was greeted by a bunch of smiling, happy associates. Props to the manager because everyone had a great attitude. The young guy Alex at the register had great recommendations and I told him to "take the wheel" and order something he thought I would enjoy.. and boy did I! He set me up with a Bison Wrap and some sweet potato fries. It was delish, mad props to Alex for the hook-up. Ambiance is nice; lots of people on work breaks or fresh out of the gym, chatting happily over their meals. 
I will definitely be back soon!

Ordered take out a few weeks ago. Got there and it was already ready to pick up. I didn't even have to wait a second for my food, which I loved. The staff was friendly and the food stayed good on my way home till it ended up in my tummy. Definitely a place to visit if your trying to get more greens and proteins in your system.

We always visit Greens and Proteins when we're in town. Delicious and healthy options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Quick service and great cucumber water! Pictured is the create your own plate: chicken, asparagus, quinoa and teriyaki sauce.

The green wellness drink was awesome. It took them a while to make it though which I didn't understand because people after me had already received their order. Must've been a mix up. Either way, still a yummy spot.
So nice to have a place in the Vegas area that is consistently tasty and healthy! Love their salads.
Great lunch. Healthy eating. Great to see a place doing things differently. This ain't no burger joint and I love it.

First time here and my experience was really good. I tried the vegan macho nachos but they were really gross to me so we said we didn't like it and they let us try there veggie pizza . It was delishhhh! The wellness drink is really good too !

Was looking for a healthy food option while in Vegas and came across this place. Food was great! I had the turkey burger with jicama fries (was thinking they were baked) and the hubby had buffalo chicken wrap with sweet potato fries.  Will be back to try BBQ pizza! Great service as well!

The people were nice, but what I got wasn't great. The Thai Chicken Peanut bowl was pretty bland and tasteless, but I guess I should know not to get Thai at a place like this. The chopped salad isn't too bad. The peanut butter banana green smoothie was ok, but it sat on the counter for about 5 mins before I walked up there and got it myself so it was semi-warm and I could only drink half of it because of that.

I've just changed my old 4 star review to a 5 star based on the job these guys did catering our party last night. I can't say enough nice things, but I'll try. They knocked it out of the park!!

First, they were so polite from the first time I called several weeks ago to inquire about their catering. I mean they really sounded excited to help me, even though at that point, I was just feeling out the local businesses to see who we'd go with. Then I had made a few changes to the menu this last week, at which time they still sounded excited to do our large order. Then, the day before our event, I got a call from the chef and we talked over all our menu selections and I modified a couple items. My wife can't eat onions, so not only did they comply with removing onions from one of the items, but he made suggestions to add something else to compensate...above and beyond, love it!

Their catering menu online is easy to pick from and does a nice job describing the items. I do recommend the .pdf version as it's easier to read. We had a party for about 20 people, and while we bought way too much food, people were all raving about it and I think every single person asked me where we got it. I was so happy with all the selection. 

We had quite a list:
-Chicken quinoa cups (fantastic)
-Mini ahi tostadas (didn't last long, omg they were good!)
-Thai peanut chicken satay (awesome chicken strips on a stick!)
-Grilled buffalo chicken skewers
-Sweet potato goat cheese skewers (I wish we'd gotten 5 orders of these instead of 1, they are heavenly)
-Tenderloin beef tip skewers (gone by the time I got food :-) a sign of how good they were )
-Angus sliders (didn't get one, but people were raving! This is where I didn't get the onions and   the substitution was made...people loved them)
-Caprese sliders (so good and tasted so fresh!)
-1 each of grilled asparagus salad and the pear and goat cheese salad (both were so fresh and both fantastic) the salads are pretty big. 

My pickup was at 5:30 and these guys were finishing it up on time to the minute. As the guys were carrying some of the items to my car, the chef and his crew were finishing up some of the last minute hot items. It was really busy in the restaurant and I truly appreciate that as I left, not only did the chef take a minute to go over everything with me, but one of the other guys took time to stand and look me in the eye, wish me luck with the party and said he really wanted feedback on how everything tasted.

Absolutely fantastic customer service and food for this catering event that was very important to me and my family! Thank you to the team at Greens and Proteins for making it wonderful!

Awesome place for healthy food options in the Henderson area. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable about their products and always recommend the best new stuff to try. It's always awesome too. 

I've been here many times and usually get the green wellness drink but this time I tried the acai berry juice instead.  It was really good.  Very fruity but still with kale and spinach to make it a super smoothie in case you're counting calories and need  your fruit  and veggie fix. The wellness smoothie is also a great choice since it combines fresh fruit and veggies together for a blend that's really awesome as well. I think both are excellent choices.  

For food I usually get the bbq chicken pizza because it's delicious and only 320 calories for the whole thing. That is nothing short of a miracle. How can something be so delicious and healthy at thethe Same  time? ? Boggles my mind but still keeps me coming back. I definitely recommend this  place to anyone looking to eat healthier but is having trouble making the switch. They make it so easy here.
We had some delicious smoothies here at G& P . Definitely coming here again! The young lady that helped us was awesome! Thanks Kayla!
This place never fails. Healthy food you don't have to wait forever for, great attention to detail and always friendly. Love this place

I love the food but I'm NEVER going back to this location! They mess my order up every time and then make me feel bad for it, and then when my remake was ready he walked past me 5 fuckin times like he didn't see me! I'm pissed! Not good customer service! What's the point of calling ahead if ur always gonna mess it up!!!!

I eat here about once a month. Great tasting food every time! Delicious smoothies ! Even better mix of fresh juices! They will prepare your food with any substitutions you request and will always bring the food to your table. My favorite are the jicama "fries" with any plate. (I usually still order another side of them) The only item I haven't yet tried is the ostrich! Don't count me out though. Maybe one day.. Lol

Took my Red Hat Society girlfriends-great time had by all. Eye candy everywhere. Cheerful staff. Loved my veg.pizza and took half home. Had 1 problem with avocado ordered extra on sandwich that was missing when it arrived. Tip not included on bill so you have to pay separately. Would recommend as alternative to fast food.

Disappointment.  

This place is smart with their marketing and ambience.  I'm just going to give a quick positive/negative feedback:

Positives:

               Space- It's clean and has modern, simple  decor. Easy to sit and chat for a while.
               Turkey- It's real, sliced turkey; not processed deli meat.

Negatives: 

                 Food quality- I'm annoyed how they come across to everyone. They want you to think this is amazing healthy food.  Not one item on their menu is organic.  They also don't have a lot of alternative ingredients to choose from. They seem to have limited knowledge of gluten-free and vegan foods. This leads me to the next negative.

                 Price- It is pretty expensive.  At least 7 dollars for a smoothie and at least 10 dollars for a sandwich.  It would be understandable if they used organic, high quality ingredients, but no.  Their ingredients do not cost much at all, therefore they are taking advantage of people.  

               Environmentally friendly? - First of all, they don't use real plates. (They care about health but not environment.) So they use paper plates.  Okay, at least they quickly biodegrade.  But wait! The utensils are crappy plastic ones.  What the heck? Be consistent. 

Overall, I seriously feel that whoever opened this place does not care about any of the things they market.  I think they know that being healthy is in, and are trying to bank on it.  They should be serving organic fruits, veggies and meats.  They should have a vast working knowledge of other types of foods for substitutions. They should be using real plates and silverware, or using all biodegradable/compostable things.

And they should not be insulting our intelligence. Needless to say, I'm not going back.  I'd rather spend my money on a place that gives quality food for a normal price.

I never thought I'd see the day where I choose a healthy green smoothie over a Starbucks frap! Haha this location is right next to Starbucks but I've been trying to eat healthier so I decided to give it a try. 

The line was really long. Almost out the door. I had to kind of stand off to the side because it was so busy. The staff was extremely nice. Their menu items are listed as well as the calorie count so that is much appreciated. I decided to try the acai berry smoothie (acai, green grapes, blueberries, blackberries, pineapple, coconut, beet powder, spinach, kale, honey, banana, and peaches). Yum! 

The smoothie took awhile to make but it was delicious and very filling for me. I also decided on the low carb Caesar salad.  I actually really disliked this salad. Not recommended. Maybe it was the Parmesan crisps on the top or the EVOO caesar dressing but I didn't like the way it tasted at all. However the decor is very beautiful, vibrant green chairs and they have real plants, along with 2 waterfalls against the back walls. Beautiful and relaxing! 

Pros: beautiful decor, friendly staff, free wifi, nice outside patio seating as an option, complimentary cucumber water, tv's along the wall 

Cons: hard to find parking, long lines sometimes out the door 

Would I go back? Yes! Next time I would love to try their ahi protein salad and the chocolate peanut butter banana shake! 

Tip*** I checked in with Yelp and received $1 off my smoothie

If you're trying to eat healthier, but still have good tasting food, this is the place for you. I've been here several times and everything I've tried has been amazing. They also offer cucumber water, which I love. They also have a children's menu which is great for those of us who do have kids and want them to eat healthy as well.
My go to has always been the turkey burger, however my last 2 visits the burger was very dry. So, maybe I'll try to find something else on the menu. The tofu fries are great, love the seasoning.

This is the best place to get health food in a convenient manner without having to do the leg work commonly associated with eating healthy. 

For being a health conscious place, the food tastes amazing! I highly recommend the pizzas or the bison cheese steak.

Love G&P hate this location. I avoid it because the food is never the same as the other locations and the service is horrendous. Tonight topped it off though, the employees literally played not it with who had to help me when I approached the counter (I had a pickup order that was already paid for sitting on the counter) so lazy and horrible service that was ridiculous. But when I get home my food is so overly salted I can't even eat it. Won't be back to this location for sure.

I love this place!!! I always come here when I am in town. Smoothies, greek scramble, sweet potato fries! Yum. The cucumber water is also great!! Wifi! Staff is awesome, friendly, helpful, wonderful. YAY
Located right in my building I love love their smoothies, wraps, and salads. Sooo good!

***** update:
I went back and had yet ANOTHER terrible experience!! I ordered for four people and specifically asked for tofu fries and then when I got my food, I politely asked where my tofu fries were and she told me the system didn't give her an option to give me tofu fries with my wrap meal even though the menu clearly stated tofu/jicama fries with wrap meals. 

The girl I was working with said she would go talk to her manager and get my fries out since I'd ordered them and she went to the back and never came out. I literally was astonished that she didn't even come back to check in. 

The first time I went to this business it was closed prior to door closing time and
when I went back to try AGAIN I had terrible customer service makes this a place not worth EVER going back to. 

If they can't treat their customers with even enough respect to walk back out to the table and tell me you weren't giving me fries that the menu said came with me meal and I ASKED for when I was ordering, then I'm not even sure why they are in business. 

I wasted money at this establishment. 
There's many other places to eat at whose employees care about treating their customers as customers.  

Go to another restaurant and don't waste your time OR money here.

Good food , good price , good service 

Turkey burger is what I had with an egg, and sweet potato fries . First time trying sweet potato fries and they were actually good at least at this place been here 3 times just last week since moving to the area
It took me awhile to return here, as I was fed up with the constant mistakes, however they have been spot on since. Glad I came back, as the food is delicious and good for ya.

I try to eat healthy, I do, so I checked out G&P to see if it lives up to the hype.  I had dinner here on Monday night with a vegan friend and it certainly has that SoCal, clean and green vibe going on.  The staff is super friendly and greeted us warmly as we perused the menu.  I'd already looked it up online prior to arriving and I just cannot believe their smoothies and wellness drinks cost so much!  You need a healthy wallet to drink healthy there!  Even with a Yelp check-in that gives you a $1 off, I still could not justify spending even $6.50 for a smoothie.  So, I went with the turkey club in a wheat wrap with tofu fries.  The wrap was great and the tofu fries were...interesting.  I just kept wishing they were real fries, but I did say I TRY to eat healthy.  My friend had the vegan pizza and she loved hers, but she also is a regular customer and has a much healthier wallet than I do.  I find it interesting that this joint which promotes health and wellness also advertises that it has an HCG-friendly menu--isn't HCG unsafe, illegal, and not approved by the FDA?  Anyway, overall, if you're vegan, vegetarian, or want to take a walk on the healthier side, come to Greens and Proteins.  They certainly live up to their name!

I had brunch at this location for the first time last week, using a Groupon before it expired.  I was supposed to meet Suzy H. and her son here, but due to a miscommunication, she went to the Eastern location instead.  No problem.  Intending to share my food, it just meant that I ate two breakfast items all by myself, the Granola Crusted Whole Wheat French toast and the Greek Scramble.  Sure, I could have taken leftovers to go, but I just kept eating until there was nothing left but the parsley.  I guess I was hungry from my earlier swim, but it was also because the food was really good.  I'd been to the Eastern location about two years ago and had a so-so experience for dinner, so much so that I've never been back there.  This brunch, though, has changed my mind about G&P.  I would certainly come back anytime for a morning meal.  I had excellent service throughout, and, contrary to my own belief, the cost for breakfast wasn't as pricey as I thought it would be, $13.94 for both dishes.  Of course, having my Groupon handy made it even cheaper, but still.  I look forward to returning by myself, or with Suzy H., or with anyone else who wants to have a healthier breakfast at a decent price.   

P.S.:  Suzy H. and I ended up eating breakfast together after all, via cellphone.  That's what friends are for :)
