I know I wrote a review for this place when it first opened and now it's nowhere to be found so.....
We are fans!  This is the nearest G&P to our house and we come here often.  I usually get the Acai Berry Smoothie with whey protein added.  I like this tasty smoothie berry much, especially because I get the extra smoothie in a second small cup so that none is wasted.  My second go-to is the combo meal of turkey, sweet potato, and broccoli which is a perfect meal for me when I'm really trying to eat clean.  The staff is friendly and the space is always clean.
Great, healthy place if you want a fresh juice after your long weekend of drinking alcohol! Definitely recommend

I had the green shake and the turkey club wrap and both were very good! Everything was so fresh. I'm currently 8 months pregnant and this is a perfect spot for healthy eating. I'll definitely be back!

Great food and drink offerings, but the teenage employees have no hustle what-so-ever. I'll try again another night, but I was not impressed with how slow they were moving. Again, I may have caught them on a bad night.

I give this place 3 stars because I've not yet eaten there; I've only stood at the counter for 10 minutes while nobody acknowledged me or attempted to take my order. So I just walked out. If I ever go back I will change my rating. But based on customer service, it was a bad experience.

I thoroughly enjoyed this place!

Our whole team stopped by during 2 hour game break @ World's. So we wanted something super light.

I ordered:

Wellness drink
SW Tofu, Soy Chorizo, and 1/2 Avocado  in a wheat wrap (Which the young lady confirmed is vegan)
Raw Vegan Chili Cheese Fries - Jicama fries sprinkled with spices and topped with cashew cheese, blended pumpkin seed chili, onions, and diced tomatoes.

Which I split both with my sister and it was super filling!

They have a lot to choose from. Pancakes, Salads, Wraps, Juices, Pizza, Vegan items, and they even have a small Raw Vegan section.

I am absolutely in love with this place, food is good, and everyone that works here is dope.

Will def visit the next time I'm in town!

Go here and get a healthy fulfilling meal.  I love all the delicious food and the low calories. My favorite is the Greek scramble and tacos
The interior is designed so beautifully and comfortable. It's always a little bit cold in there for me so bring a sweater 
There is a short wait for the food to be prepared but it's worth it and I'm sure it's because everything is made fresh to order which fills my stomach nicely!! 
It's always super clean and the employees are always nice.

Delicious food! My husband and I both ordered a wrap, bison and turkey club. Very tasty and filling. My husband wasn't a huge fan of the jicama fries but I liked the tofu fries. The food was filling without making you feel stuffed. Can't wait to come back and try some juice out.

The green goddess juice is wonderful. I always ask for it without the extra agave sweetener because it really doesn't need it. 

I love coming here over the summer and enjoying the cold smoothie on a hot day! 

I personally think that their food is a little over priced and their faux fries are so bland and the texture just doesn't do it for me. 

The smoothies are pricey but delicious!

The wait time is absolutely unbearable. It took almost 15 minutes for my smoothie to be made. 

It wasn't even mediocre...the fruit did not taste ripe and the smoothie had a disgusting bitter taste to it. 

I was running late for an appointment so I didn't even taste my smoothie until I was half way there and I was so disappointed I wasted $8 on it. 

I did get a burger there before my smoothie mishap and it was good...Took awhile but I enjoyed it.

Healthy, healthy, healthy!

The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and seem to care about their food too. The overall place is clean and the vibe is welcoming and inviting. Food is of great quality. Thus, the slightly higher prices. I will follow up with a more detailed review later of my meal but for now I will keep things short and say simply this is a 5 star place for me!

I went here yesterday morning (3/25/12) after a meeting at work got cancelled. I wasn't in the best of mood and my sister wanted to grab a drink at Starbucks. I was craving something different so decided to check out Greens and Proteins because I had remembered seeing it on Yelp.

Ummm... gurrrrl puhleeze. These prices are insanity. There isn't a drink out there that should cost $7+ unless it comes in a solid gold cup. I spent a long time looking over the menu because my family juices a LOT and many of the drinks were things we make at home already, but 5x the price. 

The staff was friendly, but I honestly couldn't make up my mind. I settled on the V9, but was a little curious as to why the girl making the drink was using jarred vegetable base, not stock, in the drink. When I asked the girls behind the counter  about the base, they said they didn't know anything about it and just held up the jar for me to see. Flavor bases, pork, chicken, beef and vegetable bases are chock full of partially hydrogenated soybean oil (transfat) and hydrolyzed soy protein (MSG). No bueno. The vegetable base had a Top Ramen flavor packet flavor in the drink.

I was disappointed that the drink was so pricey and I don't have the guts to walk out of a place after I'm there, especially after the staff was friendly. I took a drink of the V9, and was even more disappointed - the flavor and the temperature was not a good combination. Ice cold salty ramen flavor mixed with wheat grass and dried tomato seeds was what I first noticed. I couldn't drink any more of it but thought if I took it home and heated it up, it might make a nice soup. I ended up giving it to my dad, who juices vegetables 3x a day, and he told me not to buy that drink again. He said the cabbage was giving the drink a strange flavor.

As a dietetics student at UNLV, I would love to see this place get rid of the agave syrup (it has more fructose than high fructose corn syrup, so it's even MORE unhealthy!) As well, I'd love to see them scrap the unfermented soy bean products - that stuff is so toxic and causes so many adverse health problems, specifically in the thyroid and reproductive organs, that it has no business in an establishment that prides itself on being "healthy." (If these things were gone, I would raise my star rating.)

I'd love to see their raw offerings on the menu (it was a line I noticed after I ordered) and to see their drink prices decrease by 2 dollars. Even though they may be a better alternative to Jamba Juice, it really says something when Jamba Juice is considered the affordable alternative. I was sad when I checked in, AFTER to paying, that there was a dollar off coupon for drinks. Agh! frustrating. 

The place is pretty and the staff is nice, but the restaurant was empty. As long as the prices are as high as they are, I can't see this being any place other than a splurge treat. I may try this place out again, but I wouldn't reorder the V9.

We go to the LVAC right next to Greens and Proteins and have heard really good things about it from numerous people so we decided to give it a try. We did not regret it! The portion sizes were amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful, guiding us through the menu and catering to our particular tastes. (Trust me, try the sweet potato fries)!! The only knock I have on this place is that it is a little bit on the pricey side if you are getting a food and a smoothie but its worth it considering the quality of the  food and the service. Overall great place to eat along with a great experience. We will be coming back!

it was OK. thought this was a healthy joint, got what the cashier suggested (bison cheesesteak, ok i know it doesn't sound healthy!) in a spinach wrap. Also got the wellness smoothie. Unwrapped my meal at home and took a bite and it was pretty greasy and lacked flavor, I couldn't even finish my wrap. The wellness smoothie, on the other hand, was great! i don't know if it was worth the $7.99 price tag since you can get a huge bottle of green machine naked juice at costco for $6. Next time, probably won't listen to the advice of the young kid at the register and ill try something else.

I have been meaning to come here for a long time!

After my work out, I was starving, and despite the Saturday afternoon crowds in the shopping center I figured from what i heard It should be worth it. 

When I opened the door it put me immediately in line.  It wasn't as long of a wait as I thought it would be.  I ordered my food to go and took time to really check this place out while I waited. 

The place was packed, looked like there was plenty of seating (Inside & out)  I loved the earthy vibe with bright green chairs. I took a better look at the menu and noticed they also cater to those crazy RAW and HCG dieters which was pretty cool. 

As I waited for my summer berry salad and antioxidant smoothie, I was so pissed I didn't order the ostrich burger I was originally thinking about. (Damn it, I always tell myself to go with my gut, or first pick) It looked so good. From what i could see they cook just about everything in their brick oven. 

The manager or owner noticed me being nosy, and made a joke, I told him it was my first time, and couldn't help it!  He was really nice, asked my name and told me my order was coming shortly. When my salad was ready he told me that put my chicken in a separate container so it wouldn't wilt my spinach.  Crazy nice! 

Every dish I saw looked great. Can't wait for that ostrich burger.

Great place for green smoothies, juices and healthy food. Some of my favorites are salmon and bison burger. I wanna build up the courage to do get the ostrich burger. :-) for another time. Prices are also very reasonable here. Modern look and feel of th place. Will absolutely become a regular here. 

Yum yum

Used to be my favorite lunch and healthy spot until I found a staple in my drink! Ahh! So upsetting! I used to go 3-4 times a week but haven't been back since the staple incident. I let them know and all they did was make me a new one but I was honestly too Afraid to drink it. Oh well! They stay busy! The food is pretty good! Just can't stomach the staple.

I dig the place I really do. I mean where else can you finally go with your health food waiting in the wings for you (mmm wings, damn eating healthy). Everything you need is here if you're trying to slim down, following Paleo, like eating healthy, or are in to getting more than just the typical bland smoothie. The setup is clean, the service is nothing short of excellent and I will definitely be going back. The only reason I couldn't give it five stars is because the portion sizes are always inconsistent. One visit I'll get a perfectly sized chicken breast or bison meat, the next time the meat is barely enough to qualify as a snack for a five year old at recess. Some type of uniformity here so I know whether to order extra meat or not would help.

Regardless, the shakes are good and the food is delicious.  And the place is really a 4.5 it's just that this place has to be scored on a scale. When I eat at some places I think wow this food is amazing because A) the process to make was long and complex so I needed someone else to just make it B) it would be hard to find those ingredients to make it or C) it's something new that I have no idea how to make. This place doesn't apply to either of those criteria, its basic and you can make it yourself if you have the time and its going to taste exactly how you think its going to taste. (Chicken, asparagus and couscous - there's no surprise here you know what it's going to taste like but hey its good and if you want to stray away from basic the wraps and hamburger will do the trick). BUT this is not a knock on the place because I will be here every week attempting to counter the fried cheese bacon dough thingamajig I will probably have every weekend. And their juices and smoothies are actually different from what you'll find around town and actually have me feeling better after I down one so even if you hate eating healthy, their juice and smoothies are still worth the trip.
Not sure what to expect at first, but pleasantly surprised.  Had the buffalo wrap - very good.  Felt good after eating there  - so healthy food...

Easy to find and ample parking.  Ordering process took a bit long, felt like they could move a little faster, but got through it. 

Ordered the hummus, and it was not very good for a hummus lover. It was hard and dry and impossible to scoop up with the pita.  Tortilla soup we ordered was also "very" interesting. 

The bison philly sandwich was pretty good however. 4 stars still because they have so many healthy food options on the menu. However I think it tastes "too healthy" like you would expect. 
Healthy can taste amazing too. 

It also took what felt like a long time for food, so no going here if you're in a rush.

This is a health food fast food restaurant which I hope becomes a trend.  You can get great vegetarian, vegan or raw food in addition to healthy build your own plates where you pick your protein and greens or other items.  The smoothies and green drinks are as delicious as they come although pricey.  The service is not bad but they don't wait tables.  I like the wellness green drink as well as the almond coffee chocolate one.  Insofar as food they have gr8 breakfasts as well as lunch.  Try faux chorizo and tofu scrambler in a spinach rap.  Bison and ostrich burgers are available for carnivores.

The food here is good, and I like eating healthy. But there's lots of things the staff does here that make it unsavory. It's not uncommon for me to find moldy berries in my "summer berry salad" or hair in my food from and an employee with hands in their hair. I've seen employee's prepping food and taking calls on the phone, using the register with gloves on, answering the to go phone with gloves on then keeping those gloves on to prep food. The menu is good, and the food can be good if there's no hair or moldy berries,  but the people who work there need to be re-trained with health code standards. Also, I notice they get  to go orders wrong (which is obviously annoying) and charge a few bucks higher for the same order than the west location, and when I inquire as to why, sometimes they correct the value and sometimes they don't. I think it's embarrassing to argue about a buck or two with and employee who is just a kid and looks at you like are you seriously arguing about a buck or two.... But, yeah, why is there a price difference? I don't want to be charged more from the same order when I eat at both locations a few times a week. Sometimes they charge you for cheese sometimes they don't stuff like that. I think the place has great potential but staff has room for improvement and need training both in procedure and health standards. This review is based on my experiences at the Eastern location.
Great selection for normal people and crazy fitness freaks. Staff is very accommodating. Go here.

Pretty good. 

Nothing exceptional in my opinion. Been here a few times and have enjoyed grabbing a smoothie. This time we came with friends to grab a quick bite.

 We shared the steak salad. Friends had the pancakes and an egg white Mediterranean scramble. Portion sizes seem to vary. The scramble was really small and sparse on the plate while the pancakes were huge and filling. Our steak salad was good, nothing amazing. We enjoy making delicious salads at home so we weren't incredibly impressed. Must have been about 3-4oz of steak which is not a lot for $14. 

Also, syrup for the pancakes were brought out in 3 separate plastic to-go containers with lids. Each container was barely filled. Seemed like a real waste of plastic for people dining in. Might as well just fill up one or put the syrup in a dish and save the environment and keep their costs down on plastic. Just a thought. 

Definitely a fast causal and healthy option if you're downtown.

Love this place! Food is great and the smoothies are even better! I get the Green Smoothie- no stevia, it's the bomb.org. Staff is really nice and the decor is lovely. The green accents are calming and it just feels really clean and inviting. This is my go to for when I am in the mood for "fast food." LOVE!

So time for an update, :D The staff definitely stepped it up which is a bonus. They greet you as soon as you're in the door. I ordered the Wellness drink again and YES it was blended but, I just can't knock it, it is DELICIOUS and still healthy also. Didn't order food but, I'd go back for the smoothies they are worth every penny

The best green smoothie I've ever had.  I will go back before I have to head home out of state. 

This place was clean & the service was great. I kept looking at the food items everyone else was having & they all looked delicious. 

I am very happy I found this place.
Had the vegetarian pizza with vegan cheese. It was great tasting and full of a variety of vegetables.

Absolutely outstanding and it unbelievable menu of healthy items. Staff was very friendly and accommodating in the food was not expensive. If you're looking for a place with a wide variety of healthy options this is the spot to go to. I had the fish tacos wrapped in Buttercup lettuce several times with mango salsa and it was just amazing. They do tofu fries that are out of this world and a variety of different bowls made with brown or white rice or whatever it is you would like. Great place to check out and reasonably priced and the place is also clean

Great location and staff! My house is by their Henderson location on Eastern and 215 but I had a few (minor) problems over there such as double transactions and missing entr√©e items. This location hits the spot for me because it's quiet and they don't get busy. Friendly staff and good vibes! 

In terms of food, I can't complain about one thing. I love everything. Flavorful yet healthy at the same time. Makes my tummy happy :)
I always get the ostrich burger with tofu fries for dinner and Greek scramble for breakfast. 

Health is wealth & I do not mind paying extra for food like this.
Love this place ! I will be back . The service was outstanding and welcoming I left feeing satisfied

I never thought I would find a delicious AND healthy yet affordable option in Vegas. I try to go here every time we are in town. Nothing cures a massive headache from a night gambling and partying that a good healthy juice or shake. I always take to go and bring it back to the hubby in our hotel room. Nice little "local's" secret.
Not great. $13 for some yellowish romaine, a chicken breast and some dressing. Next time I'll try somewhere else.

This place is my favorite! Even when I stop by late after work, and they're about to close, they give me great service and the food is always spot on. Tonight I tried something new to eat, but stuck with my must-have drink: The Green Shake. For me, it's the perfect balance of healthy and tasty. It has banana, almonds, mango, orange, apple, avocado, spinach, collard greens, kale, vanilla and agave nectar. Think it sounds like too many greens, or like it will taste "weird"? I promise you won't feel that way once you get a taste! This drink is truly mouth-watering. Not to mention all of the vitamins and nutrients it offers for a health and wellness boost!
For my meal I ordered an Ahi Protein Salad, which I was worried wouldn't be enough food to satisfy my appetite; it definitely was! The salad was huge, and delicious. I love seared Ahi Tuna, and it was nicely complimented by the artichoke hearts, avocado, egg, portabella mushrooms, baked tofu croutons and sunflower seeds. The citrus vinaigrette was light and very flavorful, too. I will definitely be considering the salads here as substantial meal options from now on when I go in on an empty stomach like I did tonight.

I come here every time I'm in Vegas! It is amazingly delicious and healthy. The strawberry watermelon drink is a MUST! I highly recommend. 

Although it is a bit away from the strip it is worth the uber or taxi there!
I LOVE the Green Ginger Limeade! Also, this place has nice ambiance... aka attractive women hanging out after their gym sessions. If I lived in Vegas, I'd be here all the time.

I got the green shake and hummus and pita. The shake was good. Not great, but good. I'd get it again for sure. The pita came out and looked really tasty. I was very hungry so I dug in right away. There was two flavors of hummus, plain and maybe red pepper? They were both super bland. No flavor whatsoever and a weird consistency. Not smooth and yummy but kind of dry and grainy. A little olive oil was drizzled on top but even that didn't give it any flavor. Don't be afraid of garlic and spices!! A little salt and pepper even? Idk, I might come back for a smoothie but I doubt I'll try the food again.
This place is the best. It's worth the price, why not invest in your health? Food tastes great and everyone there is awesome, I basically live at here.

Thought I should update my review after eating here two more times. Last year I was invited back by the manager/owner to give them another shot. I brought a friend with me so I could get a second opinion. I made the mistake of ordering the same chicken wrap, thinking it would be better the second time around. Nope. My friend had the Bison wrap and loved it. I hesitated to update my review because I still wasn't impressed by the food, but didn't want to post a negative review when I knowingly ordered something I didn't like the first time around and my friend loved his wrap. But seriously, if you're healthy food joint and can't make a good grilled chicken wrap... what can I say?  I tried it again one more time and had the turkey burger, which while it needed some salt - was much better than the chicken wrap. The tomatoes were a way overripe ... but it wasn't bad as a whole. I still love the idea of the jicama fries, but they could really do something to make them tastier, like a citrus dressing option or something.. anything. LOL. All in all, I might eat here on occasion - but for what it is I think it's way overpriced. I spent $17+ today for the burger and a juice drink. Definitely not affordable or good enough for a daily lunch option. The place is busy, busy though... so it doesn't look like they're hurting for business.

Had the pleasure of trying this location out today for the first time. Got my order to go, staff member was very friendly and very diligent. Nothing short of great in that department. 

The "Greens and Proteins Breakfast Wrap" w/ Spinach Wrap- it lacked a little on the flavor, and was surprisingly messy. Couldn't say that I was a fan, and no amount of tofu fries could make up for this dish. 

The "Southwest Tofu & Chorizo Burrito" w/ Spinach wrap - this burrito was a good one. The flavor is amazing all the while not as messy as one would have expected. A good mix of ingredients overall making the tofu really blend in. 

As always the tofu fries are the best part. 

"Green Ginger Limeade" - very fresh and refreshing, could practically taste each individual ingredient. 

 "Watermelon Strawberry Cocktail" - not as refreshing as I would've expected, the strawberries tasted almost like preserved ones. Maybe just not as good in comparison to the "Green Ginger Limeade"

Best smoothies in Las Vegas, - whether you are vegan or not, these are unvelivable and very healthy, and not loaded with disguised names for sugars like turbinado, cane sugar,  etc. Although they do have honey and /or agave in them so you can ask for that to be omitted, you wont miss it. I love their green shake and their chocolate peanut butter banana shake personally.
They sneak in things like zucchini, and kale, and other very healthy foods and i swear you do not taste them! 
Although i have gone there many times for the smoothies i will admit I have eaten there only twice, neither was memorable for the price, i give them credit for making a difference to give people healthy options, but for example ...the tofu fries are not healthy, they are just deep fried tofu sticks The daiya cheese based vegetarian pizza is good compared to some places versions of it, but the only way to make it truly vegan(unless you want it served on a raw cracker) is to get it on the gluten free crust, after you substitute the crust you are getting charged 14.99 , otherwise if you dont mind the raw crust its 11.99 -in my opinion it is rather small and can be inhaled in just a few bites, i say its 8 inches at most and very thin. Not a great value -If you do the "build your own custom meal" they let you pick 1 protein, 1 vegetable, and 1 grains, not a great value, the plate is very very small.. although healthy tasting and not oily to try to make it taste better. but by the time you lunch and the smoothie you are looking at 20.00 minimum and you wont be full after.
Another issue i find is it can be very busy at lunch time, and they only ever have 1 person working the cash register, the line up can go out the door and the seats are all taken during these rushes. , combine that with people asking questions about the menu and being indecisive (me included)I think they should get at least 1 more register to get things running more smooth.

I had the chicken sausage pizza and it was excellent. I see other reviews not liking the portion size. I on the other hand thought it was just right. If I want a piece of cardboard with imitation cheese and sausage made out of who knows what for 10 bucks there's plenty of options. I'm a firm believer in you get what you pay for. I'm on a quasi macrobiotic diet so it has plenty of options for me. The layout is very clean and the service was prompt. I'll be back for more.

It's always good to eat healthy every now and then. They post the # of calories for their items. It is pricey so make sure you're willing to fork out the money for the healthy food. 

They've also got pizza which was surprising for me. Gonna have to recommend the BBQ pizza one. The others don't sound appetizing to me personally. 

If you order their drinks, grab the epoxy app so you can get their virtual stamp card. Cashier told me their Wellness Drink was the most popular. It's pretty good - if you like grapes. 

My favorite has got to be their tofu fries! I always try to get an extra order to go :0). 

I've been here a few times and there are times where the food is bleh (depending on what you order) and other times they're decent. Aside from the tofu fries, nothing else has stood out to me so just give yourself a few visits to try various stuff.

The turkey club sandwich also wasn't too shabby. But it's definitely better than eating at Sweet Tomatoes every time I want something healthy.

First time trying this location now that I work on this side of town. My absolute favorite is still the tofu fries. Love them! They come in 6-piece and 12-piece orders. 

This location is smaller so it feels more crowded, but I came during lunch time so it was definitely a full house. 

As you walk in, to your left is where the line starts and they have physical menus as well as menus on their TV. 

All the green in the place gives me a nice vibe for some reason, just looks nice aesthetically. 

Green shake is a bundle of health; it tastes okay but at least it's healthy, right?

Their pizza is good last I recall but when I'm here, the last thing I want is a pizza, ya know?
So delicious !!! Very happy they opened a location close to me . GREAT crew and yummy options for meat eaters, vegetarians, and vegans !

Food is so good, I get their Ahi Protein Salad every time I go in. The atmosphere is clear and open. It is always busy which is a good sign. The staff is friendly and quick to get your food out to you. The meal itself is always filling. The food is a little pricey though which is fine it just means I can't eat there every day, but over all highly recommend.

Ok, so my fat booty decided to start loosing weight, Gotta get in shape for the ladies right?? So I decided to start going to the gym that happens to be in the same plaza as this restaurant.

When I went for the first time, I really didnt feel it. I thought it was a hipster central and such, but still wanted to try it , so I did and I fell in love with some items

The tofu fries and the Margarita pizza are delicious, and I think what makes it taste better is the fact that its only 320 calories for a whole 10 inches ZA!!!

Some of the things on the menu are totally not for me, and the juices, well I rather juice at home. But I appreciate the variety and how its mixed as a fast food joint with table service. really nice, and the owners are super cool as well.

It can get a little pricy but all healthy food is and thats sad. The place can get packed but service still fast and efficient.Food comes cooked right and so far havent have one single bad experience.

If you are a freak of counting your calories intake and want some good food that wont make you look like jabba the hutt , stop by this stop.

So I usually love this place but today was not one of those times. Me and my boyfriend found hairs in both of our dishes. Not once but TWICE! We are not ones to complain but common. When we found a hair in his plate we said maybe it was in accident than we found one in mine and I almost vomited! Told the lady. Won't be back.
Good food, but slow even if you order to go Expect a  wait. I ordered at 11:45 am and it's now 12:15 with only 3 people ahead of me. I ordered the tofu southwest chorizo.

Healthy options in LV? I'll take it!
Come here after a post workout!
I'm in love with the wellness drink. At one point last week I had it 5 days in a row!
Kinda pricey tho... so I'm minusing one star for that... otherwise... I'm always happy visiting GandP.
Outdoor seating good for dog owners!

Since my last comment the management wrote me an e-mail inviting me as a guest. I politely declined, but absolutely appreciate the gesture. Goes to show you the right people do read the comments we post and try to improve things and  make everyone happier. Nothing else a returning customer could ask for =)
You spend a little more for good food.  Not a ton of ambience here but all the staff are always friendly, professional and the food gets served up pretty quickly.

Would love to have a Greens & Proteins in the Bay Area.  This place made me very happy.  Fresh, quality, healthy fast food.  The portions are generous, prices fair, and menu is incentive.  I could eat there every single day. Plus a juice bar! The interior is clean, service speedy & friendly and good is soooo good.  And good for you!  Turkey, ostrich, bison, chicken, beef, done simply or creatively what ever you are feeling. I hope this place takes off & they open up in the Bay Area. Best lunch I've had in awhile!
Loved the "create your own" option chose a great very flavorful piece of chicken, rice and a salad very satisfying. Wait time wasn't too bad for being there during Sunday brunch/ lunch hour.

Came here around 1030 in the morning to grab lunch on my way to work. I ordered the turkey club sandwich with turkey bacon and it took 15 minutes, there was literally one other person in the restaurant  I dont know if 15 minutes was really effecient for a 98% cold sandwich but fresh somehow translates to slow service. Ive heard the smoothies are great and several people came in while I was waiting and got their smoothies and were gone. Maybe Ill try one in the future but the sandwich was underwhelming and not worth a $9 price tag.
Great food and drinks. I got the acai berry smoothie and ahi protein salad. Both are great combination to get your healthy fix for the new year. Fast and friendly service.

When I actually do have the funds to splurge on a healthy meal, I choose this place.

They have a pretty healthy and diverse menu, so I'm sure you'll find something to meet your cravings. My go-to option is the Create Your Own Meal. This allows you to choose one protein, one green, one grain, and one dressing. Let your imagination run wild here. This is the perfect opportunity to meet that delicious, healthy craving you've been having.

My favorite selections for the Create Your Own Meal is salmon, asparagus, brown rice, and the lemon citrus dressing. I'll have to force myself to try the other proteins one day, but I'm always craving for salmon whenever I eat here. There's a light crust on the salmon, but the inside cuts up perfectly! The brown rice is the perfect texture - squishy, but NOT watery. The asparagus is prepared just how I like it - not burnt, but thoroughly cooked.

I really wish I had the funds to eat here everyday, but it can get pricey. This place is the perfect solution to eat healthy when you're too lazy to to make your own meal, but have the currency to splurge a little.

Second visit here was night and day from my 1st. I think his name was Stefano and I didn't catch the name of the supervisor that night. They were extremely nice. I used my check in Coupon with no backlash this time from the staff. Food was amazing Bison wrap!! Love it!! I'll be back again. I'm happy I have this place a second chance   

Ps 
I forgot to get my fork and knife and the supervisor got it for me. Very nice of her !!
Great service, good atmosphere, strawberry watermelon drink is great. My family loves the Cali grilled chicken wrap.

This place is amazing for people on a macro diet! Not only are most of the meals on "my fitness pal" but they also have a chart which they will share the information with you if you ask. The staff is always friendly and always remembers my name. The food is reliable and tastes the same every time I order the dish. My favorite is the Greek scramble or the build your own meal option.

Teriyaki Chicken was very dry 
Fries were good 

Turkey club was so dry 
Fries were good definitely worth a try


Recommend if you are looking for a new place

Came here with the hubby for the first time. We recently started working out and decided to start eating healthier. I ordered a burger with jicama fries and my husband ordered a wrap with tofu fries. Before coming here, we heard such great reviews of this place. To be completely honest, I wasn't really impressed. The food lacked flavor to me. My husband enjoyed it because he felt it was a healthy meal compared to the stuff we usually eat. I told him that healthy food can also taste good. He recently went back and had a turkey burger and said it tasted dry. There is a place a couple blocks from here called Elixer Organic Cafe that I think is much tastier. I might consider returning here to try something different one day before completely ruling it out.

This is my second time coming into greens and proteins and I have to say that I am impressed with the quality of food. Although I was a little caught off guard paying $16 for 3 tacos it was very filling, delicious & guilt Free! Today I decided to go in and try their acai bowl (I'm a sucker for those) it was more of a sorbet texture and not runny like other places make them and the granola they use is AMAZING!

After pondering about going here for a smoothie to feed my hunger I finally gave in. I ordered the berry smoothie it was alright for the price of 8$ I don't think it was worth that. But probably will just stick to my normal smoothie place across the street.

Absolutely love this place. I go there with my daughter at least twice a week and we have been going there for a couple of years now. The food is always fresh and by now the people that work there know me and know what are usually order.

One aspect I really enjoy about restaurants is when they are immaculately clean. Everything was spotless and organized. There are plenty of seats outside the patio if the weather is nice, & inside it's very spacious, with trendy tables, a nice wall backdrop with running water, & several televisions. Service is alright. Nothing going beyond the means of customer service & nothing that's bad either.

If you are anyone who is a raw foodie, don't expect this place to state it uses USDA Organic certified items just because it's named 'Greens and Proteins' (that's a question I'm going to ask the next time I'm in!) The menu is definitely a little more healthier than your fast-food alternatives, with wraps, pizza, sandwiches, salads, smoothies, juices, the works. The pricing was what got me, since I could get a green smoothie at Whole Foods for about .50 cents less than here (one that is a lot less sweeter). 

I purchased the vegetable wrap & the green smoothie, all of which came out to $20 (definitely not cheap, as most health-alternative restaurants aren't). I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the green smoothie turned out! While $7.50 is a little much, at the same time it was in a cup that was generous in size for its price. It was very sweet (from the agave nectar & stevia), nothing like the green smoothies from Whole Foods which are a little more on the less sweeter end. I was even more impressed by the vegetable wrap, for it was a filling size (had to take the other portion to-go) & it came with these tofu-like fries with seasoning & a dip sauce on the side that was amazing! 

Walking in, I was a little questionable about this place, even more so by the price, but after tasting it for myself, it's actually quite good here. I debated giving it three stars, but I was reminded by my green smoothie it's definitely a place I'd like to return to when I'm in the neighborhood craving a healthy alternative to other restaurants surrounding them!
We are from California visiting Las Vegas - the hubby and I we're looking for healthier options and ran into this place.  The food was absolutely delicious!!!

After circling the block twice to find parking. I finally found a pay for- site 2 blocks away (all this to run in and get a smoothie!) . I get in and order the "Apple Pie" Smoothie. After ordering it- the manager told what I assume to be  a new gentlemen to make it while she "watched expo". I assumed him to be new because then she told him "for the apple pie smoothie add EXTRA Ice" And boy did he ever!!!! It was just one big cinnamon ice block! YUCK! I'm certain with all the cinnamon and ice he added that he didn't have space for the almond milk, or Apples, or nuts ! Not to mention his whole process took ages! I won't go to this location again. The one on eastern is much better!

This is an awesome place for vegans and for those seeking to eat clean. Their chocolate peanut butter smoothie is delicious, and one of my favorite! The vegan burger is also delicious and it's a must try! I highly recommend this place to everyone

This place is awesome! I'm doing a raw fitness diet and this was one of 2 places I could eat. The food is amazing and they have a lot of selection. Finally a good clean eating place. Have been there more than 3 times this weeks and plan to go more :)

The staff was super nice and friendly, but the food here is horrible. The one on flamingo and 215 is way better. The chicken was super dry and chewy, probably because I literally saw the lady put it on the grill to heat it, it was pre cooked. Then I found some weird brown string thing in my rice. So that was the conclusion of my meal, gross and will never come here again.

Decided to try this spot for dinner after the gym last week. The "create your own" meal lets you select a protein, starch, veggie and sauce from a fairly extensive list. The food was well cooked, healthy (steamed, not fried...when applicable), and the sauce was fantastic. I love a menu with good vegan/vegetarian food and options! 

It was fairly priced, the staff was helpful and the place was clean. My only quasi-negative is they seem to be a little slow for takeout. However, this is probably them still getting up to speed. 

Nice plus = complementary water flavored with citrus and cucumber. It was a nice touch.
This has become my new go to place for healthy eating when I am in Henderson. They open earlier than most for breakfast and have a great variety. Lunch is special as well.

Was excited to see this open awhile back.  Finally stopped in later in the evening.  Walked in and out as we felt we were interrupting the employees conversation.  Felt unwelcome and not even acknowledged.  So unfortunate.

BBQ chicken pizza. This is the second most popular dish according to the server so I figured why not. 

I'm not sure how healthy it is, but it tasted like a regular pizza or one you might get at CPK (California Pizza Kitchen). I'm not a huge fan of CPK or anything, but maybe the flavors reminded me of it. 

Service was amazing!!!!!!

Kale Harvest Salad- 3 star. 
Chicken Quinoa Salad - 3 star. 

Both were delicious. I have had better, but it has a good price point for a healthy place. I must try their pizza next! 

Service - 5 star.
First time here great environment! Fresh fruit and healthy egg white omelette 13.22 with tip! Fast and friendly.

We are from out of town and we came to greens and proteins for breakfast on a Saturday to try out. Our party of two walked in the door, there was no one in line, yet no one greeted us or asked if we had any questions. After looking at the menu I ordered a breakfast burrito with turkey sausage and my partner had a Greek egg whites omelette. The flavor of the food was nonexistent. It is very rare for us not to finish our food when we go out to eat, but this is an exception for us. The cheese on the burrito was not cooked, tasted awful, and they forgot the feta cheese in my partners omelette! When the server finally brought us our food outside, she forgot forks and napkins. She told me I need to go inside to get those and did not offer any assistance or ask how our meal was. We will definitely not return, and will recommend that our friends and family try somewhere else when they are in Vegas! The Decour inside was very nice, we liked the water fountains have a laid-back atmosphere, but the food and the service was absolutely horrible.

Excellent! I love, love, LOVE The bison cheesesteak on spinach wrap. It is amazing! This place is pricy but you can taste the quality of the ingredients. My friend had chicken tacos and he says that they are a must order. The aioli on the tacos had a little kick to it but it was great! Definitely going to try the chicken tacos next time based on his praise. They get the food out quick but get here early because this places gets busy during lunch.

Not so great in my opinion! 

Cons: I had the vegetable smoothie (V9 I think) and it was like water with chewed up celery.  The burgers had so much meat (without any flavor) that the meat was the only thing I could get my mouth around.  It gives the illusion of being an organic restaurant but it isn't!

Pros: The interior is very crisp and clean and the jicama fries were yummy (would be even better with a slice of lime on the side).

I've been eating here for years and the food is clean and healthy.  If you want to feel great and look good... eat here !  The kitchen is the cleanest in town and the kitchen managers take pride in keeping tidy.  I hope you all enjoy this great place.

I'm so happy I decided to try this place! I ordered the ahi protein salad and it was BOMB! The servers were very friendly too! And the place was very roomy with great ambiance. I really loved the fried tofu in the dish, it was very crispy and delicious. I love being able to get a filling, healthy meal for a reasonable price. Very much recommended to try!

If you're thinking about "healthy splurging" this is the place to do it. And yes, there is such a thing. It means staying on track with your goals while still getting some enjoyment out of your meal. 

We tried the multigrain pancakes and the vegan buffalo chicken tenders. Highly recommend both. 

Prices are moderately fair. The only dieters that may not benefit from this place are the people on low carb plans. If you read the nutrition facts mostly all of the items have your daily serving for the day in just one meal so proceed with caution other than that this place is a "Win win."
I got the vegan RAW nachos and a smoothie and it was ALL SO BOMB and FRESH and plated gorgeously. The menu is huge and it was very satisfying.

Taste: 3
Creativity/Authenticity: 3.5
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 3.5
Bang for your buck: 4

I want to like this place but def still looking for other options. Came here with my gf cause she was in the mood for healthy and light got the bison wrap with tofu fries and the broccoli and cheese soup... lets start with the soup i know healthy places are known for bland food because sodium is a big factor when it comes to health but a nice little packet of salt which the supply and this soup was edible. Now the bison wrap, not bad, not great nothing special. The bison was again no flavor but noted this is a health food spot so understandable some sauce they provided made the wrap taste better and i ate it just fine. Now my main problem the "TOFU FRIES"; if you like this you might as well eat cardboard probably taste better and better for you, this was horrible the texture and flavor was like processed plastic?! ive had similar tofu fries before and they were way better than this, def recommend trying the napkins. Overall i get where this place is going and not being a health nut i cant really complain i just wont eat here and let my gf enjoy it.
Really sad that their juices are not able to be ordered in bottles to be enjoyed later...and as far as healthy, the base of most juices are fruits,I was really hoping for more veggie based drinks...

Really sad that their juices are not able to be ordered in bottles to be enjoyed later...and as far as healthy, the base of most juices are fruits (green grapes to fit the name??), I was really hoping for more veggie based drinks...for the flip side, I was only looking for juices, I didn't look at anything else on the menu...if I make it back, maybe another star and an update will be in order...
This is my go to spot when I'm too lazy to find food food. The smoothies are filling and healthy and ready in under ten minutes. Service is fine

Salads on salads on salads. 

Why can't we ever have just like, a salad?

That's all I need when I visit Greens and Proteins. 

Their steak salad is divine. Perfectly cooked filet mignon, romaine, arugula, bleu cheese, candied walnuts, roma tomatoes & pickled onions with a caramelized onion vinaigrette. I know right?! It's my goto there, and I've also swapped out the filet for grilled chicken if I'm looking for something a bit "lighter".

The Ceasar Salad is simply delicious. Romaine Lettuce, parmesan cheese, parmesan crisp and EVOO Caesar dressing. Adding chicken is highly recommended.

I've never sat and enjoyed my garden treat in the space, but there is plenty of room if I chose to do so. The staff is friendly here, the food comes out at a decent rate and it's nice to have a healthy treat that won't break the bank.

Tofu Fries! Jicama nachos! 

Watermelon juice something.. Everything was pretty delicious being an "almost-vegan" establishment. Our venture here was not a disappointment after discovering the delicious drinks they had on hand and the tofu fries. 

My mouth is watering just thinking about it!
Only had a few misses here.  Nice, friendly staff, great ahi tuna cooked to perfection!  Love the hummus too!!
I almost go to this place after the gym at LVAC, the bison burger with teriyaki sauce, basmati rice, and sweet potato mash always comes out super fresh. Love this place!

If you're the type of people who gets excited about organic kale and well-balanced meals, boy is this the place for you. This place is for the health conscious, the clean eaters, the non-meat eaters, the type of people who shop at Whole Foods, and the crowd that hits the gym. It's that type of vibe, if you get what I'm saying.

I like to come here when I'm trying (emphasis on the trying) to be healthy, but I still crave convenience. And I love eating out and eating healthy without always having to settle for a salad (but they have that here too if that's what you're into). Here's the lowdown:

THE GOOD:
+ Healthy
+ Convenient
+ Good quality ingredients
+ Good portions for decent prices
+ Vegan and Vegetarian options

THE BAD:
- Need to salt your own food 
I get /why/ they don't salt their food, I just don't /like/ that I have to do it myself. Buying an under seasoned meal just doesn't sit well with me.

Overall, I recommend this place. You could make a lot of the food here if you had the time, but I think what you're really paying for is fast, convenient, and healthy food. And I think most days it's worth it, even if you have to salt it yourself.

They have the best BBQ chicken pizza I've ever had. And it's only like 400 calories. 
Sweet potato fries are bomb. 
But let's be real. All their food is amazing (:

one of my favorite healthy spots in vegas. Build your own meal is amazing for someone who eats very particularly like myself. Plus it's great because they have something for EVERYONE whether vegan, gf, or full blown carnivore. It's a place where you can go with everyone and find something for each taste. LOVE this place !!!!

I come here a lot BC the bf likes vegetables/salads. This place has really fresh ingredients and they're very affordable :) Whats great is that you can customize your order any way you like! And they have so many healthy options! 

Service is always friendly, but can be hit or miss because the likelihood they will mess up your order is almost 50%....haha. But they are very nice about remaking food if they got something wrong.

I love breakfast foods so my fave go-to is the tomato mozzarella frittata (which comes with this amazing watermelon salad!!!)

Be wary of all the gym rats that frequent this place....G&P's are very conveniently located next to a LVAC gym, and you can definitely tell they attract that clientele ;) This particular location is is probably my fave (been to the one on Flamingo which isn't as warm or bright) and while neon green isn't my favorite color, the restaurant is overall very clean and modern.

First time at this place. I had the green ginger juice which was amazing and the trip-tip tacos. The portion was huge and maybe a little too much meat on each taco. At first I wished the meat had a sauce because it was a little dry but then I was glad it didn't because the taco would have surely fallen apart and been much more difficult to eat. The greens and dressing on top are what made that taco.

I've been to this location 3x's a week. Enough to see the pros and cons. I've also been to the Rainbow location to compare the difference between the two. I always get my usual and there is a difference in consistency between the two. Both places are good overall but the one thing that stands out between them is the customer service.

 I love their turkey chili but every bite has a 1:10 ratio of turkey and beans. I felt like the beans was the main course. Please change your recipe to add more turkey! I know it sounds a bit silly to make such a request but who would want to eat a spoon full of beans when the name is called turkey chili. 

The batch they make is already pre-made. Everytime I've asked for light on the beans at the Rainbow location they made the effort to make me a batch of where they hand scoop out the extra beans for me for no extra charge. I tipped well as a thank you. It was amazing and I was very happy. It still looked and tasted like their original. (This location is next to my corporate office. I'm assuming they have better customer service to please the business professionals.)

This Eastern location, the chef didn't even care to try. They said they would have to charge me for an extra turkey patty. I basically had to pay $7.00 for a chopped up hamburger patty that's thrown on top of my chili. Not even mixed in for me. *image attached* It looked lazy. I had to bring it back and let them know I paid basically $14.50 for half a cup of chili with a patty thrown on top. I had to ask for a second cup of at least a bit of extra chili since I did paid in full for it.

Little situations like these are the details that makes a business good to great.

Although with the same delicious healthy food, this location's service is beyond subpar, standing in queue for more than 10 mins without staff acknowledging your presence.  Not a "welcome" nor "I'll be right with you". Meanwhile the only server/cashier/runner runs around catering to all other dine in guests with other queuing guests looking at each other like "should I say something?"...   after the previously o it server/cashier/runner serviced all the queuing guests 2 other staff emerge from back of house to say hello to guests... seems to me the location is lacking management... great food however, don't think I'll dine here

Love this place, i had the ostrich burger OMG it was great having it well done it was still moist and tender. Tofu fries are becoming my favorite.. My friend MMA fighter Kyra had the Chicken satay-6 great size chicken skewers. 

Great decor and look. The owner was dressed nice and served our food and was very welcoming. Def. going back to this spot in vegas!

So this restaurant is very close to my house so it makes it convenient to come here. The service is alright i suppose.. not like they go out of their way to make you happy or anything. Although they do bring it out to you pretty fast. 

So the last time I was there I ordered the salad with berries in it.. along with some grilled shrimp on top. it was very tasty!! would definitely order again! 
I also ordered the grilled chicken tacos.. presentation wise it was pretty and was quite tasty as well. 
The other times Ive been there Ive ordered a lot of their juices and smoothies and they are all so good!! 

overall i would recommend this place to others that want a healthy place to go to.. its delicious and fast!

This place was great! DANIEL helped us out. I've never been here before and got a chicken wrap I wasn't too fond of and I'm not the type to send anything back because I am just really  picky . But Dan reassured me that it's ok and got me the bison burger which was delicious !  Customer service and staff is great here! Very friendly and clean!!!

This place is amazing!! I got the southwestern tofu and soy chorizo burrito with avocado and a wheat wrap. It was sooo much better than I expected and was very filling. I tried the stubborn soda (acai and lemon flavor) and was NOT satisfied. It was literally just sparkling water. However, I did try the vanilla cream and it was much better!! The guy who handed me my food also went across the place to get me a fork which was really nice. Will come again!

Staff was friendly and helpful, good environment. Got the albacore tuna salad and wellness juice. Wellness juice was great and very tasty. Albacore tuna salad was not good--I thought it would be slices of fresh tuna on top of a salad since it cost $10, but instead it was a lump of canned tuna with diced tomatoes, cucumbers, and butter lettuce. My wife got a barbecue chicken pizza, and that the chicken wasn't quite good quality either.

I really like this chain, as it's easy to eat as healthy or as "healthy" as you'd like. You can't go wrong with their wraps and sandwiches, as you can have it in a spinach or even a steamed cabbage wrap! They give plenty of meat as well, ensuring that you are well satisfied. The only thing I don't really recommend are the ahi tuna tacos--the flavor is there, but the weird mango salsa they put on it is really sweet and slightly out of place with the mellow avocado. It might be better to make a tangy or spicy sauce to mellow out the avocado, and a ceviche-esque dish is never a bad thing. Anyway, everything else is yummy so give it a try!

Plastic is a great material, but I would rather not have it in my smoothie. 
While visiting this location yesterday, I purchased a berry smoothie for my five year old and a Green Ginger Limeade smoothie for myself. 

While drinking my smoothie I felt an odd texture in my mouth, thinking it was a piece of a hard leaf of some sort , I chewed it only to find that it did not break up into smaller pieces as expected. When I pulled it out of my mouth it was a small piece of plastic that was the equivalent of laying 3 grains of rice end to end. I showed it to the very kind young lady who rang me up earlier and she said she was sorry and that she would share my finding with the manager. 

Thinking that this was just a fluke, I continued to sip my drink, only to find another piece of plastic about one fourth the size of the first. I went to the counter and asked to speak with a manager. The woman I was addressing informed me that she was the manager. I then explained that this was the second piece of plastic I had sucked through my straw. And she said that the night before, she had seen a piece of plastic in the grapes while they were removing the grapes from their packaging. She made a circle with her hand to show me the approximate size of said plastic piece,(approximately the size of a quarter), then went on to state that since it was clear, that made it very difficult to sort out of the grapes. 

I have visited this location in the past and had no issues. The employees and the manager were very pleasant and friendly during this visit. My problem is with the fact that the manager stated that she saw the plastic in the grapes, yet she did not take the time to stop the process of cleaning them in order to fish out the piece of plastic.  I can only think about the many health conscious patrons who come here expecting to have a healthy treat as I did.  In fact, her own baby ( that looked to be approximately 4 to 5 months old) was enjoying a smoothie and I just hate to think that someone else's child could have choked on that piece of plastic. 

In the future, I would suggest fishing the plastic out and training the employees to also keep a watchful eye for things that should not be present among the fruits and vegetables they juice. This whole thing could have been avoided by a very simple precaution.

We came here so my fianc√© could try ostrich but sadly they were out. So we ordered a wellness juice which is pretty good, he ordered a angus burger and I order a grilled veggie wrap ( because I'm vegetarian) and they gave me a grilled chicken wrap?? What? Chicken doesn't sound like veggie... And the jicama "fries" are raw and taste like dirt. Additionally the cashier was kinda snotty to us. Seeing as it's our first time and we got some crappy service and a wrong order they get 3 stars.
I tried this place a couple of days ago for the first time. And LOVED it! They have the best turkey chili in town. Fast service and friendly employees!!

I'm a huge fan of Greens and Proteins, I am definitely excited to not have to go up to Summerlin to get my fix. 

The food is good, never a problem with that. Parking is pretty easy, haven't had a hard time finding a spot. Service is good, employees are friendly. It can be pretty speedy, but when it is busier it can take a while for your order. I typically call in and pick up, that's usually the quickest. The restaurant is clean and there is plenty of tables. 

Everything on the menu is yummy, be adventurous and try something new!

My friend had been wanting to check out Greens and Protein, so I decided to join in for dinner. 

The place is cute and very modern with a green and fresh-looking atmosphere. I opted for the bison burger with tofu fries. The food arrived quickly and it didn't do much for me visually. The burger was cooked decently, but the flavors were lacking. Everything was a little bland. I love tofu, but the fries were rubbery and the jicama fries I tried from my friend's plate were ok. I usually like jicama a lot, but these were overly vinegary and not what I was hoping for when I bit in. Most others seemed to agree since most people were dumping a majority of their fries in the trash that I saw. 

The burger was solid, but nothing else really hit home for me. I appreciate the "healthy" food they seem to pride themselves in here, but I'd have to try more to see if there's anything that really hits the spot for me.

great food!!! cool price an the employees are very  nice employees are always eager to please the customers makes you happy to be a regular customer!!!!!! thanks kayla & lizette and the big boss man cesar

I'm pretty obsessed with  this place, have been here at least twice a week! I love the cucumber water they have for free, it's very refreshing and tasty. I've been getting the build your own meal, with ahi tuna, avocado and balsamic it's to die for. I'm planning on trying one of the smoothies these days, they look delish. Employees are also very friendly.

I started going to protein house just because it's more visible when I leave the gym. Last couple times I about barfed. Their food has no flavor.  I always forget greens and proteins is just down the road. Healthy food with flavor!!! Thank you!

This place is like my second kitchen. I love everything on the menu, especially the French toast. They make it easy to maintain a healthy diet for a person who's constantly on the go. Plus they are more then happy to adjust your order to your specific diet needs. I'm a ovo vegetarian and asking for a substitute of eggs in a wrap or burger instead of the meat is never an issue.

This is my go to place to eat when I'm in Vegas. I love the healthy choices and what a variety there is! If you're in the mood for Acai bowls, French toast, pizza, burgers or salad this place has it all. It also has juices. The free cucumber water is delicious too. The options are many and the healthful benefits are great too. There are many gluten free options and organic choices. I never thought eating so healthy could taste so good! I love this place more than Swamis in California where I live.

Came here the other day and was instantly reminded of why I love it so much. The atmosphere is fun and comfy...regardless of how busy it gets, the vibe is always amazing! My go-to item on the menu is the veggie pizza, with vegan cheese and gluten free crust. It never disappoints and is far better tasting than a lot of greasy, fatty pizzas I've tried. Healthy and tasty, I'd say that's a win win! I will continue to return every time I get the urge to indulge in pizza, simply because I won't have to suffer the guilt, or bloat. Not to mention, everything else on the menu is awesome...salads, smoothies, juice, and so forth. Whatever it is, you really can't go wrong!

It was me and my husband's first time here and we decided to try it because we just left the gym and wanted to try something new and healthy. This place popped up and was the only place not closing within 30 minutes. The place was clean and the guy at the cash register was really helpful when since it was our first time. We got the turkey club wrap with jicima, hummus & pita, and an apple pie smoothie with almond milk. The jicima was surprisingly good and I'm not one to stray from my usual sweet potato fries. The wrap was as expected also we added avocado to that. The hummus came in two different colors which I'm not used to seeing orange hummus, but it was still good. The apple pie smoothie did taste like apple but for me it was kind of weird drinking that flavor. Overall, I gave this place 4 stars because of the cleanliness, friendly staff, and good food.

Ate here 2 days ago.  Ordered the bison cheesesteak, ate 3/4 of it, and found the most disgusting black curly piece of hair imbedded in my meat.  Couldn't submit my review until now since it still makes me want to vomit just writing about it.
